hebrew_text: סוּכָּה שֶׁהִיא גְּבוֹהָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — פְּסוּלָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: A sukka , that is more than twenty cubits high is unfit. Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit.
llm_translation: A sukkah that is tall above twenty cubits - invalid. And Rabbi Yehuda permits.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְשֶׁאֵין לָהּ (שְׁלֹשָׁה) דְּפָנוֹת, וְשֶׁחֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מְצִלָּתָהּ — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: that is not ten handbreadths high, and that does not have three walls, and whose sunlight is greater than its shade are unfit.
llm_translation: And that which its height is ten handbreadths, and that it does not have (three) walls, and that its sun is more than its shade - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: מָבוֹי שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — יְמַעֵט. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: We learned there, an alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits, one diminish Rabbi Yehuda says he need not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Tanan, hatam: mavoi shehu gavoah me'esrim amah - yema'et. Rabbi Yehuda omer: einu tzarich. English translation: We learned in a Mishnah there: An alleyway that is higher than twenty cubits - one should decrease it. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה דְּתָנֵי פְּסוּלָה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי דְּתָנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא?
human_translation: What is different with regard to a sukka where teaches unfit, and what is different with regard to an alleyway where teaches rectification,
llm_translation: What is the difference regarding a sukkah that it teaches is invalid, and what is the difference regarding an alleyway that it teaches is a remedy?

hebrew_text: סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, תָּנֵי פְּסוּלָה. מָבוֹי דְּרַבָּנַן, תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: sukka , by Torah law, teaches unfit, an alleyway, by rabbinic law, teaches rectification,
llm_translation: Sukkah of the Torah, teaches invalid. Mavoy of the Rabbis, teaches enactment.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא, מִיהוּ סוּכָּה דִּנְפִישִׁי מִילָּתַהּ — פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי פְּסוּלָה, מָבוֹי דְּלָא נְפִישׁ מִילֵּיהּ — תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say even by Torah law, rectification. However, sukka , whose matters are numerous, it categorically teaches unfit. an alleyway, whose matters are not numerous, teaches rectification.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In matters of Torah law, it is preferable to teach a regulation, but regarding a sukkah whose essential element is missing - it is interrupted and teaches that it is invalid, a courtyard whose essential element is not missing - it teaches a regulation.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: From where are these matters,
llm_translation: What are these words?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לְמַעַן יֵדְעוּ דוֹרוֹתֵיכֶם כִּי בַסּוּכּוֹת הוֹשַׁבְתִּי אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, עַד עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא דָּר בַּסּוּכָּה, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — אֵין אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁדָּר בַּסּוּכָּה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בַּהּ עֵינָא.
human_translation: Rabba said as the verse states: “So that your future generations will know that I caused the children of Israel to reside in sukkot up to twenty cubits a person is aware that he is residing in a sukka . more than twenty cubits high, a person is not aware that he is residing in a sukka because his eye does not catch sight
llm_translation: Rabba said, as the verse states: "So that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel dwell in booths," up to twenty cubits, a person knows that he is dwelling in a sukkah; above twenty cubits - a person does not know that he is dwelling in a sukkah, because the eye does not have dominion over it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְסוּכָּה תִּהְיֶה לְצֵל יוֹמָם מֵחוֹרֶב״, עַד עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אָדָם יוֹשֵׁב בְּצֵל סוּכָּה, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — אֵין אָדָם יוֹשֵׁב בְּצֵל סוּכָּה אֶלָּא בְּצֵל דְּפָנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said from here: “And there shall be a sukka for shade in the daytime from the heat, up to twenty cubits a person is sitting in the shade of the sukka , more than twenty cubits high, a person is not sitting in the shade of the sukka but rather in the shade of the walls
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said from here: "And a sukkah shall be for shade by day from the heat" - up to twenty cubits a person sits in the shade of the sukkah, above twenty cubits - a person does not sit in the shade of the sukkah except in the shade of its walls.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּעַשְׁתְּרוֹת קַרְנַיִם, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא הָוֵי סוּכָּה?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But if so one who makes his sukka in Ashterot Karnayim, so too, is not a sukka ,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now, one who makes his sukkah with two horns, is it not true that it is not a sukkah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, דַּל עַשְׁתְּרוֹת קַרְנַיִם — אִיכָּא צֵל סוּכָּה. הָכָא, דַּל דְּפָנוֹת — לֵיכָּא צֵל סוּכָּה.
human_translation: said to him: there, removes Ashterot Karnayim there is shade of the sukka . here, removes the walls there is no shade by the sukka ,
llm_translation: He said to him: There, where the shade of the horns of the altar is thin - there is the shade of a sukkah. Here, where the shade of the walls is thin - there is no shade of a sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״בַּסּוּכּוֹת תֵּשְׁבוּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״. אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: כׇּל שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים צֵא מִדִּירַת קֶבַע וְשֵׁב בְּדִירַת עֲרַאי. עַד עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה דִּירָתוֹ דִּירַת עֲרַאי, לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — אֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה דִּירָתוֹ דִּירַת עֲרַאי אֶלָּא דִּירַת קֶבַע.
human_translation: Rava said from here: “In sukkot shall you reside seven days” The Torah said: the entire seven days, emerge from the permanent residence and reside in a temporary residence, up to twenty cubits a person render his residence a temporary residence, above twenty cubits high, one cannot render his residence a temporary residence; rather, permanent residence,
llm_translation: Rava said, from here: "You shall dwell in booths for seven days." The Torah said: Throughout the seven days, one should depart from a permanent dwelling and reside in a temporary dwelling. Up to twenty cubits, a person makes his dwelling a temporary one; beyond twenty cubits, a person does not make his dwelling a temporary one but rather a permanent one.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, עָשָׂה מְחִיצוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא הָוֵי סוּכָּה?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But if so, he constructed steel partitions and placed roofing over them, so too, it would not be a sukka ,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now, make partitions of iron and cover on top, thus it is indeed that it will not be a sukkah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ: עַד עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה דְּאָדָם עוֹשֶׂה דִּירָתוֹ דִּירַת עֲרַאי, כִּי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ דִּירַת קֶבַע, נָמֵי נָפֵיק. לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, דְּאָדָם עוֹשֶׂה דִּירָתוֹ דִּירַת קֶבַע, כִּי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ דִּירַת עֲרַאי, נָמֵי לָא נָפֵיק.
human_translation: said to him this is what I am saying to you: up to twenty cubits that a person a temporary residence, when he constructs a permanent residence, he also fulfills more than twenty cubits high, that a person a permanent residence, when he constructs it like a temporary residence, he does not fulfill his obligation.
llm_translation: He said to him, thus I am saying to you: Up to twenty cubits a person makes his dwelling a temporary dwelling, for if he makes it a permanent dwelling, it is also acceptable. Above twenty cubits, a person makes his dwelling a permanent dwelling, for if he makes it a temporary dwelling, it is also not acceptable.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ כְּרַבָּה לָא אָמְרִי, הָהוּא יְדִיעָה לְדוֹרוֹת הִיא.
human_translation: All of them, did not say as Rabba, that knowledge for generations
llm_translation: All of them like Rabbah did not say, that knowledge is for his generation.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא נָמֵי לָא אָמְרִי, הָהוּא לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: they, also did not say as Rabbi Zeira, it is to the messianic era that this is written.
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Zeira, some say, "That one is for the days of the Messiah," as it is written.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא — אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא: ״וְחוּפָּה תִּהְיֶה לְצֵל יוֹמָם״, וּמַאי ״וְסוּכָּה תִּהְיֶה לְצֵל יוֹמָם״ — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira, If so let the verse say: And there shall be a canopy for shade in the daytime from the heat, And what is “And there shall be a sukka for shade in the daytime from the heat”? Learn from it two
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira - If so, let us say the verse: "And a canopy shall be for shade by day," and what is "and a booth shall be for shade by day" - you have heard two from it.

hebrew_text: כְּרָבָא נָמֵי לָא אָמְרִי, מִשּׁוּם קוּשְׁיָא דְאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: They, also did not say as did Rava, due to the difficulty Abaye
llm_translation: As Ravah's students did not say, due to the difficulty of Abaye's question.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁאֵין דְּפָנוֹת מַגִּיעוֹת לַסְּכָךְ, אֲבָל דְּפָנוֹת מַגִּיעוֹת לַסְּכָךְ — אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה כְּשֵׁרָה. כְּמַאן?
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Yoshiya said Rav said: dispute in where the walls do not reach the roofing; however, the walls reach the roofing, even more than twenty cubits high, it is fit. In accordance with whose
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabbi Yoshiyah said in the name of Rav: A dispute when the walls do not reach the sukkah, but when the walls reach the sukkah - even if they are more than twenty cubits high, it is valid. Whose opinion is this?

hebrew_text: כְּרַבָּה, דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בַּהּ עֵינָא, וְכֵיוָן דִּדְפָנוֹת מַגִּיעוֹת לַסְּכָךְ, מִשְׁלָט שָׁלְטָא בַּהּ עֵינָא.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabba, who says because the eye does not catch sight of And since the walls reach the roofing, the eye catches sight
llm_translation: As Ravah said in the name of: because the eye does not have control over it, and once the drops reach the covering, the eye has control over it.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה כְּשֵׁרָה. כְּמַאן?
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Huna said Rav said: dispute in where there is not four cubits by four cubits in however, there is more than four cubits by four cubits in even more than twenty cubits high, it is fit. In accordance with whose
llm_translation: As to whom does this statement go according to? This is like what Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: A dispute in which it only has four cubits by four cubits, but if it has more than four cubits by four cubits - even above twenty cubits it is valid. According to whom?

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, דְּאָמַר: מִשּׁוּם צֵל הוּא, וְכֵיוָן דִּרְוִיחָא — אִיכָּא צֵל סוּכָּה.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Zeira, who says that due to shade and since is spacious there is shade from the sukka
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Zeira, who said: Because of shade it is, and once there is a scent - there is the shade of a sukkah.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא כְּדֵי רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ, אֲבָל מַחְזֶקֶת יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ — אֲפִילּוּ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה כְּשֵׁרָה. כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּחַד.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Ḥanan bar Rabba said Rav said: dispute in where only enough hold one’s head, most of his and his table, however, it hold more than one’s head, most of his and his table, even if it is more than twenty cubits high, it is fit. In accordance with whose not in accordance with of one
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This one who said, Rav Hanan son of Rabba said in the name of Rav: A dispute when it does not strengthen except the size of his head, majority, and table, but if it strengthens more than the size of his head, majority, and table - even above twenty cubits is valid. As to whom - not as one.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה פְּלִיגָא אַדְּרַב הוּנָא וְרַב חָנָן בַּר רַבָּה, דְּאִינְהוּ קָא יָהֲבִי שִׁעוּרָא בִּמְשָׁכָא, וְאִיהוּ לָא קָא יָהֵיב שִׁעוּרָא בִּמְשָׁכָא.
human_translation: Granted, of Rabbi Yoshiya differs from of Rav Huna and Rav Ḥanan bar Rabba, as they are providing the measure of the extent while he is not providing a measure.
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yoshiyah, there is a dispute between Rav Huna and Rav Hanan bar Rabbah, for they are giving a measurement in liquid measure, but he is not giving a measurement in liquid measure.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חָנָן בַּר רַבָּה, נֵימָא בְּהֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמָר סָבַר הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה בְּמַחְזֶקֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ?
human_translation: However, Rav Huna and Rav Ḥanan bar Rabba, let us say that with regard to fitness of a sukka they disagree; as Sage, holds: fitness of a sukka is four cubits, and Sage, holds: fitness of a sukka is that holds one’s head, and most of his and his table.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna and Rav Hanan, son of Rabba, say: Is it said regarding the validity of a sukkah that Mar holds that a sukkah is valid with four cubits, and Mar holds that a sukkah is valid with a covering of its roof, majority, and table?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר בְּמַחְזֶקֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ פְּלִיגִי, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מֵרֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה,
human_translation: No, as everyone, agrees the fitness of a sukka is that holds one’s head, and most of his and his table. And here, with regard to this they disagree: Sage, holds that disagree where holds the person’s head, and most of his and his table. However, larger than one’s head, and most of his and his table, everyone agrees
llm_translation: Not, that all the world, a valid sukkah, its head and majority and table. And here in this case it is disputed: for Mar holds regarding strengthening its head and majority and table, he disputes, but more than its head and majority and table - the words of everyone are valid.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר מֵרֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ עַד אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת פְּלִיגִי, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: And Sage, holds from that holds one’s head, and most of his and his table up to that is four cubits they disagree; however, more than four cubits, everyone agrees fit.
llm_translation: Mar Savar holds from his head, and his majority, and his table until four cubits, he disputes. But more than four cubits - the words of everyone are valid.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: סוּכָּה שֶׁהִיא גְּבוֹהָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה — פְּסוּלָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר עַד אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection A sukka that is more than twenty cubits high is unfit. Rabbi Yehuda deems fit up to forty or fifty cubits
llm_translation: Challenger: A sukkah that is higher than twenty cubits - invalid. And Rabbi Yehuda permits up to forty-five cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּהֵילֶנִי הַמַּלְכָּה בְּלוֹד שֶׁהָיְתָה סוּכָּתָהּ גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, וְהָיוּ זְקֵנִים נִכְנָסִין וְיוֹצְאִין לְשָׁם וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לָהּ דָּבָר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָיה? אִשָּׁה הָיְתָה וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַסּוּכָּה. אָמַר לָהֶן: וַהֲלֹא שִׁבְעָה בָּנִים הֲווֹ לָהּ, וְעוֹד: כׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ לֹא עָשְׂתָה אֶלָּא עַל פִּי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving Queen Helene in Lod where her sukka was more than twenty cubits high, and the Elders were entering and exiting and did not say anything to her said to him: proof from there? She was, a woman and exempt from the sukka . said to them Didn’t she have seven sons And furthermore, she performed all of her actions only in accordance with the Sages.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with Queen Helena in Lud, whose sukkah was higher than twenty cubits, and elders would enter and exit there, yet they did not say anything to her. They said to him: Was there any observation from there? She was a woman and exempt from the sukkah. He said to them: Did she not have seven sons, and furthermore, all her actions were done only according to the sages' ruling.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי ״וְעוֹד כׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ לֹא עָשְׂתָה אֶלָּא עַל פִּי חֲכָמִים״?
human_translation: Why do I to teach: And furthermore, she performed all of her actions only in accordance with the Sages?
llm_translation: "Why for me to learn 'and still all her deeds she has not done except by the word of the sages'?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: כִּי תֹּאמְרוּ בָּנִים קְטַנִּים הָיוּ, וּקְטַנִּים פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה — כֵּיוָן דְּשִׁבְעָה הֲווֹ, אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא הָוֵי בְּהוּ חַד שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: this is what is saying to them: If you say were minor sons and minors are exempt from the sukka , since they were seven it is not possible that there was not one among them who no longer needed his mother
llm_translation: So he said to them: When you say, "They were young children, and young children are exempt from the sukkah," since they were seven, it is impossible that there was not among them one who does not need his mother.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימְרוּ קָטָן שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְאִמּוֹ מִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב, וְאִיהִי בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא מַשְׁגְּחָה, תָּא שְׁמַע: וְעוֹד, כׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ לֹא עָשְׂתָה אֶלָּא עַל פִּי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And if you say a child who no longer needs his mother is obligated by rabbinic law, and Queen Helene did not observe rabbinic law, come hear And furthermore, she performed all of her actions only in accordance with the Sages.
llm_translation: And if you will say, a minor who does not need his mother, it is from the Rabbis that he is obligated, and she, with the Rabbis, is not responsible, come and hear: "And furthermore, all her deeds she has done only according to the sages."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁאֵין דְּפָנוֹת מַגִּיעוֹת לַסְּכָךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת, דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל מַלְכָּה לֵישֵׁב בְּסוּכָּה שֶׁאֵין דְּפָנוֹת מַגִּיעוֹת לַסְּכָךְ,
human_translation: Granted, according to the one, who said that in where the walls do not reach the roofing dispute it is customary for a queen to reside in a sukka in which the walls do not reach the roofing,
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that when the walls do not reach the s'chach there is a dispute, the way of a queen is to sit in a sukkah where the walls do not reach the s'chach.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם אַוֵּירָא. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה מַחְלוֹקֶת, וְכִי דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל מַלְכָּה לֵישֵׁב בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב אַדָּא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה קִיטוֹנִיּוֹת קִיטוֹנִיּוֹת.
human_translation: due to air However, according to the one who said a small sukka dispute is it customary for a queen to reside in a small sukka Rabba bar Rav Adda said: is necessary only a sukka that is constructed small rooms [ kitoniyyot ].
llm_translation: Due to the fear. Rather, according to the one who said in a small sukkah there is a dispute, is it the way of a queen to dwell in a small sukkah? Rabba bar Rav Adda said: Only a sukkah made of small reeds was needed.

hebrew_text: וְכִי דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל מַלְכָּה לֵישֵׁב בְּסוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה קִיטוֹנִיּוֹת קִיטוֹנִיּוֹת? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְקִיטוֹנִיּוֹת שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: Is it customary for a queen to reside in a sukka constructed small rooms Rav Ashi said: is necessary only to the compartments in
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it the way of a queen to dwell in a sukkah made of gourds, gourds? Rav Ashe said: It was only needed for the gourds within it." English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בָּנֶיהָ בְּסוּכָּה מְעַלְּיָא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי, וְאִיהִי יָתְבָה בְּקִיטוֹנִיּוֹת מִשּׁוּם צְנִיעוּתָא, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא אָמְרִי לַהּ דָּבָר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בָּנֶיהָ גַּבָּהּ הֲווֹ יָתְבִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא אָמְרִי לַהּ דָּבָר.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold: Her sons were residing in a full-fledged sukka However, she resided in the small rooms due to modesty, And for that did not say anything to her, And Rabbi Yehuda holds: Her sons would reside with her and even so, did not say anything to her,
llm_translation: The sages hold: Her sons should sit in the sukkah on a higher level, while she herself should sit in lower places out of modesty, and therefore they do not say anything to her. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: Her sons should sit in a lower place, and even so they do not say anything to her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: הֲלָכָה, צְרִיכָה שֶׁתְּהֵא מַחְזֶקֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: כְּמַאן, כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא כְּמַאן?!
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: halakha must be hold his head, and most of his and his table. Rabbi Abba said to him, In accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Shammai? said to him: Rather, in accordance with whose
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak: Halacha, it is necessary that it should be strengthening his head and majority and table. Said to him Rabbi Abba: Like whom, like Beit Shammai? Said to him: Rather like whom?!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: דַּאֲמַר לָךְ מַנִּי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, וְלָא תְּזוּז מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Abba said: Who stated to you? said to him: It was Beit Shammai, and do not budge from it,
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rabbi Abba said: He said to you "Who told you?" He said to him: It is Beit Shammai, and do not move from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִמַּאי דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה פְּלִיגִי? דִּלְמָא בְּסוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה פְּלִיגִי, וּכְגוֹן דְּיָתֵיב אַפּוּמָּא דִּמְטוּלְּתָא וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת. דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יִמָּשֵׁךְ אַחַר שׁוּלְחָנוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak strongly objects to this From where that Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagree with regard to a small sukka ? Perhaps with regard to a large sukka that they disagree, and where one is sitting at the entrance of the sukka and his table is inside the house. As Beit Shammai hold that we issue a decree lest he be drawn after his table And Beit Hillel hold that we do not decree.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objects to her: From what do Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel argue in a small sukkah? Perhaps they argue in a large sukkah, such as one where the roof extends and the table is inside the house. Beit Shammai hold: We decree lest one follow his table, and Beit Hillel hold: We do not decree.

hebrew_text: וְדַיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: מִי שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין. וְאִם אִיתָא, מַחְזֶקֶת וְאֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And is also precise, as it teaches: one whose head and most of his were in the sukka and his table was in the house, Beit Shammai deem it unfit and Beit Hillel deem it fit. And if it is so holds and does not hold what needed
llm_translation: And precisely it was taught: One whose head and most of his body were in the sukkah and his table was inside the house, Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel deem it fit. And if it comes, it strengthens and does not strengthen, they require it of him.

hebrew_text: וּבְסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה לָא פְּלִיגִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: מַחְזֶקֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ — כְּשֵׁרָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: And in the case of a small sukka do not disagree? But isn’t it taught holds his head, and most of his and his table is fit. Rabbi says: until it measures four cubits by four cubits.
llm_translation: In a small sukkah, do they not disagree? And it was taught: If its head, majority, and table are firm - it is valid. Rabbi says: Until it has four cubits by four cubits within it.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל סוּכָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פְּסוּלָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ — כְּשֵׁרָה. וְאִילּוּ שׁוּלְחָנוֹ לָא קָתָנֵי. קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי. אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, הָא בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: And it is taught in another Rabbi says: Any sukka that does not have four cubits by four cubits is unfit. And the Rabbis say: Even if it holds only his head and most of his it is fit. However, His table, is not taught contradict each other, Rather, not conclude from it that this is Beit Shammai, that is Beit Hillel?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in another Baraita: Rabbi says: Any sukkah that does not have four cubits by four cubits - it is invalid. And the Sages say: Even if it only establishes itself with its head and the majority of it - it is valid. And if it is a table, it does not establish. They are in contradiction. Rather, it is not so, learn from it: This is Beit Shammai, this is Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: ״בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין״, וְאִם אִיתָא, ״בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים לֹא יָצָא, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים יָצָא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: And the mishna is also precise, from that it teaches: Beit Shammai deem it unfit and Beit Hillel deem it fit. And if it is so Beit Shammai say: He did not fulfill and Beit Hillel say: He fulfilled what needed
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: The Mishnah in front of the judge, since it teaches: "Beit Shammai disqualify, and Beit Hillel validate," and if it is asked, "Beit Shammai say he did not fulfill his obligation, and Beit Hillel say he fulfilled his obligation," what is the reason?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא ״מִי שֶׁהָיָה״!
human_translation: But One whose difficult,
llm_translation: And rather, a difficulty: "Who was!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּתַרְתֵּי פְּלִיגִי: פְּלִיגִי בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה, וּפְלִיגִי בְּסוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה. וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מִי שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יָצָא, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יָצָא. וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא כְּדֵי רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בִּלְבַד, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Actually, they disagree with regard to two they disagree with regard to a small sukka , and they disagree with regard to a large sukka . is incomplete and this it is teaching: One whose head and most of his were in the sukka and his table was in the house, Beit Shammai say he did not fulfill and Beit Hillel say he fulfilled And that holds only his head and most of his Beit Shammai deem it unfit and Beit Hillel deem it fit.
llm_translation: Always they dispute: they dispute in a small sukkah, and they dispute in a large sukkah. And those who are lacking are lacking, and thus it is taught: one whose head and most of his body are in the sukkah and his table is inside the house, Beit Shammai say: he has not fulfilled his obligation, and Beit Hillel say: he has fulfilled his obligation. And if it only supports as much as his head and most of his body alone, Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel validate it.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּיִת שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פָּטוּר מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, וּמִן הַמַּעֲקֶה, וְאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים, וְאֵינוֹ נֶחְלָט בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה,
human_translation: Who taught that which the Sages taught: a house in which there is not four cubits by four cubits exempt from mezuza and from the parapet and it does not become ritually impure with leprosy And not rendered final houses within walled cities.
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that taught this that the Rabbis taught: A house that does not have four cubits by four cubits - exempt from mezuzah, and from the partition, and does not become impure with skin afflictions, and is not included in the houses of walled cities.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין חוֹזְרִין עָלָיו מֵעוֹרְכֵי הַמִּלְחָמָה, וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין בּוֹ, וְאֵין מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בּוֹ, וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ עֵירוּב,
human_translation: And one does not return from of waging war for And one not join for And one not merge for And one does not place the joining eiruv in
llm_translation: And not return upon him from the organizers of the war, and not mix in him, and not participate in him, and not place in him an eruv.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ עִיבּוּר בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, וְאֵין הָאַחִין וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין חוֹלְקִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And one does not render it an extension between two cities. and brothers and partners do not divide it,
llm_translation: And they do not make that junction between two cities, and the brothers and partners do not divide it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן סוּכָּה — דְּדִירַת עֲרַאי הִיא, אֲבָל לְגַבַּי בַּיִת — דְּדִירַת קֶבַע הוּא, אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ דְּאִי אִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — דָּיְירִי בֵּיהּ אִינָשֵׁי, וְאִי לָא — לָא דָּיְירִי בֵּיהּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Let us say is Rabbi and not the Rabbis, Even you say the Rabbis, the Rabbis say only there, with regard to a sukka , which is a temporary residence, However, with regard to a house, which is a permanent residence, even the Rabbis concede that if it has four cubits by four cubits, people reside in it, and if not, people do not reside in it,
llm_translation: Let us say, is it Rabbi and not the Rabbis? Even if you were to say the Rabbis, up to here the Rabbis did not say, rather, regarding the matter of a sukkah - that it is a temporary dwelling, but in comparison to a house - which is a permanent dwelling, even the Rabbis agree that if it has four cubits by four cubits - people can reside in it, and if not - people cannot reside in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: פָּטוּר מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, וּמִן הַמַּעֲקֶה, וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים, וְאֵינוֹ נֶחְלָט בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה, וְאֵין חוֹזְרִין עָלָיו מֵעוֹרְכֵי הַמִּלְחָמָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּ״בַיִת״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: The Master said is exempt from mezuza and from the parapet and it does not become ritually impure with leprosy And not rendered final houses within walled cities, and one does not return from of waging war for What is the reason that “house” is written with regard to all
llm_translation: Master said: exempt from the mezuzah, and from the lintel, and does not become impure with skin afflictions, and is not counted in the houses of walled cities, and is not included by the organizers of the army. What is the reason? Because "house" is written with regard to all of them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין בּוֹ, וְאֵין מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בּוֹ, וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ עֵירוּב. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְדִירָה. עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת — אֵין מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ, אֲבָל שִׁיתּוּף מַנִּיחִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And one not join for and one not merge for And one does not place the joining in What is the reason that it is not fit for residence. And one does not place the joining of courtyards in but the merging one places in it.
llm_translation: And do not combine in it, and do not participate in it, and do not place an Eruv in it. What is the reason? - Because it is not fit for dwelling. Eruvin of courtyards - do not place in it, but partnership Eruvin you may place in it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּלָא גָּרַע מֵחָצֵר שֶׁבְּמָבוֹי. דִּתְנַן: עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת בֶּחָצֵר, שִׁיתּוּפֵי מָבוֹי בַּמָּבוֹי.
human_translation: What is the reason that it is no less than a courtyard in the alleyway. as we learned The joining of courtyards in the courtyard the merging of alleyways in the alleyway.
llm_translation: "What is the reason? — Because it does not detract from the courtyard in the alleyway. As we learned in a Mishnah: If there are joint Eruvin for the courtyards in the courtyard, they establish a joint Eruv for the alleyway."

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ, עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת בֶּחָצֵר? וְהָתְנַן: הַנּוֹתֵן עֵירוּבוֹ בְּבֵית שַׁעַר אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת — אֵינוֹ עֵירוּב, וְהַדָּר שָׁם אֵינוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: And we discussed the joining of courtyards in the courtyard? Didn’t we learn one who placed his joining in a gatehouse a portico [ akhsadra ], or a balcony, is not a eiruv . And one who resides there, does not render it prohibited
llm_translation: We ask in it, the combining of courtyards in the courtyard? And we learned: One who places his Eruv in a gatehouse, a balcony, or a porch - his Eruv is not valid, and one who resides there does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת בְּבַיִת שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר, וְשִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת בְּחָצֵר שֶׁבַּמָּבוֹי. וְהַאי לָא גָּרַע מֵחָצֵר שֶׁבְּמָבוֹי.
human_translation: Rather, say: The joining of courtyards in the houses that is in the courtyard, and the merging of alleyways in the courtyards that into the alleyway. And this is no less than the courtyards that into the alleyway.
llm_translation: Rather say: The combining of courtyards within a house that is in a courtyard, and the partnership of entrances in a courtyard that is in an alleyway. And this is not less than a courtyard that is in an alleyway.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ עִיבּוּר בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת. דַּאֲפִילּוּ כְּבוּרְגָּנִין לָא מְשַׁוֵּינַן לֵיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא — בּוּרְגָּנִין חֲזוּ לְמִילְּתַיְיהוּ, וְהַאי לָא חֲזֵי לְמִילְּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And one does not render it an extension between two cities. we do not even render its like huts [ burganin ] What is the reason huts, are suited for their matters, while this is not suited for its matter,
llm_translation: And they do not make that junction between two cities. For even Burganin we do not compare to it. What is the reason? Burganin see their matters, and this one does not see its matters.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין הָאַחִין וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין חוֹלְקִין בּוֹ. טַעְמָא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, הָא אִית בֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — חוֹלְקִין,
human_translation: And brothers and partners do not divide The reason is that there is not four cubits in it; however, if there is four cubits in it, they divide it.
llm_translation: The brothers and partners do not divide it. The reason is that if it does not have four cubits, but if it has four cubits - they divide it.

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: אֵין חוֹלְקִין אֶת הֶחָצֵר עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לָזֶה וְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לָזֶה!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn One divides the courtyard only that there will be in it four cubits for this and four cubits for that
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One does not divide the courtyard until there are four cubits on this side and four cubits on that side!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֵין בּוֹ דִּין חֲלוּקָּה כְּחָצֵר. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חָצֵר לְפִי פְּתָחֶיהָ מִתְחַלֶּקֶת. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: נוֹתֵן לְכׇל פֶּתַח וָפֶתַח אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְהַשְּׁאָר חוֹלְקִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: Rather, say the halakha of division like a courtyard not to it. As Rav Huna said: A courtyard is divided according to its entrances. Rav Ḥisda said: One gives for each and every entrance four cubits, and the rest is divided equally
llm_translation: Rather say: It does not have the law of division like a courtyard. For Rav Huna said: A courtyard is divided according to its entrance. And Rav Hisda said: One gives to each entrance four cubits, and the rest they divide equally.

hebrew_text: דְּהָנֵי מִילֵּי בַּיִת, דִּלְמֶהֱוֵי קָאֵי — יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ חָצֵר. הַאי, דִּלְמִיסְתַּר קָאֵי — לָא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ חָצֵר.
human_translation: applies only a house that stands to endure, we provide him courtyard this which stands to be leveled, we do not provide him courtyard,
llm_translation: The matters of the house, if it is standing - we give it a courtyard. But if it is hidden - we do not give it a courtyard.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וּבָא לְמַעֲטָהּ בְּכָרִים וּכְסָתוֹת — לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט.
human_translation: was more than twenty cubits high and one comes to diminish by cushions and blankets it is not a decrease
llm_translation: She was tall from twenty cubits and he came to diminish it with beams and coverings - it is not considered a diminishment.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּבַטְּלִינְהוּ [לְכוּלְּהוּ], מִשּׁוּם דְּבָטְלָה דַּעְתּוֹ אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: And even though he nullified them all, because his intention is irrelevant by all other people.
llm_translation: And even though they nullified him to everyone, because his mind was nullified in the eyes of all people.

hebrew_text: תֶּבֶן וּבִטְּלוֹ הָוֵי מִיעוּט, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן עָפָר וּבִטְּלוֹ.
human_translation: straw and nullified it it is a decrease all the more so, dirt and nullified it.
llm_translation: Straw and its nullification is considered insignificant, and certainly so is dust and its nullification.

hebrew_text: תֶּבֶן וְאֵין עָתִיד לְפַנּוֹתוֹ, וְעָפָר סְתָם — מַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: בַּיִת שֶׁמִּילְּאָהוּ תֶּבֶן אוֹ צְרוֹרוֹת וּבִיטְּלוֹ — מְבוּטָּל.
human_translation: straw and he does not intend to evacuate it and undesignated dirt are a dispute Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis As we learned a house where one filled with straw or pebbles and nullified it is nullified,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Teben ve'ein atid lefanav, ve'afar setam - machloket Rabbi Yosei veRabanan. Ditnan: Bayit she'mile'ahu teben o tzerorot u'bitlo - mevutal." Translation: "Straw that is not destined to be turned over, and sealed dust - this is the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis. As we learned: A house that was filled with straw or bundles and it was removed - it is nullified."

hebrew_text: בִּיטְּלוֹ — אִין, לֹא בִּיטְּלוֹ — לָא. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תֶּבֶן וְאֵין עָתִיד לְפַנּוֹתוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּעָפָר סְתָם, וּבָטֵל. עָפָר וְעָתִיד לְפַנּוֹתוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כִּסְתַם תֶּבֶן, וְלָא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: he nullified it, yes, he did not nullify it, no, And it is taught concerning Rabbi Yosei says: straw and he does not intend to evacuate it, its is like undesignated dirt and nullified. dirt and he does intend to evacuate it, its is like undesignated straw, and it is not nullified.
llm_translation: He removed - no, he did not remove. And it was taught on it, Rabbi Yosei says: If there is straw and it is not destined to be turned into ash, it is like mere sealed dust and is nullified. If there is ash and it is destined to be turned into straw, it is like mere sealed straw and is not nullified.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וְהוּצִין יוֹרְדִין בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, אִם צִלָּתָם מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתָם — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאִם לָאו — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: was more than twenty cubits high, but palm leaves [ hutzin ] fall within twenty cubits, If shade is greater than the sunlight it is fit. If not, it is unfit.
llm_translation: She was tall from twenty cubits and the shadows descend within twenty cubits, if their shade is greater than their height - it is valid, and if not - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְהוּצִין יוֹרְדִין לְתוֹךְ עֲשָׂרָה, סָבַר אַבָּיֵי לְמֵימַר אִם חֲמָתָם מְרוּבָּה מִצִּלָּתָם — כְּשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: was ten handbreadths high, but the palm leaves fall within ten Abaye thought to say If the sunlight is greater than shade is fit.
llm_translation: She was ten handbreadths high, and they placed a pit ten handbreadths deep. Abbaye thought to say: If their anger is greater than their fear - it is permissible.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָא דִּירָה סְרוּחָה הִיא, וְאֵין אָדָם דָּר בְּדִירָה סְרוּחָה.
human_translation: Rava said to him: that is a sagging [ seruḥa ] residence, and a person does not reside in a sagging residence.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "This dwelling is exposed, and no person resides in an exposed dwelling."

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וּבָנָה בָּהּ אִיצְטְבָא כְּנֶגֶד דּוֹפֶן הָאֶמְצָעִי, עַל פְּנֵי כּוּלָּהּ וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: was more than twenty cubits high and one built a platform in it opposite the entire middle wall, and has fitness of a sukka , fit.
llm_translation: She was tall from twenty cubits and built in it a balcony opposite the middle wall, on the face of all of it, and it has the qualification of a sukkah - it is valid.

hebrew_text: וּמִן הַצַּד, אִם יֵשׁ מִשְּׂפַת אִיצְטְבָא לַכּוֹתֶל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פְּסוּלָה, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: And along the side If there are four cubits from the edge of the platform to the wall, is unfit, less than four cubits, fit,
llm_translation: From the side, if there is from the lip of the ledge to the wall four cubits - disqualified, less than four cubits - valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאָמְרִינַן דּוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה? תְּנֵינָא: בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְחַת וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּיו, אִם יֵשׁ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל לַסִּיכּוּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פְּסוּלָה, הָא פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן כְּשֵׁרָה!
human_translation: What is teaching us? that we say a curved wall We learned a house that was breached and one roofed over if from the wall to the roofing there are four cubits it is unfit less than that, it is fit
llm_translation: What is it teaching us, that we say "Dofen Akumah"? We learned: A house that collapsed and one placed a covering over it, if there is from the wall to the covering a distance of four cubits - it is invalid; but if it is less than this, it is valid!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּחַזְיָא לְדוֹפֶן, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְדוֹפֶן — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say there, is suited to be the wall however, here, where is not suited to be the wall say no, it teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? There, he sees the back, but here, where he does not see the back - say no, it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וּבָנָה אִיצְטְבָא בְּאֶמְצָעִיתָהּ, אִם יֵשׁ מִשְּׂפַת אִיצְטְבָא וְלַדּוֹפֶן אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לְכׇל רוּחַ וָרוּחַ — פְּסוּלָה, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: was more than twenty cubits high and one built a platform in the center of if there is from the edge of the platform to the wall in each and every direction four cubits, it is unfit, less than four cubits, is fit.
llm_translation: She was tall from twenty cubits and built a balcony in its middle, if there is from the edge of the balcony and to the wall four cubits for every wind and wind - it is disqualified, less than four cubits - it is valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאָמְרִינַן דּוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה? הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: What is teaching us? that we say curved wall this is that
llm_translation: What is it teaching us, that we say "Dofen Akumah"? That is it!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: דּוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה מֵרוּחַ אַחַת — אָמְרִינַן, אֲבָל כׇּל רוּחַ וָרוּחַ — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say we say a curved wall in one direction, but in each and every direction no, it teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? If a bent reed from one wind - we say, but from every wind - no, it is not inferred for us.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה פְּחוּתָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְחָקַק בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהַשְׁלִימָהּ לַעֲשָׂרָה, אִם יֵשׁ מִשְּׂפַת חֲקָק וְלַכּוֹתֶל שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: was less than ten handbreadths and he dug inside in order to complete to ten if from the edge of the dug- area to the wall there is three handbreadths, it is unfit,
llm_translation: She was less than ten handbreadths, and he carved into it in order to complete it to ten. If there is from the edge he carved and to the wall three handbreadths - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: less than three handbreadths fit,
llm_translation: Less than three handbreadths - valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם, דְּאָמְרַתְּ פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא, דְּאָמְרַתְּ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים?
human_translation: What is different there, that you said less than four cubits and what is different here that you said less than three handbreadths
llm_translation: What is the difference there, that you say less than four cubits, and what is the difference here, that you say less than three handbreadths?

hebrew_text: הָתָם, דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְדוֹפֶן, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — סַגִּיא, הָכָא, לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי לְדוֹפֶן, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: There, where there is a wall, less than four cubits, sufficient Here, to render it a wall less than three handbreadths, yes, not, no,
llm_translation: There, that it has for a wall, less than four cubits - it is significant. Here, for the comparison to a wall, less than three handbreadths - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה גְּבוֹהָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, וּבָנָה בָּהּ עַמּוּד שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה — סָבַר אַבָּיֵי לְמֵימַר, גּוּד אַסֵּיק מְחִיצָתָא.
human_translation: was more than twenty cubits high, and one built a pillar in that is ten handbreadths high, and on there is fitness of a sukka , Abaye thought to say Extend and raise the partitions
llm_translation: She was tall from twenty cubits, and he built in it a pillar which is tall ten handbreadths, and there is in it the qualification of a sukkah - Abaye thought to say, a wall suffices for a partition.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: בָּעֵינַן מְחִיצוֹת הַנִּיכָּרוֹת, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rava said to we require conspicuous partitions, and there are none,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: We require recognizable partitions, and there are none.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָעַץ אַרְבָּעָה קוּנְדֵּיסִין וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מַכְשִׁיר וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one inserted four posts [ kundeisin ] and placed roofing over them Rabbi Ya’akov deems it fit and the Rabbis deem it unfit.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one inserted four stakes and placed a board on top of them, Rabbi Yaakov deems it valid, while the other sages deem it invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת עַל שְׂפַת הַגָּג, דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן גּוּד אַסֵּיק מְחִיצָתָא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן גּוּד אַסֵּיק מְחִיצָתָא, אֲבָל בָּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: dispute on the edge of the roof, as Rabbi Ya’akov holds we say Extend and raise the partitions. And the Rabbis hold we do not say Extend and raise the partitions. However, in the center of the roof, everyone agrees it is unfit And Rav Naḥman said: The dispute in the center of the roof,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Dispute regarding the edge of the roof, for Rabbi Yaakov holds: We say a wall extends the partition, and the Rabbis hold: We do not say a wall extends the partition, but in the middle of the roof — all agree it is invalid. And Rav Nachman said: There is a dispute in the middle of the roof.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל עַל שְׂפַת הַגָּג דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא, בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before in the center of the roof a dispute but at the edge of the roof everyone agrees it is fit? Or perhaps dispute both in this and in that shall stand
llm_translation: He asked them: In the middle of the roof is a dispute, but on the edge of the roof everyone agrees it is valid, or perhaps, whether in this case or in that case there is a dispute? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נָעַץ אַרְבָּעָה קוּנְדֵּיסִין בָּאָרֶץ וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מַכְשִׁיר וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִין.
human_translation: raises an objection one drove four posts into the ground and placed roofing over them, Rabbi Ya’akov deems it fit and the Rabbis deem it unfit.
llm_translation: Challenger: He inserted four stakes in the ground and placed a covering over them. Rabbi Yaakov deems it valid, while the sages deem it invalid.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֶרֶץ, דִּכְאֶמְצַע הַגָּג דָּמֵי, וְקָא מַכְשִׁיר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But isn’t the ground like the center of the roof, and Rabbi Ya’akov deems it fit? a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna, a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: And the land, that is in the middle of the roof, is similar to blood, and Rabbi Yaakov deems it fit! The dispute of Rav Huna, the dispute.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: בָּאֶמְצַע הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי, אֲבָל עַל שְׂפַת הַגָּג דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה! לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּתַרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And furthermore, that they disagree in the center however, on the edge of the roof everyone agrees fit. Let us say, this is a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna on two
llm_translation: And furthermore: In the middle, they were arguing, but on the edge of the roof, everyone's words are valid! Let us say it should be the preference of Rav Huna in two matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: פְּלִיגִי בְּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג, וְהוּא הַדִּין עַל שְׂפַת הַגָּג. וְהַאי דְּקָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶמְצַע הַגָּג נָמֵי מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you they disagree in the center of the roof and the same is true in on the edge of the roof. And that they dispute in center of the roof to convey to you the far-reaching of Rabbi Ya’akov, who deems fit even in the center of the roof.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: "Argue about the middle of the roof, and it is the same law for the edge of the roof. And this one who argues about the middle of the roof, to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yaakov, that even in the middle of the roof, it is still valid."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָעַץ אַרְבָּעָה קוּנְדֵּיסִין בָּאָרֶץ וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ יֵחָקְקוּ וְיֵחָלְקוּ, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן טֶפַח לְכָאן וְטֶפַח לְכָאן — נִידּוֹנִין מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין נִידּוֹנִין מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: דְּיוֹמְדֵי סוּכָּה טֶפַח, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן, וּשְׁלִישִׁית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one inserted four posts into the ground and placed a roof over them, Rabbi Ya’akov says: One considers if they were grooved and split, and they have a handbreadth to here, and a handbreadth to there, are considered a double post [ deyumad ]. And if not, they are not considered a double post, as Rabbi Ya’akov would say: double posts of a sukka handbreadth. And the Rabbis say: only if it has two in the standard sense, and a third even a handbreadth.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one inserted four stakes into the ground and placed a covering over them, Rabbi Yaakov says: They are considered as though they were cut and divided, and there is a handbreadth here and a handbreadth there - they are liable on account of the prohibition of building on Shabbat. And if not - they are not liable on account of the prohibition of building on Shabbat. For Rabbi Yaakov used to say: The stakes of a sukkah are a handbreadth, and the Sages say: Until they are two according to their law, and the third even if it is a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. מְנָלַן?
human_translation: that is not ten handbreadths high From where do we
llm_translation: And that which it is not high, ten handbreadths. Whence?

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַב חֲבִיבָא מַתְנוּ.
human_translation: It was stated Rav, and Rabbi Ḥanina, and Rabbi Yoḥanan, and Rav Ḥaviva taught
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Yochanan and Rav Chaviva taught.

hebrew_text: בְּכוּלֵּהּ סֵדֶר מוֹעֵד, כָּל כִּי הַאי זוּגָא — חַלּוֹפֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּמְעַיְּילִי רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן.
human_translation: Throughout the entire order of Mo ’ ed , wherever this pair replace Rabbi Yoḥanan and inserting Rabbi Yonatan
llm_translation: In all of it, the order of the appointed times, whenever this pair - the disciples of Rabbi Yochanan and the disciples of Rabbi Yonatan - disagree.

hebrew_text: אָרוֹן תִּשְׁעָה, וְכַפּוֹרֶת טֶפַח — הֲרֵי כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה, וּכְתִיב: ״וְנוֹעַדְתִּי לְךָ שָׁם וְדִבַּרְתִּי אִתְּךָ מֵעַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״,
human_translation: Ark nine And Ark cover handbreadth There ten here. And it is written: “I will meet with you there and I will speak with you from above the Ark cover”
llm_translation: Ark nine, and cover palm — here ten, and written: "And I will meet with you there, and I will speak with you from above the cover."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא יָרְדָה שְׁכִינָה לְמַטָּה, וְלֹא עָלוּ מֹשֶׁה וְאֵלִיָּהוּ לַמָּרוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁמַיִם לַה׳ וְהָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִבְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: and it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: The Divine Presence never descended below, and Moses and Elijah never ascended to on high, as it is stated: “The heavens are the heavens of the Lord, and the earth He gave to the children of man”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: The Divine Presence never descended below, and neither did Moses and Elijah ascend above, as it is stated: "The heavens are the heavens of the Lord, but the earth He has given to the sons of men."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יָרְדָה שְׁכִינָה לְמַטָּה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד ה׳ עַל הַר סִינַי״! לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְעָמְדוּ רַגְלָיו בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא עַל הַר הַזֵּיתִים״! לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: And did the Divine Presence never descend below But isn’t it written: “And God descended onto Mount Sinai” ten handbreadths above But isn’t it written: “And on that day His feet will stand on the Mount of Olives” ten handbreadths above
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And did the Divine Presence not descend below? But it is written: 'And Hashem descended upon Mount Sinai!' Above ten handbreadths. And it is written: 'And his feet shall stand on that day upon the Mount of Olives!' Above ten handbreadths."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עָלוּ מֹשֶׁה וְאֵלִיָּהוּ לַמָּרוֹם? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמֹשֶׁה עָלָה אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״! לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל אֵלִיָּהוּ בַּסְעָרָה הַשָּׁמָיִם״! לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה. וְהָכְתִיב: ״מְאַחֵז פְּנֵי כִּסֵּא פַּרְשֵׁז עָלָיו עֲנָנוֹ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁפֵּירַשׂ שַׁדַּי מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָתוֹ וַעֲנָנוֹ עָלָיו! לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: And did Moses and Elijah never ascend to on high? But isn’t it written: “And Moses went up to God” below ten But isn’t it written: “And Elijah went up by a whirlwind heavenward” below ten But isn’t it written: “He grasps the face of the throne, and spreads His cloud upon him” And Rabbi Tanḥum said: teaches that the Almighty spread of the radiance of His Divine Presence and of His cloud upon him. below ten
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And did Moses and Elijah not ascend to the heavens? But it is written: 'And Moses went up to God'! Below ten. And it is written: 'And Elijah went up in a whirlwind to the heavens'! Below ten. And it is written: 'He grasps the face of His throne, He spreads His cloud upon it', and Rabbi Tanḥum said: This teaches that the Almighty revealed His Shekhinah and His cloud upon him! Below ten."

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם ״מְאַחֵז פְּנֵי כִּסֵּא״ כְּתִיב! אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי אִישְׁתַּרְבַּב לֵיהּ כִּסֵּא עַד עֲשָׂרָה, וּנְקַט בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: In any case: “He grasps the face of the throne,” is written, The throne was extended for him down to ten and grasped it;
llm_translation: From every place "grasping the face of the throne" is written! He multiplied the seats for him up to ten, and he took hold of it.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אָרוֹן תִּשְׁעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשׂוּ אֲרוֹן עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים אַמָּתַיִם וָחֵצִי אׇרְכּוֹ וְאַמָּה וָחֵצִי רׇחְבּוֹ וְאַמָּה וָחֵצִי קוֹמָתוֹ״. אֶלָּא כַּפּוֹרֶת טֶפַח, מְנָלַן? דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה, נָתְנָה בָּהֶן תּוֹרָה מִדַּת אׇרְכָּן וּמִדַּת רׇחְבָּן וּמִדַּת קוֹמָתָן. כַּפּוֹרֶת, מִדַּת אׇרְכָּהּ וּמִדַּת רׇחְבָּהּ — נָתְנָה, מִדַּת קוֹמָתָהּ — לֹא נָתְנָה.
human_translation: Granted, Ark nine as it is written: “And they shall make an Ark of acacia wood; two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height” However, from where do we Ark cover handbreadth? as Rabbi Ḥanina taught: all the vessels that Moses crafted the Torah provided their the dimension of their length, the dimension of their width, and the dimension of their height. Ark cover, provided the dimension of its length and the dimension of its width; did not provide the dimension of its height.
llm_translation: In truth, the Ark was nine cubits as it is written: "And they shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits its length, a cubit and a half its width, and a cubit and a half its height." But the cover kaporet was a cubit in size, from where do we derive this? For Rabbi Chanina taught: All the vessels that Moses made, the Torah specified for them their length, width, and height. The cover kaporet, its length and width were specified, its height was not specified.

hebrew_text: צֵא וּלְמַד מִפָּחוּת שֶׁבַּכֵּלִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ לּוֹ מִסְגֶּרֶת טֹפַח סָבִיב״, מָה לְהַלָּן טֶפַח, אַף כָּאן טֶפַח. וְנֵילַף מִכֵּלִים גּוּפַיְיהוּ! תָּפַשְׂתָּ מְרוּבֶּה — לֹא תָּפַשְׂתָּ, תָּפַשְׂתָּ מוּעָט — תָּפַשְׂתָּ.
human_translation: Go out and learn from the smallest of the vessels, as it is stated “And you shall make unto it a border of a handbreadth around” Just as there, handbreadth, so too, here, handbreadth. And let us derive from vessels themselves, If you grasped many, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped few, you grasped something.
llm_translation: Go out and learn from the smallest of the vessels, as it is stated: "And you shall make for it a rim of a handbreadth all around." Just as there, it is a handbreadth, so too here, it is a handbreadth. And we derive from vessels themselves! If you took the majority - you did not take, if you took the minority - you took.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִצִּיץ, דְּתַנְיָא: צִיץ דּוֹמֶה כְּמִין טַס שֶׁל זָהָב, וְרָחָב שְׁתֵּי אֶצְבָּעוֹת וּמוּקָּף מֵאֹזֶן לְאֹזֶן, וְכָתוּב עָלָיו שְׁתֵּי שִׁיטִין: ׳יוֹד הֵא׳ מִלְּמַעְלָה, וְ׳קֹדֶשׁ לָמֶד׳ מִלְּמַטָּה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיו בְּרוֹמִי, וְכָתוּב עָלָיו ״קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳״ בְּשִׁיטָה אַחַת!
human_translation: let us derive from the frontplate, as it is taught frontplate is a type of plate of gold that is two fingerbreadths wide and stretches from ear to ear. And written upon it are two lines: yod , heh , above; kodesh , lamed , below. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw in Rome, and upon it was written: Sacred to the Lord, on one line.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And it was taught in a Baraita: The Tzitz is similar to a crown of gold, and it is two fingerbreadths wide and encircles from ear to ear, and upon it are written two lines: 'Yud Hei' above, and 'Kodesh LaHashem' below. And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw it in Rome, and upon it was written 'Kodesh LaHashem' in one line!"

hebrew_text: דָּנִין כְּלִי מִכְּלִי, וְאֵין דָּנִין כְּלִי מִתַּכְשִׁיט.
human_translation: One derives a vessel from a vessel, and one does not derive a vessel from an ornament.
llm_translation: We evaluate vessel from vessel, and we do not evaluate vessel from adornment.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִזֵּר. דְּאָמַר מָר: זֵר מַשֶּׁהוּ! דָּנִין כְּלִי מִכְּלִי, וְאֵין דָּנִין כְּלִי מֵהֶכְשֵׁר כְּלִי. אִי הָכִי, מִסְגֶּרֶת נָמֵי הֶכְשֵׁר כְּלִי הוּא! מִסְגַּרְתּוֹ לְמַטָּה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: Let us derive from the crown as the Master said: crown, any size. One derives a vessel from a vessel, and one does not derive a vessel from finish of a vessel If so the border is also finish of a vessel border was below,
llm_translation: And we turn from the side. As the Master said: "Side is its name!" We evaluate vessel from vessel, and we do not evaluate vessel from the act of kashering a vessel. If so, the rim is indeed considered a vessel for kashering a vessel! Its rim was below.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִסְגַּרְתּוֹ לְמַטָּה הָיְתָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִסְגַּרְתּוֹ לְמַעְלָה הָיְתָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הַאי הֶכְשֵׁר כְּלִי הוּא!
human_translation: This well according to the one who said its border was below however, according to the one who said its border was above what can be said? this is finish of a vessel.
llm_translation: The one who said his boundary was below, what is there to say to him? This is a valid argument!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁנָּתְנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה מִדָּה מִדָּבָר שֶׁנָּתְנָה בּוֹ תּוֹרָה מִדָּה, וְאַל יוֹכִיחוּ צִיץ וְזֵר, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנָה בָּהֶן תּוֹרָה מִדָּה כְּלָל.
human_translation: Rather, One derives an object for which the Torah provided dimension, from an object for which the Torah provided dimension, And the frontplate and the crown, for which the Torah did not provide any dimension at all, will not prove
llm_translation: Rather: judge a matter that the Torah has given a measure from a matter that the Torah has given a measure, and they should not argue about the forehead plate and the crown, for the Torah did not give them a measure at all.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״עַל פְּנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת קֵדְמָה״, וְאֵין פָּנִים פָּחוֹת מִטֶּפַח.
human_translation: Rav Huna said from here: “Upon the face of [ penei ] the Ark cover on the east” and there is no face [ panim ] less than handbreadth.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, from here: "Facing the mercy seat eastward," and there are no less than a handbreadth of faces.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא כְּאַפֵּי
human_translation: Say like the face
llm_translation: And why not like the face.

hebrew_text: דְּבַר יוֹכָנִי! תָּפַשְׂתָּ מְרוּבֶּה לֹא תָּפַשְׂתָּ, תָּפַשְׂתָּ מוּעָט תָּפַשְׂתָּ. וְאֵימָא כְּאַפֵּי דְּצִיפַּרְתָּא דְּזוּטַר טוּבָא! אֲמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: רַב הוּנָא ״פְּנֵי״ ״פְּנֵי״ גָּמַר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״מֵאֵת פְּנֵי יִצְחָק אָבִיו״.
human_translation: of bar Yokhani , If you grasped many, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped few, you grasped something. say that it is like the face of a bird, which is extremely small? Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Rav Huna derives penei penei It is written here: “Before [ penei ] the Ark cover” and it is written there: “From the presence of [ penei ] Isaac his father”
llm_translation: Word of Yochani! You caught the majority, you did not catch the minority, you caught the minority. And say, as the bird's beak of a small bird! Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: Rav Huna has completed "face to face." It is written here: "towards the mercy seat," and it is written there: "from the presence of his father Isaac."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִפָּנִים שֶׁל מַעְלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּרְאוֹת פְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים וַתִּרְצֵנִי״! תָּפַשְׂתָּ מְרוּבֶּה לֹא תָּפַשְׂתָּ, תָּפַשְׂתָּ מוּעָט תָּפַשְׂתָּ.
human_translation: And let us derive from the face of God, as it is written: as one sees the face of [ penei ] God, and you were pleased with me” If you grasped many, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped few, you grasped something.
llm_translation: And he turned away from the presence on high, as it is written: "When You see the face of God, and it pleases you." If you have grasped the majority, you have not grasped; if you have grasped the minority, you have grasped.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִכְּרוּב, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת יִהְיוּ פְּנֵי הַכְּרוּבִים״!
human_translation: And let us derive from cherub as it is written: “Toward the Ark cover shall be the faces of [ penei ] the cherubs”
llm_translation: And we will learn from the Cherub, as it is written: "Towards the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubim be"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: גְּמִירִי אֵין פְּנֵי כְרוּבִים פְּחוּתִין מִטֶּפַח, וְרַב הוּנָא נָמֵי מֵהָכָא גְּמִיר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: We have learned the faces of the cherubs were not smaller than a handbreadth, Rav Huna derived from here as well,
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It is learned that the faces of the cherubim are less than a handbreadth, and Rav Huna also learned it from here.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי כְּרוּב? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כְּרָבְיָא, שֶׁכֵּן בְּבָבֶל קוֹרִין לְיָנוֹקָא רָבְיָא.
human_translation: And what is a cherub [ keruv ]? Rabbi Abbahu said: Like a child [ keravya ], as in Babylonia one calls a child ravya .
llm_translation: And what is "keruv"? Rabbi Avahu said: Like Ravia, for so they call a child in Babylonia, Ravia.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״פְּנֵי הָאֶחָד פְּנֵי הַכְּרוּב וּפְנֵי הַשֵּׁנִי פְּנֵי אָדָם״, הַיְינוּ כְּרוּב הַיְינוּ אָדָם! אַפֵּי רַבְרְבֵי וְאַפֵּי זוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But if so, that is written “The face of the first was the face of the cherub, and the face of the second was the face of a man” this cherub is that man. a large face and a small face.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now, as it is written: "The face of the one is the face of the cherub, and the face of the other is the face of a man," that is, the cherub is the man! The large face is the cherub and the small face is the man.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דַּחֲלָלַהּ עֲשָׂרָה בַּר מִסְּכָכַהּ? אֵימָא בַּהֲדֵי סְכָכַהּ!
human_translation: And from where that interior space ten without the roofing? Say with the roofing.
llm_translation: From where do we derive that a sukkah must have ten handbreadths of shade? Say, from within the shade itself!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִבֵּית עוֹלָמִים גָּמַר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה לַה׳ שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה אׇרְכּוֹ וְעֶשְׂרִים רׇחְבּוֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁים אַמָּה קוֹמָתוֹ״. וּכְתִיב: ״קוֹמַת הַכְּרוּב הָאֶחָד עֶשֶׂר בָּאַמָּה וְכֵן הַכְּרוּב הַשֵּׁנִי״, וְתַנְיָא: מָה מָצִינוּ בְּבֵית עוֹלָמִים כְּרוּבִים בִּשְׁלִישׁ הַבַּיִת הֵן עוֹמְדִין. מִשְׁכָּן נָמֵי — כְּרוּבִים שְׁלִישׁ הַבַּיִת הֵן עוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: Rather, derived it from the eternal Temple, as it is written: “And the house which King Solomon built for the Lord, its length was sixty cubits, and its breadth twenty cubits, and its height thirty cubits” And it is written: “The height of the first cherub was ten cubits, and likewise was the second cherub” And it is taught Just as we find in the eternal Temple cherubs stand one-third of the Temple, in the Tabernacle as well, cherubs stand one-third
llm_translation: Rather, he completed it from the house of the world, as it is written: "The house that King Solomon built for the Lord: its length was sixty cubits, its width twenty cubits, and its height thirty cubits." And it is written: "The height of one cherub was ten cubits, and so was the height of the second cherub." And it was taught: What do we find in the house of the world? Cherubim standing in the third of the house. In the Tabernacle, however, cherubim stand in the third of the house.

hebrew_text: מִשְׁכָּן כַּמָּה הָוֵי — עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת אוֹרֶךְ הַקָּרֶשׁ״, כַּמָּה הָוֵי לְהוּ — שִׁיתִּין פּוּשְׁכֵי, תִּלְתֵּיהּ כַּמָּה הָוֵי — עֶשְׂרִים פּוּשְׁכֵי, דַּל עַשְׂרָה דְּאָרוֹן וְכַפּוֹרֶת, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ עַשְׂרָה, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיוּ הַכְּרוּבִים פּוֹרְשֵׂי כְנָפַיִם לְמַעְלָה סוֹכְכִים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא סְכָכָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: How many was the Tabernacle? ten cubits, as it is written: “Ten cubits shall be the length of a beam” How many do these sixty handbreadths. And one third of that is how many? twenty handbreadths. Subtract ten of the Ark and the Ark cover ten remain, And it is written: “And the cherubs shall spread out their wings upward, screening [ sokhekhim ] the Ark cover with their wings” the Merciful One is referring to roofing [ sekhakha ] when ten above
llm_translation: Tabernacle how much is - ten cubits, as it is written: "Ten cubits the length of the board," how much is it - sixty boards, three of them how much is - twenty boards, since ten of them are for the ark and the mercy seat, they spread for them ten, and it is written: "And the cherubim shall spread out their wings on high, overshadowing the mercy seat," the Merciful One calls it overshadowing above ten.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּגַדְּפִינְהוּ עִילָּוֵי רֵישַׁיְיהוּ קָיְימִי, דִּלְמָא לַהֲדֵי רֵישַׁיְיהוּ קָיְימִי! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: ״לְמַעְלָה״ כְּתִיב. וְאֵימָא דְּמִידְּלֵי טוּבָא? מִי כְּתִיב ״לְמַעְלָה לְמַעְלָה״?
human_translation: And from where that their wings were above their heads, Perhaps they were level with their heads. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said it is written: upward,” say were extremely high Does the verse say: Upward, upward?
llm_translation: From what did they scoff at them, the heads of the yeshiva, that perhaps their heads were not established? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "Above" is written. And why did they bring up good? Who is written "above above"?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הָאַמּוֹת הָיוּ בֵּינוֹנִיּוֹת. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר, אַמָּה שֶׁל בִּנְיָן שִׁשָּׁה טְפָחִים, וְשֶׁל כֵּלִים חֲמִשָּׁה — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This well according to Rabbi Meir, who said all the cubits were intermediate however, according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said cubit of a building was six handbreadths, of vessels was five what is there to say?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for Rabbi Meir, for he said: All the cubits were of medium size. But according to Rabbi Yehuda who said, the cubit of building is six handbreadths, and that of utensils is five — what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אָרוֹן וְכַפּוֹרֶת כַּמָּה הָוֵי לְהוּ? תְּמָנְיָא וּפַלְגָא, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ חַד סְרֵי וּפַלְגָא, אֵימָא סוּכָּה עַד דְּהָוְיָא חַד סְרֵי וּפַלְגָא!
human_translation: how many was Ark and Ark cover? eight and a half eleven and a half remain say a sukka eleven and a half
llm_translation: The Ark and the Mercy Seat, how many were they? Nine and a half, they measured for them one and a half cubits, and half, say a sukkah until it becomes one and a half cubits and half!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: שִׁיעוּרִין, חֲצִיצִין, וּמְחִיצִין — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yehuda, learned halakha As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: The measures and interpositions and partitions halakhot to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: Rather, for Rabbi Yehudah, the law is established. For Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: Measurements, partitions, and enclosures - the halacha is according to the tradition from Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: שִׁיעוּרִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ! דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְגֶפֶן וּתְאֵנָה וְרִמּוֹן אֶרֶץ זֵית שֶׁמֶן וּדְבָשׁ״, וְאָמַר רַב חָנִין: כׇּל הַפָּסוּק הַזֶּה לְשִׁיעוּרִין נֶאֱמַר!
human_translation: measures They are in the Torah, as it is written: “A land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and figs, and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey” and Rav Ḥanin said: This entire verse is stated for measures
llm_translation: Tractate of Shevi'it is of Biblical origin! As it is written: "A land of wheat and barley, and vines and fig trees and pomegranates; a land of olive oil and honey," and Rav Hanin said: This entire verse was stated for the measurements!

hebrew_text: חִטָּה — לְבַיִת הַמְנוּגָּע, דִּתְנַן: הַנִּכְנָס לְבַיִת הַמְּנוּגָּע וְכֵלָיו עַל כְּתֵפָיו, וְסַנְדָּלָיו וְטַבְּעוֹתָיו בְּיָדוֹ — הוּא וָהֵן טְמֵאִין מִיָּד.
human_translation: Wheat for a house afflicted with leprosy, as we learned one who enters a house afflicted with leprosy and his clothes over his shoulders, and his sandals and his rings are in his hands, he and they, immediately ritually impure.
llm_translation: Wheat — to a house afflicted, as we learned: One who enters a house afflicted and his garments on his shoulders, and his sandals and rings in his hand — he and they are immediately unclean.

hebrew_text: הָיָה לָבוּשׁ כֵּלָיו וְסַנְדָּלָיו בְּרַגְלָיו וְטַבְּעוֹתָיו בְּאֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו — הוּא טָמֵא מִיָּד, וְהֵן טְהוֹרִים עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶה בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, פַּת חִטִּין וְלֹא פַּת שְׂעוֹרִין, מֵיסֵב וְאוֹכֵל בְּלִיפְתָּן.
human_translation: he was dressed in his clothes, and his sandals were on his feet, and his rings were on his fingers, he immediately ritually impure, but they, remain pure until he stays long enough to eat half a loaf wheat bread, and not barley bread, reclining and eating with relish
llm_translation: He was dressed, his sandals on his feet, and his rings on his fingers - he is impure immediately, and they are pure until he stays the time it takes to eat half a loaf of bread, wheat bread and not barley bread, he reclines and eats with their peelings.

hebrew_text: שְׂעוֹרָה — דִּתְנַן: עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה — מְטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע וּבְמַשָּׂא, וְאֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל.
human_translation: Barley as we learned A bone of a barley imparts impurity through contact and by being carried, it does not impart impurity of a tent,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Se'orah - ditnan: etzem kis'eorah - metamei b'maga u'vemassa, ve'eino metamei b'ohel. English translation: Barley - as we learned in a Mishnah: the bone the size of a barley grain - imparts impurity through contact and carrying, but does not impart impurity in a tent.

hebrew_text: גֶּפֶן — כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית יַיִן לְנָזִיר.
human_translation: a vine is the quantity of a quarter of wine for a nazirite.
llm_translation: "Gefen - k'dei revi'it yayin l'nazir."

hebrew_text: תְּאֵנָה — כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Fig a dried fig-bulk with regard to carrying out Shabbat.
llm_translation: Fig tree — like a dried fig for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: רִמּוֹן — דִּתְנַן: כָּל כְּלֵי בַּעֲלֵי בָתִּים — שִׁיעוּרָן כְּרִמּוֹנִים.
human_translation: Pomegranate as we learned All vessels belonging to homeowners the size of pomegranates.
llm_translation: Pomegranate — as we learned: all household vessels — their minimum measure is like pomegranates.

hebrew_text: ״אֶרֶץ זֵית שֶׁמֶן (וּדְבָשׁ)״ — אֶרֶץ שֶׁכׇּל שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ כְּזֵיתִים. ״כָּל שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! הָא אִיכָּא הָנֵי דְּאָמְרִינַן! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שֶׁרוֹב שִׁיעוּרֶיהָ כְּזֵיתִים.
human_translation: “A land of olive oil and honey,” A land, all of whose measures are olive-bulks. Does it enter your mind all of whose measures But aren’t there those that we mentioned Rather, say: A land, most of whose measures are olive-bulks,
llm_translation: "The land of olive oil (and honey)" - a land where all its measurements are like olives. "All its measurements" - is it necessary to say?! There are those that we say! Rather say: that most of its measurements are like olives.

hebrew_text: דְּבָשׁ — כְּכוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Honey, to Yom Kippur, a large date-bulk
llm_translation: Honey - like the writing of a bold woman on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ! וְתִסְבְּרָא? שִׁיעוּרִין מִי כְּתִיבִי? אֶלָּא הִלְכְתָא נִינְהוּ, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Apparently, these are in the Torah And how can you understand measures are written Rather, they are halakhot and the verse is mere support
llm_translation: The matter is from the Torah! And you might think, "Are the measurements written?" Rather, they are Halacha, and the verse is merely a support in general.

hebrew_text: חֲצִיצִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ! דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָחַץ (אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ) בַּמַּיִם״, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר חוֹצֵץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין הַמַּיִם!
human_translation: interpositions These, are in the Torah, as it is written: “And he shall bathe his flesh in the water” that nothing should interpose between his flesh and the water.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Chatzitzin de'orayta ninhu! Dichtiv: 've'rachat (et besaro) ba'mayim', shelo yehi davar chotetz beinu le'vein ha'mayim!" Translation: "They are biblical interpositions! As it is written: 'And he shall wash (his flesh) with water,' so that nothing should interpose between him and the water!"

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא — לִשְׂעָרוֹ, כִּדְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָא: נִימָא אַחַת קְשׁוּרָה — חוֹצֶצֶת, שָׁלֹשׁ — אֵינָן חוֹצְצוֹת, שְׁתַּיִם — אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ.
human_translation: When the halakha comes in one’s hair in accordance with of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: A single hair [ nima ] tied interposes Three do not interpose, two I do not know
llm_translation: When the halakha came — to his hair, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: If one is tied — it is a partition, three — they are not partitions, two — I do not know.

hebrew_text: שְׂעָרוֹ נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נִינְהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָחַץ אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ בַּמַּיִם״, אֶת הַטָּפֵל לִבְשָׂרוֹ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — שְׂעָרוֹ!
human_translation: one’s hair is also in the Torah, which is written: “And he shall bathe [ et besaro ] his flesh in the water.” et that which is subordinate to his flesh, and what is that? his hair.
llm_translation: His hair are considered part of the Torah, as it is written: "And he shall wash his flesh with water," including the plaster to his flesh. And what is it? — His hair!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא, לְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק:
human_translation: When the halakha comes in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said:
llm_translation: When the teaching came, in accordance with Rabbi Yitzchak. For Rabbi Yitzchak said:

hebrew_text: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, רוּבּוֹ וּמַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ. וְגָזְרוּ עַל רוּבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד, וְעַל מִיעוּטוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד.
human_translation: By Torah law, the majority his and he is particular about it is it an interposition However, if he is not particular about it is not an interposition. issued a decree the majority one’s which he is not particular, due to the majority one’s which he is particular. And, the minority his which one is particular, due to the majority his which one is particular.
