llm_translation: Matter of Torah, majority and meticulous upon it - he is a divider, and one who is not meticulous upon it - he is not a divider. And they decreed regarding his majority that he is not meticulous because of the majority that is meticulous, and regarding his minority that is meticulous because of the majority that is meticulous.

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְזַר נָמֵי עַל מִיעוּטוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד מִשּׁוּם מִיעוּטוֹ הַמַּקְפִּיד, אִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם רוּבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד!
human_translation: let us also issue a decree the minority one’s which he is not particular due to the minority his which he is particular, or alternatively, due to the majority his which he is not particular.
llm_translation: And to decree a decree upon him for his minority that he does not care about because of his minority, the one who cares, if for his majority that he does not care!

hebrew_text: הִיא גּוּפָא גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?!
human_translation: is itself a decree. Shall we arise and issue decree to decree?
llm_translation: It is the body of a decree, and we should take revenge and decree a decree for a decree?!

hebrew_text: מְחִיצִין — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: partitions is as we stated This well to Rabbi Yehuda, However, according to Rabbi Meir, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Partitions - this that we said: If it is suitable for Rabbi Yehuda, but not for Rabbi Meir - what is there to say?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא — לְגוּד, וְלָבוּד, וְדוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה.
human_translation: When the halakha comes to extending gode ], and joining [ lavud ], and a curved wall
llm_translation: When the matter came up - to be cut, and to be measured, and to be weighed meticulously.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵין לָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ דְּפָנוֹת.
human_translation: And that does not have three walls.
llm_translation: And she does not have three sides.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן, וּשְׁלִישִׁית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ כְּהִלְכָתָן, וּרְבִיעִית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח.
human_translation: The Sages taught two in the standard sense, and the third even handbreadth Rabbi Shimon says: Three in the standard sense, and the fourth even handbreadth
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two are considered according to their measure, and the third is considered even a handbreadth. Rabbi Shimon says: Three are considered according to their measure, and the fourth is considered even a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: With regard to what they disagree? The Rabbis hold: The tradition is authoritative, And Rabbi Shimon holds: The vocalization is authoritative,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? The Rabbis hold: There is a mother for the tradition, and Rabbi Shimon holds: There is a mother for the Scripture.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, ״בְּסֻכַּת״ ״בְּסֻכַּת״ ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: the Rabbis hold: The tradition is authoritative, “In sukkot [ basukkot ] in sukkot [ basukkot ]” in sukkot [ basukkot ]” There is here four
llm_translation: The sages hold: there is a mother to the tradition, "in a booth" "in a booth" "in booths" - here there are four.

hebrew_text: דַּל חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּלָתָא. שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן, וַאֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא וּגְרַעְתַּהּ לִשְׁלִישִׁית וְאוֹקֵמְתַּהּ אַטֶּפַח.
human_translation: Subtract one to itself, and three remain. two in the standard sense, the halakha comes and reduces the third and establishes it as handbreadth.
llm_translation: A poor person for himself, they gave him three. Two as they are accustomed, and a halakha came and reduced it to a third, and established it as a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא, ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ — הֲרֵי כָּאן שֵׁשׁ, דַּל חַד קְרָא לְגוּפֵיהּ, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ אַרְבַּע. שָׁלֹשׁ כְּהִלְכָתָן, אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא וּגְרַעְתַּהּ לִרְבִיעִית וְאוֹקֵמְתַּהּ אַטֶּפַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: The vocalization is authoritative. basukkot , basukkot , basukkot , there is here six times Subtract one verse to itself, and four remain Three in the standard sense, and the halakha comes and reduces the fourth and establishes it as handbreadth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: There is a mother to the verse, "in the sukkot," "in the sukkot," "in the sukkot" - here are six, since one verse is for itself, they are left with four. Three according to their law, a halacha came and diminished it to a quarter and established it a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: סְכָכָה בָּעֲיָא קְרָא, וּמָר סָבַר: סְכָכָה לָא בָּעֲיָא קְרָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees the vocalization is authoritative, and here, with regard to this that they disagree: One Sage, holds its roofing requires a verse; And one Sage, holds its roofing does not require a verse,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is a mother to the Scripture, and here in this case they dispute: One Master holds: The covering requires a verse, and the other Master holds: The covering does not require a verse.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא — לְגָרֵעַ. וּמָר סָבַר: כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא — לְהוֹסִיף.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees the tradition is authoritative, and here, with regard to this that they disagree: One Sage, holds: When the halakha comes to reduce And one Sage, holds: When the halakha comes to add
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is a mother to tradition, and here in this case they dispute: Master A thinks: when a halakha comes - to diminish. And Master B thinks: when a halakha comes - to add.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, כִּי אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא — לְגָרֵעַ, וְיֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת. וְהָכָא בְּדוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees when the halakha comes to reduce the tradition is authoritative, And here with regard to one derives first they disagree. Sage, holds one derives first And Sage, holds one does not derive first
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, when a halakha comes - to diminish, and there is a mother for the tradition. And here in the case of those who interpret the beginnings, they differ: Master A thinks: They interpret the beginnings, and Master B thinks: They do not interpret the beginnings.

hebrew_text: רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר: טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מֵהָכָא: ״וְסוּכָּה תִּהְיֶה לְצֵל יוֹמָם מֵחוֹרֶב וּלְמַחְסֶה וּלְמִסְתּוֹר מִזֶּרֶם וּמִמָּטָר״.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said rationale of Rabbi Shimon from here: “And there shall be a sukka for shade in the daytime from the heat, and for refuge and cover from storm and from rain”
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: The reason of Rabbi Shimon is derived from here: "And a booth shall be for shade by day from the heat, and for a refuge, and for a covert from storm and from rain."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתוֹ טֶפַח הֵיכָן מַעֲמִידוֹ? אָמַר רַב: מַעֲמִידוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹצֵא.
human_translation: where does one position that handbreadth? Rav said: He positions it opposite that emerges
llm_translation: And that cubit, where does one place it? Rav said: One places it opposite the protrusion.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב:
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav:
llm_translation: They said to him, Rav Kahana and Rav Assi to Rav:

hebrew_text: וְיַעֲמִידֶנּוּ כְּנֶגֶד רֹאשׁ תּוֹר?! שְׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: And let him position opposite line the end Rav was silent
llm_translation: And he shall establish it opposite the head of the bull! Rav remained silent.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: מַעֲמִידוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹצֵא. וְכֵן מוֹרִין בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא: מַעֲמִידוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹצֵא.
human_translation: It was also stated Shmuel said in the name of Levi: He positions it opposite that emerges And similarly, they rule in the study hall: He positions it opposite that emerges
llm_translation: It was stated similarly, Shmuel said in the name of Levi: One places him opposite the one leaving. And so do they teach in the study hall: One places him opposite the one leaving.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי סִימוֹן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ טֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, וּמַעֲמִידוֹ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים סָמוּךְ לַדּוֹפֶן, וְכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַדּוֹפֶן כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Simon and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, He establishes for an expansive handbreadth, And he positions it less than three handbreadths adjacent to the wall And any less than three adjacent to the wall is like joined
llm_translation: Rabbi Simon, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One makes for it a handbreadth ledge jutting out, and places it within three handbreadths near the wall, and any ledge less than three handbreadths near the wall is considered as if it were attached to the wall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּמָבוֹי — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאוֹתוֹ טֶפַח מַעֲמִידוֹ לְכׇל רוּחַ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: A sukka constructed like an alleyway, fit, and that handbreadth, he positions it in any direction that he chooses,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A sukkah made like a mavoy is valid, and that same handbreadth establishes it for any wind that it desires.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי סִימוֹן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ פַּס אַרְבָּעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ, וּמַעֲמִידוֹ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַדּוֹפֶן, וְכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַדּוֹפֶן כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Simon and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: one establishes for a board four and a bit and positions it less than three adjacent to wall, And any less than three adjacent to the wall is like joined
llm_translation: Rabbi Simon, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One should make for it a hole of four handbreadths and suspend it, and place it in a pit less than three handbreadths near the wall, and any pit less than three handbreadths near the wall is considered as if it were closed.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ סַגִּיא טֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ בָּעֲיָא פַּס אַרְבָּעָה? הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא שְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת כְּהִלְכָתָן — סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּטֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת, אִי אִיכָּא פַּס אַרְבָּעָה — אֵין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: What is different there, where you say an expansive handbreadth suffices and what is different here where you say it requires a board four There, where there are two walls in the standard sense, it is sufficient to have an expansive handbreadth here, where there are not two walls if there is a board four yes, if not, no,
llm_translation: And what is the difference there, that you say a protrusion of a handbreadth is effective, and what is the difference here, that you say it requires a space of four? There, because there are two sides as their law dictates - it is effective with a protrusion of a handbreadth. Here, where there are not two sides, if there is a space of four - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְאֵינָהּ נִתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: Rava said: And is permitted only in form of a doorway.
llm_translation: Rava said: And it is only permitted in the form of the opening of the door.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: וְנִתֶּרֶת נָמֵי בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: Some say Rava said: And is also permitted in form of a doorway.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rava said: "And you shall carve the stones with the form of a seal."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: וּצְרִיכָא נָמֵי צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: Some say Rava said: And also requires the form of a doorway
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rava said: And it is necessary also the form of the entrance.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דְּקָא עָבֵיד טֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, וְקָא עָבֵיד צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר מָר לְהָא דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: וְנִתֶּרֶת נָמֵי בְּצוּרַת הַפֶּתַח? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּאִידַּךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּרָבָא סְבִירָא לִי. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: וּצְרִיכָא נָמֵי צוּרַת הַפֶּתַח.
human_translation: Rav Ashi found Rav Kahana and establishing an expansive handbreadth and establishing the form of a doorway said to And does the Master not hold with that of Rava, as Rava said: And is also permitted in form of a doorway? said to him: I hold with the other version Rava, as Rava said: And also requires the form of a doorway,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe found Rav Kahana making a handbreadth measurement for a skylight, and he was making the shape of a doorway. He said to him: Does the Master not hold like what Rava said, for Rava said: And you should also leave space in the shape of a doorway? He said to him: I hold like your colleague Rava, for Rava said: And you also need to leave space in the shape of a doorway.

hebrew_text: שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן כּוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: וְכֵן לְשַׁבָּת, מִגּוֹ דְּהָוְיָא דּוֹפֶן לְעִנְיַן סוּכָּה — הָוְיָא דּוֹפֶן לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: two walls in the standard sense Rava said: And likewise to Shabbat since it is a wall with regard to sukka it is a partition with regard to Shabbat.
llm_translation: Two as their law is. Rava said: And similarly regarding Shabbat, since it is similar to the matter of a sukkah - it is similar to the matter of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמִי אָמְרִינַן מִגּוֹ? וְהָתַנְיָא: דּוֹפֶן סוּכָּה כְּדוֹפֶן שַׁבָּת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בֵּין קָנֶה לַחֲבֵרוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to And do we say Since But isn’t it taught wall of a sukka like partition of Shabbat. provided that from one reed to another will not be three handbreadths.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Did we say from a roof? But it was taught in a Baraita: The roofing of a sukkah is like the roofing of Shabbat, except that there should not be a space of three handbreadths between one beam and its fellow.

hebrew_text: וִיתֵירָה, שַׁבָּת עַל סוּכָּה, שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת אֵינָהּ נִתֶּרֶת אֶלָּא בְּעוֹמֵד מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפָּרוּץ, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּסוּכָּה.
human_translation: But Shabbat beyond sukka , as Shabbat, is permitted only in the standing is greater than the breached That is not so with regard to the sukka ,
llm_translation: Extra, Shabbat on Sukkah, that Shabbat is not permitted except by standing predominantly on the breach, which is not the case with a Sukkah.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: יְתֵירָה שַׁבָּת דְּסוּכָּה אַסּוּכָּה, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן מִגּוֹ!
human_translation: What, isn’t teaching that Shabbat that during Sukkot beyond Sukkot ? And we do not say Since
llm_translation: What is the reason that the additional Shabbat of Sukkah is called "Assukah" and we do not say "Migo"?

hebrew_text: לָא: יְתֵירָה שַׁבָּת דְּעָלְמָא עַל שַׁבָּת דְּסוּכָּה.
human_translation: No, that Shabbat in general beyond Shabbat that during Sukkot .
llm_translation: Not permitted: extra Sabbath of the world on the Sabbath of Sukkah.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: יְתֵירָה סוּכָּה דְעָלְמָא אַסּוּכָּה דְשַׁבָּת, דְּאִילּוּ סוּכָּה דְעָלְמָא בָּעֲיָא טֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, וְאִילּוּ סוּכָּה דְשַׁבָּת לָא בָּעֲיָא טֶפַח שׂוֹחֵק, וְסַגִּי בְּלֶחִי.
human_translation: If so let also teach sukka in general beyond sukka on Shabbat as a sukka in general requires an expansive handbreadth, while a sukka on Shabbat not require an expansive handbreadth and sufficient with a side post
llm_translation: If so, let it teach also: the extra covering of a sukkah of the world is like the covering of a Shabbat sukkah, for if the covering of a sukkah of the world requires a handbreadth of shade, and the covering of a Shabbat sukkah does not require a handbreadth of shade, and it is sufficient with the width of the beams.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא אַתְּ הוּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לֶחִי — כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: as you are one who said: If one placed roofing over an alleyway which has a side post it is fit
llm_translation: You are the one who said: "If you place a beam across the entrance of an alleyway that has a side post - it is valid!"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לָא אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, הַשְׁתָּא מִקִּילְּתָא לַחֲמִירְתָּא אָמְרִינַן, מֵחֲמִירְתָּא לְקִילְּתָא לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: it is not necessary Now we say from a leniency to a stringency, from a stringency, to a leniency, all the more so
llm_translation: That one did not need it, now from leniency to stringency we say, from stringency to leniency not all the more so.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: the itself. Rava said:
llm_translation: Body. Rava said:

hebrew_text: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לֶחִי — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: one placed roofing over an alleyway that has a side post, it is fit
llm_translation: "Place a beam across the entrance of a courtyard that has a side post - valid."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: And Rava said: If one placed roofing over boards wells, it is fit
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one places it on the tops of the pits of cisterns - it is valid.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מָבוֹי, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא שְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת מְעַלְּיָיתָא. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת, דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת מְעַלְּיָיתָא — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And necessary as if he taught us alleyway, due to that there are two full-fledged walls; however, boards wells, where there are not two full-fledged walls say no,
llm_translation: And it is necessary. For if we were to hear a case of a mavoi, because there are two upper side posts. But regarding the corners of courtyards, where there are not two upper side posts - say it is not considered an entrance.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן פַּסֵּי בֵירָאוֹת, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם אַרְבַּע דְפָנוֹת, אֲבָל סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי מָבוֹי, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁם אַרְבַּע דְפָנוֹת — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And if he taught us boards wells, due to that it is category of four, walls; however, one placed roofing over an alleyway, where it is not category of four walls, say no,
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a case of breaches in wells, it is considered a matter of four sides, but if it is a breach on the top of a courtyard, where there is not the matter of four sides — say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, מֵחֲמִירְתָּא לְקִילְּתָא, אֲבָל מִקִּילְּתָא לַחֲמִירְתָּא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if he taught us these two from a stringency, to a leniency, however, from a leniency to a stringency, say no. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two, stringency to leniency, but from leniency to stringency - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁחֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מְצִלָּתָהּ — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And whose sunlight, is greater than its shade, is unfit.
llm_translation: And her rage is greater than her modesty - she is disqualified.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמָתָהּ מֵחֲמַת סִיכּוּךְ, וְלֹא מֵחֲמַת דְּפָנוֹת. רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: אַף מֵחֲמַת דְּפָנוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Whose sunlight due to roofing, and not due to walls. Rabbi Yoshiya says: even due to walls.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Her anger is due to the anger of neglect, and not due to the anger of jealousy. Rabbi Yoshiyah says: Also due to the anger of jealousy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְסַכּוֹתָ עַל הָאָרוֹן אֶת הַפָּרוֹכֶת״, פָּרוֹכֶת מְחִיצָה, וְקָא קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא ״סְכָכָה״, אַלְמָא מְחִיצָה כִּסְכָךְ בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar bar Shelemya said in the name of Abaye: What is the rationale for Rabbi Yoshiya? as it is written: “And you shall screen [ vesakkota ] the Ark with the curtain” The curtain is a partition and the Merciful One calls it roofing [ sekhakha ]. Apparently, we require a partition similar roofing;
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar son of Shelemya said in the name of Abbaye: What is the reason of Rabbi Yoshiyah, as it is written: "And you shall overlay the ark with the curtain," the curtain is a partition, and the Merciful One calls it "covering," indicating that we require a partition like a covering.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא דְּנִיכּוֹף בַּיהּ פּוּרְתָּא, דְּמִחֲזֵי כִּסְכָךְ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, That that we bend a bit so that it appears as roofing
llm_translation: And the sages? That one who was leaning on the beam of the winepress, for he saw a shadow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי, וְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וַאֲחֵרִים — כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: סוּכָּה דִּירַת קֶבַע בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi and Rabbi Yoshiya, and Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabban Gamliel, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Eliezer, and Aḥerim all hold we require sukka a permanent residence.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi, and Rabbi Yoshiyah, and Rabbi Yehudah, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabban Gamliel, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Eliezer, and others — all of them hold: we require a permanent dwelling sukkah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל סוּכָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: Any sukka that does not have four cubits by four cubits is unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi — as it was taught, Rabbi says: Any sukkah that does not have four cubits by four cubits — it is invalid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya that which we stated,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah - Ha d'amaran.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דִּתְנַן סוּכָּה שֶׁהִיא גְּבוֹהָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה פְּסוּלָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda as we learned A sukka that is more than twenty cubits high is unfit; Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda taught: A sukkah that is taller than twenty cubits is invalid. Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן וּשְׁלִישִׁית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ כְּהִלְכָתָן וּרְבִיעִית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon as it is taught two in the standard sense, a third even a handbreadth; Rabbi Shimon says: Three in the standard sense, and a fourth even a handbreadth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon — as it was taught: two according to their measure, and a third even a handbreadth, Rabbi Shimon says: three according to their measure, and a fourth even a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הָעֲגָלָה אוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַסְּפִינָה, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל פּוֹסֵל, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel as it is taught one who establishes his sukka atop a wagon or atop a boat, Rabban Gamliel deems it unfit; Rabbi Akiva deems it fit.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel — as it was taught: one who makes his sukkah on top of a wagon or on top of a ship, Rabban Gamliel disqualifies it, and Rabbi Akiva validates it.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai as we learned one whose head and most of his were in the sukka and his table was in the house, Beit Shammai deem unfit, And Beit Hillel deem it fit.
llm_translation: House of Shammai — for it was taught: If one's head and the greater part of his body were within the sukkah, and his table was inside the house, Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel deem it fit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — דִּתְנַן: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ כְּמִין צְרִיף, אוֹ שֶׁסְּמָכָהּ לְכוֹתֶל, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פּוֹסֵל לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ גַּג, וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer as we learned one who establishes his sukka like a type of circular hut or who rested against the wall, Rabbi Eliezer deems it unfit because it does not have a roof, and the Rabbis deem it fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer — as we learned: One who makes his sukkah like a type of tzerif, or leans it against a wall, Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it because it does not have a roof, and the Sages deem it valid.

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים — דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּשׁוֹבָךְ — פְּסוּלָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ זָוִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Aḥerim as it is taught Aḥerim say: A sukka built like a dovecote is unfit, because it does not have corners,
llm_translation: Others — as it was taught, others say: a sukkah made like a wagon — invalid, because it lacks corners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה כְּכִבְשָׁן, אִם יֵשׁ בְּהֶקֵּיפָהּ כְּדֵי לֵישֵׁב בָּהּ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּנֵי אָדָם — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאִם לָאו — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a sukka shaped like a furnace if its circumference has sufficient space for twenty-four people to sit in it, it is fit, and if not, it is unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A sukkah made like a kevashan, if within its circumference there is enough space to sit twenty-four people - it is valid, but if not - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל סוּכָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi who said: Any sukka that does not have four cubits by four cubits is unfit.
llm_translation: As who? As Rabbi, who said: Any sukkah that does not have four cubits by four cubits is invalid.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי, גַּבְרָא בְּאַמְּתָא יָתֵיב, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּהֶקֵּיפוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים יֵשׁ בּוֹ רוֹחַב טֶפַח, בִּתְרֵיסַר סַגִּי?
human_translation: Now, since a person sits, cubit every three handbreadths circumference there is a diameter of handbreadth. twelve people suffice,
llm_translation: From where do we know that a man sitting in a cubit, if there are around him three handbreadths, there is in it a width of a handbreadth, in thirteen cubits?

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעִיגּוּלָא, אֲבָל בְּרִיבּוּעָא — בָּעֲיָא טְפֵי.
human_translation: This applies only in the circle but in square requires more
llm_translation: These matters in a circle, but in a square - require a corner.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי כַּמָּה מְרוּבָּע יוֹתֵר עַל הָעִיגּוּל — רְבִיעַ, בְּשִׁיתְּסַר סַגִּי?
human_translation: Now, how much is a square greater than the circle? one quarter with sixteen sufficient.
llm_translation: From how much more is the square greater than the circle - a quarter, in sixteen se'ah?

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעִיגּוּל דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ רִיבּוּעָא, אֲבָל רִיבּוּעָא דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ עִגּוּלָא — בָּעֵינַן טְפֵי, מִשּׁוּם מוּרְשָׁא דְקַרְנָתָא.
human_translation: This applies to a circle inscribed in a square, but a square circumscribed by a circle, requires a greater due to the projection of the corners
llm_translation: These are the words in the case of a circle that emerges from a square, but a square that emerges from a circle - we require a surplus, due to the inheritance of the horn.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי כׇּל אַמְּתָא בְּרִיבּוּעָא אַמְּתָא וּתְרֵי חוּמְשֵׁי בַּאֲלַכְסוֹנָא, בְּשִׁיבְסַר נְכֵי חוּמְשָׁא סַגִּיא? לָא דָּק.
human_translation: Now, every square cubit diagonal measures one and two-fifths cubits, seventeen minus one-fifth sufficient. was not precise
llm_translation: From the width of every cubit in a square cubit and two fifths in the diagonal, in the twelfth of the diagonal, is the diagonal of the square greater? No, it is not thin.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִינַן לָא דָּק פּוּרְתָּא, טוּבָא מִי אָמְרִינַן לָא דָּק?
human_translation: Say that we say not precise slight; great, do we say not precise?
llm_translation: Statement that we say "not thin" a feather, who said "not thin"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִי סָבְרַתְּ גַּבְרָא בְּאַמְּתָא יָתֵיב, תְּלָתָא גַּבְרֵי בְּתַרְתֵּי אַמְּתָא יָתְבִי. כַּמָּה הָווּ לְהוּ — שִׁיתְּסַר, אֲנַן שִׁיבְסַר נְכֵי חוּמְשָׁא בָּעֵינַן! לָא דָּק.
human_translation: Mar Keshisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: Do you hold a man sits, he sits cubit, three people sit two cubits. How many are there sixteen we require seventeen minus one-fifth, He was not precise
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Kashisha, son of Rav Chisda, to Rav Ashe: "Do you think a man can sit in one cubit, while three men sit in two cubits? How many were they — six. We require only five cubits, not six."

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִינַן לָא דָּק לְחוּמְרָא, לְקוּלָּא מִי אָמְרִינַן לָא דָּק?
human_translation: Say that we say not precise stringency, leniency, do we say was not precise?
llm_translation: Statement: The Gemara that we say "Lo dak lechumra," for leniency, who said we do not say "Lo dak"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַסִּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְעוֹלָם גַּבְרָא בְּאַמְּתָא יָתֵיב, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְקוֹם גַּבְרֵי לָא קָחָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: Rav Asi said to Rav Ashi: Actually, a man sits one cubit, and Rabbi Yoḥanan is not factoring the space men
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Assi to Rav Ashe: Always a man should sit in the depth, and Rabbi Yochanan the place of men is not considered.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה הָווּ לְהוּ — תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי, בְּשִׁיבְסַר נְכֵי חוּמְשָׁא סַגִּיא! הַיְינוּ דְּלָא דָּק וּלְחוּמְרָא לָא דָּק.
human_translation: How many are there eighteen seventeen minus one-fifth sufficient. This is where he was not precise, and he is not precise stringency,
llm_translation: As much as they were - eighteen measures, in the seventh year, the lambs of the fifth year are large! That is, that which is not fine and that which is fine.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן דְּקֵיסָרִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ דַּיָּינֵי דְקֵיסָרִי אָמְרִי: עִיגּוּלָא דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ רִיבּוּעָא — רִבְעָא,
human_translation: The Sages of Caesarea, and some say the judges of Caesarea, said a circle inscribed in a square one quarter
llm_translation: The scholars of Caesarea, and they say to her, the judges of Caesarea say: the circumference that emerges from the diameter is a quarter.

hebrew_text: רִיבּוּעָא דְּנָפֵיק מִגּוֹ עִיגּוּלָא — פַּלְגָא. וְלָא הִיא, דְּהָא קָחָזֵינַן דְּלָא הָוֵי כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: a square circumscribed by a circle half, And is not as we see that is not that much.
llm_translation: Mixture that comes out from the round cake - half. And it is not so, for we see that it is not all of this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שְׁתֵּי סוּכּוֹת שֶׁל יוֹצְרִים זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ — הַפְּנִימִית אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה, וְחַיֶּיבֶת בִּמְזוּזָה. וְהַחִיצוֹנָה סוּכָּה, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַמְּזוּזָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said in the name of Rabbi Meir: two craftsmen’s booths, one within the other, the inner one is not sukka , And it is obligated in mezuza . And the outer is sukka , and is not obligated in mezuza .
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said in the name of Rabbi Meir: Two sukkot made by artisans, one inside the other - the inner one is not considered a sukkah and requires a mezuzah. The outer one is considered a sukkah and is exempt from a mezuzah.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? תִּהְוֵי חִיצוֹנָה כְּבֵית שַׁעַר הַפְּנִימִית, וְתִתְחַיֵּיב בִּמְזוּזָה! מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קְבִיעַ.
human_translation: Why Let the outer be like a gatehouse of the inner and be obligated in mezuza . because is not permanent
llm_translation: And why? It should be considered an outer chamber like the inner gatehouse, and be obligated in a mezuzah! Because it is not permanent.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גַּנְבַּ״‎ךְ: סוּכַּת גּוֹיִם, סוּכַּת נָשִׁים, סוּכַּת בְּהֵמָה, סוּכַּת כּוּתִים סוּכָּה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא מְסוּכֶּכֶת כְּהִלְכָתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Gimmel , nun , beit , kaf , a booth of gentiles [ goyim ], a booth of women [ nashim ], a booth of domesticated animals [ behema ], a booth of Samaritans [ Kutim ], a booth of any sort, fit provided it is roofed in the standard sense.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A stolen sukkah, a sukkah of non-Jews, a sukkah of women, a sukkah of animals, a sukkah of Samaritans - a sukkah from any place is valid, as long as it is covered according to its law.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּהִלְכָתָהּ״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ לְצֵל סוּכָּה.
human_translation: What In the standard sense? Rav Ḥisda said And that one established to shade of a sukka
llm_translation: What is "as she goes"? Rav Ḥisdah said: That he made it for the shade of the sukkah.

hebrew_text: ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי: סוּכַּת רַקְבַּ״‎שׁ. דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוּכַּת רַקְבַּ״‎שׁ: סוּכַּת רוֹעִים, סוּכַּת קַיָּיצִים סוּכַּת בּוּרְגָּנִין סוּכַּת שׁוֹמְרֵי פֵירוֹת, סוּכָּה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא מְסוּכֶּכֶת כְּהִלְכָתָהּ.
human_translation: What does of any sort, to include? comes to include booths Reish , kuf , beit , shin , as the Sages taught: The booth reish , kuf , beit , shin , the booth of shepherds [ ro’im ], the booth of fig driers [ kayyatzim ], the booth of guards of fields [ burganin ], the booth of the guards of produce [ shomerei peirot ], a booth of any sort, fit, provided it is roofed in the standard sense.
llm_translation: "From every place" - to include what? To include: a sukkah made of reeds. For the Rabbis taught: a sukkah made of reeds includes a sukkah of shepherds, a sukkah of summer residents, a sukkah of watchmen of fruit, a sukkah of gardeners, a sukkah from any place - is valid, as long as it is covered according to its requirement.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּהִלְכָתָהּ״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ לְצֵל סוּכָּה.
human_translation: What In the standard sense? Rav Ḥisda said And that one established to shade of a sukka ,
llm_translation: What is "as she goes"? Rav Hisda said: That he made it for the shade of a sukkah.

hebrew_text: ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי: סוּכַּת גַּנְבַּ״‎ךְ.
human_translation: What does of any sort, come to include? comes to include booths gimmel , nun , beit , kaf .
llm_translation: "From all places" - to include what? To include: a stolen sukkah.

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא דְּגַנְבַּ״‎ךְ, אַלִּימָא לֵיהּ גַּנְבַּ״‎ךְ מִשּׁוּם דִּקְבִיעִי, וְקָא תָּנֵא ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי רַקְבַּ״‎שׁ, דְּלָא קְבִיעִי.
human_translation: This tanna who of gimmel , nun , beit , kaf gimmel , nun , beit , kaf powerful to him because they are permanent And he taught: any sort, to include reish , kuf , beit , shin , which, are not permanent
llm_translation: This Mishna of "Ganbak," say to him "Ganbak" because it is permanent, and it taught "from any place" to exclude "Rakbash," which is not permanent.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּרַקְבַּ״‎שׁ, אַלִּימָא לֵיהּ רַקְבַּ״‎שׁ, דִּבְנֵי חִיּוּבָא נִינְהוּ, וְתָנֵא ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי גַּנְבַּ״‎ךְ, דְּלָאו בְּנֵי חִיּוּבָא נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And that tanna of reish , kuf , beit , shin reish , kuf , beit , shin powerful to him obligated And he taught: any sort, to include gimmel , nun , beit , kaf , which, not obligated
llm_translation: The Tanna of Rekav"sh, say to him Rekav"sh, for they are the sons of obligation, and it was taught "from any place" to include your Ganb"ch, for they are not the sons of obligation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סוּכָּה יְשָׁנָה — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא סוּכָּה יְשָׁנָה, כׇּל שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ קוֹדֶם לֶחָג שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. אֲבָל אִם עֲשָׂאָהּ לְשֵׁם חַג, אֲפִילּוּ מִתְּחִילַּת הַשָּׁנָה — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: an old sukka , Beit Shammai deem it unfit and Beit Hillel deem it fit. And which is an old sukka ? any that one established thirty days prior to the Festival However, if he established it for the sake of the festival even at the beginning of the year, it is fit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A temporary hut from the previous year— Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel deem it fit. And what is considered a temporary hut from the previous year? Any hut that was made before the festival thirty days prior. But if one made it for the sake of the festival, even from the beginning of the year—it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לַה׳״, סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לְשֵׁם חַג בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Beit Shammai? the verse states: “The festival of Sukkot is seven days unto the Lord” we require a sukka established for the sake of the Festival.
llm_translation: Gemara: What are the reasons of Beit Shammai? It is said in the verse: "The Feast of Sukkot for seven days to the Lord," we require a sukkah made for the sake of the festival.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת. דְּאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִנַּיִן לַעֲצֵי סוּכָּה שֶׁאֲסוּרִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לַה׳״,
human_translation: And Beit Hillel that is necessary to in accordance with of Rav Sheshet, as Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: From where that the wood of the sukka is prohibited all seven the verse states: “The festival of Sukkot is seven days unto the Lord.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Beit Hillel? That one asks according to Rav Sheshet. For Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: From where do we derive that the branches of a sukkah that are forbidden all seven days? The verse teaches: "The Feast of Sukkot seven days to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחָל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל הַחֲגִיגָה, כָּךְ חָל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל הַסּוּכָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לַה׳״, מָה חַג לַה׳ — אַף סוּכָּה לַה׳.
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Just as the name of Heaven takes effect upon the Festival peace-offering, so too, the name of Heaven takes effect upon the sukka , as it is stated: “The festival of Sukkot is seven days unto the Lord”; just as the Festival is to the Lord, so too, the sukka is to the Lord.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: Just as the Name of Heaven is profaned over the Festival offering, so too the Name of Heaven is profaned over the Sukkah, as it is stated: "The Festival of Sukkot for seven days to the Lord." Just as the Festival is for the sake of the Lord, so too the Sukkah is for the sake of the Lord.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי נָמֵי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהָכִי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי,
human_translation: But Beit Shammai require to this as well? Yes, indeed it is so
llm_translation: And Beit Shammai says: "He should say it like this!" - "Like this," he says.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה לְךָ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, סוּכָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לְשֵׁם חַג בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Rather, what is the rationale of Beit Shammai Another verse is written: “You shall prepare for you the festival of Sukkot for seven days” we require a sukka established for the sake of the Festival.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason of Beit Shammai? — It is written in another verse: "You shall make the Feast of Booths for yourself seven days," indicating that we require a sukkah made specifically for the sake of the festival.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל — הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְעוֹשִׂין סוּכָּה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel That is necessary to that one establish a sukka during the intermediate days of the Festival.
llm_translation: Beit Hillel - that one asks him to make a sukkah on chol hamoed.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — סְבִירָא לְהוּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין עוֹשִׂין סוּכָּה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai They hold in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: One not establish a sukka during the intermediate days of the Festival.
llm_translation: House of Shammai - holds like Rabbi Eliezer, who said: We do not make a sukkah on the intermediate days of the festival.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל לֵית לְהוּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עֲשָׂאָהּ מִן הַקּוֹצִין וּמִן הַנִּימִין וּמִן הַגְּרָדִין — פְּסוּלָה. מִן הַסִּיסִין — כְּשֵׁרָה,
human_translation: And Beit Hillel not that Rav Yehuda Rav said? As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: one fashioned from thorns or from threads or from the fringes [ geradin ] unfit from balls of thread fit.
llm_translation: The House of Hillel does not have a support for Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If one made it from thorns, or from reeds, or from twigs - it is invalid. If made from flax fibers - it is valid.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: אַף מִן הַסִּיסִין נָמֵי פְּסוּלָה, (אַלְמָא) דְּבָעֵינַן טְוִיָּה לִשְׁמָהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן סוּכָּה עֲשׂוּיָה לִשְׁמָהּ!
human_translation: When I stated this before Shmuel, he said to me: Even from balls of thread unfit, as we require the spinning for the sake of here too, let us require a sukka established for the sake of
llm_translation: When she said it before Samuel, he said to me: Even from the sisisin it is also invalid, implying that we require a sukkah made for its own sake. Here too, we require a sukkah made for its own sake!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״גְּדִילִים תַּעֲשֶׂה לָךְ״, לָךְ — לְשֵׁם חוֹבָךְ. הָכָא נָמֵי: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה לְךָ״, לָךְ — לְשֵׁם חוֹבָךְ!
human_translation: different there, as the verse states: “You shall prepare for you fringes” “For you,” for the sake of your obligation. Here, too, “You shall prepare for you the festival of Sukkot ” “For you,” for the sake of your obligation?
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "You shall make tassels for yourself," for yourself - for the sake of your obligation. Here it is stated: "You shall make the Feast of Booths for yourself," for yourself - for the sake of your obligation!

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי גְּזוּלָה. הָתָם נָמֵי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי גְּזוּלָה!
human_translation: this is required to exclude stolen There, too, isn’t required to exclude stolen
llm_translation: That one asks him to exclude theft. There, too, he asks him to exclude theft!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״וְעָשׂוּ לָהֶם״ — מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: There, another verse is written: “And they shall make for them of their own,
llm_translation: There it is written in another verse: "And they shall make for themselves" — from their own.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ תַּחַת הָאִילָן — כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת. סוּכָּה עַל גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה — הָעֶלְיוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין דָּיוֹרִין בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה — הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: one who establishes his sukka beneath a tree, as though he established it inside the house a sukka atop sukka , the upper is fit and the lower is unfit. Rabbi Yehuda says: If there are no residents in the upper the lower is fit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who makes his sukkah under a tree — it is as though he made it within the house. A sukkah on top of another sukkah — the upper one is valid, and the lower one is invalid. Rabbi Yehudah says: If there are schach (covering) materials in the upper one, the lower one is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאִילָן שֶׁצִּלָּתוֹ מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתוֹ, אֲבָל חֲמָתוֹ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּלָּתוֹ — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: They taught only with regard to a tree whose shade is greater than its sunlight, However, if its sunlight is greater than its shade, is fit,
llm_translation: Gemara said Rava: They only taught this regarding a tree whose shade is more than its sunlight, but if its sunlight is more than its shade - it is valid.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי: ״כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת״: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי ״כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת״? לִיתְנֵי ״פְּסוּלָה״! אֶלָּא, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִילָן דּוּמְיָא דְּבַיִת: מָה בַּיִת צִלָּתוֹ מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתוֹ — אַף אִילָן צִלָּתוֹ מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתוֹ.
human_translation: From where from that teaches: as though he established it inside the house. Why do I to teach: as though he established it inside the house? Let teach unfit. Rather, this is teaching us that a tree is similar to a house; just as a house, its shade is greater than its sunlight, so too, a tree, its shade is greater than its sunlight.
llm_translation: From what — from where does it derive? "As if he did it inside the house": Why do I need it to be taught "as if he did it inside the house"? Let it be taught "invalid"! Rather, this teaches us that just as a house, its shade is greater than its sun — so too a tree, its shade is greater than its sun.

hebrew_text: וְכִי חֲמָתוֹ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּלָּתוֹ, מַאי הָוֵי? הָא קָא מִצְטָרֵף סְכָךְ פָּסוּל בַּהֲדֵי סְכָךְ כָּשֵׁר! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּשֶׁחֲבָטָן.
human_translation: And if the sunlight is greater than the shade what of it? Isn’t unfit roofing, joining together with fit roofing Rav Pappa said: where one lowered
llm_translation: And if his anger is greater than his shade, what is the ruling? This is considered as invalid shade combined with valid shade! Rav Papa said: In a case of a bundle.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּשֶׁחֲבָטָן מַאי לְמֵימְרָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִיגְזוֹר הֵיכָא דַּחֲבָטָן אַטּוּ הֵיכָא דְּלֹא חֲבָטָן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: If where he lowered them, what is stating lest you say: Let us issue a decree where one lowered them due to where one did not lower them. it teaches us that we do not issue a decree.
llm_translation: If in the case of a miscarriage, what is the meaning? What you might say: where it is beaten, there it is inferred; where it is not beaten, it is implied to us that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הִדְלָה עָלֶיהָ: אֶת הַגֶּפֶן וְאֶת הַדְּלַעַת וְאֶת הַקִּיסוֹס, וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן — פְּסוּלָה, וְאִם הָיָה סִיכּוּךְ הַרְבֵּה מֵהֶן אוֹ שֶׁקְּצָצָן — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: That too, we learned If one trellised the grapevine, the gourd, or the ivy, and roofing atop them, unfit, If roofing was greater than or if he cut it is fit.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: If one weaves together the vine, the ivy, and the myrtle, and places them on top of the Sukkah, it is invalid. However, if there was an abundance of them or if one trimmed them, it is valid.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא חֲבָטָן, הָא קָא מִצְטָרֵף סְכָךְ פָּסוּל עִם סְכָךְ כָּשֵׁר! אֶלָּא לָאו, כְּשֶׁחֲבָטָן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּלָא גָּזְרִינַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּדִיעֲבַד — אֲבָל לְכַתְּחִילָּה לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say he did not lower doesn’t unfit roofing join together with fit roofing Rather, isn’t where he lowered them, and conclude from this that we do not issue a decree Lest you say that this applies after the fact, but not ab initio ; teaches us
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say that they were not beaten, then it is joining invalid sukkah with valid sukkah! Rather, no, when they were beaten, and we do not decree from it! What might you say: those matters are in retrospect — but initially, no, it does not seem to us."

hebrew_text: סוּכָּה עַל גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״(בַּסּוּכּוֹת) תֵּשְׁבוּ״, וְלֹא בְּסוּכָּה שֶׁתַּחַת הַסּוּכָּה, וְלֹא בְּסוּכָּה שֶׁתַּחַת הָאִילָן, וְלֹא בְּסוּכָּה שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: a sukka atop sukka , The Sages taught “In sukkot shall you reside” and not in a sukka that is beneath sukka , and not in sukka that is beneath a tree, and not in a sukka that is inside a house.
llm_translation: Sukkah on top of a Sukkah, etc. The Rabbis taught: "You shall dwell (in the Sukkot)," not in a Sukkah that is beneath the Sukkah, and not in a Sukkah that is beneath the tree, and not in a Sukkah that is inside the house.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: ״בַּסּוּכּוֹת״ תַּרְתֵּי מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״בַּסֻכֹּת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: On the contrary, “in sukkot ,” indicates two. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: basukkot is written
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: "Basukkot" tartei mashma! Amar Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "Basukkot" ktiv. English translation: Greater is the proof: "In booths" is two implications! Said Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak: "In booths" it is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁתֵּיהֶן כְּשֵׁירוֹת, פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁתֵּיהֶן פְּסוּלוֹת, פְּעָמִים שֶׁתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה וְהָעֶלְיוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה, פְּעָמִים שֶׁתַּחְתּוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה וְהָעֶלְיוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: times when both of are fit; times when both of are unfit; times when the lower is fit and the upper is unfit; times when the lower is unfit and the upper is fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Sometimes when both are valid, sometimes when both are invalid, sometimes when the lower one is valid and the upper one is invalid, sometimes when the lower one is invalid and the upper one is valid.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁתֵּיהֶן כְּשֵׁירוֹת הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁתַּחְתּוֹנָה חֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּלָּתָהּ, וְהָעֶלְיוֹנָה צִלָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ, וְקָיְימָא עֶלְיוֹנָה בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: times when both of are fit. What are the circumstances? where lower sukka its sunlight is greater than its shade, and the upper sukka its shade is greater than its sunlight, And the upper is within twenty
llm_translation: Times that both of them when they are valid how are they valued? For example, when the lower one, her shade is more than her sunlight, and the upper one, her sunlight is more than her shade, and the upper one is established within twenty.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁתֵּיהֶן פְּסוּלוֹת הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ צִלָּתָן מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתָן, וְקָיְימָא עֶלְיוֹנָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה.
human_translation: times when both of are unfit. What are the circumstances? where both their shade is greater than their sunlight, but the upper one is twenty cubits above
llm_translation: Times that both of them invalid how their money? For example that both of them their shade more than their sun, and standing upper above twenty cubits.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה וְהָעֶלְיוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה
human_translation: times when the lower is fit and the upper is unfit.
llm_translation: Times that its bottom is valid and its top is invalid

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה צִלָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ, וְעֶלְיוֹנָה חֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּלָּתָהּ, וְקָיְימִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? where the lower its shade is greater than its sunlight, and the upper its sunlight is greater than its shade and both is within twenty
llm_translation: "How are the laws of blood established? For example, when the lower part is more shaded than its heat, and its upper part is more heated than its shade, and both are present within twenty cubits."

hebrew_text: וּפְעָמִים שֶׁהָעֶלְיוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה וְתַחְתּוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ צִלָּתָן מְרוּבָּה מֵחֲמָתָן, וְקָיְימָא עֶלְיוֹנָה בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: And times when the upper is fit and lower is unfit. What are the circumstances? where both their shade is greater than their sunlight, and upper is within twenty
llm_translation: And times that the upper one is valid and the lower one is invalid, how are the laws? For example, when both their shade is more than their sun, and the upper one is within twenty.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! תַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה וְעֶלְיוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִיגְזַר דִּילְמָא מִצְטָרֵף סְכָךְ פָּסוּל בַּהֲדֵי סְכָךְ כָּשֵׁר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. It was necessary for the lower is fit and the upper unfit, Lest you say: Let us issue a decree perhaps unfit roofing joins together with the fit roofing teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! The lower one is valid, and the upper one is invalid, he needs it. What might you say: it is derived that perhaps the invalid covering becomes combined with the valid covering, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יְהֵא בֵּין סוּכָּה לְסוּכָּה. וּתְהֵא תַּחְתּוֹנָה פְּסוּלָה?
human_translation: How much shall there be between sukka and sukka for the lower sukka be disqualified
llm_translation: How much should there be between one sukkah and another? And should the lower one be invalid?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: טֶפַח, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּאׇהֳלֵי טוּמְאָה טֶפַח. (דְּתַנְיָא:) טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח בְּרוּם טֶפַח — מֵבִיא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְחוֹצֵץ בִּפְנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה. אֲבָל פָּחוֹת מֵרוּם טֶפַח — לֹא מֵבִיא, וְלֹא חוֹצֵץ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: a handbreadth as we likewise find in tents of ritual impurity handbreadth. as we learned handbreadth by handbreadth with a height of handbreadth transmits ritual impurity. And serves as a barrier before the ritual impurity However, less than the height of handbreadth, it does not transmit and it does not serve as a barrier
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A handbreadth, for thus we find in the tents of impurity, a handbreadth. (As it was taught:) A handbreadth upon a handbreadth in height of a handbreadth - it brings impurity, and it separates before the impurity. But less than a height of a handbreadth - it does not bring, and it does not separate.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמְרִי: אַרְבָּעָה, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ מָקוֹם [חָשׁוּב] פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna say: four as we do not find a significant area less than four
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah and Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Four, that we did not find a place significant less than four.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עֲשָׂרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל — כְּהֶכְשֵׁרָהּ כָּךְ פְּסוּלָהּ. מָה הֶכְשֵׁרָהּ בַּעֲשָׂרָה, אַף פְּסוּלָהּ בַּעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: ten What is the rationale of Shmuel? As its fitness, so too its unfitness; just as its fitness in ten so too, unfitness by ten
llm_translation: Samuel said: Ten. What is the reason for Samuel's opinion? Just as its validation is in ten, so too its disqualification is in ten. Just as its validation is in ten, so too its disqualification is in ten.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵין דָּיוֹרִין בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה — הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Yehuda says: If there are no residents in the upper the lower is fit.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: If there are no residents in the upper city, the lower city is considered valid.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵין דָּיוֹרִין? אִילֵּימָא דָּיוֹרִין מַמָּשׁ: אַטּוּ דָּיוֹרִין קָא גָרְמִי? אֶלָּא לָאו, מַאי אֵין דָּיוֹרִין — כׇּל שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? דְּלָא גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְדִירָה פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: What is There are no residents? If we say actual residents, Is that to say that residents cause Rather, what is There are no residents? Is it not any that is not suitable to a residence? And what are the circumstances where is not ten high, by inference that the first tanna holds unfit even if is not suitable to a residence.
llm_translation: What is meant by "Ein Dayorin"? If you say it means actual dwelling, are they causing actual dwelling? Rather, no, what is meant by "Ein Dayorin" - anything that is not fit for dwelling, and how so? Because it is not ten handbreadths high. From the general principle that the first Tanna holds that even though it is not fit for dwelling, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר, אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: אִם אֵין הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה יְכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל כָּרִים וּכְסָתוֹת שֶׁל עֶלְיוֹנָה — הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said say in the West, If the lower is not able to support the cushions and blankets of the upper the lower is fit,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said, they say in the West: If the lower one cannot receive the beams and coverings of the upper one - the lower one is valid.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְקַבֵּל פְּסוּלָה?
human_translation: by inference that the first tanna holds even though is not able to support unfit?
llm_translation: From the principle that the first Tanna taught, does he also hold that even though it is not fitting to receive it, it is invalid?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּיכוֹלָה לְקַבֵּל עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: there is between is able to support with difficulty
llm_translation: There is a difference between them regarding the principle of acquiring through distress.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ פֵּירַס עָלֶיהָ סָדִין מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה, אוֹ תַּחְתֶּיהָ מִפְּנֵי הַנֶּשֶׁר, אוֹ שֶׁפֵּירַס עַל גַּבֵּי הַקִּינוֹף — פְּסוּלָה. אֲבָל פּוֹרֵס הוּא עַל גַּבֵּי נַקְלִיטֵי הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: one spread a sheet over due to the sun, or beneath due to the falling leaves, or one spread over the a four-post [ kinof ] unfit. However, one spread over a two-post [ naklitei ] bed,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one spreads a sheet over it because of the sun, or underneath it because of the eagle, or if one spreads it over the top of the canopy - it is invalid. But if one spreads it over the coverings of the bed, it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי הַנֶּשֶׁר. אֲבָל לְנָאוֹתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. פְּשִׁיטָא, מִפְּנֵי הַנֶּשֶׁר תְּנַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְנָאוֹתָהּ, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי מִפְּנֵי הַנֶּשֶׁר — אוֹרְחָא דְמִילְּתָא קָתָנֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: taught only due to the falling leaves; however, to beautify fit. obvious, Due to the falling leaves, we learned Lest you say the same is true, even to beautify and that teaches due to the falling leaves teaches the matter, in the manner in which it teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Ḥisda said: They only prohibited it due to the vulture. But to adorn oneself with it — it is permitted. Obviously, it was taught due to the vulture! What might you have thought? That the same law applies even for adorning oneself, and that which it was taught due to the vulture — it is teaching the common case, and it informs us.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: סִיכְּכָהּ כְּהִלְכָתָהּ וְעִיטְּרָהּ בִּקְרָמִין וּבִסְדִינִין הַמְצוּיָּרִין, וְתָלָה בָּהּ אֱגוֹזִין שְׁקֵדִים אֲפַרְסְקִין וְרִמּוֹנִים, פַּרְכִּילֵי עֲנָבִים וַעֲטָרוֹת שֶׁל שִׁבּוֹלִין, יֵינוֹת שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת — אָסוּר לְהִסְתַּפֵּק מֵהֶן
human_translation: Let us say supports one roofed in accordance with its halakhic and decorated it with colorful curtains and sheets, and hung in it nuts, almonds, peaches, and pomegranates, grape branches [ parkilei ], and wreaths of stalks wines, oils, and flour, it is prohibited to use them
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: she adorned herself according to her custom, and she adorned herself with vine branches and linen garments that are patterned, and she hung on herself walnuts, almonds, apricots, and pomegranates, clusters of grapes and heads of wheat, wines, oils, and fine flours — it is forbidden to benefit from them.

hebrew_text: עַד מוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג. וְאִם הִתְנָה עֲלֵיהֶם — הַכֹּל לְפִי תְנָאוֹ. דִּלְמָא מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: until the conclusion of the last day of the Festival. And if he stipulated with regard to them everything is according to his stipulation, perhaps on the side
llm_translation: Until the end of the last day of the festival. And if one stipulated upon them — everything according to his stipulation. Perhaps from the side.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: נוֹיֵי סוּכָּה אֵין מְמַעֲטִין בַּסּוּכָּה. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּמִן הַצַּד — מְמַעֲטִין.
human_translation: it was stated: Sukka decorations do not diminish the sukka . Rav Ashi said: on the side diminish
llm_translation: It was stated: The beauty of a sukkah does not diminish the sukkah. Rav Ashe said: And on the side - they diminish.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָמִין עַבְדֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי אִיטְּמִישָׁא לֵיהּ כִּתּוּנְתָּא בְּמַיָּא, וְאַשְׁטְחַהּ אַמְּטַלַּלְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּלְיַיהּ, דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ קָא מְסַכְּכִי בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה. וְהָא קָא חָזוּ לַיהּ דְּרַטִּיבָא! לְכִי יָבְשָׁה קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ.
human_translation: Minyamin, the servant of Rav Ashi, his shirt became wet [ itamisha ], and he spread it over the sukka Rav Ashi said to him: Take it down so that will not say they are roofing with an item susceptible to ritual impurity. But don’t they see that it is wet once it is dry I am saying to you,
llm_translation: From Minyamin, the servant of Rav Ashi, he would mix for him a potion in water, and he would drink it. Rav Ashi said to him: "Pour it out, for they are saying that you are engaging in a matter that incurs impurity." But he saw that he was becoming weak! "Go, I am standing dry for you."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: נוֹיֵי סוּכָּה הַמּוּפְלָגִין מִמֶּנָּה אַרְבָּעָה, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמְרִי: פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: It was stated sukka decorations, that are removed from four Rav Naḥman said: fit. Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna said: unfit.
llm_translation: It was stated: The ornaments of a sukkah that are detached from it by four handbreadths, Rav Nachman said: It is valid. Rav Hisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: It is invalid.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אִיקְּלַעוּ לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא. אַגְנִינְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן בְּסוּכָּה שֶׁנּוֹיֶיהָ מוּפְלָגִין מִמֶּנָּה אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים, אִשְׁתִּיקוּ וְלָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֲדוּר בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן מִשְּׁמַעְתַּיְיהוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲנַן שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֲנַן, וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna happened to the house of the Exilarch. Rav Naḥman, lodged them in a sukka whose decorations were removed from four handbreadths. They were silent and did not say anything to him, said to them: Did the Sages retract their halakhic They said to him: We are on the path to perform a mitzva and, we are exempt from the sukka .
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna entered the house of the head of the exile. Rav Naḥman showed them a booth whose walls were separated from it by four handbreadths. They were silent and did not say anything to him immediately. He said to them: "Do the Rabbis dwell in it according to what you have heard?" They said to him: "We are emissaries of a mitzvah, and we are exempt from the sukkah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּתָּר לִישַׁן בְּכִילָּה בַּסּוּכָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ גַּג, וְהוּא שֶׁאֵינָהּ גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It is permitted to sleep in netting inside the sukka , even though has a roof, provided that is not more than ten higher
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It is permitted to sleep in a sukkah with a covering, even though it has a roof, provided that it is not higher than ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַיָּשֵׁן בְּכִילָּה בַּסּוּכָּה — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּשֶׁגְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Come hear: One who sleeps in netting inside the sukka did not fulfill his obligation, With what are we dealing here? where is more than ten higher
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who sleeps in a shelter made of palm leaves - he has not fulfilled his obligation! Here, what are we dealing with? When its height is ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַיָּשֵׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה בַּסּוּכָּה — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ! הָא תַּרְגְּמַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל בְּמִטָּה גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: raises an objection One who sleeps beneath the bed in the sukka did not fulfill his obligation. Didn’t Shmuel interpret to a bed ten high?
llm_translation: Challenger: One who sleeps beneath the bed in the sukkah - he has not fulfilled his obligation! Samuel interpreted it as a bed that is ten handbreadths high.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אוֹ שֶׁפֵּירַס עַל גַּבֵּי קִינוֹפוֹת — פְּסוּלָה! הָתָם נָמֵי דִּגְבִיהִי עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Come hear Or one spread over the four-post unfit. There, too, are ten high.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: o shepeiras al gabbei kinofot - pesulah! Hatam namei digvihai asarah." English translation: "Come and hear: If it is spread over the wings - it is invalid! There, it is stated that it must be ten."

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא קָתָנֵי הָכִי. דְּתַנְיָא: נַקְלִיטִין שְׁנַיִם, וְקִינוֹפוֹת אַרְבָּעָה. פֵּירַס עַל גַּבֵּי קִינוֹפוֹת — פְּסוּלָה, עַל גַּבֵּי נַקְלִיטִין — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִהְיוּ נַקְלִיטִין גְּבוֹהִין מִן הַמִּטָּה עֲשָׂרָה. מִכְּלָל דְּקִינוֹפוֹת — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין גְּבוֹהִין עֲשָׂרָה!
human_translation: But that is not it is taught, as it is taught Naklitin are two and kinofot are four one spread over four posts, unfit; over two posts fit, provided the two posts are not ten higher than the bed. by inference that four posts even if it is not ten high.
llm_translation: The text does not teach so. For it was taught: Naklitin two, and kinofot four. If one spreads the hide over the kinofot - it is invalid, over the naklitin - it is valid, provided that the naklitin are not more than ten handbreadths higher than the ground. From the principle of kinofot - even though they are not ten handbreadths high!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי קִינוֹפוֹת, דִּקְבִיעִי. וַהֲרֵי סוּכָּה עַל גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה דִּקְבִיעָא, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּהֶכְשֵׁרָהּ כָּךְ פְּסוּלָהּ! אָמְרִי: הָתָם, דִּלְמִפְסַל סוּכָּה — בַּעֲשָׂרָה. הָכָא, דִּלְשַׁוּוֹיֵי אוּהְלָא — בְּצִיר מֵעֲשָׂרָה נָמֵי הָוֵי אוּהְלָא.
human_translation: Four posts are different because they are fixed But a sukka atop sukka is fixed, and Shmuel said: As its fitness, so too its unfitness. say There, in order to disqualify sukka , ten here, in order to consider a tent, less than ten is also a tent,
llm_translation: The nests of locusts are fixed. And behold, a sukkah on top of a sukkah is fixed, and Shmuel said: Just as its kashrut, so too its disqualification! They said: There, perhaps it disqualifies a sukkah - with ten. Here, where the tent is swaying - even if it is within ten, it is not considered a tent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַיָּשֵׁן בְּכִילָּה עָרוֹם — מוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ חוּץ לַכִּילָה וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said: One who sleeps naked in netting moves his head out from the netting and recites Shema .
llm_translation: Rav Tahalifa, son of Avimi, said in the name of Shmuel: One who sleeps in a cloak naked - he may stick out his head outside the cloak and recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַיָּשֵׁן בְּכִילָּה עָרוֹם — לֹא יוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ חוּץ לַכִּילָה וְיִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁגְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: raises an objection One who sleeps naked in a bed with netting not move his head out from the netting and recite Shema . With what are we dealing here? where is ten high.
llm_translation: The question was raised: One who sleeps in a cloak naked - he shall not protrude his head outside the cloak and recite the Shema! Here, what are we dealing with - when its height is ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָא לְמָה זֶה דּוֹמֶה? לְעוֹמֵד בְּבַיִת עָרוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ חוּץ לַחַלּוֹן וְיִקְרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that it is taught the latter clause To what is this comparable? to one standing naked in house, that he not move his head out the window and recite Shema . learn from it
llm_translation: So it was taught in the latter part: What is this comparable to? To one standing naked in a house, who does not stick his head out through the window and recite the Shema. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וּבַיִת נָמֵי, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה, כֵּיוָן דִּקְבִיעַ — אוּהְלָא הוּא, דְּלָא גָּרַע מִקִּינוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: And also a house even if it is not ten high. Since it is a fixed it is a tent as it is no less than four posts,
llm_translation: House of Naomi, even though it is not ten high, since it is permanent - it is considered a tent, as it does not lack from its corners.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּתָּר לִישַׁן בְּכִילַּת חֲתָנִים בַּסּוּכָּה לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ גַּג, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Some say another version Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It is permitted to sleep inside bridal canopy in the sukka since it does not have a roof, even though it is ten high.
llm_translation: The other sages said to her, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It is permitted to sleep in the canopy of the groom in the sukkah because it does not have a roof, even though it is ten handbreadths high.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַיָּשֵׁן בְּכִילָּה בַּסּוּכָּה — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ גַּג.
human_translation: raises an objection One who sleeps in netting inside the sukka did not fulfill his obligation. With what are we dealing here with in it has a roof.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: hayashen bekilah basukah - lo yatza yedei chovato! Hakha bema'i oskinan - beshesh yesh lah gag. English translation: It was raised in objection: One who sleeps in a kiln in a sukkah - he has not fulfilled his obligation! Here, what are we dealing with - when it has a roof.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נַקְלִיטִין שְׁנַיִם, וְקִינוֹפוֹת אַרְבָּעָה, פֵּירַס עַל גַּבֵּי קִינוֹפוֹת — פְּסוּלָה, עַל גַּבֵּי נַקְלִיטִין — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ נַקְלִיטִין גְּבוֹהִין מִן הַמִּטָּה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. הָא גְּבוֹהִין מִן הַמִּטָּה עֲשָׂרָה — פְּסוּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ גַּג!
human_translation: Come hear Naklitin are two and kinofot are four one spread over four posts, unfit; over two posts fit, provided the two posts are not ten higher than the bed. But are higher than ten is unfit even though it has no roof,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If two loops and four corners are spread over the corners - it is invalid; if they are spread over the loops - it is valid, provided that the loops are not more than ten handbreadths high from the ground. If they are more than ten handbreadths high - it is invalid, even though it does not have a roof!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי נַקְלִיטִין, דִּקְבִיעִי. אִי קְבִיעִי, לֶיהֱוֵי כְּקִינוֹפוֹת! לְגַבַּי קִינוֹפוֹת — לָא קְבִיעִי, לְגַבֵּי כִילָּה — קְבִיעִי.
human_translation: Two posts are different because they are fixed If they are fixed let them be like four posts Vis-à-vis four posts, not fixed vis-à-vis netting, are fixed
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "The difference between 'naklitin' and 'kvi'i. If it is 'kvi'i,' let it be like 'kinofot'! In relation to 'kinofot' - it is not 'kvi'i,' in relation to 'killa' - it is 'kvi'i.'"

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: מוּתָּר לִישַׁן בְּכִילָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ גַּג, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: לָא אָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קֶבַע. דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נוֹהֲגִין הָיִינוּ לִישַׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה בִּפְנֵי הַזְּקֵנִים.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna taught: It is permitted to sleep in netting even though it has a roof even though it is higher than ten In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda who said a temporary tent does not come and negate a permanent tent, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: We were accustomed to sleep beneath the bed before the Elders.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna expounded: It is permitted to sleep in a kilah, even though it has a roof, even though it is ten handbreadths high. According to whom? According to Rabbi Yehudah, who said: A temporary tent does not come and annul a permanent tent. For we learned: Rabbi Yehudah said: We used to be accustomed to sleep beneath the bed in the presence of the elders.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: And let him say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And say, is the halakha like Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אִי אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִטָּה, דִּלְגַבָּהּ עֲשׂוּיָה, אֲבָל כִּילָּה, דִּלְתוֹכָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּלָא אָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קָבַע, לָא שְׁנָא מִטָּה וְלָא שְׁנָא כִּילָּה.
human_translation: If he said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, I would have said that this applies only to a bed, which is made for atop it However, netting, which is made for within it, say no, teaches us the rationale for Rabbi Yehuda is that a temporary tent does not come and negate a permanent tent, there is no difference a bed netting
llm_translation: If one were to say that the halakha is like Rabbi Yehudah, I would say: those things that are below, with their height made, but a sling, with its middle made - I would say no, for we learn the reason of Rabbi Yehudah that a temporary tent does not come and annul a permanent tent, whether it is below or whether it is a sling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הִדְלָה עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַגֶּפֶן וְאֶת הַדַּלַּעַת וְאֶת הַקִּיסוֹס וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּהּ — פְּסוּלָה. וְאִם הָיָה סִיכּוּךְ הַרְבֵּה מֵהֶן, אוֹ שֶׁקְּצָצָן — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: one trellised a grapevine, or gourd or ivy [ kissos ], over and roofing atop them, unfit. If roofing was greater or if he cut it is fit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one covered it with grapevines, gourd vines, or ivy, and placed a covering on top of them - it is invalid. But if the covering was mostly from them, or if one trimmed them - it is valid.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְאֵין גִּידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ. וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ — מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: This is the principle Anything that is susceptible to ritual impurity, or its growth is not from the ground, one may not roof with it. And anything that is not susceptible to ritual impurity and its growth is from the ground, one may roof with it.
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that can become ritually impure but does not grow from the ground - we do not cover it. And anything that cannot become ritually impure and grows from the ground - we cover it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב רַב יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: אוֹ שֶׁקְּצָצָן כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאָמַר רַב: צָרִיךְ לְנַעְנֵעַ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said, Or if he cut them, it is fit. And Rav said is obligated move
llm_translation: Gemara: Gemara Yateiv Rav Yosef Kamaih d'Rav Huna, v'yateiv v'ka'amar: O sheketsatzan k'shera, v'amar Rav: Tzarich l'na'nea. Translation: Gemara: Gemara sat Rav Yosef before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: Or that it was cut properly, and Rav said: One must shake it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא: הָא שְׁמוּאֵל אַמְרַהּ. אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַב יוֹסֵף לְאַפֵּיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ מִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ דְּלָא אַמְרַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל? אַמְרַהּ רַב, וְאַמְרַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַמְרַהּ וְלָא רַב, דְּרַב אַכְשׁוֹרֵי מַכְשַׁר. כִּי הָא דְּרַב עַמְרָם חֲסִידָא רְמָא תְּכֵלְתָּא לְפַרְזוּמָא דְּאִינָשֵׁי בֵּיתֵיהּ. תְּלָאָן, וְלֹא פָּסַק רָאשֵׁי חוּטִין שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to Shmuel stated this Rav Yosef turned his face away and said to him: Did I say to you that Shmuel did not say it? Rav said it, and Shmuel said it Rav Huna said to him: This is what I am saying to you, that Shmuel said it and not Rav, as Rav deems fit as that where Rav Amram the Pious cast the sky-blue dye, upon the garment pirzuma of the people of his household. he attached them, but did not cut the ends of their strands
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna: This is what Shmuel said. Rav Yosef repeated it to his face and said to him: Are you saying that Shmuel did not say it? Rav said it, and Shmuel said it! Rav Huna said to him: This is what I am saying to you, that Shmuel said it and not Rav, for Rav is stringent in his rulings. For example, Rav Amram the pious would hang a blue thread in the entrance of his house. They hung it, and did not cut off the heads of their threads.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: מְפַסְּקָן וְהֵן כְּשֵׁרִין. אַלְמָא: פְּסִיקָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן. הָכָא נָמֵי: קְצִיצָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן.
human_translation: came before Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi He said to him this Rav said: One cuts them and they are fit. Apparently, their cutting is their preparation. Here too, Their cutting is their preparation,
llm_translation: He came before Rav Chiya bar Ashe, he said to him: So said Rav: They are interrupted and they are valid. Implication: Their interruption is their action. Here too: Their cutting is their action.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל לָא אָמְרִינַן פְּסִיקָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן? וְהָא תָּנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הֵטִיל לִשְׁנֵי קְרָנוֹת בְּבַת אַחַת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ פָּסַק רָאשֵׁי חוּטִין שֶׁלָּהֶן — כְּשֵׁרִין. מַאי לָאו — שֶׁקּוֹשֵׁר וְאַחַר כָּךְ פּוֹסֵק! לֹא, שֶׁפּוֹסֵק וְאַחַר כָּךְ קוֹשֵׁר.
human_translation: And does Shmuel hold we do not say: Their cutting is their preparation? But didn’t Shmuel teach in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: If one cast upon two corners simultaneously and afterward cut the ends of their strands fit. What, is it not where one ties and afterward cuts them? No, he cuts and afterward ties
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel thought, do we not say that their cutting is their making? But Samuel taught in the name of Rabbi Hiyya: If one inserted two horns into one hole, and afterwards cut their threads - they are valid. What is the reason? Is it not because he ties and then cuts? No, it is because he cuts and then ties.

hebrew_text: פּוֹסֵק וְאַחַר כָּךְ קוֹשֵׁר מַאי לְמֵימְרָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא:
human_translation: he cuts and afterward ties what to state Lest you say
llm_translation: He stops, and afterwards ties. What is meant by saying? What might you think?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵינַן כָּנָף בִּשְׁעַת פְּתִיל — וְלֵיכָּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: we require corner at the time of threading And there is not teaches us
