llm_translation: We require a wing at the time of the wick - and it is not so, as it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תְּלָאָן וְלֹא פָּסַק רָאשֵׁי חוּטִין שֶׁלָּהֶן — פְּסוּלִין. מַאי לָאו: פְּסוּלִין לְעוֹלָם, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב? אָמַר לְךָ רַב: מַאי פְּסוּלִין — פְּסוּלִין עַד שֶׁיִּפָּסְקוּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: פְּסוּלִין לְעוֹלָם. וְכֵן אָמַר לֵוִי: פְּסוּלִין לְעוֹלָם. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: פְּסוּלִין לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: raises an objection one attached and did not cut the ends of their strands, they are unfit. What, is it not unfit forever and a conclusive refutation of Rav? Rav said to you: What unfit? unfit until they will be cut; And Shmuel said they are unfit forever. And Levi also said: They are unfit forever. And likewise, Rav Mattana said Shmuel said: They are unfit forever.
llm_translation: Challenger: Their warp threads broke but their woof threads did not break - they are invalid. What is the reason? Are they not invalid forever, and the objection of Rav? Rav said to you: What is meant by "invalid" - they are invalid until they break. And Shmuel said: They are invalid forever. And so said Levi: They are invalid forever. And so said Rav Matna in the name of Shmuel: They are invalid forever.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וַאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וַאֲמַר לִי: פְּסוּלִין לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Some say Rav Mattana said: was an incident to me and I came before Master Shmuel and he said to me: They are unfit forever.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Matna said: The matter was in my hands, and Mar Samuel came before me, and he said to me: They are invalid forever.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תְּלָאָן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ פָּסַק רָאשֵׁי חוּטִין שֶׁלָּהֶן פְּסוּלִין. וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ — וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הִדְלָה עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַגֶּפֶן וְאֶת הַדַּלַּעַת וְאֶת הַקִּיסוֹס וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּן — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: raises an objection one attached and afterward cut the ends of their strands, they are unfit. And furthermore, it is taught with regard to a sukka : Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared. From here said: If one trellised a grapevine, a gourd or ivy and roofing atop unfit.
llm_translation: The question was raised: their the Sukkah's walls, and afterwards they the owners designated the tops of their threads, they are invalid. And furthermore, it was taught regarding a Sukkah: "You shall make" — not from what is already made. From here they said: If one spreads over it a vine, a gourd, or a cucumber, and leans the Sukkah covering on them — it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא קְצָצָן, מַאי אִירְיָא מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ — וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דִּמְחוּבָּרִין נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁקְּצָצָן, וְקָתָנֵי פְּסוּלָה, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן קְצִיצָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say where he did not cut why does particularly due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared? Let him derive that they are attached Rather, where he cut them and is teaching unfit, and learn from it that we do not say: Their cutting is their preparation; and a conclusive refutation of Rav.
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say it is when they were not cut, what is the relevance of "you shall make" - and not from what is actually done? Let him derive that they are considered connected! Rather, it is when they were cut, and it teaches that it is disqualified, and infer from it that we do not say their cutting is their making, and this is a superior aspect of Rav!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּשַׁלְפִינְהוּ שַׁלּוֹפֵי, דְּלָא מִינַּכְרָא עֲשִׂיָּה דִּידְהוּ. מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, תְּלָאָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ פָּסַק, קַשְׁיָא לְרַב! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav said to you: With what are we dealing here? where he pulled their preparation is not conspicuous, In any case, one attached and afterward cut a difficulty to Rav? difficult
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: Here, with what are we dealing? With their own shovels, so that their workmanship is not recognizable. Nevertheless, they hung them and then decided, a difficulty for Rav! A difficulty.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי. עָבַר וְלִיקְּטָן — פָּסוּל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר יְהוֹצָדָק. וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . he transgressed and picked them it is unfit; the statement of Rabbi Shimon bar Yehotzadak. And the Rabbis deem it fit
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: If one passed and gathered them - invalid, the words of Rabbi Shimon bar Yehotzadak. But the Sages deem it valid.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לוּלָב צָרִיךְ אֶגֶד, וְיָלְפִינַן לוּלָב מִסּוּכָּה. דִּכְתִיב גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ — וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי.
human_translation: thought that everyone, lulav , require a binding And we derive lulav from sukka , as it is written with regard to sukka : Prepare, and not from that which has already been prepared, and
llm_translation: They thought that everyone in the world needs a bound palm branch, and we should make the palm branch from a covering. As it is written regarding a covering: "You shall make" — not from what is already made.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמַאן דְּמַכְשַׁיר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה קְצִיצָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן, וְגַבֵּי לוּלָב נָמֵי אָמְרִינַן לְקִיטָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן. וּמַאן דְּפָסֵיל סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה קְצִיצָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן, וְגַבֵּי לוּלָב נָמֵי לָא אָמְרִינַן לְקִיטָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן!
human_translation: What, is it not disagree with regard to the following? That the one who deems fit, holds with regard to a sukka we say: Their cutting is their preparation, and with regard to lulav as well, we say: Their picking is their preparation, And the one who deems it unfit holds with regard to a sukka we do not say: Their cutting is their preparation, and with regard to lulav as well, we do not say: Their picking is their preparation.
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not differentiate in this matter: One who deems it valid holds: We say regarding the sukkah, its cutting is its making, and regarding the lulav, we also say its binding is its making. And one who deems it invalid holds: We do not say regarding the sukkah, its cutting is its making, and regarding the lulav, we do not say its binding is its making!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא אָמְרִינַן גַּבֵּי סוּכָּה קְצִיצָתָן זוֹ הִיא עֲשִׂיָּיתָן, וְהָכָא בְּמֵילַף לוּלָב מִסּוּכָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מַאן דְּמַכְשַׁר סָבַר: לָא יָלְפִינַן לוּלָב מִסּוּכָּה, וּמַאן דְּפָסֵיל סָבַר: יָלְפִינַן לוּלָב מִסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: No, that everyone agrees we do not say with regard to sukka : Their cutting is their preparation, and here with regard to deriving lulav from sukka they disagree. The one who deems fit holds we do not derive lulav from sukka , And the one who deems unfit holds we derive lulav from sukka .
llm_translation: Not, of all the world, not do we say regarding a sukkah, their cutting is this their making, and here in Milah regarding a lulav from a sukkah they argue. Whoever permits, he holds: not should we take a lulav from a sukkah, and whoever disqualifies, he holds: we should take a lulav from a sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּלוּלָב צָרִיךְ אֶגֶד, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּיָלְפִינַן לוּלָב מִסּוּכָּה. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: צָרִיךְ אֶגֶד, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין צָרִיךְ אֶגֶד. וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: לוּלָב, בֵּין אָגוּד בֵּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ אָגוּד — כָּשֵׁר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָגוּד — כָּשֵׁר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ אָגוּד — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say If we hold that lulav requires a binding, everyone agrees we derive lulav from sukka And here with regard to the following they disagree: Sage, holds requires a binding, and Sage, holds does not require a binding, And with regard to in the dispute between these tanna’im , as it is taught A lulav , whether bound and whether not bound, is fit. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it is bound it is fit; if it is not bound it is unfit.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: If it seems to us that a lulav requires a binding, the entire world does not argue that we should bind the lulav with a covering. And here, in this case, they argue: one Master holds that it requires a binding, and the other Master holds that it does not require a binding. And in the dispute of these Tannaim, as it was taught: A lulav, whether bound or unbound — is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: Bound — is valid, unbound — is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? יָלֵיף ״לְקִיחָה״ ״לְקִיחָה״ מֵאֲגוּדַּת אֵזוֹב. כְּתִיב הָתָם: ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם אֲגוּדַּת אֵזוֹב״, וּכְתִיב הָכָא: ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם לָכֶם בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן״. מָה לְהַלָּן בַּאֲגוּדָּה, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי בַּאֲגוּדָּה. וְרַבָּנַן: ״לְקִיחָה״ מִ״לְּקִיחָה״ לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: What is the rationale Rabbi Yehuda? he derives taking, from taking the bundle of hyssop. It is written there, “Take a bundle of hyssop” and it is written here, “And you shall take for yourselves on the first day Just as there, in a bundle, so too here, in a bundle. And the Rabbis We do not derive taking from taking
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? He derives "taking" "taking" from the bundle of hyssop. It is written there: "And you shall take a bundle of hyssop," and it is written here: "And you shall take for yourselves on the first day." Just as there, it is with a bundle, so too here, it is with a bundle. And the Rabbis: "Taking" from "taking" we do not derive.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: לוּלָב מִצְוָה לְאוֹגְדוֹ, וְאִם לֹא אֲגָדוֹ — כָּשֵׁר. אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, כִּי לֹא אֲגָדוֹ אַמַּאי כָּשֵׁר? אִי רַבָּנַן, אַמַּאי מִצְוָה? לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן הִיא, וּמִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״ — הִתְנָאֶה לְפָנָיו בְּמִצְוֹת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught a mitzva to bind the lulav . And if he did not bind it, it is fit. If Rabbi Yehuda, when one did not bind it, why is it fit? If the Rabbis, why a mitzva Actually, it is the Rabbis. And due to that it is stated: “This is my God and I will glorify Him [ ve’anvehu ]” Beautify yourself [ hitna’e ] before Him in mitzvot.
llm_translation: As to where did he go, this is what was taught: With regard to the lulav, it is a mitzvah to bind it, and if one did not bind it - it is valid. If you say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda, if one did not bind it, why is it valid? If you say it is according to the Rabbis, why is it a mitzvah? Indeed, it is according to the Rabbis, and because it is stated: "This is my God, and I will beautify Him" - beautify Him with mitzvot.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁמְּקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֵד יַעֲלֶה מִן הָאָרֶץ״. מָה אֵד — דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ, אַף סוּכָּה — דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: This is the principle anything that is susceptible to ritual impurity From where are these matters Reish Lakish said the verse states: “And there went up a mist from the earth, just as mist, is a substance not capable of contracting ritual impurity, and its growth is from the ground, so too, sukka a substance not susceptible to ritual impurity and its growth is from the ground.
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that does not accept impurity, etc. How do we know these words? Reish Lakish said, a verse says: "And a mist shall rise from the earth." What is a mist? Something that does not accept impurity and its growth is not from the earth, so too a sukkah - something that does not accept impurity and its growth is not from the earth.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַנְנֵי כָבוֹד הָיוּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סוּכּוֹת מַמָּשׁ עָשׂוּ לָהֶם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּתַנְיָא: ״כִּי בַסּוּכּוֹת הוֹשַׁבְתִּי אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, עַנְנֵי כָבוֹד הָיוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: סוּכּוֹת מַמָּשׁ עָשׂוּ לָהֶם. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This well according to the one who said were clouds of glory, However, according to the one who said established for themselves actual sukkot what can be said? As it is taught “I made the children of Israel to reside in sukkot ”; were clouds of glory, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: They established for themselves actual sukkot . This well according to Rabbi Eliezer; however, according to Rabbi Akiva what can be said?
llm_translation: The one who says they were clouds of glory, what can he say? But the one who says they actually made real booths for themselves, what is there to say? As it was taught: "For I made the children of Israel dwell in booths," they were clouds of glory, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: They actually made real booths for themselves. The one who agrees with Rabbi Eliezer, what can he say? Rather, what is there to say according to Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה לְךָ״, מַקִּישׁ סוּכָּה לַחֲגִיגָה. מָה חֲגִיגָה — דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ, אַף סוּכָּה — דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְגִידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse states: “You shall prepare for you the festival of Sukkot ” likens sukka to the Festival peace-offering ḥagiga ]. Just as the Festival peace-offering is an item not susceptible to ritual impurity, and its growth is from the ground, so too, the sukka a substance that is not susceptible to ritual impurity and its growth is from the ground.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said, "The verse states: 'You shall make the festival of Sukkot for yourself,' equating the Sukkah to the festival offering. Just as the festival offering is something that does not contract impurity and its growth is not from the earth, so too the Sukkah is something that does not contract impurity and its growth is not from the earth."

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה חֲגִיגָה בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים, אַף סוּכָּה נָמֵי בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים!
human_translation: If Just as the Festival peace-offering animals, so too sukka animals.
llm_translation: If: what is the celebration for living beings, also a sukkah for living beings!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּאׇסְפְּךָ מִגׇּרְנְךָ וּמִיִּקְבֶךָ״, בִּפְסוֹלֶת גּוֹרֶן וָיֶקֶב הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse states: as you gather from your threshing floor and from your winepress” with regard to the waste of the threshing floor and of the winepress the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse states: "When you gather in from your threshing floor and your winepress," the Scripture speaks of the invalidation of the grain heap and the wine vat.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא גּוֹרֶן עַצְמוֹ וָיֶקֶב עַצְמוֹ! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״יֶקֶב״ כְּתִיב כָּאן, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְסַכֵּךְ בּוֹ.
human_translation: And say threshing floor itself, and the winepress itself, Rabbi Zeira said: “Winepress” is written here, and it is impossible to roof with
llm_translation: And why not say that the threshing floor has its own bones and the winepress has its own bones! Rabbi Zeira said: "Yeqev" is written here, and it is impossible to cover it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: וְאֵימָא יַיִן קָרוּשׁ הַבָּא מִשְּׂנִיר שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְעִיגּוּלֵי דְּבֵילָה! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָא מִלְּתָא הֲוָה בִּידַן, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וּשְׁדָא בַּיהּ נַרְגָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya strongly objects to this: Say congealed wine that comes from Senir, which is similar to a cake of figs. Rabbi Zeira said: This matter was in our hands, and Rabbi Yirmeya came and took an axe to it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Yirmeya raised an objection: But perhaps the diluted wine that comes from Sinir, which resembles the cakes of dung! Rabbi Zeira said: This matter was in our hands, and then Rabbi Yirmeya came and clarified it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״מִגׇּרְנְךָ״ וְלֹא גּוֹרֶן עַצְמוֹ, ״מִיִּקְבֶךָ״ וְלֹא יֶקֶב עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: “From your threshing floor,” but not threshing floor, itself; “from your winepress,” but not winepress, itself.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "From your threshing floor" and not the floor itself, "from your winepress" and not the press itself.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״צְאוּ הָהָר וְהָבִיאוּ עֲלֵי זַיִת וַעֲלֵי עֵץ שֶׁמֶן וַעֲלֵי הֲדַס וַעֲלֵי תְמָרִים וַעֲלֵי עֵץ עָבוֹת״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said from here: “Go forth to the mount and fetch olive branches, and branches of wild olive, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and the boughs of a dense-leaved tree
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said from here: "Go to the mountain and bring olive branches and branches of oil trees and myrtle branches and branches of palm trees and branches of thick trees."

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ ״הֲדַס״, הַיְינוּ ״עֵץ עָבוֹת״! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲדַס שׁוֹטֶה — לְסוּכָּה, וְעֵץ עָבוֹת — לְלוּלָב.
human_translation: These myrtle are those a dense-leaved tree; Rav Ḥisda said a wild myrtle, for the sukka . And a dense-leaved tree” for the lulav ,
llm_translation: This is the myrtle, this is the "hadas"! Rav Ḥisdah said: A foolish myrtle - for the sukkah, and a thick tree - for the lulav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲבִילֵי קַשׁ וַחֲבִילֵי עֵצִים וַחֲבִילֵי זְרָדִין — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן. וְכוּלָּן שֶׁהִתִּירָן — כְּשֵׁרוֹת. וְכוּלָּן כְּשֵׁרוֹת לִדְפָנוֹת.
human_translation: One not roof with bundles of straw or bundles of wood, or bundles of twigs. And all of if one untied them, fit And all of fit for walls
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: bundles of straw, bundles of wood, and bundles of branches - one may not use them to make a sukkah. And all of them, when they were untied, are valid. And all of them are valid for the walls.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: שְׁמַעִית מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּרְתֵּי: חֲדָא — הָא, וְאִידַּךְ — הַחוֹטֵט בַּגָּדִישׁ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ סוּכָּה — אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said: I heard from Rabbi Yoḥanan two One this and the other one who hollows out a stack of grain to establish a sukka for him. not a sukka .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Yaakov: I heard from the teachings of Rabbi Yochanan two: one — this, and the other — one who walks around in a haystack to make for himself a sukkah — it is not a sukkah.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא: מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת אוֹצָר. וַחֲדָא מִשּׁוּם: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״, וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי. וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ מִשּׁוּם אוֹצָר וְהֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ מִשּׁוּם תַּעֲשֶׂה וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי.
human_translation: one due to the decree of the storehouse. And one due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared, And I do not know which of is due to storehouse and which of them is due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared.
llm_translation: One: due to a decree of the treasury. And one due to: "you shall make," and not from what is already made. And we do not know which one is due to a decree of the treasury and which one is due to "you shall make," and not from what is already made.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: נִיחְזֵי אֲנַן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ חֲבִילֵי קַשׁ וַחֲבִילֵי עֵצִים וַחֲבִילֵי זְרָדִין אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן? פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם בָּא מִן הַשָּׂדֶה בָּעֶרֶב וַחֲבִילָתוֹ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ, וּמַעֲלָהּ וּמַנִּיחָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי סוּכָּתוֹ כְּדֵי לְיַבְּשָׁהּ, וְנִמְלַךְ עָלֶיהָ לְסִיכּוּךְ, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״, וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי. מִדְּהָא מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת אוֹצָר, הָא מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Let us see as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For what they say one not roof with bundles of straw, and bundles of wood, and bundles of twigs? sometimes a person comes from the field in the evening, and his bundle on his shoulder, and he lifts it and places it atop his shed to dry it. And, he reconsiders for roofing. And the Torah said: Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared. From that this due to the decree of the storehouse, that due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: We are pleased, for Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Why did they say that bundles of straw, bundles of wood, and bundles of branches do not serve as valid schach? Sometimes a person comes from the field in the evening with his bundle on his shoulder, and he lifts it and places it on top of his sukkah in order to dry it out, and he leans on it for schach. And the Torah said: "You shall make," not from something already made. For even though due to a decree of the treasury, these bundles are invalid, here it is due to "You shall make," not from something already made.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב? הָךְ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov he did not hear this of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yaakov? This is like what Rabbi Chiya bar Abba did not hear from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַטּוּ חֲבִילֵי קַשׁ וַחֲבִילֵי עֵצִים מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת אוֹצָר אִיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי לֵיכָּא? וְהַחוֹטֵט בְּגָדִישׁ, מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי אִיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת אוֹצָר לֵיכָּא?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Is that to say bundles of straw and bundles of wood due to the decree of the storehouse not due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared? And one who hollows a stack of grain, due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared, not due to the decree of the storehouse?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Are bundles of straw and bundles of wood subject to the decree of storing? Is it not from the category of "making" and not from what is already made that they are subject to the decree of storing? And one who smooths a pile of sheaves, is it from the category of "making" and not from what is already made that he is subject to the decree of storing?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָךְ, הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן״, לְכַתְּחִלָּה הוּא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you, Here, where it teaches: One not roof with them, it is ab initio
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to you, here where it is taught: "One may not cover them," initially it is.

hebrew_text: דְּאֵין מְסַכְּכִין מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת אוֹצָר, הָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. הָתָם דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה״ אֲפִילּוּ דִּיעֲבַד — מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה.
human_translation: that one not roof, due to the decree of the storehouse but by Torah seems well There, where it teaches: It is not a sukka , even after the fact, by Torah as well, it is not a sukka .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Since we do not cover the sukkah due to the decree of the treasury, the fact that it is from the Torah is indeed valid. There, where it teaches "it is not a sukkah," even if it was done - from the Torah it is indeed not a sukkah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: סִכְּכָהּ בְּחִיצִּין זְכָרִים — כְּשֵׁרָה. בִּנְקֵבוֹת — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: one roofed with convex arrow fit. with concave unfit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If its covering is with male arrows - it is valid. If with female arrows - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: זְכָרִים כְּשֵׁרָה, פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִיגְזוֹר זְכָרִים אַטּוּ נְקֵבוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: convex fit obvious. Lest you say: Let us issue a decree convex due to concave teaches us
llm_translation: Males are valid, it is obvious! What might you say: if males were castrated, then females, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: (אָמַר מָר:) בִּנְקֵבוֹת פְּסוּלָה, פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בֵּית קִבּוּל הֶעָשׂוּי לְמַלּאוֹת לָא שְׁמֵיהּ קִיבּוּל, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The Master said: concave unfit. obvious. Lest you say: A receptacle that is designated to be filled, its status not a receptacle, teaches us
llm_translation: Said Mar: In a perforated vessel she is disqualified, it is obvious! What might you say: a vessel designated for filling, its name is not designated, it has been taught to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סִכְּכָהּ בַּאֲנִיצֵי פִשְׁתָּן — פְּסוּלָה. בְּהוּצְנֵי פִשְׁתָּן — כְּשֵׁרָה. וְהוּשְׁנֵי פִשְׁתָּן, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַהוּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one roofed with bundles of combed flax, unfit, with stalks of flax, fit. And the hoshen of flax, I do not know what
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: If it was woven with linen warp threads - it is invalid. If it was woven with linen woof threads - it is valid. And if it was woven with both linen warp and woof threads, I do not know.

hebrew_text: וְהוּשְׁנֵי עַצְמָן אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי דְּיִיק וְלָא נְפִיץ — הוּשְׁנֵי קָרֵי לֵיהּ, אֲבָל תְּרֵי וְלָא דְּיִיק — הוּצְנֵי קָרֵי לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: תְּרֵי וְלָא דְּיִיק נָמֵי הוּשְׁנֵי קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And hoshen of itself, I do not know Which way you if one crushed and did not comb calls it hoshen , but if he soaked and did not crush calls it hotzen , Or, perhaps if he soaked and did not crush calls it hoshen ,
llm_translation: The two bones I do not know. What is your soul: if it is precise and not scattered - the two are called after it, but if it is two and not precise - the two are called after it. Or perhaps: even if it is two and not precise, the two are also called after it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָנֵי שׁוּשֵׁי וּשְׁווֹצְרֵי — מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּשׁוּשֵׁי מְסַכְּכִין, בִּשְׁווֹצְרֵי לָא מְסַכְּכִין. מַאי טַעְמָא, כֵּיוָן
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: these licorice and wormwood one roof his sukka with them, Abaye said: With licorice one roof with wormwood one not roof What is the reason Since
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Those made of linen and those made of wool — they may be interwoven. Abbaye said: With linen they may be interwoven, with wool they may not be interwoven. What is the reason? Since

hebrew_text: דְּסָרֵי רֵיחַיְיהוּ — שָׁבֵיק לְהוּ וְנָפֵיק.
human_translation: their odor grows offensive one abandons and exits.
llm_translation: The text reads: "desarei reichaiyehu - shaveik lehu venafeik."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: הָנֵי הִיזְמֵי וְהִיגֵי מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּהִיזְמֵי — מְסַכְּכִינַן, בְּהִיגֵי — לָא מְסַכְּכִינַן. מַאי טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דְּנָתְרִי טַרְפַיְיהוּ, שָׁבֵיק לַהּ וְנָפֵיק.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said: these thorns and shrubs, one roof with them. Abaye said: With thorns, one roof with shrubs, one not roof What is the reason Since their leaves fall one abandons and exits.
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Rava said: Those who are careful and those who are negligent, they are involved in it. Abbaye said: With those who are careful - we are involved, with those who are negligent - we are not involved. What is the reason? - Since their prey is torn, he leaves it and departs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: הַאי אַפָּקוּתָא דְּדִיקְלָא מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲגִידִי, אֶגֶד בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד. אַף עַל גַּב דַּהֲדַר אָגֵיד לְהוּ, אֶיגֶד בְּחַד לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: this offshoot of the palm tree, one roof the sukka with it. Although are bound, a binding at the hand of Heaven is not considered a binding. although one then binds one binds into one it is not considered a binding.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: This covering of the palm tree, we may spread it over them. Even though I will say it, if it is in the hands of Heaven, it is not called my saying. Even though I will come back and say it to them, it is not called my saying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: הָנֵי דּוּקְרֵי דְקָנֵי מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲגִידִי נִינְהוּ — אֶגֶד בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד. אַף עַל גַּב דַּהֲדַר אָגֵיד לְהוּ — אֶיגֶד בְּחַד לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Ravina bar Sheila said: these offshoots of reeds, one roof the sukka with them. Although are bound, a binding at the hand of Heaven is not considered a binding. although one then binds one binds into one it is not considered a binding.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said, Ravina bar She'ila said: Those who pierce holes in the ceiling are obstructing it. Even though I have told them, "A hole made by Heaven is not called a hole," and even though I will tell them again, "A hole made by a single person is not called a hole."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: קָנִים וְדוּקְרָנִין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן. קָנִים פְּשִׁיטָא! אֵימָא: קָנִים שֶׁל דּוּקְרָנִין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: this is also taught reeds and spades, one roof with them. reeds obvious. say: these offshoots of reeds, one roof the sukka with them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namely, thus did they teach: Canes and pegs are used to cover with them. Canes, it is obvious! Say: Canes of pegs are used to cover with them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: הָנֵי מְרָרְיָתָא דְאַגְמָא — אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Ravina bar Sheila said: With these bitter herbs of a marsh, a person fulfills his obligation on Passover.
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said, Ravina bar Sheila said: Those bitter herbs of Agma - a person fulfills his obligation with them on Passover.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵזוֹב, וְלֹא אֵזוֹב יוֹן, וְלֹא אֵזוֹב כּוֹחֳלִי, וְלֹא אֵזוֹב מִדְבָּרִי, וְלֹא אֵזוֹב רוֹמִי, וְלֹא אֵזוֹב שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שֵׁם לְוַוי.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection to his hyssop and neither a hyssop Greece, nor stibium hyssop, nor desert hyssop, nor Roman hyssop, nor hyssop whose a modifier.
llm_translation: Challenger: Ezov, and not Ezov Yavan, and not Ezov Kochli, and not Ezov Midbari, and not Ezov Romi, and not Ezov sheyesh lo shem Levavi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֹּל שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּנָּה שְׁמוֹ קוֹדֶם מַתַּן תּוֹרָה, וּבָאתָה תּוֹרָה וְהִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שֵׁם לְוַוי. וְהָנֵי לֹא נִשְׁתַּנָּה שְׁמַיְיהוּ קוֹדֶם מַתַּן תּוֹרָה כְּלָל.
human_translation: Abaye said Every whose name was differentiated prior to the giving of the Torah, and the Torah came and was particular about it is known that has a modifier And these their names were not differentiated prior to the giving of the Torah at all;
llm_translation: Abaye said: Anyone whose name was changed before the giving of the Torah, and then the Torah came and insisted on his original name - it is known that he has a name for prophecy. And these names were not changed before the giving of the Torah at all.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָנֵי — מְרָרְיָתָא סְתָמָא שְׁמַיְיהוּ, וְהַאי דְּקָרֵי לְהוּ מְרָרְיָתָא דְאַגְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִשְׁתְּכַח בְּאַגְמָא.
human_translation: Rava said name is merely bitter herbs And that one calls them bitter herbs of the marsh is because they are found in the marsh.
llm_translation: Rava said: Those - Meraryata Setamah their names, and this that is called to them Meraryata of Agma - because it is found in Agma.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֶיגֶד בְּחַד — לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד. שָׁלֹשׁ — שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד. שְׁנַיִם — מַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: מִצְוַת אֵזוֹב, שְׁלֹשָׁה קְלָחִים וּבָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה גִבְעוֹלִין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוַת אֵזוֹב שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּבְעוֹלִין, וּשְׁיָרָיו שְׁנַיִם, וְגַרְדּוּמָּיו כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If one bound one it is not considered a binding. three it is considered a binding. two a dispute Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis, as we learned the mitzva of hyssop, three stalks and on them three stems, Rabbi Yosei says: mitzva of hyssop three stems. its remnants two stumps of its any size.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If it is one — its name is not egged. If it is three — its name is egged. If it is two — it is a dispute between Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis. As we learned in a Mishnah: The requirement of hyssop, three stalks, and among them three buds. Rabbi Yosei says: The requirement of hyssop is three buds, and its stems are two, and its leaves can be any amount.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין מִדִּשְׁיָרָיו שְׁנַיִם, תְּחִילָּתוֹ נָמֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה — לְמִצְוָה. וּמִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמִצְוָה, לְרַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: It enters our minds From that its remnants are two, its origins also two And that teaches three for mitzva And from that Rabbi Yosei three for mitzva the Rabbis, three renders it unfit
llm_translation: He went up with his two thoughts from his two gates, his beginning is considered as two, and this that it teaches three — for a commandment. And according to Rabbi Yosei, three for a commandment, for the Rabbis three to delay.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵזוֹב תְּחִילָּתוֹ שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד פָּסוּל, וְאֵינוֹ כָּשֵׁר עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא תְּחִילָּתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה וּשְׁיָרָיו שְׁנַיִם! אֵיפוֹךְ: לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה לְעַכֵּב, לְרַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמִצְוָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei said: hyssop its origins two and its remnants are one, unfit. And it is fit only when its origins three and its remnants are two. reverse to Rabbi Yosei, three renders it unfit to the Rabbis, three for mitzva
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: If its beginning is two and its remainder one, it is invalid, and it is not valid until its beginning is three and its remainder two! Conversely: According to Rabbi Yosei, three is to disqualify, according to the Rabbis, three is for the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵזוֹב תְּחִילָּתוֹ שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד — כָּשֵׁר, וְאֵינוֹ פָּסוּל עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא תְּחִלָּתוֹ וּשְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד.
human_translation: And this was taught hyssop its origins two and its remnants one, fit. And it is unfit only when its origins and its remnants one.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: The hyssop, its beginning two and its remainder one - valid, and it is not disqualified until its beginning and its remainder are one.

hebrew_text: שְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד פָּסוּל? הָא אָמְרַתְּ שְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: its remnants one, unfit? Didn’t you say its remnants one fit?
llm_translation: His barley one disqualified? But you said his barley one valid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא תְּחִלָּתוֹ כִּשְׁיָרָיו אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, say: only when its origins, like its remnants, one.
llm_translation: Rather say: until its beginning like its end one.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ מָרִימָר: הָנֵי אִיסּוּרְיָיתָא דְסוּרָא — מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲגִדָן — לְמִנְיָנָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּאֲגִדָן.
human_translation: Mareimar taught: these bundles from Sura one roof with them. Although bound them, he bound them merely to the number
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: Those forbidden items of Surah - we cover them. Even though we cover them, it is merely a general principle that we cover them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הָנֵי צְרִיפֵי דְאוּרְבָּנֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוּתְּרָה רָאשֵׁי מַעֲדַנִּים שֶׁלָּהֶן — כְּשֵׁרִין. וְהָא אֲגִידִי מִתַּתַּאי! אֲמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּשָׁרֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: these huts of willow branches, once their upper ties are undone, fit But aren’t they tied from below? Rav Pappa said: where he unties them
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Those bundles of herbs, once their tops have been untied, are fit. But is this so from below! Rav Papa said: It is permitted for them.

hebrew_text: (וְאָמַר) רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דְּלָא שָׁרֵי לְהוּ, כׇּל אֶגֶד שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי לְטַלְטְלוֹ — לָא שְׁמֵיהּ אֶגֶד.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Even you say where one does not untie them any binding not destined to be moved is not considered a binding.
llm_translation: And said Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: Even if you say it is not permitted for them, any bolt that is not made for removal - its name is not a bolt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יְרָקוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח, מְבִיאִין אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְאֵין חוֹצְצִין בִּפְנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה, וּפוֹסְלִין בַּסּוּכָּה מִשּׁוּם אֲוִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דִּלְכִי יָבְשִׁי פָּרְכִי וְנָפְלִי, כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said: vegetables which the Sages said: One fulfills his obligation on Passover, transmit ritual impurity, And, they do not serve as a barrier before the spread of ritual impurity. and they render a sukka unfit due to airspace. What is the reason Since when they dry they crumble and fall, as one that is not there.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: Vegetables that the Sages said a person fulfills his obligation with them on Passover, one may bring them into a state of impurity, and one does not cut them in the presence of impurity, and they invalidate a Sukkah due to the issue of airspace. What is the reason? Since they are dry, they break and fall, resembling something that was not placed there.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַבּוֹצֵר לַגַּת — אֵין לוֹ יָדוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Rav Huna said: one who harvests for the winepress, do not have handles.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna: One who harvests for a winepress - he has no hands.

hebrew_text: וְרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַקּוֹצֵר לִסְכָךְ — אֵין לוֹ יָדוֹת.
human_translation: And Rav Menashya bar Gadda said Rav Huna said: one who harvests for roofing has no handles.
llm_translation: And Rav Menashya bar Gadda said, Rav Huna said: One who gathers for the purpose of making a sukkah - he has no hands.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר קוֹצֵר, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בּוֹצֵר — דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, דְּלָא נִימְצְיֵיהּ לְחַמְרֵיהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר בּוֹצֵר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ יָדוֹת, אֲבָל קוֹצֵר יֵשׁ לוֹ יָדוֹת — דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיסַכֵּךְ בְּהוּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיבַּדְּרָן.
human_translation: The one who said harvests all the more so harvests since are not suitable for his so that they will not absorb wine. the one who said harvests that it has no handles, however, one who harvests it has handles, since is suitable for his roof with them so that it does not scatter
llm_translation: One who says "reaping," certainly "gathering" — for it is not pleasing to him, as it is not found in his donkey's trough. One who says "gathering" without hands, but "reaping" with hands — it is pleasing to him, for he does not mix them together, so that they will not be confused.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא דְּרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: סוֹכֵי תְאֵנִים וּבָהֶן תְּאֵנִים, פַּרְכִּילִין וּבָהֶן עֲנָבִים, קַשִּׁין וּבָהֶן שִׁבֳּלִים, מַכְבֵּדוֹת וּבָהֶן תְּמָרִים, כּוּלָּן, אִם פְּסוֹלֶת מְרוּבָּה עַל הָאוֹכָלִין — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאִם לָאו — פְּסוּלָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ קַשִּׁין מְרוּבִּין עַל הַיָּדוֹת וְעַל הָאוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: Let us say that Rav Menashya bar Gadda is tanna’im , as it is taught Fig branches, and figs on them; vines, and grapes on them; straw, and stalks of grain on them; palm branches, and dates on them, them all, if the waste is greater than the food, fit. And if not, unfit. Aḥerim say: until the straw is greater than the handles and the food.
llm_translation: The statement of Rav Menashya bar Gadda, is it a teaching? For it was taught: "Palm branches with their dates, vines with their grapes, straw with their grains, palm leaves with their dates, all of them, if the disqualified part is more abundant than the edible part - it is valid, but if not - it is invalid." Others say: "Until they are more abundant on the hands and on the food."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר יֵשׁ לָהֶן יָדוֹת, וּמַר סָבַר אֵין לָהֶן יָדוֹת!
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds have handles; and Sage, holds that they do not have handles?
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not argue about this? Because one Master holds that they have hands, and the other Master holds that they do not have hands!

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אַבָּא — וַדַּאי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. לְרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא מִי לֵימָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? אָמַר לָךְ רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סָבְרִי הַקּוֹצֵר סְכָךְ אֵין לוֹ יָדוֹת. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁקְּוצָצָן לַאֲכִילָה, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Abba, it is certainly tanna’im . according to Rav Menashya bar Gadda, shall we say it is tanna’im , Rav Menashya said to you that everyone agrees: one who harvests roofing, does not have handles. And here with what are we dealing? where one cut for food, and reconsidered for them, for roofing.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Abba - and surely it is a teaching. To Rav Menashya bar Gadda, who will say it is a teaching? Rav Menashya said to you: The whole world thinks that one who gathers palm branches does not have hands. And here we are dealing with what? For example, when he cuts them for eating, and he softens them for roofing.

hebrew_text: אִי קְוצָצָן לַאֲכִילָה, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? וְכִי תֵּימָא קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן כֵּיוָן דְּנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן לְסִיכּוּךְ, בָּטְלָה לֵיהּ מַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ. וּמִי בָּטְלָה לֵיהּ מַחְשָׁבָה בְּהָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים
human_translation: If he cut them for food, what is the rationale of the Rabbis And if you say the Rabbis hold once he reconsidered for them for roofing, his intent was negated And was his intent negated in that Didn’t we learn All vessels
llm_translation: If they cut it for eating, what is the reason of the Rabbis? And if you will say that the Rabbis hold that since it is fit for covering, his intention is nullified. And did his intention become nullified in this case? But we learned: All vessels...

hebrew_text: יוֹרְדִין לִידֵי טוּמְאָה בְּמַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵין עוֹלִין מִטּוּמְאָתָן אֶלָּא בְּשִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה. מַעֲשֶׂה מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וּמִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה. מַחְשָׁבָה אֵינָהּ מוֹצִיאָה לֹא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וְלֹא מִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: descend into their ritual impurity by means of thought? However, they ascend from their ritual impurity only by means of a change action. Action negates action and thought; thought negates neither action nor thought.
llm_translation: Descending into impurity through thought, and one does not ascend from their impurity except through an action of change. An action removes impurity immediately from an action and immediately from thought. Thought does not remove impurity neither immediately from an action nor immediately from thought.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי כֵּלִים דַּחֲשִׁיבִי, אֲבָל יָדוֹת, דִּלְצוֹרֶךְ אֲכִילָה נִינְהוּ — בְּמַחְשָׁבָה נַעֲשֶׂה וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה סָלְקָא. וְהָתְנַן: כָּל יְדוֹת הָאוֹכָלִין שֶׁבְּסָסָן בַּגּוֹרֶן — טְהוֹרוֹת (וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַמֵּא).
human_translation: And if you say: this applies only vessels, which are significant, but handles that are for the purpose of food, by means of thought they become and by means of thought they emerge but didn’t we learn All handles of food that one besasan on the threshing floor are ritually pure, And Rabbi Yosei deems ritually impure.
llm_translation: And if you will say: those matters of vessels are significant, but hands, which are necessary for eating — they are made by thought and by thought they are removed. And we learned: all hands of food in the millstone — pure (and Rabbi Yosei deems them impure).

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״בְּסָסָן״ — הִתִּיר אִגּוּדָן, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַאי ״בְּסָסָן״ — בְּסָסָן מַמָּשׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said besasan one untied their binding, well. However, according to the one who said: What is besasan ? he actually trampled them, what can be said?
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says "in sasan" - he permitted their bundles, it is good. Rather, according to the one who says, what is "in sasan" - in sasan literally, what can be said?

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, שֶׁבְּסָסָן מַמָּשׁ. אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דַּאֲחֵרִים? דַּאֲמוּר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: Here too, where one actually trampled them, If so, what is the rationale of Aḥerim , because state in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as we learned Rabbi Yosei deems ritually impure
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Here, it is stated that in Susa itself. If so, what is the reason that others are different? It is said like Rabbi Yosei. As we learned: Rabbi Yosei declares impure.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי?! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם — טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי חַזְיָא לְכִדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: הוֹאִיל וּרְאוּיוֹת לְהוֹפְכָן בְּעֶתֶר.
human_translation: What is this Granted, there, the rationale of Rabbi Yosei, they are suitable in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: since is suited to turning over with a pitchfork,
llm_translation: This what?! In truth there — the reason of Rabbi Yosei Hazaya according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish. For Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Since they are fit to be overturned at the time.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא לְמַאי חַזְיָא? חַזְיָא לְכִי סָתַר לְמִנְקַט לְהוּ בְּגִילַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: However, here, what are suited They are suited when one dismantles to hold by the straw,
llm_translation: Instead, here, what does he see? He sees that he should hide from them with their own weapons.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, כָּל יְדוֹת הָאוֹכָלִין שֶׁבְּסָסָן בַּגּוֹרֶן — טְהוֹרוֹת, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטַמֵּא. מַאי ״בְּסָסָן״? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בְּסָסָן מַמָּשׁ. רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) אוֹמֵר: הִתִּיר אַגְדָּן.
human_translation: the itself: All handles of food that one besasan on the threshing floor are ritually pure, and Rabbi Yosei deems ritually impure. What is besasan ? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one actually trampled Rabbi Elazar says: he untied their binding.
llm_translation: The body, all hands of the food in the threshing floor - pure, and Rabbi Yosei declares impure. What is "in the threshing floor"? Rabbi Yochanan said: In the threshing floor itself. Rabbi (Eliezer) says: He permitted their bundle.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר), דְּאָמַר ״בְּסָסָן״ — הִתִּיר אַגְדָּן, הַיְינוּ דִּמְטַמֵּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר בְּסָסָן מַמָּשׁ, אַמַּאי מְטַמֵּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: הוֹאִיל וּרְאוּיוֹת לְהוֹפְכָן בְּעֶתֶר.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar, who said that besasan he untied their binding, this is that Rabbi Yosei deems capable of contracting ritual impurity. However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said besasan actually trampled them, why does Rabbi Yosei deem capable of contracting ritual impurity? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: since is suited to turning over with a pitchfork.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Eliezer, who said "with a 'sasan' - he permitted their bundles," meaning that Rabbi Yosei becomes impure. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said "with a 'sasan' literally," why does Rabbi Yosei become impure? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Since they are fit to be overturned with a pitchfork.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלָה תְּפִלָּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים כְּעֶתֶר — לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה עֶתֶר זֶה מְהַפֵּךְ אֶת הַתְּבוּאָה בַּגּוֹרֶן מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם, אַף תְּפִלָּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מְהַפֶּכֶת דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמִּדַּת אַכְזָרִיּוּת לְמִדַּת רַחֲמָנוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Why are the prayers of the righteous likened to a pitchfork [ eter ]? to say to you: Just as this pitchfork overturns the grain on the threshing floor from place to place, so too, the prayers of the righteous overturn the mind of the Holy One, Blessed be He, from the attribute of cruelty to the attribute of mercy,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: Why is the prayer of the righteous compared to incense? To tell you: Just as this incense transforms the produce in the granary from place to place, so too the prayer of the righteous transforms the mind of the Holy One, blessed be He, from the attribute of cruelty to the attribute of mercy.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְסַכְּכִין בִּנְסָרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹסֵר. נָתַן עָלֶיהָ נֶסֶר שֶׁהוּא רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִישַׁן תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: One roof with boards the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir prohibits If one placed a board that is four handbreadths wide atop is fit. provided he does not sleep beneath
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may cover with a canopy of eagle feathers, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda, while Rabbi Meir prohibits it. If one places on it a feather that is four handbreadths wide - it is valid, provided that one does not sleep beneath it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּנְסָרִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה. אֲבָל בִּנְסָרִין שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחֲלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rav said: The dispute is with regard to boards that have four in their Rabbi Meir is of the decree of the roof. And Rabbi Yehuda is not of the decree of the roof. However, with regard to boards that do not have four in their everyone agrees that is fit. And Shmuel said: The dispute is with regard to boards that do not have four in their however, they have four in their everyone agrees that it is unfit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav: Dispute in Nisrin that there are in them four, of Rabbi Meir has to him decree of roof, and of Rabbi Yehuda has not to him decree of roof. But in Nisrin that there are not in them four — words of all valid. And Shmuel said: In that there are not in them four dispute, but there are in them four — words of all invalid.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, הָא קָנִים בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: do not have four and even less than three aren’t they merely reeds;
llm_translation: There are not four, and even less than three, are they considered mere reeds?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה, מַאי טַעְמָא — קָנִים בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עַד אַרְבָּעָה. מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ שִׁיעוּר מָקוֹם, לָא גָּזְרִינַן. וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּנָפְקִי לְהוּ מִתּוֹרַת לָבוּד, גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said this is what is saying: they have four in their everyone agrees that unfit. less than three everyone agrees that fit. What is the reason? they are merely reeds. When they disagree from three to four Sage, holds since they are not the measure of place, we do not issue a decree And Sage, holds since they have departed from the status of joined [ lavud ], we issue a decree
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, thus he said: There are four — all agree it is invalid, less than three — all agree it is valid. What is the reason? They are merely reeds. When do they dispute? From three to four. One Master holds: Since there is no fixed measure of space, we do not decree. And one Master holds: Since they are taken from the Torah of separation, we decree.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נָתַן עָלֶיהָ נֶסֶר שֶׁהוּא רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִישַׁן תַּחְתָּיו. בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא יִישַׁן תַּחְתָּיו. אֶלָּא לְרַב דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל אֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַמַּאי לֹא יִישַׁן תַּחְתָּיו?
human_translation: We learned If one placed a board that is four handbreadths wide atop is fit. provided he does not sleep beneath Granted, according to Shmuel, who said the dispute is with regard to boards that do not have four in their however, they have four in their everyone agrees that it is unfit due to that one should not sleep beneath However, according to Rav, said the dispute is with regard to boards that have four in their however, they do not have four in their everyone agrees that it is fit, according to Rabbi Yehuda, why one not sleep beneath it?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one places a plank on top of a bed that is four handbreadths wide - it is valid, provided that one does not sleep underneath it. According to Shmuel, this is understandable when there are not four disagreements in it, but if there are four disagreements, all agree that it is invalid, therefore one should not sleep underneath it. However, according to Rav who says that if there are four disagreements in it, but there are not four points of agreement, it is valid, why should one not sleep underneath it according to Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הִיא? סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Do you hold is everyone, agrees? the latter clause we have come to Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Who holds that the words of all are the same? The end comes to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי סְדִינִין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Come hear: Two sheets join together
llm_translation: Come and hear: two sheets join together.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי נְסָרִין אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף נְסָרִין כִּסְדִינִין.
human_translation: two boards do not combine. Rabbi Meir says: Even boards are like sheets,
llm_translation: Two nesarin do not combine. Rabbi Meir says: Even nesarin are like sardinin.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה, מַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to Shmuel, who said the dispute is with regard to boards that do not have four in their but they have four in their everyone agrees that it is unfit; what join together? combine to four
llm_translation: In truth, according to Shmuel who said that when they do not contain four disagreements, but they do contain four matters, all agree that it is invalid. What is the meaning of "they combine"? They combine to form four.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב, דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל אֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, לְמָה לְהוּ לְאִיצְטְרוֹפֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, אַמַּאי? וְהָא קָנִים בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: However, according to Rav, who said the dispute is with regard to boards that have four in their but they do not have four in their everyone agrees that it is fit, what are the circumstances? If has four why must they join together does not have four why But aren’t they merely reeds
llm_translation: Rather, to Rav, who said that if there are four disagreements in it, but if there are not four, everyone agrees that it is valid, how is it similar? If there are four in it, why should they be combined? If there are not four in it, why? And are they merely reeds?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, וּמַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: Actually, that there are four in what join together? They join together to four cubits from the side.
llm_translation: Forever that there are in it four, and what is "combine" - they combine to four cubits from the side.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה, מַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: another version Granted, according to Shmuel, who said the dispute is with regard to boards that do not have four in their but they have four in their everyone agrees that it is unfit, what join together? they join together to four cubits from the side,
llm_translation: Another interpretation: According to Shmuel who said that when they do not contain four divisions, but when they contain four, everyone agrees that it is invalid. What is the meaning of "they combine"? They combine to four cubits on the side.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִן הַצַּד. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה כְּשֵׁרָה, מַאי ״אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין״? קָנִים בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ! אַיְּידֵי דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר ״מִצְטָרְפִין״, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין״.
human_translation: However, to Rav, granted, to Rabbi Meir, what join together? they join together to four cubits from the side. However, according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said that even they have four in their fit, what do not join together? They are merely reeds, Since Rabbi Meir Join together, Rabbi Yehuda, said: Do not join together.
llm_translation: To Rav: According to Rabbi Meir, what is "combine"? - They combine for four cubits on the side. But according to Rabbi Yehuda who says even if there are four together it is valid, what is "do not combine"? - They are merely like separate poles! Since Rabbi Meir said "combine," Rabbi Yehuda said "do not combine."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rav, it is taught in accordance with Shmuel.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: סִכְּכָהּ בִּנְסָרִים שֶׁל אֶרֶז שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרָה. יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rav: one roofed with cedar boards that do not have four in their everyone agrees fit. there are four in their Rabbi Meir deems it unfit and Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: If one covered it with cedar branches that do not have four t’fachim in width, everyone agrees that it is valid. If they have four t’fachim in width, Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda declares it valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה שֶׁהֵבֵיאנוּ נְסָרִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה וְסִיכַּכְנוּ עַל גַּבֵּי מִרְפֶּסֶת, וְיָשַׁבְנוּ תַּחְתֵּיהֶן! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! אֵין שְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident during a time of danger, which we brought boards that had four in their and we roofed the porch and we sat beneath them. They said to him: proof from there? no proof a time of danger.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident at a time of danger when they brought us planks that had four nails in them, and we placed them on the edge of a balcony, and we sat beneath them! They said to him: Is that a proper sight?! A time of danger is not a proper sight.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: סִכְּכָהּ בִּנְסָרִים שֶׁל אֶרֶז שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה. אֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר שֶׁאִם יֵשׁ בֵּין נֶסֶר לְנֶסֶר כִּמְלֹא נֶסֶר — שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ פְּסָל בֵּינֵיהֶם, וּכְשֵׁרָה. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם נָתַן עָלֶיהָ נֶסֶר שֶׁהוּא רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאֵין יְשֵׁנִים תַּחְתָּיו, וְהַיָּשֵׁן תַּחְתָּיו — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Shmuel: one roofed with cedar boards that have four in their everyone agrees unfit. there are not four in their Rabbi Meir deems it unfit and Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit. And Rabbi Meir concedes that, if between board board complete of a board, one places waste and is fit. And Rabbi Yehuda concedes that if one roofed a board that is four handbreadths wide is fit and, one not sleep beneath and one who sleeps beneath it does not fulfill his obligation.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: If one covered it with cedar planks that have four knots, all agree that it is invalid. If they do not have four knots, Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda declares it valid. Rabbi Meir concedes that if there is a space of the width of a plank between one plank and another, he places an invalid plank between them, and it is valid. Rabbi Yehuda concedes that if one places a plank that is four handbreadths wide on it, it is valid, and if there are sleepers beneath it, and the sleepers are beneath it, he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: הֲפָכָן עַל צִידֵּיהֶן, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה, וְרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמְרִי: כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: It is stated one turned on their sides, Rav Huna said: is unfit, and Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna said: fit.
llm_translation: It was stated: If they turned them over on their sides, Rav Huna said: Invalid, and Rav Ḥisdah and Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Valid.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַב נַחְמָן לְסוּרָא, עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: הֲפָכָן עַל צִידֵּיהֶן, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּסוּלָה, נַעֲשׂוּ כְּשַׁפּוּדִין שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman happened to Sura. Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna entered before him. They said to him: one turned on their sides what is He said to them: unfit; their became like skewers [ shapudin ] of metal,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman arrived in Sura, Rav Chisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna came before him. They said to him: Should we turn them over on their sides? He said to them: It is invalid, they have become like metal plates.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא: לָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ אֱמַרוּ כְּווֹתִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וּמִי אָמַר לַן מָר טַעְמָא וְלָא קַבֵּלְינַן מִינֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: וּמִי בְּעֵיתוּ מִינַּאי טַעְמָא וְלָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ?
human_translation: Rav Huna said to them: Didn’t I tell you that you should say in accordance with my They said to him: And did the Master actually say a reason to us, and we did not accept it from him? He said to them: And did you ask me for the reason and I did not say you?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Huna: Did I not say to you, "Say like my colleagues"? They said to him: And who told us the reason, and we did not accept it from him? He said to them: And who asked you for reasons, and did not say to you?

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת כְּדֵי רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁנִּפְרְצָה בָּהּ פִּרְצָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּזְדַּקֵּר בָּהּ גְּדִי בְּבַת רֹאשׁ, אוֹ שֶׁנָּתַן עָלֶיהָ נֶסֶר שֶׁהוּא רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִכְנִיס לְתוֹכָהּ אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Let us say that supports does not hold one’s head, most of his and his table; was breached with a breach large enough for a goat to jump through headlong, that one placed atop a board that is four handbreadths wide, even if he only introduced three handbreadths into unfit.
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: it does not strengthen as much as the size of his head, majority, and table, or if a breach occurred in it the size of a kid's head, or if an eagle's talon was placed upon it that is four handbreadths wide, even though he only inserted within it three handbreadths - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, (מַאי) לָאו כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֲפָכָן עַל צִידֵּיהֶם? לָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּאַנְּחַהּ אַפּוּמָּא דִמְטַלַּלְתָּא, דְּעָיֵיל תְּלָתָא לְגָיו וְאַפֵּיק חַד לְבַר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ פְּסָל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַסּוּכָּה, וְכׇל פְּסָל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַסּוּכָּה — נִידּוֹן כַּסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances What, is it not that he turned on its side, No, with what are we dealing here? where one placed over the entrance of the sukka , He introduced three into and took one out so that be like roofing that protrudes from the sukka , and any roofing that protrudes from the sukka is considered like that of the sukka .
llm_translation: How are they similar, what is it not like that they turned on their sides? No, here we are dealing with what? For example, when you blow a lamp that is hanging, it brings three to the valley and takes out one to the outside, which would be a disqualified Sukkah covering that is taken out of the Sukkah, and any disqualified covering that is taken out of the Sukkah is judged like the Sukkah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תִּקְרָה שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ מַעֲזִיבָה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְפַקְפֵּק, וְנוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְפַקְפֵּק, אוֹ נוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם, וְאֵינוֹ מְפַקְפֵּק.
human_translation: a roof upon which there is no plaster, Rabbi Yehuda says Beit Shammai say: One moves and one removes one from among Beit Hillel say: one move or remove one from among Rabbi Meir says: One removes one from among and does not move
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A roof that does not have a parapet, Rabbi Yehuda says: Beit Shammai say: He should dismantle it and take one from between two. And Beit Hillel say: He should dismantle it, or take one from between two. Rabbi Meir says: He should take one from between two, and he does not need to dismantle it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל, טַעְמַיְיהוּ מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי. אִי מְפַקְפֵּק, עָבֵיד לֵיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה. אִי נוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם, עָבֵד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה. אֶלָּא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ וְלֹא מִן הֶעָשׂוּי — בַּחֲדָא סַגִּי! אִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה — בְּנוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם סַגִּי!
human_translation: Granted, Beit Hillel, their reason due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared. If one moves he performs an action. if he removes one from among he performs an action. However, Beit Shammai, what is the rationale their If due to Prepare and not from that which has already been prepared, one should suffice. if due to the decree of the roof, removing one from among suffice.
llm_translation: Gemara: In accordance with the opinion of Beit Hillel, their reasoning is based on "ta'aseh" and not on what has already been done. If one hesitates, he should perform the action. If he takes one of the two, he should perform the action with it. But Beit Shammai, what is their reasoning? If it is based on "ta'aseh" and not on what has already been done - this is sufficient. If it is based on a decree of the sages - by taking one of the two, this is sufficient!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה, וְהָכִי קָאָמְרִי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּפַקְפֵּק, אִי נוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Actually, due to the decree of the roof, and this is they are saying: Although one moves if he removes one from among yes, if not, no,
llm_translation: Always because of the decree of the scripture, and thus they say: Even though he hesitates, if he does not take one of the two - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נוֹטֵל אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם, אֲבָל לֹא יְפַקְפֵּק — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הַיְינוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause Rabbi Meir says: One removes one from among but does not move Rabbi Meir is Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: Rabbi Meir says: One may take one of the two, but not pick and choose - Rabbi Meir is Beit Shammai!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּדָבָר זֶה.
human_translation: This is what is saying: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not disagree on this matter.
llm_translation: Thus he said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree on this matter.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה — וְהָא אִפְּלִיגוּ בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! דִּתְנַן: מְסַכְּכִין בִּנְסָרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: What is teaching us? that Rabbi Meir is of the decree of the roof and Rabbi Yehuda is of the decree of the roof? But didn’t they disagree about this once, as we learned One roof with boards; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir prohibits
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? That Rabbi Meir holds the decree of a roof, and Rabbi Yehuda does not hold the decree of a roof - and they argued about it once! As we learned: One may cover with boards, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Meir prohibits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רֵישָׁא — בִּנְסָרִים מְשׁוּפִּין עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת כֵּלִים נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in the first clause, we are dealing with planed boards. but it is due to the decree of the vessels touched upon it.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Initially — we are dealing with nisarim, and due to the decree of vessels they touched it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר: סִכְּכָהּ בְּחִיצִּין זְכָרִים — כְּשֵׁרָה. בִּנְקֵבוֹת — פְּסוּלָה, וְלָא גָּזַר זְכָרִים אַטּוּ נְקֵבוֹת. הָכָא נָמֵי לָא נִגְזַר נְסָרִים מְשׁוּפִּין אַטּוּ כֵּלִים!
human_translation: And to Rav Yehuda, who said Rav said: one roofed with convex arrow fit, with concave unfit; and he did not issue a decree convex due to concave here too, let us not issue a decree planed boards, due to vessels.
llm_translation: And to Rav Yehudah said Rav, as he said: If it is covered with male arrows - it is valid. If with female arrows - it is invalid. And he did not decree male arrows because of female arrows. Here too, we do not decree saws because of planes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עַל כׇּרְחָךְ רֵישָׁא פְּלִיגִי בִּגְזֵרַת תִּקְרָה, וְסֵיפָא פְּלִיגִי בִּגְזֵרַת תִּקְרָה. וְאִפְּלוֹגֵי בְּתַרְתֵּי זִימְנֵי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rather, perforce you say the first clause they disagree with regard to the decree of the roof, and in the latter clause, they disagree with regard to the decree of the roof. Why do I disagree twice?
llm_translation: Rather, by force of circumstance, the first part disputes regarding the decree of the roof, and the latter part disputes regarding the decree of the roof. And even if they dispute twice, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה (הִיא), דְּקָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַמַּאי קָא אָסְרַתְּ בִּנְסָרִים — מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה? הַאי סְבָרָא לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי הוּא דְּאִית לְהוּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל לָא גָּזְרִי! וְאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּדָבָר זֶה.
human_translation: the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda, who is saying to Rabbi Meir: Why do you prohibit with boards? due to the decree of the roof? That reason according to Beit Shammai, who are of But, Beit Hillel do not issue the decree. And Rabbi Meir said Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to this matter
llm_translation: The latter part: Rabbi Yehuda (it is), when he said to Rabbi Meir: Why did you prohibit the use of neserim? — Is it because of a decree of the roof? This reasoning belongs to Beit Shammai, who have a reason for it, but Beit Hillel do not decree! And Rabbi Meir said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree on this matter.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַב, דְּאָמַר מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵית לֵיהּ גְּזֵרַת תִּקְרָה. אֶלָּא שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה, סֵיפָא בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: This well according to Rav, who said the dispute is in have four in their that Rabbi Meir is of the decree of the roof, and Rabbi Yehuda is not of the decree of the roof. However, according to Shmuel, who said the dispute is in do not have four in their but where they have four in their everyone agrees that is unfit, in the latter clause with regard to what do they disagree?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha to Rav, de'amar machloket b'she'yesh bahen arba'ah, de'Rabbi Meir it leih gezirat tikra ve'Rabbi Yehuda leit leih gezirat tikra. Ela Shmuel, de'amar b'she'ein bahen arba'ah machloket, aval yesh bahen arba'ah — divrei hakol pesulah, seifa b'mai p'ligi?" The English translation is as follows: "It is satisfactory for Rav, who said that a dispute when there are four opinions, for Rabbi Meir holds that there is a prohibition of a ceiling, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that there is no prohibition of a ceiling. But Shmuel, who said that when there are not four opinions in a dispute, but there are four opinions — everyone agrees that it is invalid; the latter clause, what do they dispute about?"

hebrew_text: בְּבַיטּוֹלֵי תִּקְרָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר בָּטְלָה בְּהָכִי, וּמַר סָבַר בְּהָכִי לָא בָּטְלָה.
human_translation: with regard to negating roof they disagree. Sage, holds: is thereby negated, and Sage, holds is not thereby negated
llm_translation: In the cases of nullification of a roof, they dispute: One Master holds that it is nullified in this way, and the other Master holds that it is not nullified in this way.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקָרֶה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּשַׁפּוּדִין אוֹ בַּאֲרוּכּוֹת הַמִּטָּה, אִם יֵשׁ רֶיוַח בֵּינֵיהֶן כְּמוֹתָן — כְּשֵׁרָה. הַחוֹטֵט בְּגָדִישׁ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ סוּכָּה — אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה.
human_translation: one who roofs his sukka with skewers or with the long boards of the bed, if there is space between them equal to fit. one who hollows out a stack of grain to establish a sukka for him, not a sukka .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who constructs his sukkah with shpudin or with the branches of a bed, if there is an interval between them like their size - it is valid. One who spreads a sheet over a pile of grain to make it into a sukkah - it is not a sukkah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. דְּאִתְּמַר: פָּרוּץ כְּעוֹמֵד, רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מוּתָּר. וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אָסוּר!
human_translation: Let us say, that this will be a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, as it is stated the breached is equal to the standing Rav Pappa said: It is permitted Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: It is prohibited
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say that it should be the opinion of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. As it was stated: "Parutz (a breach) is like standing." Rav Papa said: Permitted. And Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Forbidden!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַאי כְּמוֹתָן — בְּנִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to you: What Like where enter and emerge
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to you: What is "k'motan" - in entering and exiting.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם! אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בְּמַעֲדִיף.
human_translation: But isn’t it possible to be precise? Rabbi Ami said: where one extends
llm_translation: And is it possible to shorten? Rabbi Ammi said: In a preferred manner.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲדִיף, אִם הָיוּ נְתוּנִים שְׁתִי — נוֹתְנָן עֵרֶב, עֵרֶב — נוֹתְנָן שְׁתִי.
human_translation: Rava said: Even you say where one does not extend if were placed lengthwise one places widthwise, widthwise, one places the lengthwise.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say that when there is no preference, if two were given - one gives an evening, an evening - one gives two.

hebrew_text: אוֹ בַּאֲרוּכּוֹת הַמִּטָּה. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר טַבְיוֹמֵי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר טַבְיוֹמֵי: סִכְּכָהּ בִּבְלָאֵי כֵלִים — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Or with the long boards of the bed, Let us say supports Rabbi Ami bar Tavyomei, as Rabbi Ami bar Tavyomei said: one roofed with worn, vessels, unfit.
llm_translation: Or in the thicknesses of the bed. Let us say it supports for Rabbi Ammi bar Tabiomei, as Rabbi Ammi bar Tabiomei said: If one covered it with utensils — it is invalid.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן אָמַר רַבִּי: בַּאֲרוּכָּה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם, בִּקְצָרָה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם. הָכָא נָמֵי: בַּאֲרוּכָּה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם, בִּקְצָרָה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם.
human_translation: similar to which Rabbi Ḥanan said Rabbi said with the long board and two legs or with the short board with two legs Here too, with the long board and two legs or with the short board and two legs,
llm_translation: As Rabbi Hanan said, Rabbi said: In length and two legs, in shortness and two legs. Here it is stated: In length and two legs, in shortness and two legs.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַבִּי חָנָן אָמַר רַבִּי? אַהָא דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Where is it stated which Rabbi Ḥanan Rabbi said? As we learned
llm_translation: Here is where it was stated that Rabbi Hanan said Rabbi? Here is what we learned:

hebrew_text: מִטָּה מְטַמֵּאת חֲבִילָה וּמְטַהֶרֶת חֲבִילָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְטַמֵּאת אֵבָרִים וּמְטַהֶרֶת אֵבָרִים. מַאי נִיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן אָמַר רַבִּי: אֲרוּכָּה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם, קְצָרָה וּשְׁתֵּי כְרָעַיִם.
human_translation: A bed becomes ritually impure entity And it becomes ritually pure as a entity the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. The Rabbis say: It becomes ritually impure parts, and, it becomes ritually pure parts. what are Rabbi Ḥanan said Rabbi said: a long board and two legs and a short board and two legs
llm_translation: From below, it defiles a bundle and purifies a bundle, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: it defiles limbs and purifies limbs. What is the reason? Rabbi Hanan said in the name of Rabbi: a long one and two legs, a short one and two legs.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי חַזְיָא? לְמִסְמְכִינְהוּ אַגּוּדָּא וּלְמֵיתַב עֲלַיְיהוּ וּמִשְׁדֵּא אַשְׁלֵי.
human_translation: And for what are suited; to lean them against the wall and to sit on them, and placing ropes
llm_translation: Regarding what does he see? To support them with a peg and to sit upon them, and to remove the burden.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר טַבְיוֹמֵי: סִכְּכָהּ בִּבְלָאֵי כֵלִים פְּסוּלָה. מַאי בְּלָאֵי כֵלִים? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַטְלָנִיּוֹת שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶם שָׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ, דְּלָא חַזְיָין לֹא לַעֲנִיִּים וְלֹא לַעֲשִׁירִים.
