human_translation: the itself Rabbi Ami bar Tavyomei said: If one roofed with worn, vessels, unfit. What are worn vessels? Abaye said: cloths that do not have three by three which, are not suited either by the poor or by the wealthy.
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Ammi bar Tabiomi said: If she covered it with utensils, it is invalid. What are utensils? Abaye said: Small mats that are not three by three, for they are not fit for the poor or the rich.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר טַבְיוֹמֵי: מַחְצֶלֶת שֶׁל שִׁיפָא וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי, שְׁיָרֶיהָ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּפְחֲתוּ מִכְּשִׁיעוּרָהּ — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rabbi Ami bar Tavyomei: a mat of papyrus and reed grass, even though its remnants were reduced from measure one not roof with them.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ammi bar Tabiomi: A cucumber of the shipha and a cucumber of the gemi, its remnants, even though they have diminished from their original size - one may not cover with them.

hebrew_text: מַחְצֶלֶת הַקָּנִים, גְּדוֹלָה — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, קְטַנָּה, — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף הִיא מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה, וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: a mat of reeds large one roof with it. a small one not roof with it. Rabbi Eliezer says: even is capable of contracting ritual impurity, and one not roof with it.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Machzelet ha'kanim, gedolah — mesachekhin bah, ketanah, — ein mesachekhin bah. Rabbi Eliezer omer: af hi mekabelet tum'ah, ve'ein mesachekhin bah." Translation: "The covering of reeds, if large — one may use it as a covering; if small, — one may not use it as a covering. Rabbi Eliezer says: It also contracts impurity, and one may not use it as a covering."

hebrew_text: הַחוֹטֵט בְּגָדִישׁ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין שָׁם חָלָל טֶפַח בְּמֶשֶׁךְ שִׁבְעָה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם חָלָל טֶפַח בְּמֶשֶׁךְ שִׁבְעָה — הֲרֵי זֹה סוּכָּה.
human_translation: one who hollows out a stack of grain, Rav Huna said: taught only where there is not a space one handbreadth along seven However, if there is a space one handbreadth along seven it is sukka .
llm_translation: The one who shakes out a bundle of grain. Rav Huna said: They only taught that there is no empty space of a handbreadth in a length of seven, but if there is an empty space of a handbreadth in a length of seven - behold, this is a sukkah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַחוֹטֵט בְּגָדִישׁ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ סוּכָּה — הֲרֵי זֹה סוּכָּה. וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּדְרַב הוּנָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: That is also taught One who hollows out a stack of grain to make himself a sukka , it is a sukka . But didn’t we learn it is not a sukka ? Rather, is it not conclude from it, in accordance with Rav Huna, learn from it
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: One who spreads a bundle of grain to make a sukkah for himself—behold, this is a sukkah. But we learned in our Mishnah: It is not a sukkah! Rather, understand from it as Rav Huna said. Understand from it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּרָמֵי לַיהּ מִירְמֵא. תְּנַן: הַחוֹטֵט בְּגָדִישׁ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ סוּכָּה — אֵינָהּ סוּכָּה. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הֲרֵי זוֹ סוּכָּה! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם חָלָל טֶפַח בְּמֶשֶׁךְ שִׁבְעָה, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם חָלָל טֶפַח בְּמֶשֶׁךְ שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Some raised a contradiction We learned One who hollows out a stack of grain in order to make himself a sukka , it is not a sukka . But wasn’t it taught this is a sukka ? Rav Huna said: not difficult. Here, where there is a space one handbreadth along seven there, where there is not a space one handbreadth along seven
llm_translation: There is one who raises an objection against him from a different angle. We learned in a Mishnah: One who spreads a covering over a pile of grain to make a sukkah out of it—it is not considered a sukkah. But isn't it taught: Behold, this is a sukkah! Rav Huna said, it is not difficult: here, where there is an empty space of a handbreadth within a span of seven, and here, where there is no empty space of a handbreadth within a span of seven.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְשַׁלְשֵׁל דְּפָנוֹת מִלְמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה, אִם גָּבוֹהַּ מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה. מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה, אִם גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, כָּךְ מִלְמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: One who lowers the walls from up downward, if three handbreadths above the ground, unfit. down upward, if ten handbreadths high, fit. Rabbi Yosei says: Just as from down upward ten handbreadths, so too, from up downward, ten handbreadths
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who extends the corners from above downwards, if it is three handbreadths high from the ground - it is invalid. From below upwards, if it is ten handbreadths high - it is valid. Rabbi Yosei says: Just as from below upwards it is ten handbreadths, so too from above downwards it is ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת, וּמַר סָבַר מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה אֵינָהּ מַתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? Sage, holds a suspended partition, renders it permitted And Sage, holds a suspended partition does not render it permitted
llm_translation: Gemara: With what do they argue? One Master holds that a suspended partition is valid, and the other Master holds that a suspended partition is not valid.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בּוֹר שֶׁבֵּין שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵירוֹת — אֵין מְמַלְּאִין מִמֶּנָּה בְּשַׁבָּת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עָשָׂה לָהּ מְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, בֵּין מִלְמַעְלָה בֵּין מִלְּמַטָּה, בֵּין בְּתוֹךְ אוֹגְנוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: We learned there, a cistern that is between two courtyards, one may draw from it on Shabbat only a partition ten handbreadths high was erected for whether it is above, whether below, or whether it is within the rim, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says
llm_translation: We learned there: A pit between two courtyards - one may not fill it on Shabbat unless he made for it a partition of ten handbreadths, whether above or below, whether within its rim. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים מִלְמַעְלָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים מִלְּמַטָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא תְּהֵא מְחִיצָה גְּדוֹלָה מִן הַכּוֹתֶל שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: below; and Beit Hillel said above. Rabbi Yehuda said: A partition should be no more than the wall between
llm_translation: House of Shammai says from above, and House of Hillel says from below. Rabbi Yehuda said: There shall not be a large partition from the wall between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר מְחִיצָה תְּלוּיָה מַתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Yehuda stated in the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, who said a suspended partition permits
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Yehuda, according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, said it, as he said, a hanging partition is permissible.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And that is not so, neither does Rabbi Yehuda hold in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, nor does Rabbi Yosei hold in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And not this, not Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם, אֶלָּא בְּעֵירוּבֵי חֲצֵירוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן. אֲבָל הָכָא, סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא.
human_translation: Neither does Rabbi Yehuda hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as Rabbi Yehuda states only there, with the joining of the courtyards, by rabbinic However, here, sukka , by Torah not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda does not hold like Rabbi Yosei: Until here, Rabbi Yehuda did not say there, but in the joint domains of the Rabbis. But here, with a biblical sukkah - no.

hebrew_text: וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָכָא, אֶלָּא בְּסוּכָּה דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה. אֲבָל שַׁבָּת, דְּאִיסּוּר סְקִילָה — לָא.
human_translation: Nor does Rabbi Yosei hold in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as Rabbi Yosei states only here, with regard to a sukka , which is a positive mitzva. However, Shabbat, which is a prohibition stoning, no,
llm_translation: And not Rabbi Yosei holds like Rabbi Yehuda: Until here did not say Rabbi Yosei here, rather in a sukkah of a positive commandment. But Shabbat, of a prohibition of stoning - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, עַל פִּי מִי נַעֲשָׂה? לֹא עַל פִּי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֶלָּא עַל פִּי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And if you say: according to whose action that was taken in Tzippori performed, not according to Rabbi Yosei rather on the authority of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And if you will say: an incident that occurred in Tzipori, by whose authority was it done? Not by the authority of Rabbi Yosei, but by the authority of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מַעֲשֶׂה — דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: פַּעַם אַחַת שָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא הֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, לְמָחָר פֵּירְסוּ סְדִינִין עַל גַּבֵּי הָעַמּוּדִים, וְהֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְקָרְאוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: And what incident? When Rav Dimi came he said: One time they forgot and did not bring a Torah scroll on Shabbat eve The next day, they spread sheets on posts And they brought a Torah scroll and read from it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And what is the incident? — For when Rav Dimi came, he said: Once they forgot and did not bring a Torah scroll from before Shabbat, the next day they spread out linen cloths on the pillars, and they brought a Torah scroll and read from it."

hebrew_text: פֵּירְסוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? מֵהֵיכָן הֱבִיאוּם בְּשַׁבָּת! אֶלָּא, מָצְאוּ סְדִינִין פְּרוּסִין עַל גַּבֵּי הָעַמּוּדִים וְהֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְקָרְאוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind they spread From where did they bring on Shabbat? Rather, they found sheets spread on the posts, and they brought a Torah scroll and read from it.
llm_translation: Spread out the table of your knowledge? From where did they bring them on Shabbat! Rather, they found spread out sheets on the tops of the pillars and brought a Torah scroll and read from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: מַחְצֶלֶת אַרְבָּעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ — מַתֶּרֶת בְּסוּכָּה מִשּׁוּם דּוֹפֶן. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? תָּלֵי לֵיהּ בָּאֶמְצַע, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה לְמַטָּה וּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה לְמַעְלָה, וְכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Avimi said: A mat four handbreadths and a bit permit as a wall. How does one accomplish He suspends it in the middle less than three below and less than three above And any less than three is as if joined [ lavud ].
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Avimi: A partition of four handbreadths and its space — it is permitted in a sukkah because of a dovecoat. How does one make it? He hangs it in the middle, less than three handbreadths below and less than three handbreadths above, and any amount less than three is considered as if it were filled.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: חַד לָבוּד אָמְרִינַן, תְּרֵי לָבוּד לָא אָמְרִינַן — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. Lest you say we state lavud once we do not state twice teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Peshita? Mahu d'teima: Chad lavud amrinan, trei lavud la amrinan - ka mashma lan." English translation: "Is it obvious? What is the reasoning: If we say one is necessary, we do not say two are necessary - this implies to us."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מַחְצֶלֶת שִׁבְעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ מַתֶּרֶת בְּסוּכָּה מִשּׁוּם דּוֹפֶן. כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בְּסוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה. וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דִּמְשַׁלְשְׁלִין דְּפָנוֹת מִלְמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection A mat seven handbreadths and a bit permit as a wall. When that baraita was taught, it was with regard to a large sukka , And what does it teach us? that one lower walls from up downward, in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Challenger: a cucumber seven days old and it is permitted in a sukkah because of its thickness. For it was taught in a Baraita, in a large sukkah. And what does it indicate to us? That the walls may be slanted from above downward, like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: פַּס אַרְבָּעָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ — מַתִּיר בְּסוּכָּה מִשּׁוּם דּוֹפֶן. וּמוֹקֵים לֵיהּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים סָמוּךְ דּוֹפֶן, וְכׇל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַדּוֹפֶן כְּלָבוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: A board four and a bit permit of a sukka , as a wall, and one establishes it less than three from the wall. And any less than three is as if joined.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: If it is four handbreadths and a bit - it permits one in a sukkah because of a wall. And we establish it with less than three handbreadths adjacent to a wall, and any measurement less than three handbreadths adjacent to the wall is considered as if it were attached to the wall.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — שִׁיעוּר מֶשֶׁךְ סוּכָּה קְטַנָּה שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: What is he teaching us? He comes to teach us measure extension of a small sukka is seven
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? It is teaching us - the measurement of the length of a small sukkah is seven handbreadths.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הִרְחִיק אֶת הַסִּיכּוּךְ מִן הַדְּפָנוֹת שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: one distanced the roofing from the walls a distance of three handbreadths unfit,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "If one distances the plaster from the walls by three handbreadths - it is invalid."

hebrew_text: בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְחַת וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּיו — אִם יֵשׁ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל לַסִּיכּוּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: a house that was breached, and one roofed over if from the wall to the roofing there are four cubits it is an unfit
llm_translation: House that collapsed and plastered on its top - if there is from the wall to the plastering four cubits, invalid.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן חָצֵר שֶׁהִיא מוּקֶּפֶת אַכְסַדְרָה, סוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ — אִם יֵשׁ תַּחְתָּיו אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And likewise, a courtyard that is surrounded by a portico, a large sukka that was surrounded with material with which one not roof if there are four cubits beneath unfit.
llm_translation: And so too, a courtyard that is surrounded by a balcony, a large sukkah that they surrounded with something that does not provide shade - if there are four cubits beneath it, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כׇּל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְחַת — מִשּׁוּם דְּהָנֵי מְחִיצוֹת לְבַיִת עֲבִידָן. אֲבָל חָצֵר הַמּוּקֶּפֶת אַכְסַדְרָה, דִּמְחִיצוֹת לָאו לְאַכְסַדְרָה עֲבִידִי — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: Why do I need all these necessary as, if taught us the house that was breached, because those walls were established for the house. However, a courtyard surrounded by a portico, walls were established not for the portico say no, necessary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Why do I need all these? The answer is: for if we were to hear of a house that collapsed - it is because these partitions were made for the house. But a courtyard surrounded by a fence, where the partitions are not made for the courtyard - one might say no, it is necessary." I hope this translation is helpful to you.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, מִשּׁוּם דִּסְכָכָן סְכָךְ כָּשֵׁר הוּא, אֲבָל סוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בּוֹ, דִּסְכָכָהּ סְכָךְ פָּסוּל הוּא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us these two because their roofing is fit roofing, However, a large sukka that was surrounded with material with which one not roof roofing is unfit say no, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two, because it is a valid covering, but a large sukkah that they surrounded with something that is not used for covering, its covering is invalid - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: אֲוִיר פּוֹסֵל בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, סְכָךְ פָּסוּל פּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Rabba said: I found the Sages of the school of Rav, who were sitting and saying Space renders unfit with three unfit roofing renders unfit with four
llm_translation: Rabah said: I found them, the scholars of the house of Rav, sitting and saying: A roof invalidates with three, and a covering invalidates with four.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: אֲוִיר דְּפוֹסֵל בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְנָא לְכוּ — דִּתְנַן: הִרְחִיק אֶת הַסִּיכּוּךְ מִן הַדְּפָנוֹת שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה. סְכָךְ פָּסוּל נָמֵי לָא לִיפְסֹיל אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דִּתְנַן: בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְחַת וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּיו, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּין הַסִּיכּוּךְ לַכּוֹתֶל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — פְּסוּלָה!
human_translation: And I said to them: From where you space renders unfit three as we learned one distanced the roofing from the walls at a distance of three handbreadths, unfit. also unfit roofing, let it render unfit only four cubits, as we learned a house that was breached and one roofed over if from the wall to the roofing there is four cubits unfit.
llm_translation: I would say to them: The air that disqualifies with three Mana for you - as we learned: If one removed the covering from the walls by three handbreadths - it is invalid. A covering that is invalid is not disqualified except with four cubits, as we learned: A house that collapsed and one covered it, if there is between the covering and the wall four cubits - it is invalid!

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרוּ לִי: בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא, דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מִשּׁוּם דּוֹפֶן עֲקוּמָּה נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: And they said to me: apart from this as both Rav and Shmuel said that touched upon
llm_translation: And they said to me: "Son of heresy of that, that Rav and Shmuel both said: because a bent threshold they touched it."

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: מָה אִילּוּ אִיכָּא סְכָךְ פָּסוּל פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה וַאֲוִיר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה מַאי? כְּשֵׁרָה. מַלְּיֵיהּ בְּשַׁפּוּדִין מַאי — פְּסוּלָה, וְלֹא יְהֵא אֲוִיר הַפּוֹסֵל בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה כִּסְכָךְ פָּסוּל הַפּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבָּעָה!
human_translation: And I said to them: What if is less than four unfit roofing and space less than three what fit, filled with skewers, what unfit, But shouldn’t space, which renders unfit with three be as unfit roofing, which renders unfit with four
llm_translation: I would say to them: What if there is a sukkah that has invalid schach less than four handbreadths high and airspace less than three handbreadths high, what is the ruling? It is valid. What if one fills it with shpudin, what is the ruling? It is invalid, and the airspace that invalidates must be at least three handbreadths high, just as the schach that invalidates must be at least four handbreadths high!

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרוּ לִי: אִי הָכִי, לְדִידָךְ נָמֵי דְּאָמְרַתְּ סְכָךְ פָּסוּל פּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מָה אִילּוּ אִיכָּא סְכָךְ פָּסוּל פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וַאֲוִיר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, מַאי? כְּשֵׁרָה. מַלְּיֵיהּ בְּשַׁפּוּדִין מַאי — פְּסוּלָה. לֹא יְהֵא אֲוִיר הַפּוֹסֵל בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה כִּסְכָךְ פָּסוּל הַפּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת!
human_translation: And they said to me: If so, according to you, who said unfit roofing renders unfit with four cubits Just as, if there were less than four cubits of unfit roofing and space less than three what fit. filled with skewers, unfit. Shouldn’t space, which renders unfit with three be as unfit roofing, which renders unfit with four cubits
llm_translation: And they said to me: If so, according to your opinion, since you said that a skylight that is invalid invalidates within four cubits, what if there is an invalid skylight less than four cubits and the airspace less than three cubits, what is the ruling? It is valid. What if one fills it with shavings? It is invalid. The airspace that invalidates within three cubits should not be like a skylight that invalidates within four cubits!

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: הַאי מַאי? בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת —
human_translation: And I said to them: What is this Granted, according to that I say four cubits,
llm_translation: And I say to them: What is this? Granted, according to my opinion, I say four cubits —

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם שִׁיעוּרָא וְלָאו שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא. הַאי לָאו שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא שָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי — לָא מִצְטָרְפִי.
human_translation: on the basis the measure or not the measure. this not the measure since their measures are not equal they do not combine
llm_translation: Due to measurement and not measurement it is. This not measurement it is, since not equal measurements to each other - do not combine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ דְּאָמְרִיתוּ שִׁיעוּר מִשּׁוּם הַפְלָגָה — מָה לִי אִיתַּפְלַג בִּסְכָךְ פָּסוּל, מָה לִי אִתַּפְלַג בִּסְכָךְ פָּסוּל וַאֲוִיר.
human_translation: However, according to you, who say due to distance what to me if it was distanced due to unfit roofing, what to me if it was distanced due to unfit roofing and space?
llm_translation: Rather, according to our opinion, for you have said that the measurement is due to the division - why do I need to divide in a sukkah that is invalid, why do I need to divide in a sukkah that is invalid and open.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּלְמָר נָמֵי, נְהִי דְּלָא שָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ בְּסוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה, בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה מִי לָא שָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Abaye said to And according to Master, too, although their measures are not equal in a large sukka , in a small sukka aren’t their measures equal?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And for Mar the same, isn't it that they did not equalize their measurements in a large sukkah, in a small sukkah who did not equalize their measurements?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּשָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי הוּא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לְשִׁיעוּרָא דְסוּכָּה הוּא.
human_translation: said to him: There, not due to that their measures are equal. Rather, due to that the sukka lacks the measure
llm_translation: He said to him: There, it is not because their measurements are equal to Hadadei, but because it does not have the measurement of a sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּלָא שָׁווּ שִׁיעוּרַיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי לָא מִצְטָרְפִי? וְהָתְנַן: הַבֶּגֶד שְׁלֹשָׁה עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה, הַשַּׂק אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה, הָעוֹר חֲמִשָּׁה עַל חֲמִשָּׁה, מַפָּץ שִׁשָּׁה עַל שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: And anywhere that their measures are not equal, do they not combine But didn’t we learn The garment three by three and the sackcloth four by four and the hide five by five; a mat six by six?
llm_translation: And all cases where their measurements are not equal do not combine? And we learned in a Mishnah: A garment of three by three, a sack of four by four, leather of five by five, a mat of six by six.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: הַבֶּגֶד וְהַשַּׂק, הַשַּׂק וְהָעוֹר, הָעוֹר וְהַמַּפָּץ — מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: And is taught concerning The garment and the sackcloth, the sackcloth and the hide, the hide and the mat join together with one another.
llm_translation: And he taught about it: the garment and the sack, the sack and the skin, the skin and the mat, they combine with each other.

hebrew_text: הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם — הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְטַמֵּא מוֹשָׁב. כְּדִתְנַן: הַמְקַצֵּעַ מִכּוּלָּן טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח — טָמֵא.
human_translation: There, it is as the reason is taught Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason since are fit to become ritually impure a seat  As we learned one who trims of any of handbreadth by handbreadth, is ritually impure.
llm_translation: There, as it is taught the reason, Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason - since it is fitting to become impure from sitting. As we learned: One who cuts from all of them a handbreadth upon a handbreadth - is impure.

hebrew_text: טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח לְמַאי חֲזֵי? וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי (לִיטְּלוֹ) עַל גַּבֵּי הַחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: For what is handbreadth by handbreadth fit? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: Since it is suitable for a patch on a donkey’s
llm_translation: A handbreadth upon a handbreadth, for what purpose is it seen? And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: Since it is fitting (to place it) upon the back of a donkey.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא אָמְרִי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּהַאי לִישָּׁנָא. בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא מַתְנוּ: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: סְכָךְ פָּסוּל בָּאֶמְצַע — פּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבָּעָה. מִן הַצַּד — פּוֹסֵל בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְרַב אָמַר: בֵּין מִן הַצַּד בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע — בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: In Sura, they stated this halakha in that language In Neharde’a, they taught Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Unfit roofing in the center renders unfit with four Along the side it renders unfit with four cubits And Rav said: Both along the side and in the center, with four cubits
llm_translation: In Sura they said regarding this matter. In Nehardea it was taught: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If the sukkah is invalid in the middle - it invalidates in four directions. From the side - it invalidates in four cubits. And Rav said: Whether from the side or in the middle - in four cubits.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נָתַן עָלֶיהָ נֶסֶר שֶׁהוּא רָחָב אַרְבָּעָה טְפָחִים — כְּשֵׁרָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב דְּאָמַר בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע בֵּין מִן הַצַּד בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי כְּשֵׁרָה. אֶלָּא שְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר בָּאֶמְצַע בְּאַרְבָּעָה — אַמַּאי כְּשֵׁרָה? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: We learned If one placed a board that is four handbreadths wide atop is fit. Granted, according to Rav, who said both along the side and in the center, with four cubits due to that is fit. However, according to Shmuel, who said in the center with four why is fit? With what are we dealing here? along the side;
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one placed a beam upon it that is four handbreadths wide - it is valid. According to Rav who said whether in the middle or on the side, in four cubits, for this reason it is valid. But Shmuel who said in the middle in four cubits - why is it valid? Here we are dealing with what? - on the side.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי סְדִינִין — מִצְטָרְפִין. שְׁנֵי נְסָרִים — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נְסָרִים כִּסְדִינִין.
human_translation: Come hear: Two sheets join together two boards do not combine Rabbi Meir says: Even boards as sheets,
llm_translation: Come and hear: two linen garments - combine. Two woolen garments - do not combine. Rabbi Meir says: Woolen garments are like linen garments.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רַב בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע בֵּין מִן הַצַּד בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אֶלָּא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רַב בָּאֶמְצַע בְּאַרְבָּעָה, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאִית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, לְמָה לְהוּ אִצְטְרוֹפֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, קַנְיָא בְּעָלְמָא נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: Granted, according to that version that Rav said: Both along the side and in the center, with four cubits what join together? join together to four cubits. However, according to this version in which Rav said: with four what are the circumstances? If has four why must they join together does not have four why they are merely reeds?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, to strike the wall, as Rav said, whether in the middle or from the side, within four cubits, what is the meaning of "they combine"? They combine within four cubits. Rather, to strike the wall, as Rav said, in the middle within four, what is the case? If there are four within it, why do they combine? If there are not four within it, are they merely a reed?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִית בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה, וּמַאי ״מִצְטָרְפִין״ — מִצְטָרְפִין לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: Actually, where has four and what join together? they join together to four cubits along the side.
llm_translation: Always that there are four, and what is "combine" - they combine to four cubits from the side.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: סִכְּכָהּ בִּנְסָרִין שֶׁל אֶרֶז שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה. אֵין בָּהֶן אַרְבָּעָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Come hear one roofed with cedar beams that have four their everyone agrees unfit. they do not have four their Rabbi Meir deems unfit and Rabbi Yehuda deems it fit.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one roofed it with cedar branches that contain four branches, all agree that it is invalid. If they do not contain four branches, Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda declares it valid.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר שֶׁאִם יֵשׁ בֵּין נֶסֶר לְנֶסֶר כִּמְלֹא נֶסֶר — שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ פְּסָל בֵּינֵיהֶם וּכְשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir concedes that if between board board complete of a board, one places waste and is fit.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir concedes that if there is between one eagle to another eagle like the volume of an eagle - he places a disqualified object between them and it is valid.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע בֵּין מִן הַצַּד בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי כְּשֵׁרָה. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּאֶמְצַע בְּאַרְבָּעָה, אַמַּאי כְּשֵׁרָה?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said: Both along the side and in the center with four cubits due to that fit, However, according to the one who said with four in the center, why fit?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says whether in the middle or on the side, in four cubits - for this reason it is valid. But according to the one who says in the middle in four cubits, why is it valid?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָכָא בְּסוּכָּה דְּלָא הָוְיָא אֶלָּא שְׁמֹנֶה מְצוּמְצָמוֹת עָסְקִינַן, וְיָהֵיב נֶסֶר וּפְסָל וְנֶסֶר וּפְסָל וְנֶסֶר וּפְסָל מֵהַאי גִּיסָא, וְנֶסֶר וּפְסָל וְנֶסֶר וּפְסָל וְנֶסֶר וּפְסָל מֵהַאי גִּיסָא,
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Here, we are dealing with a sukka that is exactly eight And he places board and waste, and board and waste, and a board and waste, from this side, And a beam and waste, a beam and waste, and a beam and waste, from that side,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Here in a sukkah that was only eight handbreadths wide, we were dealing, and he placed a beam and an invalid beam, and a beam and an invalid beam, and a beam and an invalid beam from this side, and a beam and an invalid beam, and a beam and an invalid beam, and a beam and an invalid beam from this side.

hebrew_text: דְּהָווּ לְהוּ שְׁנֵי פְסָלִין בָּאֶמְצַע, וְאִיכָּא הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: that has two waste in the middle there is fitness of a sukka in the middle,
llm_translation: There were two idols in the middle, and there was a valid sukkah in the middle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲוִיר שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּסוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה וּמִיעֲטוֹ, בֵּין בְּקָנִים בֵּין בְּשַׁפּוּדִין — הָוֵי מִיעוּט. בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה, בְּקָנִים — הָוֵי מִיעוּט, בְּשַׁפּוּדִין — לָא הָוֵי מִיעוּט.
human_translation: Abaye said: space three in a large sukka , and one diminished whether with branches, whether with skewers, it is diminution, in a small sukka , with branches it is diminution; with skewers, it is not diminution
llm_translation: Abaye said: If the airspace is three handbreadths in a large sukkah and its roof is sparse, whether with beams or with boards — it is considered sparse. In a small sukkah, with beams — it is considered sparse, with boards — it is not considered sparse.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי מִן הַצַּד. אֲבָל בָּאֶמְצַע — פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: יֵשׁ לָבוּד בָּאֶמְצַע, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין לָבוּד בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: And this applies only along the side However, in the center Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree One said: lavud is in the center And one said: lavud is not in the center
llm_translation: These are the words from the side. But in the middle - Rav Acha and Ravina disagree about it, one says: there is a connection in the middle, and one says: there is no connection in the middle.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לָבוּד בָּאֶמְצַע — דְּתַנְיָא: קוֹרָה הַיּוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאֵינָהּ נוֹגַעַת בְּכוֹתֶל אַחֵר, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי קוֹרוֹת, אַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל אַחֵר וְאֵינָן נוֹגְעוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ — פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת. שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the one who said: lavud is in the center as it is taught beam that projects from this wall but does not touch the other wall, and similarly, two beams, one projecting from this wall and one projecting from the other wall and they do not touch each other, less than three one need not bring another beam three one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the one who says there is a separation in the middle? For it was taught: A beam that extends from this wall and does not touch another wall, and similarly two beams, one extending from this wall and one from another wall, and they do not touch each other - if less than three, there is no need to bring another beam. If three, one must bring another beam.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ — שָׁאנֵי קוֹרוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the other beams are different by rabbinic
llm_translation: And the other one - the opinions of the sages differ.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין לָבוּד בָּאֶמְצַע — דִּתְנַן: אֲרוּבָּה שֶׁבַּבַּיִת וּבָהּ פּוֹתֵחַ טֶפַח, טוּמְאָה בַּבַּיִת — כּוּלּוֹ טָמֵא, מַה שֶּׁכְּנֶגֶד אֲרוּבָּה — טָהוֹר. טוּמְאָה כְּנֶגֶד אֲרוּבָּה — כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: What is the reason of the one who said: lavud does not in the center? as we learned a skylight in the house whose opening is one handbreadth, ritual impurity inside the house, the entire ritually impure, that are opposite the skylight are ritually pure, ritual impurity aligned with the skylight, the entire house are ritually pure,
llm_translation: What is the reason for the opinion that there is no lavud in the middle? For it was taught: If the courtyard of the house has a breach of one handbreadth, and it is impure inside the house, the entire courtyard is impure; but that which is opposite the courtyard is pure. If the impurity is opposite the courtyard, the entire house is pure.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּאֲרוּבָּה פּוֹתֵחַ טֶפַח, טוּמְאָה בַּבַּיִת — כְּנֶגֶד אֲרוּבָּה, טָהוֹר. טוּמְאָה כְּנֶגֶד אֲרוּבָּה — כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: If the skylight does not have a square handbreadth there is ritual impurity in the house, opposite the skylight ritually pure. ritual impurity is aligned with the skylight, the entire house are ritually pure.
llm_translation: In the pit does not open a handbreadth, impure in the house - opposite the pit, pure. Impure opposite the pit - the entire house is pure.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? שָׁאנֵי הִלְכוֹת טוּמְאָה דְּהָכִי גְּמִירִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: And the other The halakhot of ritual impurity are different, as that they learned them
llm_translation: And the other? The laws of impurity are different in that they are learned for him.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִלְעַאי: בַּיִת שֶׁנִּפְחַת וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבָּיו — כְּשֵׁרָה. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רַבִּי, פָּרֵישׁ, כָּךְ פֵּירַשׁ אַבָּא: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת פְּסוּלָה, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai taught: A house that was breached and one roofed over it fit Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: My teacher, explain this is how father explained four cubits unfit. less than four cubits, fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai expounded: A house that has a roof and you plaster it over - it is valid. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose, said before him: Rabbi, explain it as Abba explained: If it is less than four cubits, it is invalid; if it is four cubits or more, it is valid.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִלְעַאי: אַבְרוּמָא שַׁרְיָא. אֲמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: רַבִּי, פָּרֵישׁ, כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא: שֶׁל מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי — אֲסוּרָה, שֶׁל מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי — מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai taught: abramis [ avroma ], permitted Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: My teacher, explain this is how father explained it: of place so-and-so, prohibited; of place so-and-so, permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai expounded: Avruma Sharya. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said before him: Rabbi, it was taught as follows by Abba: That of a certain place is forbidden, that of a certain place is permitted.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי צַחַנְתָּא דְּבָב נַהֲרָא שַׁרְיָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּרְדִיפִי מַיָּא, וְהַאי דָּג טָמֵא כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ חוּט הַשִּׁדְרָה לָא מָצֵי קָאֵים — וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּקָאֵי!
human_translation: similar that which Abaye said: These small fish [ tzaḥanta ] of the Bav River are permitted. What is the reason If we say due to that the water flows rapidly, and these non-kosher fish, since they do not have a spinal cord, are not able to exist Don’t we see that exist
llm_translation: The text reads: "For Abaye said: This fish of the river Bab is permitted. What is the reason? Firstly, because it is pursued by water, and this impure fish, since it does not have a thread of the spinal cord, cannot stand – yet we see that it stands!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּמְלִיחִי מַיָּא, וְהַאי דָּג טָמֵא, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ קִילְפֵי לָא מָצֵי קָאֵי — וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּקָאֵי! אֶלָּא: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְרַבֵּה טִינַיְיהוּ דָּג טָמֵא. אֲמַר רָבִינָא: וְהָאִידָּנָא, דְּשָׁפְכִי נְהַר אֵיתָן וּנְהַר גַּמְדָּא לְהָתָם, אֲסִירָא.
human_translation: Rather, because the water is salty, and these non-kosher fish are not able to exist because they do not have scales. don’t we see that exist Rather, because the mud in that is not non-kosher fish to reproduce. Ravina said: And today, since Eitan River and Gamda River spill into prohibited
llm_translation: Rather, because it is diluted water, and this fish is impure, since it does not have scales, it is not standing on its fins — but we see that it is standing! Rather, because one should not increase the number of impure fish. Ravina said: And now, that the rivers Etan and Gamda flow there, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי אַכְסַדְרָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ פַּצִּימִין — כְּשֵׁרָה. שֶׁאֵין לָהּ פַּצִּימִין, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, וְרָבָא אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר כְּשֵׁרָה —
human_translation: It was stated If one roofed a portico that has posts fit. that does not have posts Abaye said: fit, Rava said: unfit. Abaye said: fit,
llm_translation: It was stated: If one placed a vessel on top of a bench that has pegs — it is valid. If it does not have pegs, Abbaye said: it is valid, and Rava said: it is invalid. Abbaye said: it is valid —

hebrew_text: אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. רָבָא אָמַר פְּסוּלָה — לָא אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: we say the edge of the roof descends and seals Rava said: unfit, we do not say the edge of the roof descends and seals.
llm_translation: We say: "The mouth of the roof descends and seals." Rava said: "It is invalid" - we do not say: "The mouth of the roof descends and seals."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אַבָּיֵי, לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם, אֲפִילּוּ הִפְחִית דּוֹפֶן אֶמְצָעִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ בְּהָהִיא, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּמָבוֹי הַמְפוּלָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rava said to Abaye: According to you, who said: The edge of the roof descends and seals even if one removed the middle wall, said to him: I concede to you in that as it is like an open alleyway,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Abaye, according to your opinion that you said, "The mouth that reads descends and closes, even if you have reduced the middle bar!" He said to him: We agree with you in that case, where it is like an open alleyway.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאִתְּמַר: אַכְסַדְרָה בְּבִקְעָה, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְטַלְטֵל בְּכוּלּוֹ, דְּאָמְרִינַן פִּי תִּקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם.
human_translation: The Gemara suggests: Let us say Abaye and Rava disagree with regard to in the dispute of Rav and Shmuel; As it was stated: a portico, in a field, Rav said: It is permitted to move throughout the entire as we say the edge of the roof descends and seals And Shmuel said: One may move in only within four as we do not say the edge of the roof descends and seals
llm_translation: Let Abaye and Rava argue in the dispute of Rav and Shmuel. For it was stated: A skylight in a valley, Rav said: It is permitted to move it in its entirety, as we say, "The mouth of the roof descends and closes." And Shmuel said: One may only move it within four cubits, for we do not say, "The mouth of the roof descends and closes."

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: According to of Shmuel, everyone, agrees
llm_translation: In the school of Shmuel, everyone agrees.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב. אַבָּיֵי כְּרַב, וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: עַד כָּאן לָא אָמַר רַב הָתָם אֶלָּא דִּמְחִיצוֹת לְאַכְסַדְרָה הוּא דַּעֲבִידִי, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָאו לְהָכִי עֲבִידִי, לָא.
human_translation: When they disagree according to Rav. Abaye in accordance with Rav: And Rava said to you: Rav stated only there, the partitions are established for the portico. However, here, where are not established for the no,
llm_translation: When they argued in the study hall of Rav, Abbaye sided with Rav, while Rava said to you: Until here Rav did not say that, only regarding partitions for a balcony does he make it, but here where he does not do so, he does not.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכֵן חָצֵר הַמּוּקֶּפֶת אַכְסַדְרָה. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא פִּי תִקְרָה יוֹרֵד וְסוֹתֵם!
human_translation: We learned a courtyard that is surrounded by a portico, And why Let us say the edge of the roof descends and seals,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: And similarly, a courtyard that is surrounded by a balcony. And why is this so? Say: The mouth of the roof descends and closes!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רָבָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁהִשְׁוָה אֶת קֵירוּיוֹ.
human_translation: Rava interpreted in accordance with Abaye: where one equalized its roofing,
llm_translation: Rava translated it in the house of Abaye: when he equalized his beams.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא מַתְנִי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּהַאי לִישָּׁנָא. בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא מַתְנִי: סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי אַכְסַדְרָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ פַּצִּימִין, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פְּסוּלָה. יֵשׁ לָהּ פַּצִּימִין, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, רָבָא אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר כְּשֵׁרָה — אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד. רָבָא אָמַר פְּסוּלָה — לָא אָמְרִינַן לָבוּד. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: In Sura, they teach this halakha in that language In Pumbedita they teach If one roofed a portico that does not have posts everyone agrees unfit. that has posts Abaye said: fit, Rava said: unfit. Abaye said: fit, we say lavud Rava said: unfit, we do not say lavud And the halakha in accordance with the first version.
llm_translation: In Surah, it was taught regarding that matter in this case. In Pumbedita, it was taught: Place it on top of a bench that does not have crossbars, everyone agrees it is invalid. If it has crossbars, Abbaye said: it is valid, Rava said: it is invalid. Abbaye said it is valid - we say it is established. Rava said it is invalid - we do not say it is established. And the halakha is in accordance with the first opinion.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דְּקָא מְסַכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי אַכְסַדְרָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ פַּצִּימִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר מָר הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: יֵשׁ לָהּ פַּצִּימִין כְּשֵׁרָה, אֵין לָהּ פַּצִּימִין פְּסוּלָה! אַחְוִי לֵיהּ, נִרְאֶה מִבִּפְנִים וְשָׁוֶה מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi found Rav Kahana, who was placing roofing atop a portico that did not have posts. He said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold that which Rava said: it has posts, fit; it does not have posts unfit? showed him was visible from the inside and even from the outside.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe found Rav Kahana who was covering a skylight that does not have bars. He said to him: Does the Master not hold like what Rava said: If it has bars, it is valid; if it does not have bars, it is invalid! He answered him, "It appears from the inside and is equal from the outside."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Alternatively, was visible from the outside and even from the inside.
llm_translation: If so, it appears from the outside and is equal from within.

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּמַר: נִרְאֶה מִבַּחוּץ וְשָׁוֶה מִבִּפְנִים, נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם לֶחִי. וְלֶחִי הַיְינוּ פַּצִּימִין.
human_translation: as it was stated visible from outside but even on the inside status post, And post are that posts
llm_translation: It was stated: If it appears from the outside and is equal from the inside, it is judged due to the cheek. And "cheek" refers to the flanks.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: פְּסָל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַסּוּכָּה — נִידּוֹן כַּסּוּכָּה. מַאי פְּסָל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַסּוּכָּה? אָמַר עוּלָּא: קָנִים הַיּוֹצְאִים לַאֲחוֹרֵי סוּכָּה.
human_translation: It was taught waste that extend from the sukka status like the sukka . What is Waste that extend from the sukka ? Ulla said: Branches that extend behind the sukka
llm_translation: Mishna: A disqualified Sukkah - is judged as a Sukkah. What is a disqualified Sukkah that emerges from the Sukkah? Ulla said: reeds that emerge behind the Sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בָּעֵינַן שָׁלֹשׁ דְּפָנוֹת! בִּדְאִיכָּא. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה! בִּדְאִיכָּא. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן צִלָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ! בִּדְאִיכָּא.
human_translation: But don’t we require three walls where there are But don’t we require fitness of a sukka ? where there is But don’t we require its shade exceeds its sunlight? where there is
llm_translation: And this, we require three walls! In what case? And this, we require a valid sukkah! In what case? And this, we require its shade to be greater than its sunlight! In what case?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וּלְגַוַּואי עֲבִידִי וּלְבָרַאי לָא עֲבִידִי — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, what to state Lest you say since, these were established for inside but not for outside say no, teaches us
llm_translation: So what is there to say? What might one say? If you were to suggest: "Since it is done for my benefit and not for the benefit of the Creator, let me not do it," I would say, no, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: הָכָא בְּקָנִים הַיּוֹצְאִים לִפְנִים מִן הַסּוּכָּה, וּמָשְׁכָא וְאָזְלָא חֲדָא דּוֹפֶן בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָא לֵית בַּהּ הֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say Here, with branches that extend before the front of the sukka , and one of the side walls extends together with Lest you say does not have fitness of a sukka , teaches us
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef said together: Here, with regards to reeds that protrude inward from the sukkah, and one bends and goes in between them. What might you say? There is no valid sukkah here, it seems to us.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְסוּכָּה שֶׁרוּבָּהּ צִלָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ, וּמִעוּטָהּ חֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מְצִלָּתָהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: תִּפְּסַל בְּהָךְ פּוּרְתָּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וּמַאי יוֹצֵא — יוֹצֵא מֵהֶכְשֵׁר סוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: was needed only to its majority its shade exceeds its sunlight, and its minority its sunlight exceeds its shade. Lest you say should be rendered unfit due to that little therefore, teaches us what extends extends fitness of a sukka .
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Only a sukkah is needed whose shade is greater than its sunlight, and its small amount of sunlight is greater than its shade. What might you say: it invalidates with that beam, it teaches us. And what is the outcome - it invalidates the kashering of the sukkah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לִסְכָךְ פָּסוּל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה. וּמַאי ״יוֹצֵא״ — יוֹצֵא מִתּוֹרַת סוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: was needed only to unfit roofing less than three in a small sukka . what extends extends status of sukka ;
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: Only needed to cover invalid less than three, in a small sukkah. And what is "leaving" - leaving from the law of sukkah.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: לֹא יְהֵא אֶלָּא אֲוִיר, וַאֲוִיר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים בְּסוּכָּה קְטַנָּה מִי פָּסֵיל?
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya strongly objects to this: Let be only as space. And does space less than three handbreadths in a small sukka render unfit?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Hoshaya objects to her: Should it not be only air, and is air less than three handbreadths in a small sukkah invalid?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: זֶה מִצְטָרֵף וִישֵׁנִים תַּחְתָּיו, וְזֶה מִצְטָרֵף וְאֵין יְשֵׁנִים תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to him: This combines And one sleep beneath it, that combines one not sleep beneath it,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Abba: this one joins and there are those who sleep beneath him, and this one joins and there are no those who sleep beneath him.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִצְטְרוֹפֵי מִצְטָרֵף וְהוּא עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ כָּשֵׁר? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְיָשִׁב: אִין,
human_translation: Is there any item that combines but itself is not fit? Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elyashiv said: Yes,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is there a case where when it is joined, it is joined, but it itself is not valid? Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elyashiv said: No."

hebrew_text: טִיט הַנָּרוֹק יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁמִּצְטָרֵף לְאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וְהַטּוֹבֵל בּוֹ — לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה.
human_translation: mortar that is poured proves as, it combines with water to complete the forty se’a to But, one who immerses in immersion does not fulfill his
llm_translation: Mud that is squeezed will prove, that it combines with forty se'ah, and one who immerses in it — immersion has not ascended for him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ כְּמִין צְרִיף, אוֹ שֶׁסְּמָכָהּ לְכוֹתֶל — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פּוֹסֵל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ גַּג, וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: One who establishes his sukka like a type of circular hut, or who rested against the wall, Rabbi Eliezer deems it unfit because it does not have a roof, and the Rabbis deem it fit;
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who makes his sukkah like a type of sieve, or leans it against a wall — Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it because it lacks a roof, while the Sages deem it valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁאִם הִגְבִּיהָהּ מִן הַקַּרְקַע טֶפַח, אוֹ שֶׁהִפְלִיגָהּ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל טֶפַח — שֶׁהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer concedes that if one lifted off the ground at least handbreadth, or if one distanced one handbreadth from the wall,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tana: Rabbi Eliezer concedes that if he raised it from the ground a handbreadth, or if he distanced it from the wall a handbreadth - it is valid."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? שִׁיפּוּעֵי אֹהָלִים כְּאֹהָלִים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the Rabbis, the incline of a tent is like a tent.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? The joining together of the curtains is like the curtains themselves.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּקָא גָּנֵי בְּכִילַּת חֲתָנִים בַּסּוּכָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? שָׁבְקַתְּ רַבָּנַן וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר!
human_translation: Abaye found Rav Yosef, who was sleeping inside bridal canopy, inside a sukka . said to him: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, Did you abandon Rabbis, and act in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer?
llm_translation: Abaye found Rav Yosef that he was stealing in the bridal chamber in the sukkah. He said to him: "Who are you like - like Rabbi Eliezer? You have left the Rabbis and acted like Rabbi Eliezer!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, בָּרַיְיתָא אִיפְּכָא תָּנֵי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מַכְשִׁיר וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִין. שָׁבְקַתְּ מַתְנִיתִין וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּבָרַיְיתָא?
human_translation: said to him: baraita , the opposite is taught. Rabbi Eliezer deems it fit and the Rabbis deem it unfit. Did you abandon the mishna, and act in accordance with a baraita ,
llm_translation: He said to him, a braita contradicts it: Rabbi Eliezer permits and the sages disqualify. You have abandoned the mishna and followed the braita?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַתְנִיתִין יְחִידָאָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ כְּמִין צְרִיף אוֹ שֶׁסְּמָכָהּ לְכוֹתֶל, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פּוֹסֵל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ גַּג, וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: said to him: the mishna is an individual as it is taught One who establishes his sukka like a type of circular hut or rests against the wall, Rabbi Natan says Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit because it does not have a roof, and the Rabbis deem it fit.
llm_translation: He said to him: "It is a singular teaching." As it was taught: "One who makes his sukkah like a type of sieve or leans it against a wall, Rabbi Natan says: Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it because it does not have a roof, and the Sages deem it valid."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַחְצֶלֶת קָנִים גְּדוֹלָה, עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה, וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. לְסִיכּוּךְ — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, וְאֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַחַת קְטַנָּה וְאַחַת גְּדוֹלָה, עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, לְסִיכּוּךְ — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, וְאֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: a large mat of reeds, one produced it for lying it is susceptible to ritual impurity and one not roof with it. for roofing, one roof with it, and it is not susceptible to ritual impurity, Rabbi Eliezer says both a small and a large one produced it for lying it is susceptible to ritual impurity and one not roof with it. for roofing, one roof with it, and it is not susceptible to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A large mat made of reeds, if one made it for lying upon - it contracts impurity, and one does not spread it over a corpse. If made for covering - one spreads it over a corpse, and it does not contract impurity. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whether small or large, if one made it for lying upon - it contracts impurity and one does not spread it over a corpse. If made for covering - one spreads it over a corpse, and it does not contract impurity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא. אָמְרַתְּ: עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה, הָא סְתָמָא — לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: This itself difficult, you said: If one produced it for lying it is susceptible to ritual impurity and one not roof with it. reason one produced it for lying without designation for roofing,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, ha gufah kashya. Amrata: asa'ah lishkivah - mekabelet tum'ah ve'ein mesakkchin bah. Ta'ama de'asa'ah lishkivah, ha setama - l'sichuch. English translation: The Gemara: this body is difficult. You said: if it was made for lying down - it accepts impurity and we do not cover it. The reason for if it was made for lying down, this is a general principle - for covering.

hebrew_text: וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: לְסִיכּוּךְ מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ וְאֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה, טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ, הָא סְתָמָא — לִשְׁכִיבָה!
human_translation: And then it is taught for roofing, one roof and it is not susceptible to ritual impurity. reason one produced it for roofing. without designation for lying
llm_translation: And return, it was taught: For the purpose of covering, they cover it, and it does not accept impurity, the reason being that it was made for covering. This is a general principle - for lying down!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּגְדוֹלָה, כָּאן בִּקְטַנָּה.
human_translation: This not difficult. Here, to a large There, to a small
llm_translation: Talmudic text: This is not difficult: here in the case of the adult, here in the case of the minor.

hebrew_text: (בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קַשְׁיָא, דִּתְנַן:) רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַחַת קְטַנָּה וְאַחַת גְּדוֹלָה, עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה, הָא סְתָמָא — לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the Rabbis not difficult; However, according to Rabbi Eliezer, difficult, as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: both a small and a large one produced it for lying it is susceptible to ritual impurity and one not roof with it. reason one produced it for lying without designation for roofing,
llm_translation: In truth, it is not difficult for the Rabbis, rather it is difficult for Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: If one made one bed small and one bed large, for lying on it - it receives impurity and one does not cover it. The reason that if one made it for lying on it, this is a general principle - for covering.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: עֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ וְאֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה. טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ, הָא סְתָמָא — לִשְׁכִיבָה!
human_translation: say the latter clause for roofing, one roof with it and it is not susceptible to ritual impurity, reason one produced it for roofing. without designation for lying
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima seifa: asa'ah l'sichuch - mesakkchin bah v'einah mekabelet tum'ah. Ta'ama d'asa'ah l'sichuch, ha setama - lishkivah! English translation: Say the latter clause: if one made it for roofing - we may spread it over it, and it does not receive impurity. The reason for making it for roofing, this is the default assumption - for lying down!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בִּגְדוֹלָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּסְתָמָא לְסִיכּוּךְ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּקְטַנָּה. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סְתָם קְטַנָּה לִשְׁכִיבָה, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: סְתָם קְטַנָּה נָמֵי לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: With regard to a large everyone agrees that without designation, for roofing. Where they disagree, is with regard to a small The first tanna holds a small without designation for lying and Rabbi Eliezer holds a small without designation also for roofing.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In the case of a large vessel, everyone agrees that it is intended for soaking. The disagreement arises when discussing a small vessel. The first Tanna holds: A small vessel is intended for lying in it, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: A small vessel is also intended for soaking.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מַחְצֶלֶת הַקָּנִים גְּדוֹלָה, עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה — מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה, וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה, הָא סְתָמָא — נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ, מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. (קְטַנָּה, עֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. טַעְמָא דַּעֲשָׂאָהּ לְסִיכּוּךְ, הָא סְתָמָא — נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה, וְאֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ). וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר: אַחַת קְטַנָּה וְאַחַת גְּדוֹלָה, סְתָמָא — כְּשֵׁרָה לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: And this is what is saying: a large mat of reeds, one produced it for lying it is susceptible to ritual impurity, and one not roof with it. reason one produced it for lying without designation becomes as produced for roofing, roof with it. a small mat of reeds, one produced it for roofing, one roof with it. reason one produced it for roofing; without designation becomes as produced for lying and not roof with it. And Rabbi Eliezer comes to say both a small and a large without designation fit
llm_translation: And thus he said: A large mat of reeds, if one made it for lying on - it receives impurity, and one does not cover it. The reason that if one made it for lying on, it is assumed to be like one who made it for covering, one covers it. (A small mat, if one made it for covering - one covers it. The reason that if one made it for covering, it is assumed to be like one who made it for lying on, and one does not cover it). And Rabbi Eliezer came to say: Whether small or large, if it is assumed - it is fit for covering.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַחַת קְטַנָּה וְאַחַת גְּדוֹלָה, ״אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If so, Rabbi Eliezer says: Both a small and a large needed Both a large and a small
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If so, Rabbi Eliezer says: One small and one large, "one large and one small" he requires!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בִּגְדוֹלָה הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי — וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְחוּמְרָא. דְּתַנְיָא: מַחְצֶלֶת הַקָּנִים גְּדוֹלָה מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת טוּמְאָה — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, when they disagree, is with regard to a large and Rabbi Eliezer’s a stringency as it is taught a reed mat, with a large one roof Rabbi Eliezer says: If it is not susceptible to ritual impurity, one roof with it.
llm_translation: And furthermore: when they disputed, it is in a matter of stringency - and Rabbi Eliezer is stringent. As it was taught: a mat made of reeds is large enough to provide shade. Rabbi Eliezer says: if it does not accept impurity - one may provide shade with it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בִּקְטַנָּה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּסְתָמָא לִשְׁכִיבָה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּגְדוֹלָה, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סְתַם גְּדוֹלָה לְסִיכּוּךְ, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: סְתַם גְּדוֹלָה נָמֵי לִשְׁכִיבָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: with regard to a small everyone agrees that without designation, for lying When they disagree, is with regard to a large The first tanna holds a large without designation for roofing, and Rabbi Eliezer holds a large without designation also for lying
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: With a small bed, everyone agrees that it is not intended for lying down. When they argue about a large bed, the first Tanna holds: A large bed is intended for reclining, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: A large bed is also intended for lying down.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי עֲשָׂאָהּ לִשְׁכִיבָה דְּקָאָמַר — הָכִי קָאָמַר: סְתַם עֲשִׂיָּיתָהּ נָמֵי לִשְׁכִיבָה, עַד דְּעָבֵיד לְסִיכּוּךְ.
human_translation: What, one produced it for lying that states? This is what is saying: Making mats without designation is also for lying until one makes for roofing.
llm_translation: And what did he do for her to lie down that he said - this is what he said: Its mere making is also for lying down, until he makes it for covering.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַחְצֶלֶת שֶׁל שִׁיפָה וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי, גְּדוֹלָה — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, קְטַנָּה — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. שֶׁל קָנִים וְשֶׁל חִילָת, גְּדוֹלָה — מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ, אֲרוּגָה — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught a mat [ maḥatzelet ] of papyrus or bulrushes, a large one roof with it, a small one not roof with it, of reeds or reeds for plaiting, a large, one roof with it, woven one not roof with it,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A mat made of reeds and of rushes, if it is large, one may spread it over a coffin; if it is small, one may not spread it over a coffin. But a mat made of canes and of palm leaves, if it is large, one may spread it over a coffin; if it is woven, one may not spread it over a coffin.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ מְסַכְּכִין בָּהּ. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said in the name of his father: Both with this and with that one roof And likewise, Rabbi Dosa would say in accordance with his statement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: "One this and one this we cover with it." And so too Rabbi Dosa used to say in accordance with his words.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: כׇּל הַחוֹצָלוֹת מְטַמְּאִין טְמֵא מֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִדְרָס.
human_translation: We learned there: All ḥotzalot can become ritually impure impurity a corpse. the statement of Rabbi Dosa. And the Rabbis say: treading.
llm_translation: We learned there: All vegetables that are uprooted render impure like a dead body, the words of Rabbi Dosa. And the sages say: from a d'ras.

hebrew_text: מִדְרָס אִין, טְמֵא מֵת לָא? וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: כׇּל הַמִּטַּמֵּא מִדְרָס — מִטַּמֵּא טְמֵא מֵת. אֵימָא: אַף מִדְרָס.
human_translation: treading, yes; impurity a corpse, no? But didn’t we learn Any item that becomes ritually impure by treading becomes ritually impure imparted by a corpse, say: even treading.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a midras is not considered impure from a corpse? But we learned: Anyone who becomes impure from a midras - becomes impure from a corpse. Say: Also a midras.

hebrew_text: מַאי חוֹצָלוֹת? אָמַר רַב אַבְדִּימִי בַּר הַמְדּוּרֵי: מַרְזוֹבְלֵי. מַאי מַרְזוֹבְלֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מַזְבְּלֵי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: מַחְצָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: What ḥotzalot ? Rav Avdimi bar Hamduri said: marzovelei . What marzovelei ? Rabbi Abba said: mezablei Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: actual mats.
llm_translation: What are "chutzalot"? Rav Avdimi bar Hamdurei said: Marzovlei. What are Marzovlei? Rabbi Abba said: Mazblei. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Actual dung.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הֲרֵינִי כַּפָּרַת רַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבָנָיו, שֶׁבִּתְחִלָּה כְּשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּכְּחָה תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — עָלָה עֶזְרָא מִבָּבֶל וְיִסְּדָהּ. חָזְרָה וְנִשְׁתַּכְּחָה — עָלָה הִלֵּל הַבַּבְלִי וְיִסְּדָהּ. חָזְרָה וְנִשְׁתַּכְּחָה — עָלוּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבָנָיו וְיִסְּדוּהָ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבָנָיו: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי דּוֹסָא וַחֲכָמִים עַל מַחְצָלוֹת שֶׁל אוּשָׁא
human_translation: And Reish Lakish follows his reasoning as Reish Lakish said: I am the atonement for Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons, as initially, when Torah forgotten from Jewish people Ezra ascended from Babylonia and reestablished again forgotten Hillel the Babylonian ascended and reestablished again forgotten Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons ascended and reestablished And so said Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons: Rabbi Dosa and the Rabbis did not disagree concerning the mats of Usha,
llm_translation: The head of Lakish went according to his reasoning. For Reish Lakish said: "I am like the atonement of Rabbi Chiya and his sons, that when the Torah was forgotten from Israel - Ezra ascended from Babylon and established it. When it was forgotten again - Hillel the Babylonian ascended and established it. When it was forgotten again - Rabbi Chiya and his sons ascended and established it." And so said Rabbi Chiya and his sons: "Rabbi Dosa and the sages did not disagree regarding the kneading-troughs of Usha."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהֵן טְמֵאוֹת, וְשֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא שֶׁהֵן טְהוֹרוֹת. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ? עַל שְׁאָר מְקוֹמוֹת. מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיכָּא דְּיָתֵיב עֲלַיְיהוּ — כְּדִטְבֶרְיָא דָּמְיָין, וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּמִקְּרֵי וְיָתְבִי עֲלַיְיהוּ — כִּדְאוּשָׁא דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: that they ritually impure, And of Tiberias, that they are ritually pure, Concerning what do they disagree? concerning rest of the places. Sage, holds: Since there is no one who sits on these they are comparable of Tiberias And Sage, holds that since happens and one sits on them they are comparable of Usha
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They are impure, and those of Teverya are pure. On what do they disagree? On other places. One Sage holds: Since there is no one sitting on them - they are like Teverya. And one Sage holds: Since they are called and sit on them - they are like Usha."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כׇּל הַחוֹצָלוֹת מְטַמְּאִין טְמֵא מֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו!
human_translation: The Master said: All ḥotzalot can become ritually impure impurity a corpse; the statement of Rabbi Dosa. But wasn’t it taught And likewise, Rabbi Dosa would say in accordance with his statement,
llm_translation: The Master said: All courtyards render impure like a corpse, the words of Rabbi Dosa. And it was taught: And so Rabbi Dosa used to say in accordance with his words!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ גְּדָנְפָא, הָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ גְּדָנְפָא.
human_translation: not difficult. This is that has an upturned edge, That is that does not have an upturned edge [ gedanpa ];
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one that has a tail, this one that does not have a tail.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חוֹצָלוֹת שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי וְשֶׁל שַׂק וְשֶׁל סְפִירָא — מִטַּמֵּא טְמֵא מֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִדְרָס.
human_translation: raises an objection: Ḥotzalot of papyrus, or of bulrushes, or of sackcloth or of horsehair, can become ritually impure impurity a corpse the statement of Rabbi Dosa. And the Rabbis say: even treading.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Flaxen garments, woolen garments, sackcloth, and sapphire — they convey impurity of a corpse, the words of Rabbi Dosa. But the Sages say: Also linen.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַרְזוֹבְלֵי. שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי — חֲזוּ לְכִינְתָּא דְפֵירֵי. שֶׁל שַׂק וְשֶׁל סְפִירָא — חֲזוּ לִגְוָלְקֵי וְצַנֵּי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַחְצָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ, בִּשְׁלָמָא שֶׁל שַׂק וְשֶׁל סְפִירָא — חֲזוּ לִפְרָסֵי וְנָפְווֹתָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי לְמַאי חֲזוּ? חֲזוּ לְנַזְיָאתָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said marzovelei , of papyrus and of bulrushes are fit as a fruit basket, of sackcloth and of horsehair are fit as sacks [ gulkei ] and baskets However, according to the one who said actual mats Granted, of sackcloth, or of horsehair are fit for screens and sifters. However, of papyrus and of bulrushes, for what are they fit? They are fit for for vats of ale.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that the Marzovlei, of Shem and of Jemini—observe the beauty of the stones. Of sackcloth and of sapphire—observe the coals and the baskets. But according to the one who says actual nuts, in truth, of sackcloth and of sapphire—observe the hammers and the anvils. But of Shem and of Jemini, what do they observe? They observe the sparkles.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַחְצָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ, שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי — חֲזוּ לְנַזְיָאתָא, שֶׁל שַׂק וְשֶׁל סְפִירָא — חֲזוּ לִפְרָסֵי וְנָפְווֹתָא. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַרְזוֹבְלֵי, בִּשְׁלָמָא שֶׁל שַׂק וְשֶׁל סְפִירָא — חֲזוּ לִגְוָלְקִי וְצַנֵּי, אֶלָּא שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל גֶּמִי — לְמַאי חֲזוּ? חֲזוּ לְכִינְתָּא דְפֵירֵי.
human_translation: Some say Granted, according to the one who said actual mats, of papyrus and of bulrushes are fit for vats of ale, of sackcloth, and of horsehair be used as screens or sifters. However, according to the one who said that marzovelei , Granted, of sackcloth and of horsehair are fit to baskets and sacks; but for what of papyrus or of bulrushes fit; They are fit as a fruit basket.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Regarding the one who says that the cucumbers are real, made of linen and wool — look at the basket, made of sackcloth and sapphire — look at the plates and the vessels. But regarding the one who says that they are marrows, made of sackcloth and sapphire — look at the baskets and the basins, but if made of linen and wool — what should one look at? Look at the nest of young pigeons.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה: כְּשֶׁיָּרַדְתִּי לַגּוֹלָה מָצָאתִי זָקֵן אֶחָד, וְאָמַר לִי: מְסַכְּכִין בְּבוּדְיָא. וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֲחִי אַבָּא, הוֹדָה לִדְבָרָיו. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ גְּדָנְפָא.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Ḥananya said: When I descended to the exile I found one Elder, who said to me: One roof with a mat. When I came to Rabbi Yehoshua the brother of father, he agreed with his statement. Rav Ḥisda said: That only does not have an upturned edge
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Hananiah said: When I descended to the exile, I found an elderly man, and he said to me: They are covering themselves in Budya. And when I came to Rabbi Yehoshua, the brother of Abba, he confirmed his words. Rav Hisda said: And he does not have a forehead.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הָנֵי בּוּדְיָתָא דִּבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא, אִלְמָלֵא קִיר שֶׁלָּהֶן, מְסַכְּכִין בְּהוּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מְסַכְּכִין בְּבוּדְיָא, וְאִם יֵשׁ לָהֶן קִיר — אֵין מְסַכְּכִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Ulla said: These mats of the residents of Meḥoza, if not for their wall, one roof with them. That opinion is also taught One roof with a mat; and if they have a wall, one not roof them
llm_translation: Ula said: Those wine cellars of the people of Mahoza, if not for their wall, we would cover them. It was also taught likewise: We cover with a wine cellar, and if they have a wall - we do not cover them.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ סוּכָּה
llm_translation: We will return to you, Sukkah.

hebrew_text: הַיָּשֵׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה בַּסּוּכָּה — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נוֹהֲגִין הָיִינוּ שֶׁהָיִינוּ יְשֵׁנִים תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה בִּפְנֵי הַזְּקֵנִים, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לָנוּ דָּבָר.
human_translation: One who sleeps beneath the bed in the sukka did not fulfill his obligation, Rabbi Yehuda said: It was our custom that we would sleep beneath the bed before the Elders and they did not say anything to us
llm_translation: The one who sleeps beneath the bed in the sukkah - he has not fulfilled his obligation. Rabbi Yehuda said: We used to have the practice of sleeping beneath the bed in the presence of the elders, and they did not say anything to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַעֲשֶׂה בְּטָבִי עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיָה יָשֵׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה, וְאָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַזְּקֵנִים: רְאִיתֶם טָבִי עַבְדִּי, שֶׁהוּא תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וְיוֹדֵעַ שֶׁעֲבָדִים פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה, לְפִיכָךְ יָשֵׁן הוּא תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה. וּלְפִי דַּרְכֵּינוּ: לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁהַיָּשֵׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said, There was an incident involving Tavi, the slave of Rabban Gamliel, who was sleeping beneath the bed, and Rabbi Gamliel said to the Elders: you see my slave Tavi, who is a Torah scholar and knows that slaves are exempt from sukka ? Therefore, he sleeps under the bed. And by the way, we learned that one who sleeps beneath the bed did not fulfill his obligation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said, there was an incident involving Tabi, the servant of Rabban Gamliel, who was sleeping under the bed, and Rabban Gamliel said to the elders: "Have you seen my servant Tabi, who is a Torah scholar and knows that slaves are exempt from the sukkah, therefore he sleeps under the bed. And according to our ways: we have learned that one who sleeps under the bed does not fulfill his obligation."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָא לֵיכָּא עֲשָׂרָה! תַּרְגְּמָא שְׁמוּאֵל בְּמִטָּה עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: But lacking ten Shmuel interpreted of a bed ten
llm_translation: Gemara: And there are only nine! Samuel interpreted "ten" as "ten minus one."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֶחָד חוֹר שֶׁחֲרָרוּהוּ מַיִם, אוֹ שְׁרָצִים, אוֹ שֶׁאֲכָלַתּוּ מְלַחַת, וְכֵן מִדְבַּךְ אֲבָנִים, וְכֵן סְוָאר שֶׁל קוֹרוֹת — מַאֲהִיל עַל הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: We learned there Both a hole that was perforated water creeping animals, or that was eaten away salt, and likewise a course of stones, and likewise a pile of beams a tent over impurity.
llm_translation: We learned there: One who a hole that water cleared it, or that vermin, or that consumed it salt, and so that from between stones, and so that a nail of beams — feeds upon the impurity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אֹהֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי בִּידֵי אָדָם — אֵינוֹ אֹהֶל. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: any tent that is not established by a person is not a tent What is the rationale of Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any tent that is not made by human hands - is not a tent. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's statement?

hebrew_text: יָלֵיף ״אֹהֶל״ ״אֹהֶל״ מִמִּשְׁכָּן. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״זֹאת הַתּוֹרָה אָדָם כִּי יָמוּת בְּאֹהֶל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיִּפְרֹשׂ אֶת הָאֹהֶל עַל הַמִּשְׁכָּן״, מָה לְהַלָּן בִּידֵי אָדָם, אַף כָּאן בִּידֵי אָדָם. וְרַבָּנַן: ״אֹהֶל״ ״אֹהֶל״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: He derives tent from tent Tabernacle. It is written here “This is the teaching when a man dies in a tent” And it is written there “And he spread the tent over the Tabernacle” Just as there, by a person, so too here, by a person. And the Rabbis, tent tent, is amplifies
llm_translation: The word "ohel" is derived from the Mishkan. It is written here: "This is the Torah when a man dies in a tent," and it is written there: "And he spread the tent over the Mishkan." Just as there it is in the hands of man, so too here it is in the hands of man. And the Rabbis say: "Ohel ohel" denotes a dispute.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כׇּל אֹהֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי בִּידֵי אָדָם אֵינוֹ אֹהֶל? וּרְמִינְהוּ: חֲצֵירוֹת הָיוּ בְּנוּיוֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי הַסֶּלַע, וְתַחְתֵּיהֶם חָלָל, מִפְּנֵי קֶבֶר הַתְּהוֹם. וּמְבִיאִין נָשִׁים עוּבָּרוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת שָׁם וּמְגַדְּלוֹת בְּנֵיהֶם שָׁם לַפָּרָה.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold any tent that is not established by a person is not a tent? raises a contradiction Courtyards were built in Jerusalem atop the rock, and beneath space due to a grave the depths. And they bring pregnant women, and they would give birth there And they raise their children there the heifer,
