llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: every tent that is not made by human hands is not a tent? And they raised an objection: courtyards were built in Jerusalem on top of the rock, and beneath them was a hollow due to the grave of the abyss. And they would bring pregnant women and those in labor there, and nurse their children there for the cow.

hebrew_text: וּמְבִיאִין שְׁוָורִים וְעַל גַּבֵּיהֶן דְּלָתוֹת, וְתִינוֹקוֹת יוֹשְׁבִין עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן וְכוֹסוֹת שֶׁל אֶבֶן בִּידֵיהֶם. הִגִּיעוּ לַשִּׁילוֹחַ, יָרְדוּ לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם וּמִילְּאוּם, וְעָלוּ וְיָשְׁבוּ לָהֶם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הָיָה מְשַׁלְשֵׁל וּמְמַלֵּא, מִפְּנֵי קֶבֶר הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: And would bring oxen And doors on the backs and the children sit upon and cups of stone, in their hands. they reached the Siloam they descended into the water and filled and ascended and sat themselves Rabbi Yosei says: from his place would lower and fill due to a grave the depths
llm_translation: And they bring oxen and on their backs doors, and infants sit on their backs and cups of stone in their hands. They reached the canal, descended into the water and filled them, and ascended and sat for them. Rabbi Yosei says: From its place it was sloshing and filling, because of the grave of the abyss.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלָתוֹת, אֶלָּא שְׁוָורִים. וְהָא שְׁוָורִים, דְּאֹהֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי בִּידֵי אָדָם הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלָתוֹת אֶלָּא שְׁוָורִים!
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: They would not bring doors; rather oxen. aren’t oxen a tent that is not established by a person; and it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: They did not bring doors; rather oxen.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: They would not bring doors, only oxen. And regarding the oxen, since it is a tent that is not made by human hands. And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: They would not bring doors, only oxen!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כִּמְלֹא אֶגְרוֹף. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בִּשְׁקִיפִין וּבִנְקִיקֵי הַסְּלָעִים.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yehuda concedes a fistbreadth, That is also taught And Rabbi Yehuda concedes in the caves and deep cavities in the rocks
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yehuda concedes like a full scoop. It was taught similarly: And Rabbi Yehuda concedes in looking glasses and in the crevices of rocks.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי דֶּלֶת, דְּיֵשׁ בָּהּ כַּמָּה אֶגְרוֹפִין, וְקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלָתוֹת אֶלָּא שְׁוָורִים! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא הוּצְרְכוּ לְהָבִיא דְּלָתוֹת.
human_translation: But a door that several fistbreadths, and it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: They did not bring doors but oxen. Abaye said They did not need to bring doors
llm_translation: And behold a door, that has in it several bolts, and it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: They would only bring doors for oxen! Abaye said, they did not need to bring doors.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא הָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלָתוֹת כׇּל עִיקָּר, שֶׁמִּפְּנֵי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל תִּינוֹק גַּסָּה עָלָיו, שֶׁמָּא יוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ אוֹ אֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו, וְיִטָּמֵא
human_translation: Rava said They would not bring doors at all. Because a child has an sense of self-confidence and perhaps he will extend his head or one of his limbs and will become impure
llm_translation: Rava said: They did not bring the doors entirely, because the mind of a child is strong upon him, lest he stick out his head or one of his limbs, and become impure.

hebrew_text: בְּקֶבֶר הַתְּהוֹם.
human_translation: with a grave the depths.
llm_translation: In the grave of the abyss.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלָתוֹת כׇּל עִיקָּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל תִּינוֹק גַּסָּה עָלָיו, שֶׁמָּא יוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ אוֹ אֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו וְיִטָּמֵא בְּקֶבֶר הַתְּהוֹם. אֶלָּא מְבִיאִין שְׁוָורִים הַמִּצְרִים שֶׁכְּרֵיסוֹתֵיהֶן רְחָבוֹת, וְהַתִּינוֹקוֹת יוֹשְׁבִין עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן, וְכוֹסוֹת שֶׁל אֶבֶן בִּידֵיהֶן. הִגִּיעוּ לַשִּׁילוֹחַ — יָרְדוּ וּמִלְּאוּם, וְעָלוּ וְיָשְׁבוּ לָהֶן עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava, Rabbi Yehuda says: They would not bring doors at all, because a child has an sense of self-confidence perhaps he will extend his head or one of his limbs and will become impure with a grave the depths. Rather, they would bring Egyptian oxen whose bellies are broad, and the children would sit upon them and cups of stone in their hands. they reached the they descended and filled them, and ascended and sat themselves on backs
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava. Rabbi Yehuda says: They did not bring the doors of the main entrance, because the mind of a child is strong upon him, lest he stick out his head or one of his limbs and become impure in the grave of the abyss. Instead, they brought Egyptian oxen whose backs were wide, and the children sat on their backs, holding stone cups in their hands. When they reached the river, they descended and filled them, then ascended and sat on their backs.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מִטָּה, דְּיֵשׁ בָּהּ כַּמָּה אֶגְרוֹפִים, וּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹהֲגִים הָיִינוּ שֶׁהָיִינוּ יְשֵׁנִים תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה בִּפְנֵי הַזְּקֵנִים! שָׁאנֵי מִטָּה, הוֹאִיל וּלְגַבָּהּ עֲשׂוּיָה. שְׁוָורִים נָמֵי לְגַבָּן עֲשׂוּיִם!
human_translation: But a bed, which several fistbreadths, we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: It was our custom that we would sleep beneath the bed before the Elders? A bed is different, since it is designed for upon it; oxen also designated for upon them
llm_translation: And behold, a bed, that has several pegs in it. And we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: We used to be accustomed to sleeping under the bed in front of the elders! It is different with a bed, since it is made high. Oxen are also made high!

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שָׁאנֵי שְׁוָורִים הוֹאִיל וּמְגִינִּים עַל הָרוֹעִים בַּחַמָּה מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה וּבַגְּשָׁמִים מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. אִי הָכִי, מִטָּה נָמֵי — הוֹאִיל וּמְגִינָּה עַל מִנְעָלִים וְסַנְדָּלִים שֶׁתַּחְתֶּיהָ!
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Elazar said: Oxen are different since they protect the shepherds in the sun from the sun, and in the rain from the rain. If so, a bed too since it protects shoes and sandals that beneath it.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Elazar said: The oxen are different, as they protect the shepherds from the heat in the sun and from the rain in the rain. If so, the ground is also different - as it protects the shoes and sandals that are underneath it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי שְׁוָורִים, הוֹאִיל וַעֲשׂוּיִם לְהָגֵין עַל בְּנֵי מֵעַיִם שֶׁלָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עוֹר וּבָשָׂר תַּלְבִּישֵׁנִי וּבַעֲצָמוֹת וְגִידִים תְּסוֹכְכֵנִי״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Oxen are different since are made to protect their innards, as it is stated: “With skin and flesh You have clothed me, and with bones and sinews You have knitted me together”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The difference with oxen is that they are fit to protect their owners' vineyards, as it is stated: "Clothe me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews."

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: סוּכָּה דִּירַת קֶבַע בָּעֵינַן. וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ מִטָּה דִּירַת עֲרַאי, וְסוּכָּה אֹהֶל קֶבַע — וְלָא אָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קֶבַע.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda his reasoning, as he stated We require a sukka permanent residence. bed is a temporary residence, and the sukka a permanent tent; and a temporary tent does not come and negate a permanent tent.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, for he said: A sukkah of permanent residence we require. And he had a bed of temporary residence, and a sukkah is a tent of permanence - and not does a tent of temporary residence come and annul a tent of permanence.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר נָמֵי — סוּכָּה דִּירַת קֶבַע בָּעֵינַן, (הָא) וְאָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קֶבַע! (אִין) בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי, מָר סָבַר: אָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קֶבַע, וּמַר סָבַר: לָא אָתֵי אֹהֶל עֲרַאי וּמְבַטֵּל אֹהֶל קֶבַע.
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon, who also stated that we require a sukka permanent residence, a temporary tent comes and negates a permanent tent. Yes, that is they disagree. Sage, holds: A temporary tent comes and negates a permanent tent, and Sage, holds: A temporary tent does not come and negate a permanent tent.
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Shimon said: "We require a permanent sukkah in one's eyes, yet a temporary tent comes and nullifies the permanent sukkah! In this they do not disagree, one Master holds: a temporary tent comes and nullifies the permanent sukkah, and the other Master holds: a temporary tent does not come and nullify the permanent sukkah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּטָבִי עַבְדּוֹ. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִשִּׂיחָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָמַדְנוּ שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים: לָמַדְנוּ שֶׁעֲבָדִים פְּטוּרִים מִן הַסּוּכָּה, וְלָמַדְנוּ שֶׁהַיָּשֵׁן תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said, an incident involving Tavi, the slave It is taught Rabbi Shimon said: From the conversation of Rabban Gamliel we learned two matters. We learned that slaves are exempt from the sukka , and we learned that one who sleeps beneath the bed did not fulfill his obligation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: There was an incident with Tabi his servant. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: From the conversation of Rabban Gamliel we learned two things: We learned that slaves are exempt from the sukkah, and we learned that one who sleeps under the bed does not fulfill his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: ״מִדְּבָרָיו שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל״? מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ שִׂיחַת תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, צְרִיכָה לִימּוּד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָלֵהוּ לֹא יִבּוֹל״.
human_translation: And let say: From the statement of Rabban Gamliel. he teaches us in passing, like that which Rabbi Aḥa bar Adda said, and some say Rabbi Aḥa bar Adda said Rabbi Hamnuna said Rav said: From where that even conversation of Torah scholars require analysis, as it is stated and whose leaf does not wither”
llm_translation: And say: "From the words of Rabban Gamliel"? The matter, due to his way, is heard by us, for this that Rav Acha bar Adda said, and some say he said Rav Acha bar Adda said Rav Hamnuna said Rav: From where is it derived that even the conversation of the scholars' students requires study - as it is said: "And it shall not wither."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַסּוֹמֵךְ סוּכָּתוֹ בְּכַרְעֵי הַמִּטָּה — כְּשֵׁרָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: One who supports his sukka on the legs of the bed, is fit. Rabbi Yehuda says: If cannot stand in and of itself it is unfit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who supports his sukkah on the legs of the bed – it is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it cannot stand on its own – it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל. חַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קֶבַע. וְחַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲמִידָהּ בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Abba bar Memel disagree with regard to One said: because it lacks permanence. And one said: because he is supporting with an object that is susceptible to ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Abba bar Memel dispute it. One said: Because it does not have permanence. And one said: Because it establishes it with a matter that can become impure.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּעַץ שַׁפּוּדִין שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל וְסִיכֵּךְ עֲלֵיהֶם. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קֶבַע — הֲרֵי יֵשׁ לָהּ קֶבַע. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲמִידָהּ בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה — הֲרֵי מַעֲמִידָהּ בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: What is between them? where one wedged iron skewers and roofed upon them. According to the one who said because it lacks permanence, has permanence, the one who said because he is supporting with an object that is susceptible to ritual impurity, he supporting it with an object that is susceptible to ritual impurity,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? For example, if one inserted iron nails and placed them on it. According to the one who says it does not have permanence - behold, it has permanence. And according to the one who says because she supports it with something that can become impure - behold, she supports it with something that can become impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא סָמַךְ. אֲבָל סִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּב הַמִּטָּה — כְּשֵׁרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קֶבַע — הֲרֵי יֵשׁ לָהּ קֶבַע. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲמִידָהּ בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה — הֲרֵי אֵין מַעֲמִידָהּ בְּדָבָר הַמְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: taught only one leaned However, one placed the roofing atop the bed, is fit. What is the reason According to the one who said because it lacks permanence, has permanence according to the one who said because he supports it with an object that is susceptible to ritual impurity, he is not supporting it with an object that is susceptible to ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught the law with regard to leaning the vessel. But if one placed the vessel on the bed — it is valid. What is the reason? According to the one who said that since it does not have a fixed place — behold, it has a fixed place. According to the one who said that because she sets it up for a matter that accepts impurity — behold, she does not set it up for a matter that accepts impurity.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סוּכָּה הַמְדוּבְלֶלֶת וְשֶׁצִּילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. הַמְעוּבָּה כְּמִין בַּיִת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין הַכּוֹכָבִים נִרְאִין מִתּוֹכָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: A sukka that is meduvlelet and whose shade exceeds its sunlight is fit. is thick like a house of sorts, even though that the stars cannot be seen from within it, is fit.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: A sukkah that is interwoven, and its shade is more than its sunlight - it is valid. If it is plastered like a house, even though the stars are not visible from within it - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מְדוּבְלֶלֶת? אָמַר רַב: סוּכָּה עֲנִיָּיה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: קָנֶה עוֹלֶה וְקָנֶה יוֹרֵד.
human_translation: What is meduvlelet ? Rav said: an impoverished sukka , And Shmuel said: reed ascending and reed descending.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: What is Meduvlelet? Rav said: A poor sukkah. And Shmuel said: A reed that goes up and a reed that goes down.

hebrew_text: רַב תָּנֵי חֲדָא, וּשְׁמוּאֵל תָּנֵי תַּרְתֵּי. רַב תָּנֵי חֲדָא: סוּכָּה מְדוּבְלֶלֶת, מַאי מְדוּבְלֶלֶת — מְדוּלְדֶּלֶת, שֶׁצִּילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל תָּנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: מַאי מְדוּבְלֶלֶת — מְבוּלְבֶּלֶת, וְתַרְתֵּי קָתָנֵי: סוּכָּה מְבוּלְבֶּלֶת כְּשֵׁרָה, וְצִילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rav taught one and Shmuel taught two Rav taught one a sukka meduvlelet . what is meduvlelet ? sparse as the shade exceeds the sunlight is fit. And Shmuel taught two What is meduvlelet ? disordered And he teaches two A disordered sukka is fit, and one whose shade exceeds its sunlight is fit.
llm_translation: Rav teaches one, and Shmuel teaches two. Rav teaches one: a sukkah that is meduvbelet, what is meduvbelet - meduldelet, that its shade is more than its sunlight - it is valid. And Shmuel teaches two: what is meduvbelet - mevulbelet, and the two teachings: a sukkah that is mevulbelet is valid, that its shade is more than its sunlight - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — פְּסוּלָה. אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין בְּגַגּוֹ טֶפַח, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בְּגַגּוֹ טֶפַח — כְּשֵׁרָה. דְּאָמְרִינַן: חֲבוֹט רְמִי.
human_translation: Abaye said: They taught only where there is not three handbreadths between However, there is three handbreadths between them it is unfit. Rava said: Even there is three handbreadths between them, we say only where there is not a handbreadth in its roof. However, there is a handbreadth in its roof, is fit, because we say Lower and cast
llm_translation: Abaye said: They did not teach this, except that there is not between this and this three handbreadths, but there is between this and this three handbreadths — it is invalid. Rava said: Even if there is between this and this three handbreadths, we also did not say, except that there is not a handbreadth in its roof, but if there is a handbreadth in its roof — it is valid. As we say: "A clenched fist is thrown."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ דְּכִי אִית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי, וְכִי לֵית בֵּיהּ לָא אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי? דִּתְנַן: קוֹרוֹת הַבַּיִת וְהָעֲלִיָּיה שֶׁאֵין עֲלֵיהֶם מַעֲזִיבָה, וְהֵן מְכֻוּוֹנוֹת טוּמְאָה תַּחַת אַחַת מֵהֶן — תַּחְתֶּיהָ טָמֵא.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say that when there is a handbreadth in its we say lower and cast and when there is not a handbreadth in its we do not say lower and cast as we learned the boards of the house and of the second story that do not have plaster on them, and are aligned ritual impurity beneath one of beneath is impure
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? Because if it has a handbreadth in it, we say "hammer and lift." And if it does not have a handbreadth in it, do we not say "hammer and lift"? For we learned: The beams of a house and an upper story that do not have abandonment on them, and they are arranged such that impurity is underneath one of them - underneath it is impure.

hebrew_text: בֵּין הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה לָעֶלְיוֹנָה — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָמֵא, עַל גַּבֵּי הָעֶלְיוֹנָה — כְּנֶגְדָּהּ עַד לָרָקִיעַ טָמֵא. הָיוּ הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת כְּבֵין הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת, טוּמְאָה תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — תַּחַת כּוּלָּן טָמֵא. עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן — כְּנֶגְדָּן עַד לָרָקִיעַ טָמֵא.
human_translation: between the lower and upper between is impure; atop the upper board, aligned up to the heavens is impure. the upper are between the lower impurity beneath beneath any of impure, above them, aligned up to the heavens is impure.
llm_translation: Between the lower chamber and the upper chamber - between them it is impure. On top of the upper chamber - opposite it, up to the firmament it is impure. If the upper chambers were like the lower chambers, impure is what is beneath them - beneath all of them it is impure. On top of them - opposite them, up to the firmament it is impure.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן טֶפַח וּבֵינֵיהֶן פּוֹתֵחַ טֶפַח, אֲבָל אֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן פּוֹתֵחַ טֶפַח, טוּמְאָה תַּחַת אַחַת מֵהֶן — תַּחְתֶּיהָ טָמֵא, בֵּינֵיהֶן וְעַל גַּבֵּיהֶן — טָהוֹר. אַלְמָא כִּי אִית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח, אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי, וְכִי לֵית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח, לָא אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And it is taught on this In what is this statement said? when have a handbreadth, and between them space of a handbreadth. However, space of a handbreadth between them, impurity beneath one of beneath it is impure, between and atop them pure. Apparently, when there is a handbreadth we say lower and cast And when there is not a handbreadth we do not say lower and cast conclude from here
llm_translation: And he taught about it: In what case are these words said? — When there is a handbreadth in it, and there is an opening between them of a handbreadth, but if there is no opening between them of a handbreadth, if impurity is under one of them — it is impure underneath it, between them, and on top of them — it is pure. This implies that if there is a handbreadth in it, we say "it raises and suspends," but if there is no handbreadth in it, we do not say "it raises and suspends"! Learn from it.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח לָא אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי?
human_translation: Rav Kahana sat and stated this halakha Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: wherever there is not a handbreadth, we do not say lower and cast?
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Kahana and saying to that matter. Said to him Rav Ashei to Rav Kahana: And all where there is not in it a handbreadth not we say a wall is raised?

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: קוֹרָה הַיּוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאֵינָהּ נוֹגַעַת בְּכוֹתֶל זֶה, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי קוֹרוֹת אַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאַחַת יוֹצְאָה מִכּוֹתֶל זֶה וְאֵינָן נוֹגְעוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught in beam that projects from this wall but does not touch the other wall, and similarly, two beams, one projecting from this wall and one projecting from the other wall, and they do not touch each other, less than three one need not bring another beam three one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: A beam that extends from this wall and does not touch this wall, and similarly, two beams, one extending from this wall and one from that wall, and they do not touch each other, if less than three handbreadths - there is no need to bring another beam, if three handbreadths - one must bring another beam.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, says:
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:

hebrew_text: פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, אַרְבָּעָה — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: less than four one need not bring another beam. four one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: Less than four - no need to bring another beam, four - need to bring another beam.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי קוֹרוֹת הַמַּתְאִימוֹת, לֹא בָּזוֹ כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ וְלֹא בָּזוֹ כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל אָרִיחַ, אִם מְקַבְּלוֹת אָרִיחַ לְרׇחְבּוֹ טֶפַח — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת, וְאִם לָאו — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת,
human_translation: And similarly, two parallel, beams there is not in this in order to receive a small brick, and there is not in that in order to receive a small brick, if receive a small brick along its handbreadth width, one need not bring another beam But if not, one is required to bring another beam.
llm_translation: And so too, two beams that are aligned, if they do not receive a span to accommodate and do not receive a span to accommodate, if they receive a span to widen it by a handbreadth - there is no need to bring another beam, but if not - one must bring another beam.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מְקַבְּלוֹת אָרִיחַ לְאׇרְכּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת. וְאִם לָאו — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא קוֹרָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If receive a small brick along its length, three handbreadths, one need not bring another beam, but if not, one must bring another beam.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If they receive it, I will smell it to its length of three handbreadths - it is not necessary to bring another beam. And if not - it is necessary to bring another beam.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְאַחַת לְמַטָּה, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין הָעֶלְיוֹנָה כְּאִילּוּ הִיא לְמַטָּה, וְאֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה כְּאִילּוּ הִיא לְמַעְלָה. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא עֶלְיוֹנָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה, וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה. הָא זֶה וְזֶה בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים — אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: If are one above and one below, one considers the upper as though it were below, and the lower one as though it were above, provided that the upper is not above twenty cubits and the lower below ten this and that are within twenty we say Lower and cast even though there is not a handbreadth
llm_translation: They were one above and one below, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: The upper one is seen as if it is below, and the lower one as if it is above. Only that the upper one should not be more than twenty cubits above, and the lower one below ten. If both are within twenty cubits - we say, "A handbreadth is thrown even though it does not have a handbreadth!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תָּרֵיץ וְאֵימָא הָכִי: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא עֶלְיוֹנָה לְמַעְלָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים, אֶלָּא בְּתוֹךְ עֶשְׂרִים, וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה סְמוּכָה לָהּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה. אִי נָמֵי: בִּלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא תַּחְתּוֹנָה לְמַטָּה מֵעֲשָׂרָה, אֶלָּא לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה, וְעֶלְיוֹנָה סְמוּכָה לָהּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה, אֲבָל שְׁלֹשָׁה, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ טֶפַח — לָא אָמְרִינַן חֲבוֹט רְמִי.
human_translation: said to him: Interpret and say as follows: Provided that the upper is not above twenty rather within twenty and the lower one is adjacent to it, less than three Alternatively, Provided that the lower is not below ten rather above ten and the upper is adjacent to it, less than three However, three since there is not handbreadth in we do not say: Lower and cast
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should resolve it and say as follows: And only that it should not be higher than twenty, rather within twenty, and the lower one adjacent to it by less than three. Alternatively: Only that it should not be lower than ten, rather higher than ten, and the higher one adjacent to it by less than three, but three, since it does not have a handbreadth - we do not say 'tighten and raise.'

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁצִּילָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מֵחַמָּתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. הָא כִּי הֲדָדֵי — פְּסוּלָה. וְהָא תְּנַן בְּאִידַּךְ פִּירְקִין: וְשֶׁחֲמָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה מִצִּילָּתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, הָא כִּי הֲדָדֵי — כְּשֵׁרָה!
human_translation: whose shade exceeds its sunlight is fit. are equal, unfit. But didn’t we learn in another chapter sunlight exceeds its shade is unfit. are equal, is fit.
llm_translation: And when her preservation is greater than her disqualification, she is valid. This is like Hadadei - disqualified. And we learned in the other chapter: And when her disqualification is greater than her preservation, she is disqualified. This is like Hadadei - valid!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן מִלְּמַעְלָה, כָּאן מִלְּמַטָּה. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: כְּזוּזָא מִלְּעֵיל, כְּאִיסְתְּרָא מִלְּתַחַת.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, from above, there, from below, Rav Pappa said: That is folk saying Like a zuz above, like an istera below.
llm_translation: The difficulty is not difficult: here from above, here from below. Rav Papa said, this is what people say: "Like a doorpost from above, like a threshold from below."

hebrew_text: מְעוּבָּה כְּמִין בַּיִת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְעוּבָּה כְּמִין בַּיִת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין הַכּוֹכָבִים נִרְאִין מִתּוֹכָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. אֵין כּוֹכְבֵי חַמָּה נִרְאִין מִתּוֹכָהּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: thick like a type of house The Sages taught thick like a type of house, although that the stars are not visible from within it, is fit. the rays of the sun are not visible from within it, Beit Shammai deem unfit and Beit Hillel deem fit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A raised platform is like a house. The Rabbis taught: If a raised platform is like a house, even though the stars are not visible from within it — it is valid. If the sun's rays are not visible from within it — Beit Shammai disqualify it, and Beit Hillel validate it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הָעֲגָלָה אוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַסְּפִינָה — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְעוֹלִין לָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. בְּרֹאשׁ הָאִילָן אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי גָּמָל — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: one who establishes his sukka at the top of the wagon or at the top of the ship, is fit, And one ascend it on Festival at top of a tree or atop a camel, is fit, but one may not ascend it on Festival
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who constructs his sukkah on top of a wagon or on top of a ship— it is valid, and one may ascend into it on a festival. If one constructs it on top of a tree or on the back of a camel— it is valid, but one may not ascend into it on a festival.

hebrew_text: שְׁתַּיִם בָּאִילָן וְאַחַת בִּידֵי אָדָם, אוֹ שְׁתַּיִם בִּידֵי אָדָם וְאַחַת בָּאִילָן — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. שָׁלֹשׁ בִּידֵי אָדָם וְאַחַת בָּאִילָן — כְּשֵׁרָה, וְעוֹלִין לָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: two in the tree and one by a person, two by a person and one in the tree, is fit, but one may not ascend it on Festival three by a person and one in the tree, is fit, and one may enter it on Festival
llm_translation: Two in the tree and one in the hand of man, or two in the hand of man and one in the tree - it is valid, and they do not ascend with it on a festival. Three in the hand of man and one in the tree - it is valid, and they ascend with it on a festival.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁיִּנָּטֵל הָאִילָן וִיכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה וְעוֹלִין לָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: this is the principle: Any where, the tree removed, the be able to remain standing in and of itself, is fit, and one may ascend it on Festival,
llm_translation: This is the principle: any tree that is uprooted and is able to stand on its own - it is valid, and one may ascend it on a festival day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בְּרֹאשׁ הַסְּפִינָה — רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל פּוֹסֵל, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: whose the mishna? is Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught one who establishes his sukka at the top of the ship, Rabban Gamliel deems unfit and Rabbi Akiva deems fit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara mani matnitin — Rabbi Akiva hi. DeTanya: Ha'oseh sukato b'rosh hasefinah — Rabban Gamliel posel, veRabbi Akiva makshir. English translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who makes his sukkah on the top of a ship" — Rabban Gamliel disqualifies it, and Rabbi Akiva validates it.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִין בִּסְפִינָה, עָמַד רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְעָשָׂה סוּכָּה בְּרֹאשׁ הַסְּפִינָה. לְמָחָר נָשְׁבָה רוּחַ וַעֲקָרַתָּה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: עֲקִיבָא! הֵיכָן סוּכָּתְךָ?
human_translation: an incident involving Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Akiva, who were coming on a ship. Rabbi Akiva arose and established a sukka at the top of the ship. The next day the wind blew and uprooted it. Rabban Gamliel said to him: Akiva, where is your sukka ?
llm_translation: The story of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Akiva who were traveling on a ship, Rabbi Akiva stood and made a sukkah at the head of the ship. The next day, a wind came and uprooted it. Rabban Gamliel said to him: Akiva! Where is your sukkah?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, הֵיכָא דְּאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה דְּיַבָּשָׁה — לֹא כְּלוּם הִיא. יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה דְּיַבָּשָׁה, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּכְשֵׁרָה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּדִיכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה דְּיַבָּשָׁה וְאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד (בְּרוּחַ שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה דְּיַבָּשָׁה). רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: סוּכָּה דִּירַת קֶבַע בָּעֵינַן, וְכֵיוָן דְּאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה דְּיָם — לֹא כְּלוּם הִיא. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: סוּכָּה דִּירַת עֲרַאי בָּעֵינַן, וְכֵיוָן דִּיכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה דְּיַבָּשָׁה — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees that where is unable to withstand a typical land wind, is of no consequence it is able to withstand an atypical land wind, everyone agrees that is fit. Where they disagree in where is able to withstand a typical land wind but is unable to withstand an atypical land wind, Rabban Gamliel holds: sukka , we require a permanent residence, and since it is not able to withstand a typical sea wind, it is of no consequence Rabbi Akiva holds: sukka , we require a temporary residence, and since it is able to withstand a typical land wind, is fit,
llm_translation: Abaye said: In all the world, in a place where it cannot withstand a strong dry wind - it is not a valid sukkah. If it can withstand where there is no strong dry wind, all the world agrees that it is valid. When do they disagree? When it cannot withstand a strong dry wind but can withstand where there is no strong dry wind. Rabban Gamliel holds: We require a sukkah of permanence, and since it cannot withstand a strong dry wind - it is not valid. Rabbi Akiva holds: We require a sukkah of temporary nature, and since it can withstand a strong dry wind - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי גָּמָל כּוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַכְשִׁיר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹסֵל. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה לְךָ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״. סוּכָּה הָרְאוּיָה לְשִׁבְעָה — שְׁמָהּ סוּכָּה. סוּכָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לְשִׁבְעָה — לֹא שְׁמָהּ סוּכָּה.
human_translation: Or atop a camel, Who is the mishna? It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught one who establishes his sukka atop an animal, Rabbi Meir deems fit and Rabbi Yehuda deems unfit. What is the rationale of Rabbi Yehuda? the verse states: “You shall prepare for yourself the festival of Sukkot for seven days” A sukka that is suitable for seven is called a sukka , a sukka that is not suitable for seven is not called a sukka .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or on top of a camel, etc. The Mishnah teaches — it is Rabbi Meir's opinion. As it was taught: One who makes his sukkah on top of an animal — Rabbi Meir deems it valid, while Rabbi Yehuda deems it invalid. What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? He said: "You shall make the Feast of Booths for yourself seven days." A sukkah fit for seven — its name is sukkah. A sukkah not fit for seven — its name is not sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא נָמֵי — מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִחְזֵא חַזְיָא, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בַּהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, By Torah law, this is also suitable and it is the Sages who issued a decree it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, the one named — from the Torah sees a vision, and the Rabbis are the ones who decreed upon it.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂאָהּ לִבְהֵמָה דּוֹפֶן לְסוּכָּה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ לֹא דּוֹפֶן לְסוּכָּה, וְלֹא לֶחִי לְמָבוֹי, וְלֹא פַּסִּין לְבֵירָאוֹת, וְלֹא גּוֹלֵל לְקֶבֶר. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אָמְרוּ: אַף אֵין כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: one utilized animal a wall for a sukka Rabbi Meir deems unfit and Rabbi Yehuda deems fit, as Rabbi Meir would say: any animate object, one neither establish it as a wall for sukka , nor a side post an alleyway nor boards wells nor covering for a grave. In the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili said: Nor one write bills of divorce on it.
llm_translation: He made it for an animal a roof — Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda permits it. For Rabbi Meir used to say: Anything that has a living spirit in it, one may not make it neither a roof for a sukkah, nor a door for an alleyway, nor a partition for wells, nor a covering for graves. In the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean they said: Also, one may not write divorce documents on it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת. רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח. בְּפִיל קָשׁוּר כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּאִי נָמֵי מָיֵית — יֵשׁ בְּנִבְלָתוֹ עֲשָׂרָה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּפִיל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָשׁוּר. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת — לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח — חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Meir, Abaye said: lest die, Rabbi Zeira said: lest it flee. In a tied elephant, everyone agrees as even if it dies its carcass has ten Where they disagree in an elephant that is not tied. According to the one who said: lest die, we are not concerned According to the one who said: a decree lest it flee, we concerned.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? Abaye said: Lest he die. Rabbi Zeira said: Lest he escape. In a tightly sealed barrel, everyone agrees, for if it dies, there are ten measures in its carcass. When do they disagree? In a barrel that is not tightly sealed. According to the one who says lest he die, we are not concerned. According to the one who says it is a decree lest he escape, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת, נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח! אֶלָּא: בְּפִיל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָשׁוּר, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְלִיגִי בִּבְהֵמָה קְשׁוּרָה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת — חָיְישִׁינַן. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח — לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: According to the one who said: a decree lest it die, let us be concerned lest it flee, Rather, In an elephant that is not tied, everyone agrees Where they disagree in a tied animal. According to the one who said: a decree lest die, we are concerned, And according to the one who said: a decree lest it flee, we are not concerned.
llm_translation: To whom says decree lest die, concern lest escape! Rather: in elephant that not tied, everyone world not argue. For argue in animal tied. To whom says decree lest die - we are concerned. And to whom says decree lest escape - we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח, נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת? מִיתָה לָא שְׁכִיחָא. וְהָאִיכָּא רַוְוחָא דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי? דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא.
human_translation: And the one who said: a decree lest it flee, let us be concerned lest it die. death is not common. But isn’t there the space between He establishes for it with hard palm leaves and laurel leaves,
llm_translation: And one who says, "A decree lest she escape," is concerned lest she die? Death is not common. But is there not a space between them? He can do it with a partition and a board.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא רָבְעָה? דִּמְתִיחָה בְּאַשְׁלֵי מִלְּעֵיל. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת נָמֵי, הָא מְתִיחָה בְּאַשְׁלֵי מִלְּעֵיל! זִמְנִין דְּמוֹקֵים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַסְּכָךְ,
human_translation: And perhaps it will crouch, where is tied with ropes from above And according to the one who said: a decree lest it die, also it is tied with ropes from above. Sometimes established adjacent to the roofing, less than three
llm_translation: Perhaps it is a fourth wall? For it is plastered with mortar from above. And according to the one who says it is a decree to prevent danger, lest one die, behold, it is plastered with mortar from above! This applies in cases where they are placed at a distance of less than three handbreadths near the skylight.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּמָיְיתָא — כָּוְוצָא וְלָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And once it dies, it contracts it not his mind
llm_translation: And since he resembled — like a duck, and not his knowledge.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר חָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא חָיֵישׁ? וְהָתְנַן: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן וְהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם — אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים.
human_translation: And did Abaye say Rabbi Meir is concerned about death and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned? Didn’t we learn daughter of an Israelite who married a priest and her husband went to a country overseas, partake of teruma the presumptive status that he is alive?
llm_translation: And who said? Abbaye said: Rabbi Meir is concerned for death, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned? And it was taught in a Mishnah: A daughter of Israel who marries a Kohen and her husband went to a distant province — she may eat Terumah, under the presumption that he is alive.

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵינַן עֲלַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם מִיתָתִי — אֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה מִיָּד!
human_translation: And we raised a contradiction This is your bill of divorce one hour prior to my death, it is prohibited for her to partake of teruma immediately
llm_translation: And we raise an objection: "Behold, this is your divorce document, one hour before my death" - it is forbidden to eat terumah immediately!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּלָא חָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: And Abaye said not difficult. This is Rabbi Meir, who is not concerned about death. That is Rabbi Yehuda, who is concerned about death.
llm_translation: And Abaye said, it is not difficult: this is like Rabbi Meir who is not concerned for death, and this is like Rabbi Yehuda who is concerned for death.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִים, אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה, עֲשָׂרָה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, תִּשְׁעָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: As it is taught one who purchases wine from among the Samaritans he says: Two log that I will separate in the future are teruma , ten first tithe; nine second tithe. And he deconsecrates and drink immediately, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who purchases wine from among the Kutim, he says: "Two logim that I am destined to separate, behold they are Terumah, ten percent as the first tithe, nine percent as the second tithe, and he may wait and drink immediately." These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit!

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר חָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא חָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה, דְּתַנְיָא: עֲשָׂאָהּ לַבְּהֵמָה דּוֹפֶן לַסּוּכָּה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹסֵל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Reverse Rabbi Meir is concerned about death, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned about death, as it is taught one utilized animal a wall for the sukka , Rabbi Meir deems unfit and Rabbi Yehuda deems fit.
llm_translation: Opposite: Rabbi Meir is concerned for death, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned for death, as it was taught: If one made it for an animal, resembling a booth - Rabbi Meir disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yehuda permits it.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר! אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִיתָה שְׁכִיחָא, בְּקִיעַת הַנּוֹד לָא שְׁכִיחָא, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמָסַר לֵיהּ לְשׁוֹמֵר.
human_translation: difficult, of Rabbi Meir of Rabbi Meir Rabbi Meir said to you: Death is common, the bursting of the wineskin is not common it is possible that he gave to a guard
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Meir, the difficulty of Rabbi Meir! Rabbi Meir said to you: Death is common, tearing of the garment is not common, it is possible that he handed it over to a guardian.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: difficult, of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is according to Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחָיֵישׁ לִבְקִיעַת נוֹד, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵית לֵיהּ ״בְּרֵירָה״.
human_translation: The rationale of Rabbi Yehuda not due to that he is concerned about the bursting of wineskin; rather, because he is not of clarification.
llm_translation: Reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda is not because he is concerned about the tearing of the tithe, but because it does not have "choice."

hebrew_text: וְלָא חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לִבְקִיעַת נוֹד? וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד וְנִמְצָא זֶה שׁוֹתֶה טְבָלִים לְמַפְרֵעַ? וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע. מִכְּלָל דְּחָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לִבְקִיעַת הַנּוֹד!
human_translation: And is Rabbi Yehuda not concerned about the bursting of the wineskin? But isn’t from that it teaches the latter clause said to Rabbi Meir Do you not concede that perhaps the wineskin will burst, and it will be determined retroactively that he is drinking untithed produce? And said to When it bursts, by inference Rabbi Yehuda, is concerned about the bursting of the wineskin.
llm_translation: And not concerned Rabbi Yehuda for the breaking of a flask? And this is learned in the latter clause: They said to Rabbi Meir: Do you admit that perhaps the flask will break and this one will be found drinking untithed wine? And he said to them: When it breaks. From here it is inferred that Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned for the breaking of the flask!

hebrew_text: הָתָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: לְדִידִי לֵית לִי בְּרֵירָה. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ דְּיֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה — אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה דְּשֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע.
human_translation: there, it is Rabbi Yehuda who is saying to Rabbi Meir: For me, I am not of clarification, However, according to your that there is clarification, do you not concede that lest the wineskin burst? said to him: When it bursts,
llm_translation: There, Rabbi Yehuda is the one who said to Rabbi Meir: According to me, there is no free choice. Rather, according to you, that there is free choice - do you agree that perhaps the vow will be annulled? He said to him: When it will be annulled.

hebrew_text: וְלָא חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְמִיתָה? וְהָא תְּנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת מַתְקִינִין לוֹ, שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת אִשְׁתּוֹ. הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בְּכַפָּרָה.
human_translation: And is Rabbi Yehuda not concerned about death? Didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: even designate another wife for him lest his wife die. But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: They established a higher standard with atonement?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is Rabbi Yehuda not concerned for death? But we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even another woman is arranged for him, lest his wife die. And it was stated about him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: They acted with him leniently.

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת, בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁמָּא תִּבְרַח, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְחִיצָה מְעַלְּיָא הִיא, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בָּהּ. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר תְּטַמֵּא מִשּׁוּם גּוֹלֵל? אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַמֵּא מִשּׁוּם גּוֹלֵל, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְטַהֵר?
human_translation: Both according to the one who said lest it die, according to the one who said lest it flee, it is a full-fledged partition by Torah law, and it is the Sages who issued a decree its However, if so, to Rabbi Meir be impure due to covering of a grave. Why, did we learn Rabbi Yehuda imparts ritual impurity due to covering of a grave, but Rabbi Meir deems it pure?
llm_translation: Between according to who said perhaps you will die, between according to who said perhaps you will escape, from the Torah it is a partition above, and the Rabbis are the ones who decreed it. Rather, from now on, for Rabbi Meir to become impure because of a clod? Why do we learn: Rabbi Yehuda declares impure because of a clod, and Rabbi Meir declares pure?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כָּל מְחִיצָה שֶׁעוֹמֶדֶת בְּרוּחַ — אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר כׇּל מְחִיצָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה בִּידֵי אָדָם — אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said, Rabbi Meir holds any partition that stands by air, is not a partition. Some say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Rabbi Meir holds any partition that is not established by a person is not a partition.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: Rabbi Meir holds: Any partition that stands by means of the wind - is not a partition. There are those who say, Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: Rabbi Meir holds: Any partition that is not made by human hands - is not a partition.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאוֹקְמַהּ בְּנוֹד תָּפוּחַ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְחִיצָה עוֹמֶדֶת בְּרוּחַ אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה — הֲרֵי עוֹמֶדֶת בְּרוּחַ, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה בִּידֵי אָדָם —
human_translation: What is between There is between them one establishes with an inflated wineskin. According to the one who said a partition stands by air is not a partition, stands by air According to the one who said that it is not established by a person
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one was established with a nod of an apple. According to the one who says a partition standing in the wind is not a partition - behold, it is standing in the wind. According to the one who says it is not made by human hands -

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי עֲשׂוּיָה בִּידֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: was established by a person
llm_translation: Behold, it is made by the hands of man.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אָמְרוּ: אַף אֵין כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? דְּתַנְיָא: ״סֵפֶר״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא סֵפֶר. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת כָּל דָּבָר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Master said in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili they said: Nor one write bills of divorce on it. What is the rationale of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? as it is taught a scroll [ sefer ] I have only a scroll From where to include all objects The verse states: “That he write her,” in any case,
llm_translation: Master said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: They also do not write for him women's bills of divorce. What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? For it was taught: "a document," I have only a document. From where do we know to include everything? The Talmud teaches: "and he shall write for her" from every place.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״סֵפֶר״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה סֵפֶר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: Scroll? to tell you Just as a scroll is neither alive nor is it food, so too, any object that is neither alive nor food.
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "sefer"? To tell you: Just as a sefer (book) that does not have a living spirit and does not eat, so too, anything that does not have a living spirit and does not eat.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? אִי כְּתַב ״בְּסֵפֶר״, כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״סֵפֶר״ — לִסְפִירַת דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, If had written: in the scroll [ basefer ], as you said, Now that it is written a sefer , it comes to a mere account of the matters [ sefirat devarim ]
llm_translation: The sages? If he wrote "in a book," as you said. Now that it is written "book" - it is for the counting of words in the world that he came.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הַאי ״וְכָתַב״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ, בִּכְתִיבָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּכֶסֶף. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ יְצִיאָה לַהֲוָיָה, מָה הֲוָיָה בַּכֶּסֶף — אַף יְצִיאָה בְּכֶסֶף, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And what do the Rabbis derive from “That he write her”? That is required is divorced by means of writing, and she is not divorced by means of money. It might have entered your mind to say: Since leaving is juxtaposed to becoming just as becoming is with money, so too, leaving with money. teaches us:
llm_translation: The sages said: What is the interpretation of the word "and he shall write" in this context? That one requires it for himself, in writing it is effective, but not effective with money. Is it your opinion that I would say: Since it is connected to existence, just as it is effective with money, so too it is effective with existence. This is what we hear.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הַאי סְבָרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? מִ״סֵּפֶר כְּרִיתוּת״ נָפְקָא לֵיהּ. סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, from where does he this reasoning He derives it from “A scroll of severance,” a scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, does this reasoning satisfy him? He derives it from the book of "Kritut." The book of Kortah, and there is nothing else but Kortah.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְדָבָר הַכּוֹרֵת בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן, וְעַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלְכִי לְבֵית אָבִיךְ לְעוֹלָם — אֵין זֶה כְּרִיתוּת, כָּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — הֲרֵי זֶה כְּרִיתוּת.
human_translation: And the other requires that to a matter that severs between him and her. As it is taught This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will never drink wine, or on the condition that you will never go to your father’s house, that is not severance; for the duration of thirty days, that is severance,
llm_translation: And the other? He requires her for a matter of a cutting thing between him and her. As it was taught: "Here is your divorce on the condition that you do not drink wine, and on the condition that you do not go to your father's house forever - this is not a divorce, up to thirty days - this is a divorce."

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? מִ״כָּרֵת״ ״כְּרִיתוּת״ נָפְקָא. וְאִידַּךְ? ״כָּרֵת״ ״כְּרִיתוּת״ לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And the other derives from karet , keritut . And the other does not derive karet keritut ,
llm_translation: And the other opinion? From "karet" "k'ritut" is derived. And the other opinion? "Karet" "k'ritut" you did not expound.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בֵּין הָאִילָנוֹת וְהָאִילָנוֹת דְּפָנוֹת לָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: one who establishes his sukka between the trees, and the trees walls for it, is fit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who makes his sukkah among trees, and the trees serve as its walls — it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כׇּל מְחִיצָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד בְּרוּחַ מְצוּיָה — אֵינָהּ מְחִיצָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Any partition that is not able to stand in a typical wind, is not a partition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Acha bar Yaakov: Any partition that cannot withstand a common wind - is not a partition.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּתוֹ בֵּין הָאִילָנוֹת וְהָאִילָנוֹת דְּפָנוֹת לָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. וְהָא קָאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּקָשִׁין.
human_translation: we learned one who establishes his sukka between the trees, and the trees walls for it, is fit. But don’t sway back and forth With what are we dealing here? to hard
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who makes his sukkah among trees, and the trees serve as its walls — it is valid. But here it is shady and comes! What are we dealing with here? — With tough cases.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא נוֹפוֹ! דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִיגְזַר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּאִילָן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But isn’t there its foliage, that he established with hard palm leaves and laurel leaves If so what to state lest you say: Let us issue a decree lest one come to use the tree teaches us
llm_translation: And where is the window! That he made for it with a projection and a ledge. If so, what is there to say? Perhaps it will come to be used for hanging on a tree, which would be a violation.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה שָׁם אִילָן אוֹ גָּדֵר אוֹ מְחִיצַת הַקָּנִים — נִידּוֹן מִשּׁוּם דְּיוֹמָד! הָתָם נָמֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא.
human_translation: Come hear was a tree there, or fence or a partition of reeds, its assessed like a double board There, too, due to that he established with hard palm leaves and laurel leaves.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If there was there a tree or a fence or a partition of reeds - it is discussed because of the issue of dyeing! There, it is stated, because he does it with hutzah and dapna.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אִילָן הַמֵּיסֵךְ עַל הָאָרֶץ, אִם אֵין נוֹפוֹ גָּבוֹהַּ מִן הָאָרֶץ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים — מְטַלְטְלִין תַּחְתָּיו. אַמַּאי, הָא קָא אָזֵיל וְאָתֵי? הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא.
human_translation: Come hear a tree cover the ground, if its foliage is not three handbreadths high the ground one carry beneath it, Why Doesn’t it sway back and forth There, too, that he established with hard palm leaves and laurel leaves.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: a tree that leans over the ground, if its branch is not three handbreadths high from the ground - one may move objects underneath it. Why? Because it goes and comes there. There too, it is done for the purpose of removing and covering.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נִיטַּלְטֵל בְּכוּלֵּיהּ! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ
human_translation: If so let him move in the entire Why, did Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, say: One carry
llm_translation: Thus, it is absorbed in its entirety! Why did Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, say: "One may not move it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית סָאתַיִם!
human_translation: only two beit se’a ,
llm_translation: Rather, two se'ahs!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישֶׁיהָ לַאֲוִיר, וְכׇל דִּירָה שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישֶׁיהָ לַאֲוִיר אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין בּוֹ אֶלָּא סָאתַיִם.
human_translation: because it is a residence whose uses are for air And any residence whose uses are for air one carry in it only if two beit se’a .
llm_translation: Because it is a dwelling whose use is for the air, and any dwelling whose use is for the air, one may only move in it two se'ahs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁבַת בְּתֵל שֶׁהוּא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה, וְהוּא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם, וְכֵן בְּנֶקַע שֶׁהוּא עָמוֹק עֲשָׂרָה, וְהוּא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַד בֵּית סָאתַיִם, וְכֵן קָמָה קְצוּרָה וְשִׁבּוֹלוֹת מַקִּיפוֹת אוֹתָהּ — מְהַלֵּךְ אֶת כּוּלָּהּ וְחוּצָה לָהּ אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה. אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי! הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא.
human_translation: Come hear one established his Shabbat on a mound that is ten high and from four cubits to two beit se’a ; and similarly, in a cavity that is ten deep and from four cubits to two beit se’a ; reaped grain, and stalks surround it, he walk in the entire and outside it two thousand cubits. although they sway back and forth There, too, that he established with hard palm leaves and laurel leaves.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A Sabbath boundary that is ten high, and it is from four cubits to two se'ahs, and so too with a pit that is deep ten, and it is from four cubits to two se'ahs, and so too with a short wall and surrounding stalks - one may walk its entirety and two thousand cubits outside of it. Even though it is going and coming! There too, because he is doing it with a boundary and a covering.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה. חוֹלִין וּמְשַׁמְּשֵׁיהֶן — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה. אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין עֲרַאי חוּץ לַסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: Those on the path a mitzva are exempt from the sukka . ill and their caretakers are exempt from the sukka . One eat and drink casual outside the sukka .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Those sent on a mitzvah are exempt from the sukkah. The sick and those who attend to them are exempt from the sukkah. Those who eat and drink temporarily outside the sukkah."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ בְּבֵיתֶךָ״ — פְּרָט לְעוֹסֵק בְּמִצְוָה, ״וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ בַדֶּרֶךְ״ — פְּרָט לְחָתָן. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת הַבְּתוּלָה — פָּטוּר, וְאֶת הָאַלְמָנָה — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: From where are these matters The Sages taught “When you sit in your house,” to the exclusion of one who is engaged in a mitzva, “and when you walk by the way,” to the exclusion of a groom, from here stated: One who marries a virgin is exempt and a widow is obligated.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Tanu rabanan: "Beshivtecha beitecha" — perat le'osek be'mitzvah, "u'velechtecha baderech" — perat le'chatan. Mikkan amru: hakones et habetulah — patur, ve'et ha'almanah — chayav. English translation: What are these matters derived from? The Rabbis taught: "When you sit in your house" — excluding one who is engaged in a commandment, "and when you walk on the way" — excluding a groom. From here they said: One who marries a virgin — exempt, and one who marries a widow — obligated.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כְּדֶרֶךְ. מָה דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת, אַף כֹּל רְשׁוּת, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הַאי דִּבְמִצְוָה עָסוּק.
human_translation: From where be inferred Rav Huna said: like the way: Just as way voluntary so too, all voluntary to the exclusion of this who is engaged in a mitzva.
llm_translation: What is implied? Rav Huna said: Like the way. Just as the way is optional, so too, everything is optional, to exclude this one who is engaged in a commandment.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּקָאָזֵיל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וְקָא אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לִיקְרֵי! אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא ״בְּשֶׁבֶת וּבְלֶכֶת״, מַאי ״בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ״ ״וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ״ — בְּלֶכֶת דִּידָךְ הוּא דְּמִיחַיְּיבַתְּ, הָא בְּלֶכֶת דְּמִצְוָה — פְּטִירַתְּ.
human_translation: Are we not dealing with one who is walking for a matter of a mitzva, and the Merciful One says to recite If so let the verse state: When sitting and when walking. What is “When you sit…and when you walk”? It is in your walking, that you are obligated in walking of a mitzva, you are exempt
llm_translation: We are dealing with one who is going out to perform a mitzvah, and the Merciful One said to call him! If so, let the verse say "on your sitting and on your walking," what is "on your sitting" and "and on your walking" — "on your walking" is where you are obligated, but "on your walking" of a mitzvah — exemption.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹנֵס אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה נָמֵי? כּוֹנֵס אֶת הַבְּתוּלָה טְרִיד, כּוֹנֵס אַלְמָנָה לָא טְרִיד.
human_translation: If so, even one who marries a widow also One who marries a virgin is preoccupied one who marries a widow is not preoccupied.
llm_translation: If so, even if one gathers the widow, it is effective? Gathers the virgin, it is ineffective; gathers the widow, it is not effective.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּטְרִיד, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?! אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, טָבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם — דִּטְרִיד, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בְּכׇל הַמִּצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה חוּץ מִן הַתְּפִילִּין, שֶׁהֲרֵי נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״פְּאֵר״!
human_translation: And wherever is preoccupied is he indeed exempt? But if so, whose ship sank at sea, who is preoccupied, also exempt. And if you say indeed, that is so, didn’t Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say Rav said: A mourner is obligated in all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah, except for phylacteries, as splendor is stated with regard to
llm_translation: And all cases where he is troubled, is it so that he is exempt?! Rather, from now on, if his ship sank in the sea — he is troubled, is it so that he is exempt?! And if you say he is exempt, but didn't Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say in the name of Rav: But he is obligated in all the commandments stated in the Torah except for Tefillin, as it is said about them "beauty"!

hebrew_text: הָכָא טְרִיד טִירְדָּא דְמִצְוָה, הָתָם טְרִיד טִירְדָּא דִרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Here, he is preoccupied the preoccupation of a mitzva there, he is preoccupied the preoccupation of a voluntary
llm_translation: Here the trid tir'da of mitzvah, there the trid tir'da of drashut.

hebrew_text: וְהָעוֹסֵק בְּמִצְוָה פָּטוּר מִן הַמִּצְוָה מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וַיְהִי אֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ טְמֵאִים לְנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם וְגוֹ׳״ — אוֹתָם אֲנָשִׁים מִי הָיוּ? נוֹשְׂאֵי אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף הָיוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: And one who is engaged in a mitzva is exempt from mitzva derived from here? It is derived from there, as it is taught “There were certain men who were impure by the corpse of a person those men Who were they? They were the bearers of Joseph’s coffin, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The one who is engaged in a commandment is exempt from the commandment - from where is this derived? It is derived from there, as it is taught: "And there were men who were impure by the soul of a man, etc." - who were those men? They were the bearers of the coffin of Joseph, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִישָׁאֵל וְאֶלְצָפָן הָיוּ, שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹסְקִין בְּנָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: אִם נוֹשְׂאֵי אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף הָיוּ, כְּבָר הָיוּ יְכוֹלִין לִיטָּהֵר. אִם מִישָׁאֵל וְאֶלְצָפָן הָיוּ, יְכוֹלִין הָיוּ לִיטָּהֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: They were Mishael and Elzaphan, who were engaged in Nadav and Avihu Rabbi Yitzḥak says: if they were the bearers of Joseph’s coffin, they could have been purified. if they were Mishael and Elzaphan they could have been purified,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Mishael and Eltzafan were, for they were engaged in the offering of Nadav and Avihu. Rabbi Yitzchak says: If they were the bearers of the Ark of Joseph, they would have already been able to purify themselves. If Mishael and Eltzafan were, they would have been able to purify themselves.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, עוֹסְקִין בְּמֵת מִצְוָה הָיוּ שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלָּהֶן לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב פֶּסַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יָכְלוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת הַפֶּסַח בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא״, בְּיוֹם הַהוּא אֵין יְכוֹלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת, הָא לְמָחָר — יְכוֹלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת!
human_translation: Rather, they were engaged in a corpse mitzva, their seventh day occurred precisely on the eve of Passover, as it is stated: “And they could not observe the Pesaḥ on that day” On that day they could not observe it; on the next day they could observe it.
llm_translation: Rather, they were occupied with a deceased person who was a mitzvah, whose seventh day of mourning coincided with the eve of Passover, as it is stated: "And they could not perform the Passover offering on that day." On that day they could not perform it, but on the next day they could perform it!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָתָם — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְטָא זְמַן חִיּוּבָא דְּפֶסַח, אֲבָל הָכָא, דִּמְטָא זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא כָּרֵת, אֲבָל הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא כָּרֵת — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: are necessary. As, if it had taught us there, due to that the time of the obligation of the Pesaḥ had not yet arrived However, here, where the time Shema had already arrived say no, necessary And if it had taught us here, due to that there is no karet However, there, where there is karet say that one is not necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we would hear there - because it does not come at the time of the obligation of Pesach, but here, where it comes at the time of the recitation of Shema - say perhaps not, it is necessary. And if we would hear here - because there is no karet, but there, where there is karet - say perhaps not, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בְּכׇל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה חוּץ מִתְּפִילִּין, שֶׁהֲרֵי נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״פְּאֵר״. מִדַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל ״פְּאֵרְךָ חֲבוֹשׁ עָלֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״ — אַתְּ הוּא דְּמִיחַיְּיבַתְּ, אֲבָל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא פְּטִירִי.
human_translation: the matter itself, Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said Rav said: A mourner is obligated in all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah except for phylacteries, as splendor is stated the Merciful One said to Ezekiel: bind your splendor upon you, You are obligated however, everyone is exempt.
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: A mourner is obligated in all the commandments stated in the Torah except for Tefillin, as it is said about them "your beauty." From the fact that the Merciful One said to Ezekiel "your beauty is upon you, etc." - you are the one who is obligated, but all others are exempt.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ כְּיוֹם מָר״.
human_translation: This applies on the first day as it is written: and the end thereof as a bitter day”
llm_translation: And these are the matters on the first day, as it is written: "And its end is like a bitter day."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בַּסּוּכָּה. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: מִצְטַעֵר פָּטוּר מִן הַסּוּכָּה — הַאי נָמֵי מִצְטַעֵר הוּא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן: הָנֵי מִילֵּי צַעֲרָא דְמִמֵּילָא, אֲבָל הָכָא, אִיהוּ הוּא דְּקָא מְצַעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְיַתּוֹבֵי דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said Rav said: A mourner is obligated in sukka . obvious; Lest you say since Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said Rav said one who is suffering is exempt from the sukka , this too is one who is suffering he teaches us this applies only suffering that is by itself, However, here, where he is causing himself to suffer he is required to settle himself
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: A mourner is obligated in the sukkah. Is it not obvious? Lest you say: Since Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: One who is in distress is exempt from the sukkah — this one also is in distress, but it teaches us: Those matters of distress that come from Heaven are exempt, but here, he himself is causing distress to his soul, if he wants, he can sit and have his mind at ease.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: חָתָן וְהַשּׁוֹשְׁבִינִין וְכׇל בְּנֵי הַחוּפָּה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעוּ לְמִיחְדֵּי. וְלֵיכְלוּ בַּסּוּכָּה וְלִיחְדּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה! אֵין שִׂמְחָה אֶלָּא בַּחוּפָּה. וְלֵיכְלוּ בַּסּוּכָּה וְלִיחְדּוֹ בַּחוּפָּה! אֵין שִׂמְחָה אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said Rav said: The groom and the groomsmen and all members of the wedding are exempt from the sukka all seven What is the reason because they wish to rejoice. And let them eat in the sukka and rejoice in the sukka . The celebration is only in the wedding home let them eat in the sukka and rejoice in the wedding home. There is joy only in the place meal.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: The groom, and the companions, and all the members of the wedding party - are exempt from the sukkah for seven days. What is the reason? Because they are occupied with the bride. Let them eat in the sukkah and be occupied with the sukkah! There is no joy except with the bride. Let them eat in the sukkah and be occupied with the bride! There is no joy except in the place of a meal.

hebrew_text: וְלֶיעְבְּדוּ חוּפָּה בַּסּוּכָּה? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד. וְרָבָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם צַעַר חָתָן. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּשְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּנָפְקִי וְעָיְילִי לְהָתָם. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד — לֵיכָּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם צַעַר חָתָן — אִיכָּא.
human_translation: And let them establish the wedding home in the sukka . Abaye said: due to seclusion And Rava said: due to the suffering of the groom. What is between them? between them is where people regularly enter and leave According to the one who said alone together, there is no according to the one who said due to the suffering of the groom, there is
llm_translation: And to serve the wedding feast in the sukkah? Abbaye said: Because of unity. And Rava said: Because of the groom's discomfort. What is the practical difference between them? The difference between them is that people are commonly found going in and out there. According to the one who said it is because of unity - there is no issue. According to the one who said it is because of the groom's discomfort - there is an issue.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֲנָא אֲכַלִי בַּסּוּכָּה וַחֲדַי בַּחוּפָּה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן דְּחָדֵי לִיבַּאי דְּקָא עָבֵידְנָא תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: and I ate in the sukka and rejoiced in the wedding home, and all the more so my heart rejoiced as I fulfilled two
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: I ate in the sukkah and drank in the courtyard, and certainly the hearts of my hosts were pleased with the two things I did.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָתָן וְהַשּׁוֹשְׁבִינִין וְכׇל בְּנֵי חוּפָּה, פְּטוּרִין מִן הַתְּפִלָּה וּמִן הַתְּפִילִּין, וְחַיָּיבִין בִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The groom and the groomsmen and all the members of the wedding are exempt from prayer and from phylacteries but they are obligated in reciting Shema .
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A groom, and those accompanying him, and all the members of the wedding party, are exempt from prayer and from wearing phylacteries, but are obligated in reciting the Shema.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרוּ: חָתָן פָּטוּר, וְהַשּׁוֹשְׁבִינִין וְכׇל בְּנֵי הַחוּפָּה חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: In the name of Rabbi Sheila they said: A groom is exempt but the groomsmen and all the members of the wedding are obligated.
llm_translation: From the teaching of Rabbi Sheilah they said: The groom is exempt, but the attendants and all the members of the wedding party are obligated.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא: כּוֹתְבֵי סְפָרִים תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת, הֵן וְתַגָּרֵיהֶן וְתַגָּרֵי תַגָּרֵיהֶן וְכׇל הָעוֹסְקִין בִּמְלֶאכֶת שָׁמַיִם, לְאֵתוֹיֵי מוֹכְרֵי תְכֵלֶת — פְּטוּרִין מִקְּרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּמִן הַתְּפִלָּה וּמִן הַתְּפִילִּין וּמִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה, לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹסֵק בְּמִצְוָה פָּטוּר מִן הַמִּצְוָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya said: scribes of Torah scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot , they and the merchants them, and the merchants the merchants and sell them to others, and all who are engaged in the labor of Heaven, to include the sellers of the sky-blue dye are exempt from reciting Shema and from prayer and from phylacteries and from all mitzvot that are mentioned in the Torah to fulfill statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as Rabbi Yosei HaGelili would say: One who is engaged in a mitzva is exempt from mitzva.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Hananiah ben Akavya said: Scribes, makers of phylacteries, and makers of mezuzot, both they and their apprentices, and the apprentices of their apprentices, and all who are engaged in the work of Heaven, to include those who sell blue dye, are exempt from reciting the Shema, from prayer, from wearing phylacteries, and from all the commandments mentioned in the Torah, in order to fulfill the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean used to say: One who is engaged in a commandment is exempt from the commandment.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוֹלְכֵי דְרָכִים בַּיּוֹם — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה בַּיּוֹם, וְחַיָּיבִין בַּלַּיְלָה. הוֹלְכֵי דְרָכִים בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה בַּלַּיְלָה וְחַיָּיבִין בַּיּוֹם. הוֹלְכֵי דְרָכִים בַּיּוֹם וּבַלַּיְלָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. הוֹלְכִין לִדְבַר מִצְוָה — פְּטוּרִין בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. כִּי הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא כִּי הֲווֹ עָיְילִי בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִגְלָא לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, הֲווֹ גָּנוּ אַרַקְתָּא דְסוּרָא, אָמְרִי: אֲנַן שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֲנַן וּפְטוּרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught Travelers during the day are exempt from sukka during the day and are obligated at night. Travelers by night are exempt from sukka at night and obligated during the day. Travelers during the day and at night are exempt from sukka both during the day and at night. travel for a matter of mitzva are exempt both during the day and at night, as this Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna. When they would enter the house of the Exilarch on the Shabbat of the Festival they would sleep on the bank of the Sura They said We are ones on the path a mitzva and exempt
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Those who travel on the road during the day are exempt from the sukkah during the day and obligated at night. Those who travel on the road at night are exempt from the sukkah at night and obligated during the day. Those who travel on the road both during the day and at night are exempt from the sukkah both during the day and at night. Those who are engaged in a mitzvah are exempt both during the day and at night. For example, Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna were once traveling on Shabbat eve to the house of exile. They reached the entrance of the city of Sura, and they said: We are emissaries of a mitzvah, and we are exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שׁוֹמְרֵי הָעִיר בַּיּוֹם — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה בַּיּוֹם, וְחַיָּיבִין בַּלַּיְלָה. שׁוֹמְרֵי הָעִיר בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַסּוּכָּה בַּלַּיְלָה, וְחַיָּיבִין בַּיּוֹם. שׁוֹמְרֵי הָעִיר בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּטוּרִים מִן הַסּוּכָּה בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Guardians of the city during the day are exempt from sukka during the day and are obligated at night. Guardians of the city at night are exempt from sukka at night and are obligated during the day. Those who guard the city both during the day and at night are exempt from sukka both during the day and at night.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Guardians of the city by day - exempt from the sukkah by day, and obligated at night. Guardians of the city by night - exempt from the sukkah at night, and obligated by day. Guardians of the city, whether by day or by night - exempt from the sukkah both by day and by night.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמְרֵי גַנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִים — פְּטוּרִין בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. וְלִיעְבְּדוּ סוּכָּה הָתָם וְלִיתְּבוּ? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״ — כְּעֵין תָּדוּרוּ.
human_translation: Guardians of gardens and orchards are exempt both during the day and at night. And let them establish a sukka there and reside there. Abaye said: shall you reside” ( as you dwell
llm_translation: Guardians of gardens and orchards - exempt both during the day and at night. And to make a sukkah there, are they exempt or obligated? Abbaye said: "You shall dwell" - similar to your permanent residence.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: פִּרְצָה קוֹרְאָה לַגַּנָּב. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּקָא מְנַטַּר כַּרְיָא דְפֵירֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: A breach summons the thief. What is between There is between them where he is guarding a pile of fruit,
