hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וּמִן הַמּוּפְקָר שָׁלֹשׁ סְעוּדוֹת וְתוּ לָא? וּרְמִינְהִי: הַפֵּיגָם וְהַיַּרְבּוּזִין וְהַשֵּׁיטִים וַחֲלֹגְלוֹגוֹת וְהַכּוּסְבָּר שֶׁבֶּהָרִים וְהַכַּרְפַּס שֶׁבַּנְּהָרוֹת וְהַגַּרְגִּיר שֶׁל אֲפָר — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְנִיקָּחִין מִכׇּל אָדָם בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן נִשְׁמָר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection: And from ownerless three meals and no more? He raised a contradiction Rue and sorrel, asparagus, purslane, coriander that is in the mountains, water parsley of the rivers, and garden-eruca exempt from tithes and they may be purchased from any person during the Sabbatical Year because no of their that is safeguarded.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: And from ownerless items, are there three meals? And it was raised: The wild figs, the wild carobs, the sycamore figs, the carob pods, the caper bushes on the mountains, the wild gourds in the rivers, and the ash gourd — are exempt from tithing, and may be taken by anyone in the Sabbatical year, because there is no equivalent to them that is preserved.

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: בִּכְדֵי מָן שָׁנוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּכְדֵי מָן שָׁנוּ. מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״מָן״ לִישָּׁנָא דִּמְזוֹנֵי הוּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְמַן לָהֶם הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: raised the objection, and he resolved it: taught sufficient sustenance [ man ]. And likewise, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: taught sufficient sustenance [ man ]. From where may it be inferred that man is a term sustenance? as it is written: “And the king appointed [ vayman ] for them
llm_translation: He sets it up for her and he explains it to her: in the amount of time they taught. And so Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: in the amount of time they taught. What is implied by this term "man"? It refers to sustenance, as it is written: "And the king provided for them, etc."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לוּלָב נָמֵי! לוּלָב בַּר שִׁשִּׁית הַנִּכְנָס לִשְׁבִיעִית הוּא. אִי הָכִי אֶתְרוֹג נָמֵי — בַּת שִׁשִּׁית הַנִּכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁבִיעִית הִיא! אֶתְרוֹג, בָּתַר לְקִיטָה אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: If so, also a lulav lulav is of the sixth that is entering the seventh If so, etrog , too, is of the sixth that is entering the seventh an etrog , we go picking
llm_translation: So it is, the lulav is similar! The lulav from the sixth enters into the seventh. So it is, the etrog is similar — the daughter of the sixth that enters into the seventh! The etrog, we go after the picking.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בֵּין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּבֵין רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, לְעִנְיַן שְׁבִיעִית אֶתְרוֹג בָּתַר חֲנָטָה אָזְלִינַן! דִּתְנַן: אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים, וְלַיָּרָק בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד.
human_translation: But both Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer, of Sabbatical Year an etrog we go ripening, as we learned in a mishna an etrog is like of tree in three manners and of a vegetable in one manner.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But between Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer, with regard to the matter of the seventh year, do we go after the etrog before the festival or after the festival? For it was taught in a Mishnah: An etrog is comparable to a tree in three ways, and to vegetables in one way.

hebrew_text: שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים — לְעׇרְלָה וְלִרְבָעִי וְלִשְׁבִיעִית. וּלְיָרָק בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד —
human_translation: of a tree in three manners: to orla , to fourth- and to the Sabbatical Year. of a vegetable in one manner:
llm_translation: Comparable to a tree in three ways - regarding uncircumcision, the fourth year, and the seventh year. And regarding vegetables in one way -

hebrew_text: שֶׁבִּשְׁעַת לְקִיטָתוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן לְכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: that at the time of its picking it is tithed; the statement of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Eliezer says: an etrog is like of tree in every matter.
llm_translation: At the time of its gathering, its juice, the words of Rabban Gamliel. Rabbi Eliezer says: An etrog is comparable to a tree in every way.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אַבְטוּלְמוֹס הֵעִיד מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים: אֶתְרוֹג אַחַר לְקִיטָה לַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ נִמְנוּ בְּאוּשָׁא וְאָמְרוּ בֵּין לַמַּעֲשֵׂר בֵּין לַשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: It was who stated in accordance with tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said Avtolemos, testified in the name of five Elders: etrog by picking to tithes. And our Sages were counted in Usha, and said: both to tithes and to the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna taught: Rabbi Yosei said: Avtulmos testified on behalf of five elders: that one may take an etrog after the gathering for tithing, and our Rabbis were counted in the council and said, whether for tithing or for the seventh year.

hebrew_text: שְׁבִיעִית מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֶתְרוֹג אַחַר לְקִיטָה לַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְאַחַר חֲנָטָה לַשְּׁבִיעִית. וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ נִמְנוּ בְּאוּשָׁא וְאָמְרוּ: אֶתְרוֹג בָּתַר לְקִיטָה, בֵּין לַמַּעֲשֵׂר בֵּין לַשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Sabbatical Year, who mentioned it? is incomplete, and this it is teaching: an etrog by picking to tithes and by ripening to Sabbatical Year. And our Sages were counted in Usha and said: an etrog by both to tithes and to the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: Seventh, who mentioned his name? Hassorei Michasra, and thus it was taught: Another citron for gathering for the tithe, and after that for the seventh year. And our Rabbis counted in Usha and said: Another citron after gathering, whether for the tithe or for the seventh year.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלוּלָב בַּר שִׁשִּׁית הַנִּכְנָס לִשְׁבִיעִית הוּא, הָא דִּשְׁבִיעִית קָדוֹשׁ, אַמַּאי? עֵצִים בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְעֵצִים אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשַּׁת שְׁבִיעִית! (דִּתְנַן:) עֲלֵי קָנִים וַעֲלֵי גְפָנִים שֶׁגִּבְּבָן לְחוּבָּה עַל פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה, לִקְּטָן לַאֲכִילָה — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשַּׁת שְׁבִיעִית, לִקְּטָן לְעֵצִים — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשַּׁת שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: The reason is that it is a lulav of the sixth year that is entering the seventh. of the seventh sacred Why It is merely wood, and wood is not subject the sanctity of the Sabbatical Year, as it was taught reed leaves and vine leaves that one piled for storage upon the field, he gathered them for eating, they are subject the sanctity of the Sabbatical Year; if he gathered them for wood, they are not subject the sanctity of the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: Reason for the lulav in the sixth year that enters the seventh year, it the seventh year is holy, why? It is just regular wood, and regular wood does not have the sanctity of the seventh year! As we learned: Regarding stalks and grapevines that one prunes for decoration in the field, for gathering for eating - they have the sanctity of the seventh year, for gathering for wood - they do not have the sanctity of the seventh year.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לָכֶם לְאׇכְלָה״. ״לָכֶם״ דּוּמְיָא דִּלְאָכְלָה — מִי שֶׁהֲנָאָתוֹ וּבִיעוּרוֹ שָׁוֶה. יָצְאוּ עֵצִים, שֶׁהֲנָאָתָן אַחַר בִּיעוּרָן.
human_translation: different there, as the verse states: for you for food” For you similar to for food; those whose benefit and whose consumption coincide. Wood is excluded, as its benefit is subsequent to its consumption.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "for you to eat." "For you" is similar to "to eat" - one whose benefit and removal are equal. Wood may be removed, as their benefit comes after their removal.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא עֵצִים דְּמִשְׁחַן, דַּהֲנָאָתָן וּבִיעוּרָן שָׁוֶה! אָמַר רָבָא: סְתָם עֵצִים, לְהַסָּקָה הֵן עוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: But isn’t there wood heat benefit coincides with its consumption? Rava said: Undesignated wood exists for fuel,
llm_translation: And where are the beams of the Tabernacle, that their planting and removal are equal! Rava said: Regular beams, they stand for removal.

hebrew_text: וְעֵצִים לְהַסָּקָה, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מוֹסְרִין פֵּירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית לֹא לְמִשְׁרָה וְלֹא לִכְבוּסָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: kindling wood, is tanna’im , as it is taught One may neither transfer Sabbatical-Year produce, for soaking nor for laundering Rabbi Yosei says: One may transfer
llm_translation: "And wood for kindling, it is a teaching, as it was taught: One may not use the fruits of the seventh year for cooking or for laundering. Rabbi Yosei says: One may use."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא — דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לְאׇכְלָה״, וְלֹא לְמִשְׁרָה וְלֹא לִכְבוּסָה. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — אָמַר קְרָא: ״לָכֶם״, ״לָכֶם״ לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמִשְׁרָה וְלִכְבוּסָה. וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הָא כְּתִיב ״לָכֶם״! הַהוּא ״לָכֶם״ דּוּמְיָא דִּלְאׇכְלָה: מִי שֶׁהֲנָאָתוֹ וּבִיעוּרוֹ שָׁוֶה, יָצְאוּ מִשְׁרָה וּכְבוּסָה — שֶׁהֲנָאָתָן אַחַר בִּיעוּרָן.
human_translation: What is the rationale of first tanna ? as the verse states “For food,” And not for soaking and not for laundering. What is the rationale of Rabbi Yosei as the verse states: “For you,” For you, for all your needs, and even for soaking and for laundering. But the first tanna , isn’t it written: “For you”? that “for you” For you, similar to for food; those whose benefit and whose consumption coincide, excludes soaking and laundering, benefit is subsequent to their consumption.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the first Tanna? — For the verse says: "For eating," and not for anointing and not for laundering. What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? — For the verse says: "For you," "For you" for all your needs, even for anointing and laundering. And the first Tanna taught, but it is written "For you"! That "For you" is similar to "For eating": one whose benefit and disposal are equal, they are exempt from anointing and laundering — their benefit comes after their disposal.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״לְאׇכְלָה״! הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ ״לְאׇכְלָה״ וְלֹא לִמְלוּגְמָא. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״לְאׇכְלָה״ — וְלֹא לִמְלוּגְמָא. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״לְאׇכְלָה״ וְלֹא לִמְלוּגְמָא, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא וְלֹא לִכְבוּסָה? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לָכֶם״, הֲרֵי לִכְבוּסָה אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״לְאׇכְלָה״ — ״לְאׇכְלָה״ וְלֹא לִמְלוּגְמָא. מָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַכְּבוּסָה וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַמְּלוּגְמָא?
human_translation: But Rabbi Yosei, isn’t it written: “For food,” He needs that For food, and not for a remedy [ melugma ], as it is taught For food and not for a remedy. you say: For food and not for a remedy, or it is only: and not for laundering? When says: “For you,” for laundering is stated How, do I uphold “For food”? For food, and not for a remedy. What did you see to include the laundering and to exclude the a remedy?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei: Is it not written "for eating"? That one wants it for "eating" and not for mixing. As it was taught: "for eating" — and not for mixing. Do you say "for eating" and not for mixing, or is it rather for washing? When it says "for you," it is indeed said for washing. What am I fulfilling "for eating" — "for eating" and not for mixing. Why do you want to include washing and exclude mixing?

hebrew_text: מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַכְּבוּסָה שֶׁשָּׁוָה בְּכׇל אָדָם, וּמוֹצִיא אֶת הַמְּלוּגְמָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ שָׁוָה לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: I include laundering, which equally to every person, and I exclude a remedy, which not equally to every person;
llm_translation: I increase the laundry that is equal for all people, and I remove the mixed garment that is not equal for all people.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לְאׇכְלָה״ — וְלֹא לִמְלוּגְמָא, ״לְאׇכְלָה״ — וְלֹא לְזִילּוּף, ״לְאׇכְלָה״ — וְלֹא לַעֲשׂוֹת מִמֶּנָּה אַפִּיקְטְוִיזִין? כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, הָא אִיכָּא נָמֵי מִשְׁרָה וּכְבוּסָה.
human_translation: Who taught that which the Sages taught For food, and not for a remedy; for food, and not for sprinkling for food, and not to make it an emetic [ apiktoizin ] In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as, if the Rabbis, isn’t there also soaking and laundering
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna that taught this that the Rabbis taught: "For eating" - and not for mixing, "For eating" - and not for sprinkling, "For eating" - and not to make from it apiktevizin? Like whom? Like Rabbi Yosei. For if it were the Rabbis, there is also the aspect of soaking and rinsing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין שְׁבִיעִית מִתְחַלֶּלֶת אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Sabbatical-Year is deconsecrated only by means of purchase; Rabbi Yoḥanan said: both by means of purchase and by means of redemption.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The seventh year is only violated through a transaction. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether through a transaction or through common use.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל הַזֹּאת וְגוֹ׳״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר״, דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח וְלֹא דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יוֹבֵל הִיא קֹדֶשׁ״. מָה קֹדֶשׁ — בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל, אַף שְׁבִיעִית — בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל.
human_translation: What is the rationale for Rabbi Elazar? as it is written: “In this year of Jubilee and juxtaposed to it “And if you sell an item by means of purchase and not by means of redemption. And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the rationale for as it is written: “For it is a Jubilee; it shall be consecrated just as consecrated both by means of purchase and by means of redemption, so too, Sabbatical-Year both by means of purchase and by means of redemption.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar? As it is written: "In this Jubilee year, etc.," and adjacent to it: "And if you sell a sale," in the manner of a transaction and not in the manner of desecration. And what is the reason of Rabbi Yochanan? As it is written: "For it is a Jubilee, it is holy." Just as with holiness - whether in the manner of a transaction or in the manner of desecration, so too with the seventh year - whether in the manner of a transaction or in the manner of desecration.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַאי ״כִּי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: בּוֹא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה קָשֶׁה אֲבָקָהּ שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית וְכוּ׳. אָדָם נוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית, לְסוֹף מוֹכֵר אֶת מִטַּלְטְלָיו וְאֶת כֵּלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל הַזֹּאת תָּשֻׁבוּ אִישׁ אֶל אֲחוּזָּתוֹ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר לַעֲמִיתֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what does he do with this “If you sell an item”? He needs it in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: Come and see how severe hint of the Sabbatical Year is; A person engages in commerce with Sabbatical-Year produce ultimately sell his movable property and his vessels, as it is stated: “In this year of Jubilee and juxtaposed to it, “And if you sell an item
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, this "when you make a sale" what does it do? It is needed for him according to Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: Come and see how difficult is the dust of the Sabbatical year, etc. A person may engage in transactions with the produce of the Sabbatical year, but in the end, he sells his moveable property and utensils, as it is stated: "In this Jubilee year, each of you shall return to his own property," and adjacent to it: "And if you make a sale to your neighbor, etc."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, הַאי קְרָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״כִּי יוֹבֵל הִיא קֹדֶשׁ״. מָה קֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו — אַף שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת אֶת דָּמֶיהָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, what does he do with this verse which Rabbi Yoḥanan He needs it in accordance with which is taught “For it is a Jubilee; it shall be consecrated just as consecrated takes effect on money they so too, Sabbatical-Year takes effect on money it
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, "What does Rabbi Yochanan do with this verse? He interprets it according to the following teaching: 'For it is a Jubilee, it is holy.' Just as holiness takes hold of its blood, so too the seventh year takes hold of its produce."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת אֶת דָּמֶיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יוֹבֵל הִיא קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״, מָה קֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו — וְאָסוּר, אַף שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת אֶת דָּמֶיהָ — וַאֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar, and it is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan. it is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar: Sabbatical-Year takes effect on money as it is stated: “For it is a Jubilee; it shall be consecrated just as consecrated takes effect on money they and prohibited so too, Sabbatical-Year takes effect on money it and prohibited
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, and it was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan. It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Elazar: The seventh year captures its blood, as it is stated: "For it is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you." Just as the holiness of the Jubilee year captures its blood — and it is prohibited, so too the seventh year captures its blood — and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִי, מָה קֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס דָּמָיו — וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין, אַף שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת אֶת דָּמֶיהָ — וְיוֹצֵאת לְחוּלִּין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּהְיֶה״, בַּהֲוָיָיתָהּ תְּהֵא.
human_translation: Or just as consecrated takes effect on money they assumes non-sacred so too, Sabbatical-Year takes effect on money it assumes non-sacred the verse states: “It shall be It shall be as it is.
llm_translation: If, what holy holds its blood - and goes out to secular, also the seventh holds its blood - and goes out to secular? The verse says: "It shall be," in its existence it shall be.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? לָקַח בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית בָּשָׂר — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מִתְבַּעֲרִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. לָקַח בַּבָּשָׂר דָּגִים — יָצָא בָּשָׂר וְנִכְנְסוּ דָּגִים. לָקַח בַּדָּגִים יַיִן — יָצְאוּ דָּגִים וְנִכְנַס יַיִן. לָקַח בַּיַּיִן שֶׁמֶן — יָצָא יַיִן וְנִכְנַס שֶׁמֶן.
human_translation: How so? one purchased meat with Sabbatical-Year produce, both this, and that, must be removed during the Sabbatical Year. purchased fish for the meat, the meat emerges and the fish assumes purchased wine for the fish, the fish emerges and the wine assumes he purchased oil for the wine, the wine emerges and the oil assumes
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? If one took seventh-year produce with meat - both the produce and the meat are subject to the laws of the seventh year. If one took fish with meat - the meat goes out and the fish come in. If one took fish with wine - the fish go out and the wine comes in. If one took wine with oil - the wine goes out and the oil comes in."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד: אַחֲרוֹן אַחֲרוֹן נִכְנָס בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וּפְרִי עַצְמוֹ אָסוּר. מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״לָקַח״ ״לָקַח״, אַלְמָא דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח — אִין, דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל — לָא.
human_translation: How so? The last assumes of the Sabbatical Year, and the produce itself forbidden From that teaches Purchased, purchased, apparently by means of transaction, yes, by means of redemption, no,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? The last one enters in the seventh year, and its fruit is prohibited. From the verse 'to take, to take,' we learn that the normal way of acquisition is effective, but the way of desecration is not."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶחָד שְׁבִיעִית וְאֶחָד מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מִתְחַלְּלִין עַל בְּהֵמָה חַיָּה וָעוֹף, בֵּין חַיִּין בֵּין שְׁחוּטִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל שְׁחוּטִין — מִתְחַלְּלִין, עַל חַיִּין — אֵין מִתְחַלְּלִין, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְגַדֵּל מֵהֶן עֲדָרִים.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan. Both Sabbatical-Year and second-tithe are deconsecrated upon domesticated animals, undomesticated animals, and fowl, whether alive or whether slaughtered; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Upon slaughtered they are deconsecrated; upon alive, they are not deconsecrated. decree lest one raise flocks from them.
llm_translation: It was taught in the Mishnah in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan: One animal of the seventh year tithe and one animal of the tithe of animals desecrate the sanctity of the tithe upon a living domestic animal and bird, whether they are alive or slaughtered, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Regarding slaughtered animals — they desecrate the sanctity, but regarding living animals — they do not desecrate the sanctity, as a precaution lest one raise herds from them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת
human_translation: Rava said: dispute
llm_translation: Rava said: A dispute.

hebrew_text: בִּזְכָרִים, אֲבָל בִּנְקֵבוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: עַל שְׁחוּטִין — מִתְחַלְּלִין, עַל חַיִּין — אֵין מִתְחַלְּלִין, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יְגַדֵּל מֵהֶן עֲדָרִים.
human_translation: with regard to male However, with regard to female everyone agrees upon slaughtered is deconsecrated, upon alive, is not deconsecrated. a decree lest one raise flocks from
llm_translation: In males, but in females - the words of all: regarding those slaughtered - they become defiled, regarding those alive - they do not become defiled, a decree lest one raise herds from them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּפְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, אֲבָל בִּפְרִי שֵׁנִי — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל. וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״לָקַח״ ״לָקַח״, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״לָקַח״, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״לָקַח״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: dispute is with regard to the original produce However, with regard to secondary produce everyone agrees both by means of purchase and by means of redemption. And that teaches: Purchased, purchased, since taught the first clause purchased, he taught the latter clause purchased,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Disagreement in the first fruit, but in the second fruit — the words of everyone: whether by way of acquisition or by way of desecration. And that which it teaches "acquisition" "acquisition," it is because the first Tanna taught "acquisition," and the later Tanna also taught "acquisition."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ סֶלַע שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית וּבִיקֵּשׁ לִיקַּח בּוֹ חָלוּק, כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל חֶנְווֹנִי הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי בְּסֶלַע פֵּירוֹת, וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ, וְחוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי פֵּירוֹת הַלָּלוּ נְתוּנִים לְךָ בְּמַתָּנָה. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֵא לְךָ סֶלַע זוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, וְהַלָּה לוֹקֵחַ בָּהֶן מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה. וְהָא הָכָא, דִּפְרִי שֵׁנִי הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח — אִין, דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל — לָא!
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rav Ashi: one who has a sela of the Sabbatical Year and seeks to purchase a garment with it, how should he do He should go to the storekeeper whose he typically and say to him: Give me fruits in sela , and gives him And then he says to These fruits are given to you as a gift. And says to him: Here is a sela for you as a gift, and that purchases with it whatever he wants, But here, isn’t it secondary produce, and teaches: By means of purchase, yes, by means of redemption, no,
llm_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rav Ashi: One who has a seventh-year produce rock and sought to acquire a portion from it, how should he proceed? He should go to a merchant who is accustomed to dealing with him, and say to him: "Give me the fruits from the rock," and he gives them to him. Then he goes back and says to him: "These fruits are a gift to you." And he says to him: "Here, take this rock as a gift, and the other party can take from it whatever he desires." And here, in this case, the second fruit is the subject, and it is taught: In the way of acquisition — yes, in the way of desecration — no!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּפְרִי שֵׁנִי, אֲבָל בִּפְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח — אִין, דֶּרֶךְ חִילּוּל — לָא. וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי: אֶחָד שְׁבִיעִית וְאֶחָד מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי — מַאי שְׁבִיעִית? דְּמֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, the dispute is with regard to secondary produce; however, with regard to original produce, everyone agrees: By means of purchase, yes, by means of redemption, no, And that which is taught Both Sabbatical-Year and second-tithe What Sabbatical-Year money Sabbatical-Year
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: The dispute is regarding the second tithe, but regarding the first tithe, everyone agrees: in the normal course of business - no, in a case of desecration - yes. And that which was taught: one is seventh-year produce and one is second tithe - what is seventh-year produce? The value of seventh-year produce.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״מַעֲשֵׂר״ — מַעֲשֵׂר מַמָּשׁ? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״. אֶלָּא דְּמֵי מַעֲשֵׂר — הָכָא נָמֵי דְּמֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: as, if you do not say so second tithe actual second-tithe isn’t it written and bind up the money in your hand… Rather, money second-tithe Here, too, money Sabbatical-Year
llm_translation: If you don't say so, "tithe" — an actual tithe? But it is written: "And you shall bind the money in your hand." Rather, the value of the tithe — here it is also the value of the seventh year.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה לוּלָב נִיטָּל בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ שִׁבְעָה, וּבַמְּדִינָה יוֹם אֶחָד. מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהֵא לוּלָב נִיטָּל בַּמְּדִינָה שִׁבְעָה, זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Originally, lulav was taken in the Temple seven and in the country one day. Once the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the lulav be taken in the country seven commemoration of the Temple.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Initially, one would take the lulav in the Temple for seven days, and in the provinces for one day. When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted that the lulav should be taken in the provinces for seven days, as a remembrance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר.
human_translation: And that the entire day of waving it be prohibited
llm_translation: And that the day of the waving is entirely forbidden.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא לַן דְּעָבְדִינַן זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי אַעֲלֶה אֲרוּכָה לָךְ וּמִמַּכּוֹתַיִךְ אֶרְפָּאֵךְ נְאֻם ה׳ כִּי נִדָּחָה קָרְאוּ לָךְ צִיּוֹן הִיא דּוֹרֵשׁ אֵין לָהּ״. ״דּוֹרֵשׁ אֵין לָהּ״, מִכְּלַל דְּבָעֲיָא דְּרִישָׁה.
human_translation: From where do we we institute commemoration of the Temple? Rabbi Yoḥanan said as the verse states: “For I will restore health unto you and I will heal you of your wounds, says the Lord; because they have called you an outcast, she is Zion, there is none that seeks her” by inference that it requires seeking,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar mena lan de'avdinan zekher laMikdash? Amar Rabbi Yochanan, de'amar kra: 'Ki a'aleh arukha lakh u'mimakotayikh erpaeikh ne'um Hashem ki niddakha kar'u lakh Tzion hi doresh ein lah.' 'Doresh ein lah,' miklal de'ba'aya derisha." English translation: "How do we know that we should mention the memory of the Temple? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: 'For I will bring healing to you and cure you of your wounds,' says the Lord, 'because they called you an outcast, saying: This is Zion, no one seeks her.' 'No one seeks her,' indicating the need for seeking."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף. מַאי טַעְמָא? מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְיֹאמְרוּ: אֶשְׁתָּקַד מִי לֹא אָכַלְנוּ בְּהֵאִיר מִזְרָח? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל. וְאִינְהוּ לָא יָדְעִי דְּאֶשְׁתָּקַד דְּלָא הֲוָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ — הֵאִיר מִזְרָח, הִתִּיר. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיכָּא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ — עוֹמֶר מַתִּיר.
human_translation: that the entire day of waving What is the reason soon the Temple will be rebuilt, and will say: Last year, didn’t we eat as soon as the eastern was illuminated, Now, too, let us eat And they do not know that last year, when there was no Temple, the illuminating of the eastern permitted now that there is a Temple, the omer permits
llm_translation: And that the day should be prolonged. What is the reason? So that the Temple may be quickly rebuilt, and they will say: "Who has not eaten from the Paschal lamb that was roasted in the east?" Now we can eat. And they did not know that the Temple was not yet built — when it was dark in the east, it was permitted. Now that the Temple exists — the omer offering permits.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיבְּנִי אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיבְּנִי בְּשִׁיתְּסַר, הֲרֵי הִתִּיר הֵאִיר מִזְרָח! אֶלָּא דְּאִיבְּנִי בַּחֲמֵיסַר, מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וּלְהַלָּן תִּשְׁתְּרֵי, דְּהָא תְּנַן: הָרְחוֹקִים, מוּתָּרִין מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וּלְהַלָּן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מִתְעַצְּלִים בּוֹ!
human_translation: When that will be rebuilt If we say that it will be rebuilt on the sixteenth illuminating of the eastern sky permitted Rather, that it will be rebuilt on the fifteenth illuminating of the eastern sky. from midday and onward let it be permitted as we learned The distant are permitted from midday and onward because court are not indolent with regard to
llm_translation: When was it built? If you say it was built in the sixth hour, behold, the east has already been illuminated! Rather, if you say it was built in the fifth hour, from midday onwards and beyond, it will be permitted, for we learned: Those who are far away are permitted from midday onwards and beyond, because the court does not procrastinate with it!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיבְּנִי בְּלֵילְיָא, אִי נָמֵי סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. (אָמַר) רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר: מִן הַתּוֹרָה הוּא אָסוּר, דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: No, necessary will be rebuilt at night, Alternatively, adjacent to sunset Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai stated in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: It is prohibited by Torah law as it is written:
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it is built at night, if not close to sunset. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai in the name of Rabbi Yehuda said it, as he said: It is forbidden from the Torah, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״עַד עֶצֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״ — עַד עִיצּוּמוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם, וְקָסָבַר ״עַד״ וְעַד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: until this selfsame [ etzem ] day, until the essence [ itzumo ] of the day, And he holds that “Until,” until is inclusive,
llm_translation: "Until the bone of this day" - until its very end, and he holds that "until" means until in general.

hebrew_text: וּמִי סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ? וְהָא מִפְלָיג פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ, (דְּתַנְיָא:) מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא מִן הַתּוֹרָה הוּא אָסוּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד עֶצֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״ — עַד עִיצּוּמוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם!
human_translation: And does hold in accordance with But doesn’t he disagree with him, as it is taught Once the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the entire day of waving it be prohibited Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Isn’t it prohibited by Torah law, as it is written: “Until this selfsame day,” Until the essence of the day?
llm_translation: And who holds like his opinion? And this is what he disputes, (as it was taught:) When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai decreed that the day of Tisha B'Av should be entirely forbidden. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: But isn't it already forbidden by the Torah, as it is written: "Until this very day" - until the end of the day!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הוּא דְּקָא טָעֵי, הוּא סָבַר מִדְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר. וְלָא הִיא, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא קָאָמַר. וְהָא ״הִתְקִין״ קָאָמַר! מַאי ״הִתְקִין״ — דָּרַשׁ וְהִתְקִין.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehuda who is mistaken. He thought is saying by rabbinic law. And that is not he is saying by Torah law. But didn’t say: instituted, What instituted? he interpreted and instituted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, he is the one who is mistaken, he holds like the Rabbis. But is it not so? He is speaking from the Torah. And this "he established" he said! What is "he established" - he interpreted and established.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, כׇּל הָעָם מוֹלִיכִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. לַמׇּחֳרָת מַשְׁכִּימִין וּבָאִין, כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מַכִּיר אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ וְנוֹטְלוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן בְּלוּלָבוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, וּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַחַג — אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּלוּלָבוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְשָׁכַח וְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַלּוּלָב לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוֹצִיאוֹ בִּרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: the first of festival of Sukkot occurs on Shabbat, all of the people bring their lulavim to the synagogue The next day, rises early and comes Each and every one recognizes his and takes it. because the Sages said: A person does not fulfill his obligation on the first day of the Festival with the lulav of another, and the rest of the days of the Festival a person fulfills his obligation with the lulav of another. Rabbi Yosei says: the first day of Festival occurs on Shabbat, and he forgot and carried the lulav out into the public domain, he is exempt because he carried it out with permission,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: On the first day of the festival that falls on Shabbat, all the people bring their lulavs to the synagogue. The next day, they rise early and come, and each person recognizes his own and takes it, because the Sages said: A person does not fulfill his obligation on the first day of the festival with the lulav of his fellow, but on the rest of the festival days, a person fulfills his obligation with the lulav of his fellow. Rabbi Yosei says: On the first day of the festival that falls on Shabbat, if one forgot and took out the lulav to a public domain, he is exempt, because he took it out unintentionally.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם״, שֶׁתְּהֵא לְקִיחָה בְּיַד כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד. ״לָכֶם״, מִשֶּׁלָּכֶם — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַשָּׁאוּל וְאֶת הַגָּזוּל. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג בְּלוּלָבוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נְתָנוֹ לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “And you shall take that there should be taking in the hand of each and every yourselves From your own, to exclude a borrowed or stolen From here the Sages stated: A person does not fulfill his obligation on the first day of Festival with the lulav of another unless gave it to him as gift,
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words teaching us? For the Rabbis taught: "And you shall take," that the taking should be done by each individual. "For yourselves," from what belongs to you — to exempt oneself from the obligation of the first day of the festival with the lulav of another. From here the Sages said: A person does not fulfill his obligation on the first day of the festival with the lulav of another unless it was given to him as a gift.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִין בִּסְפִינָה, וְלֹא הָיָה לוּלָב אֶלָּא לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּלְבַד, שֶׁלְּקָחוֹ בְּאֶלֶף זוּז. נְטָלוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְיָצָא בּוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּמַתָּנָה. נְטָלוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְיָצָא בּוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה בְּמַתָּנָה. נְטָלוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְיָצָא בּוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. נְטָלוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְיָצָא בּוֹ, וְהֶחְזִירוֹ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: an incident involving Rabban Gamliel, and Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, and Rabbi Akiva, who were traveling on a ship and only Rabban Gamliel had a lulav , which he bought for one thousand zuz . Rabban Gamliel took it and fulfilled with it and then gave it to Rabbi Yehoshua as a gift. Rabbi Yehoshua took it and fulfilled with it and gave it to Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya as a gift. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya took it and fulfilled with it and gave it to Rabbi Akiva as a gift. Rabbi Akiva took it and fulfilled with it and returned it to Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: And it happened with Rabban Gamliel, and Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and Rabbi Akiva, who were traveling on a ship, and there was only one lulav, which Rabban Gamliel alone had acquired for a thousand zuz. Rabban Gamliel took it and went out with it, and they gave it as a gift to Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Yehoshua took it and went out with it, and they gave it as a gift to Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah took it and went out with it, and they gave it as a gift to Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Akiva took it and went out with it, and they returned it to Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר הֶחְזִירוֹ? מִלְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מַתָּנָה עַל מְנָת לְהַחְזִיר — שְׁמָהּ מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: Why do I to say returned teaches us matter in passing, a gift on the condition that it be returned is considered gift.
llm_translation: "Why do I need to say 'return it'? The word itself implies its return: a gift given on condition of return - its name is a gift."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: ״הֵא לְךָ אֶתְרוֹג זֶה עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּחְזִירֵהוּ לִי״. נְטָלוֹ וְיָצָא בּוֹ, הֶחְזִירוֹ — יָצָא, לֹא הֶחְזִירוֹ — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: like that which Rava said, Here is an etrog for you on condition that you return it to me, and took it and fulfilled his obligation with it, he returned he fulfilled he did not return he did not fulfill
llm_translation: This is what Rava said: "Here, take this etrog on condition that you return it to me." He took it and went out with it. If he returned it - he fulfilled his obligation; if he did not return it - he did not fulfill his obligation.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר שֶׁלְּקָחוֹ בְּאֶלֶף זוּז? לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כַּמָּה מִצְוֹת חֲבִיבוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Why do I to say that bought for one thousand zuz ? to inform you how beloved mitzvot were to them
llm_translation: To what purpose for me to say that he bought it for a thousand zuz? To inform you how many beloved commandments are upon it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַבָּא צַלּוֹיֵי קָא מְצַלֵּי בֵּיהּ. מֵיתִיבִי: לֹא יֹאחַז אָדָם תְּפִילִּין בְּיָדוֹ וְסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בְּחֵיקוֹ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. וְלֹא יַשְׁתִּין בָּהֶן מַיִם, וְלֹא יִישַׁן בָּהֶן לֹא שֵׁינַת קֶבַע וְלֹא שֵׁינַת עֲרַאי.
human_translation: Mar bar Ameimar said to Rav Ashi: father would pray with raises an objection: A person not hold phylacteries in his hand or a Torah scroll in his lap and pray neither should he urinate with them nor should he sleep with them neither a deep sleep nor a brief nap.
llm_translation: He said to him, Master, son of Amemar, to Rav Ashei: Abba is wrapping himself in it. They raised an objection: A person should not hold Tefillin in his hand and a Torah scroll in his lap and pray. And he should not urinate while wearing them, and he should not sleep in them, neither a permanent sleep nor a temporary sleep.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: סַכִּין וּקְעָרָה, כִּכָּר וּמָעוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן. הָתָם לָאו מִצְוָה נִינְהוּ, וּטְרִיד בְּהוּ. הָכָא מִצְוָה נִינְהוּ, וְלָא טְרִיד בְּהוּ.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: a knife, a bowl a loaf or money, these are similar to those There, they are not a mitzva, and he is preoccupied with them. Here, they are a mitzva, he is not preoccupied with them
llm_translation: And Samuel said: A knife and a bowl, a loaf and coins - these are equivalent to them. There, they are not a commandment, and one may trouble them. Here, they are a commandment, and one may not trouble them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: כָּךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגָן שֶׁל אַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, אָדָם יוֹצֵא מִבֵּיתוֹ — וְלוּלָבוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. הוֹלֵךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת — לוּלָבוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּמִתְפַּלֵּל — וְלוּלָבוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה וְנוֹשֵׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו — מַנִּיחוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. הוֹלֵךְ לְבַקֵּר חוֹלִים וּלְנַחֵם אֲבֵלִים — לוּלָבוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. נִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ — מְשַׁגֵּר לוּלָבוֹ בְּיַד בְּנוֹ, וּבְיַד עַבְדּוֹ, וּבְיַד שְׁלוּחוֹ.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok says: This was the custom of the people of Jerusalem A person leaves his house, and his lulav is in his hand; he goes to the synagogue, his lulav is in his hand; he recites Shema and prays, and his lulav is in his hand; he reads the Torah and lifts his hands he places it on the ground He goes to visit the ill or to console mourners, his lulav is in his hand; he enters the study hall he sends his lulav in the hands of his son, in the hands of his slave, or in the hands of his agent.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok says: This was the custom of the men of Jerusalem: A person would leave his house - and his lulav in his hand. He would go to the synagogue - his lulav in his hand. He would recite the Shema and pray - and his lulav in his hand. He would read from the Torah and raise his hands - he would place it on the ground. He would go to visit the sick and comfort mourners - his lulav in his hand. If he entered the study hall - he would send his lulav with his son, or with his servant, or with his messenger.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כַּמָּה הָיוּ זְרִיזִין בְּמִצְוֹת.
human_translation: What is teaching us to inform you how vigilant they were in mitzvot
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? To inform you how diligent they were in fulfilling commandments.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר יוֹם טוֹב. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says day Festival Abaye said:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says, "Yom Tov." Abaye said:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא יָצָא בּוֹ, אֲבָל יָצָא בּוֹ — חַיָּיב. הָא מִדְּאַגְבְּהֵיהּ נְפַק בֵּיהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁהֲפָכוֹ.
human_translation: taught only where he did not fulfill However, he fulfilled liable Didn’t he, from that he lifted it, fulfill with it? Abaye said: where he overturned it
llm_translation: They did not teach except that if he did not go out with it, but he went out with it - he is liable. But from where did he take it out? Abaye said: When he turned it over.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא הֲפָכוֹ, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹצִיאוֹ בִּכְלִי. וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: לְקִיחָה עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר — שְׁמָהּ לְקִיחָה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי דֶּרֶךְ כָּבוֹד, אֲבָל דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן — לָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Even if you say that he did not invert it, with what are we dealing here? where he took out in a vessel But isn’t Rava the one who said taking by means of another object is considered taking? This applies only a deferential manner, But a degrading manner, no,
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say that he did not turn it over, here we are dealing with what? For example, when he took it out in a vessel. And Rava is the one who said: If the taking was by means of another object — its name is taking! Those matters that are done in a respectful manner, yes, but matters done in a disrespectful manner — no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, עוֹלַת הָעוֹף שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בֵּין אֲגַפַּיִים, וּכְסָבוּר חַטַּאת הָעוֹף הִיא וַאֲכָלָהּ — פָּטוּר. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה — פָּטוּר? הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rabbi Yosei would say: a bird a burnt-offering that is found among birds and thought that it was a bird a sin-offering and he ate it, he is exempt What is teaching us? that one erred in the matter of a mitzva, he is exempt? This is that
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Rabbi Yosei says, a bird offering found between the wings, and he holds that it is a sin offering and one ate it - exempt. What does this teach us, that if one erred in a matter of a commandment - exempt? That is so!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה פָּטוּר — הַיְינוּ דַּעֲבַד מִצְוָה. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה וְלָא עֲבַד מִצְוָה — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say it is there, that one who erred in a matter of a mitzva is exempt that is he performed a mitzva; however, here, where he erred in the matter of a mitzva but did not perform a mitzva say no, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? There, one who erred in a matter of a commandment is exempt - that is, he performed the commandment. But here, one who erred in a matter of a commandment and did not perform the commandment - say no, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתָּמִיד שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְבוּקָּר כְּהִלְכָתוֹ בַּשַּׁבָּת — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת, וְצָרִיךְ תָּמִיד אַחֵר!
human_translation: raises an objection. Rabbi Yosei says: one who slaughters the daily offering on Shabbat that is not properly inspected, He is liable a sin-offering, and he needs a different daily offering.
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi Yosei says: One who slaughters the continual offering that is not inspected according to its law on Shabbat - is liable for a sin offering, and another continual offering is required!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא. דְּהָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר חַתַּאי אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֱבִיאוֹ מִלִּשְׁכָּה שֶׁאֵינָן מְבוּקָּרִין.
human_translation: said except from that as it was stated concerning Rav Shmuel bar Ḥatai said Rav Hamnuna Sava said Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashian said Rav Huna said Rav said: a case where they brought from a chamber that are not inspected.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Son of that kind." For it was said about him, Rav Shmuel bar Chatati said in the name of Rav Hamnuna the Elder said in the name of Rav Yitzchak bar Ashyayan said in the name of Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: For example, when they brought him from an unclean chamber.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְקַבֶּלֶת אִשָּׁה מִיָּד בְּנָהּ וּמִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ, וּמַחְזִירָתוֹ לְמַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּשַּׁבָּת מַחְזִירִין, בְּיוֹם טוֹב מוֹסִיפִין, וּבַמּוֹעֵד מַחְלִיפִין.
human_translation: A woman receive from her son or from her husband and return it on Shabbat to the water Rabbi Yehuda says: On Shabbat one may return and on the Festival one may add during the Festival, one may change
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman may immerse herself immediately after childbirth, both in the presence of her son and in the presence of her husband, and she may immerse her husband's vessel in water on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: On Shabbat, vessels may be immersed, on Yom Tov they may be added to, and on a festival they may be exchanged.

hebrew_text: קָטָן הַיּוֹדֵעַ לְנַעְנֵעַ — חַיָּיב בְּלוּלָב.
human_translation: A minor who knows to wave is obligated in lulav
llm_translation: A minor who knows how to shake - is obligated in the lulav.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִשָּׁה לָאו בַּת חִיּוּבָא הִיא, אֵימָא לָא תְּקַבֵּל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. lest you say: Since a woman is not subject to the obligation say she should not receive teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it obvious? What might you say: Since a woman is not obligated, say she should not accept, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: קָטָן הַיּוֹדֵעַ לְנַעְנֵעַ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קָטָן הַיּוֹדֵעַ לְנַעְנֵעַ — חַיָּיב בְּלוּלָב, לְהִתְעַטֵּף — חַיָּיב בְּצִיצִית, לִשְׁמוֹר תְּפִילִּין — אָבִיו לוֹקֵחַ לוֹ תְּפִילִּין, יוֹדֵעַ לְדַבֵּר — אָבִיו מְלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה וּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: A minor who knows to wave The Sages taught: A minor who knows how to wave is obligated lulav ; to wrap himself is obligated in ritual fringes; to preserve phylacteries his father buys him phylacteries; knows to speak, his father teaches him Torah and Shema .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A minor who knows how to shake the lulav. The Rabbis taught: A minor who knows how to shake the lulav — is obligated in taking the lulav, to wrap himself — is obligated in tzitzit, to guard his tefillin — his father buys him tefillin, when he knows how to speak — his father teaches him Torah and the recitation of the Shema.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: ״תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה קְהִלַּת יַעֲקֹב״. קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע מַאי הִיא? פָּסוּק רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And what is Torah Rav Hamnuna said: “Moses commanded us Torah, an inheritance of the congregation of Jacob” And what is Shema first verse
llm_translation: Torah, what is it? Rav Hamnuna said: "Torah commanded us by Moses, an inheritance of the congregation of Jacob." What is the recitation of Shema? The first verse.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹדֵעַ לִשְׁמוֹר גּוּפוֹ — אוֹכְלִין עַל גּוּפוֹ טְהָרוֹת. לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת יָדָיו — אוֹכְלִין עַל יָדָיו טְהָרוֹת. הַיּוֹדֵעַ לִישָּׁאֵל, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — סְפֵיקוֹ טָמֵא, בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סְפֵיקוֹ טָהוֹר. הַיּוֹדֵעַ לִפְרוֹס כַּפָּיו — חוֹלְקִין לוֹ תְּרוּמָה בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: who knows to protect his body eat ritually pure with his body. to protect his hands eat ritually pure with his hands. who knows to be asked in the private domain uncertainty, impure. in the public domain uncertainty, pure. who knows to spread his hands one distributes teruma to him in the granary
llm_translation: One who is knowledgeable to guard his body - may eat upon his body pure. To guard his hands - may eat upon his hands pure. One who is knowledgeable to lend to Israel, with the permission of the individual - his doubt is impure, with the permission of the public - his doubt is pure. One who is knowledgeable to spread out his palms - they allocate for him terumah in the granary.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹדֵעַ לִשְׁחוֹט — אוֹכְלִין מִשְּׁחִיטָתוֹ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְהוּא שֶׁגָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבָּיו.
human_translation: who knows to slaughter one may eat from that he slaughtered. Rav Huna said: provided that an adult is standing over him
llm_translation: The one who knows how to slaughter — may eat from his slaughter. Rav Huna said: And this is when he is standing on his back.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל כְּזַיִת דָּגָן — מַרְחִיקִין מִצּוֹאָתוֹ וּמִמֵּימֵי רַגְלָיו אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹכְלוֹ בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יֵיבָא: וּבַגָּדוֹל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיוֹסִיף דַּעַת יוֹסִיף מַכְאוֹב״.
human_translation: is able to eat an olive-bulk of grain, one distances four cubits from his feces and from his urine Rav Ḥisda said: provided that can eat in to eat a half-loaf Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Yeiva, said: And with regard to an adult, even if he is unable to eat in to eat a half-loaf as it is written: “And he that increases knowledge, increases sorrow”
llm_translation: One could eat a k'zayit of grain - we distance from his excrement and from the water of his feet four cubits. Rav Ḥisda said: And this is when he can eat it in the time it takes to eat half a loaf. Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Yeiva, said: And with a large animal, even though he cannot eat it in the time it takes to eat half a loaf - as it is written: "And with increased knowledge comes increased pain."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל כְּזַיִת צָלִי — שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו אֶת הַפֶּסַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְבָרֵר אֲכִילָה. כֵּיצַד? נוֹתְנִין לוֹ צְרוֹר — וְזוֹרְקוֹ, אֱגוֹז — וְנוֹטְלוֹ.
human_translation: is able to eat an olive-bulk of roasted one slaughters the Paschal lamb on his as it is stated: “According to every man’s eating Rabbi Yehuda says: until he is able to discern eating. How one gives him a pebble and he throws it a nut and he takes it,
llm_translation: One could eat like an olive of roasted meat — they slaughter the Passover offering for him, as it is stated: "According to the eating of each one." Rabbi Yehuda says: Until he is able to clarify his eating. How so? They give him a bundle — and he throws it, a nut — and he takes it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ לוּלָב הַגָּזוּל
llm_translation: We will return to you, stolen lulav.

hebrew_text: לוּלָב וַעֲרָבָה — שִׁשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה. הַהַלֵּל וְהַשִּׂמְחָה — שְׁמוֹנָה. סוּכָּה וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם — שִׁבְעָה. הֶחָלִיל — חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: lulav and willow branch six or seven the hallel and the rejoicing, is in effect for eight sukka and the water libation are seven The flute five or six
llm_translation: Lulav and willow - six and seven. Hallel and joy - eight. Sukkah and water libation - seven. Flute - five and six.

hebrew_text: לוּלָב שִׁבְעָה, כֵּיצַד? יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — לוּלָב שִׁבְעָה, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַיָּמִים — שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: lulav seven How the first day of the Festival occurs on Shabbat, lulav seven And rest of the days six
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Lulav seven, how? The first day of the festival that falls on Shabbat - lulav seven, and the rest of all the days - six."

hebrew_text: עֲרָבָה שִׁבְעָה, כֵּיצַד? יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי שֶׁל עֲרָבָה שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — עֲרָבָה שִׁבְעָה, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַיָּמִים — שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: willow branch seven How the seventh day of willow branch occurs on Shabbat, willow branch seven And rest of the days six
llm_translation: Aravah seven, how? day the seventh of Aravah that happens to be on the Sabbath — Aravah seven, and rest all the days — six.

hebrew_text: מִצְוַת לוּלָב, כֵּיצַד (בַּשַּׁבָּת)? יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת מוֹלִיכִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן לְהַר הַבַּיִת, וְהַחַזָּנִין מְקַבְּלִין מֵהֶן וְסוֹדְרִין אוֹתָן עַל גַּבֵּי אִיצְטְבָא, וְהַזְּקֵנִים מַנִּיחִין אֶת שֶׁלָּהֶן בְּלִשְׁכָּה. וּמְלַמְּדִין אוֹתָם לוֹמַר: כׇּל מִי שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לוּלָבִי לְיָדוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה.
human_translation: How is the mitzva of lulav on Shabbat? the first day of the Festival occurs on Shabbat, bring their lulavim to the Temple Mount The attendants receive from them and arrange them on a bench [ itztaba ], while the Elders place their in the chamber. And teaches to say: anyone whom my lulav reaches his possession, it is his as a gift.
llm_translation: Commandment of the lulav, how (on Shabbat)? The first day of the festival that falls on Shabbat, they bring their lulavs to the Temple Mount, and the priests receive them and arrange them on the side of the altar, and the elders place theirs in the chamber. And they teach them to say: "Whoever reaches his lulav in his hand - behold, it is his as a gift."

hebrew_text: לְמָחָר מַשְׁכִּימִין וּבָאִין, וְהַחַזָּנִין זוֹרְקִין אוֹתָם לִפְנֵיהֶם, וְהֵן מְחַטְּפִין וּמַכִּין אִישׁ אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. וּכְשֶׁרָאוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁבָּאוּ לִידֵי סַכָּנָה — הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹטֵל בְּבֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: The next day rises early and comes and the attendants throw before them. And snatch and strike one another. And when the court saw that they came to danger, they instituted that each and every will take in his house
llm_translation: Tomorrow morning they arise and come, and the cantors sprinkle them before them, and they grab and strike each other. And when the court saw that they were in danger - they decreed that each and every one should take in his house.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? טִלְטוּל בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְלִידְחֵי שַׁבָּת! אָמַר רַבָּה: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלֶנּוּ בְּיָדוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל בָּקִי לִלְמוֹד,
human_translation: Why is merely moving let it override Shabbat Rabba said: a decree lest one take in his hand and go to an expert to learn
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, why? It is a general carrying, and to push off Shabbat! Rabba said: A decree lest he carry it in his hand and go to an expert to learn."

hebrew_text: וְיַעֲבִירֶנּוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְשׁוֹפָר, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִמְגִילָּה.
human_translation: and carry it four cubits in the public domain, And that is the reason for shofar and that is the reason for Scroll
llm_translation: And he shall carry it four cubits in a public domain. And this is the reason of the shofar, and this is the reason of the Megillah.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי! רִאשׁוֹן, הָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן בְּבֵיתוֹ. הָתִינַח אַחַר תַּקָּנָה, קוֹדֶם תַּקָּנָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר!
human_translation: If so, the first day too first the Sages instituted in his house. This well after the ordinance prior to ordinance, what is there to say
llm_translation: So it is, on the first day he slept! First, the Rabbis established for him in his house. If he protested after the establishment, what can be said before the establishment!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רִאשׁוֹן דְּאִיתֵיהּ מִן הַתּוֹרָה בִּגְבוּלִין — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. הָנָךְ דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ מִן הַתּוֹרָה בִּגְבוּלִין — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, first in the outlying areas is by Torah the Sages did not issue a decree these is not in effect by Torah in the outlying areas the Sages issued a decree
llm_translation: First, if it is from the Torah in the boundaries - the Rabbis did not decree upon it. But if it is not from the Torah in the boundaries - the Rabbis decreed upon it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי! אֲנַן לָא יָדְעִינַן בְּקִיבּוּעָא דְיַרְחָא. אִינְהוּ, דְּיָדְעִי בְּקִיבּוּעָא דְיַרְחָא, לִידְחוֹ!
human_translation: If so today too We do not know when the establishment of the month who know when the establishment of the month let them override
llm_translation: So it is, behold now! We do not know the exact time of the new moon. They, who know the exact time of the new moon, should inform us!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. (דְּתָנֵי) חֲדָא: בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת כׇּל הָעָם מוֹלִיכִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן לְהַר הַבַּיִת, (וְתַנְיָא) אִידַּךְ: לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so, as was taught one On the first day of the Festival that occurs on Shabbat, all the people bring their lulavim to the Temple Mount And we learned another to the synagogue. Learn from here, when the Temple is in existence, and there, when the Temple is not in existence. learn from it
llm_translation: So it is indeed stated. (For it was taught) one: On the first day of the festival which happens to fall on Shabbat, all the people bring their lulavs to the Temple Mount, (and it was taught) the other: to the synagogue. Learn from it: here — when the Temple is standing, here — when the Temple is not standing. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתֵיהּ מִן הַתּוֹרָה בִּגְבוּלִין מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם״. שֶׁתְּהֵא לְקִיחָה בְּיַד כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: From where do we that by Torah is in the outlying areas? As it was taught “And you shall take,” that there be taking in the hand of each and every one,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From the Torah, how do we know about boundaries? As it was taught: "And you shall take." This teaches that the taking should be done by each individual personally.

hebrew_text: ״לָכֶם״ — מִשֶּׁלָּכֶם, לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַשָּׁאוּל וְאֶת הַגָּזוּל. ״בַּיּוֹם״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת. ״רִאשׁוֹן״ — אֲפִילּוּ בִּגְבוּלִין. ״הָרִאשׁוֹן״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶלָּא יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Yourselves from your own, to exclude a borrowed or stolen On the day even on Shabbat. first, even in the outlying areas. The first, teaches that overrides only the first day of the Festival.
llm_translation: "To you" - from yours, to bring out the lost and the stolen. "On the day" - even on Shabbat. "First" - even in the borders. "The first" - teaches that one only pushes off to the first good day alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״בַּיּוֹם״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת. מִכְּדֵי טִלְטוּל בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמִישְׁרֵי טִלְטוּל? אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְמַכְשִׁירֵי לוּלָב, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּהַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: לוּלָב וְכׇל מַכְשִׁירָיו דּוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: The Master said: On the day, even on Shabbat. Now, since entails merely moving is a verse needed to permit moving Rava said: is necessary only for facilitators lulav , And in accordance with this tanna as it was taught Lulav and all its facilitators override Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Master said: "On the day" — even on Shabbat. Since it is for the purpose of general handling, does a verse need to be necessary for the permission of general handling? Rava said: It is only necessary for the preparations of the lulav. And in accordance with this Mishnah that was taught: The lulav and all its preparations override the Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בַּיּוֹם״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת. וְרַבָּנַן —הַאי בַּיּוֹם מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: ״בַּיּוֹם״, וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר ״בַּיּוֹם״ וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִסֵּיפָא דִקְרָא: ״וּשְׂמַחְתֶּם לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ — יָמִים וְלֹא לֵילוֹת. וְרַבָּנַן — אִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לֵילַף ״יָמִים״ ״יָמִים״ מִסּוּכָּה. מָה לְהַלָּן — יָמִים וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי יָמִים — וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Eliezer? the verse states: On the day, and even on Shabbat. And the Rabbis, what do they do with On the day? They require it during the day and not at night. And from where does Rabbi Eliezer during the day and not at night? He derives it from the end of the verse: “And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God seven days” days and not nights. And the Rabbis, If from there, I would have said: Derive days from days sukka just as there, days and even nights, here too, days and even nights.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer? The verse says: "On the day," even on Shabbat. And the Rabbis - what does the term "on the day" do for them? They interpret it as: "On the day," and not at night. And how does Rabbi Eliezer derive "on the day" and not at night? He deduces it from the continuation of the verse: "And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God for seven days" - days and not nights. And the Rabbis - if I were there, I would say: to repeat "days" twice is redundant. Just as there, "days" includes nights, so too here, "days" - and even nights.

hebrew_text: וְסוּכָּה גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בַּסּוּכּוֹת תֵּשְׁבוּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, ״יָמִים״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״יָמִים״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא ״יָמִים״ וְלֹא לֵילוֹת? וְדִין הוּא: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״יָמִים״, וְנֶאֱמַר בְּלוּלָב ״יָמִים״, מָה לְהַלָּן — ״יָמִים״ וְלֹא לֵילוֹת, אַף כָּאן — ״יָמִים״ וְלֹא לֵילוֹת.
human_translation: And sukka itself, from where do we As the Sages taught “You shall reside in sukkot for seven days” Days and even nights. you say days and even nights; or is only days and not nights? And it logically It is stated here, “Days.” And it is stated with regard to lulav : “Days.” Just as there, days and not nights, so too here, days and not nights.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how do we know the sukkah itself? For the Rabbis taught: "You shall dwell in sukkot for seven days," "days" - even nights. Do you say "days" - even nights, or is it only "days" and not nights? And it is logical: It is stated here "days," and it is stated in the case of the lulav "days," just as there "days" and not nights, so too here "days" and not nights.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לַדֶּרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״יָמִים״ וְנֶאֱמַר בְּמִלּוּאִים ״יָמִים״. מָה לְהַלָּן — ״יָמִים״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת, אַף כָּאן — ״יָמִים״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת.
human_translation: Or, go this way It is stated here, Days, and it is stated with regard to the inauguration days” Just as there, days and even nights, so too here, days and even nights.
llm_translation: Or like to the way this: It is stated here "days" and it is stated in the filling "days." Just as there — "days" includes even nights, so too here — "days" includes even nights.

hebrew_text: נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה: דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ כׇּל הַיּוֹם מִדָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ שָׁעָה אַחַת. אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ לְדוֹרוֹת מִדָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ לְדוֹרוֹת, וְאַל יוֹכִיחוּ מִלּוּאִים שֶׁאֵין נוֹהֲגִין לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: Let us see to which comparable. one derives a matter whose mitzva is the entire day, from matter whose mitzva is the entire day, and do not let a matter whose mitzva is a brief moment, prove Or go this way One derives a matter whose mitzva is throughout the generations, from matter whose mitzva is throughout the generations, and do not let inauguration that is not in practice throughout generations, prove
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar: judging a matter whose commandment is all day, to a matter whose commandment is all day, and one should not judge a matter whose commandment is for one hour. Or you can say in this way: judging a matter whose commandment is for generations, to a matter whose commandment is for generations, and they should not judge fillings that are not customary for generations.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר:
human_translation: the verse states:
llm_translation: The Talmud says:

hebrew_text: ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״ ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״ — לִגְזֵרָה שָׁוָה. נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״, וְנֶאֱמַר בְּמִלּוּאִים ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״. מָה לְהַלָּן — ״יָמִים״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת, אַף כָּאן — ״יָמִים״ וַאֲפִילּוּ לֵילוֹת.
human_translation: “You shall reside,” “you shall reside,” of a verbal analogy. It is stated here, “You shall reside and it is stated with regard to the inauguration you shall reside Just as there, days and even nights, so too here, days and even nights.
llm_translation: "Sit" "Sit" - for an equal decree. It is stated here "sit", and it is stated in the fillings "sit". Just as there - "days" even nights, so too here - "days" even nights.

hebrew_text: עֲרָבָה שִׁבְעָה. כֵּיצַד? עֲרָבָה בִּשְׁבִיעִי מַאי טַעְמָא דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי לְפַרְסְמָהּ שֶׁהִיא מִן הַתּוֹרָה. אִי הָכִי, לוּלָב נָמֵי לִידְחֵי, כְּדֵי לְפַרְסְמוֹ שֶׁהוּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה!
human_translation: willow branch seven How willow branch on the seventh what is the reason it overrides Shabbat? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in order to publicize that it is applies by Torah If so, lulav too should override in order to publicize that it is by Torah
llm_translation: Aravah seven. How? Aravah on the seventh, what is the reason that it overrides Shabbat? Rabbi Yochanan said: In order to publicize it, as it is from the Torah. If not, the Lulav should also be nullified, in order to publicize it, as it is from the Torah!

hebrew_text: לוּלָב — גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבָּה. אִי הָכִי, עֲרָבָה נָמֵי נִגְזוֹר! עֲרָבָה — שְׁלוּחֵי בֵּית דִּין מַיְיתִי לַהּ. לוּלָב — לַכֹּל מָסוּר.
human_translation: lulav decree due to by Rabba If so, willow branch as well let us issue a decree willow branch, agents of the court bring it lulav is incumbent upon every individual.
llm_translation: Lulav - decree from Rabah. If so, willow should also be decreed! Willow - messengers of the court bring it. Lulav - given to everyone.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כׇּל יוֹמָא נָמֵי לִידְחֵי! אָתֵי לְפַקְפּוֹקֵי בְּלוּלָב. וְלִידְחֵי בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן! לָא מוֹכְחָא מִלְּתָא, אָמְרִי: לוּלָב הוּא דְּקָא דָחֵי.
human_translation: If so, let override every day as well. would come to raise doubts about lulav , And let override on the first day of the Festival, The matter would not be apparent, would say it is lulav that overrides
llm_translation: If so, every day is suitable for waving! He comes to investigate the lulav. And to wave on the first day of the festival! It is not a proven matter, they said: It is the lulav that he is waving.

hebrew_text: וְלִידְחֵי בְּחַד מֵהָנָךְ? כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מַפְּקַתְּ לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן, אוֹקְמַהּ אַשְּׁבִיעִי.
human_translation: And let override on one of these Once you moved it from the first establish it on the seventh
llm_translation: "And to push aside with one of these? Since it is removing it from the first, establish it as the seventh."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי לִידְחֵי! אֲנַן לָא יָדְעִינַן בְּקִיבּוּעָא דְיַרְחָא.
human_translation: If so, let it override today as well, We do not know the establishment of the month
llm_translation: If so, now we are standing to argue! We do not know about the sanctification of the month.

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ, דְּיָדְעִי בְּקִיבּוּעָא דְיַרְחָא — לִידְחֵי! כִּי אֲתָא בַּר הֶדְיָא, אָמַר: לָא אִיקְּלַע. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין וְכׇל נָחוֹתֵי, אָמְרִי: אִיקְּלַע וְלָא דָּחֵי.
human_translation: who know the establishment of the month, let them override When bar Hedya came he said: does not coincide When Ravin and all those who descended came, they said: It does coincide but it does not override
llm_translation: They, who know the calculation of the moon - let them come! When Bar Hedya came, he said: It did not arrive. When Ravin and all the others came, they said: It arrived and did not depart.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דַּעֲרָבָה בִּנְטִילָה? דִּלְמָא בִּזְקִיפָה!
human_translation: But difficult; Rav Yosef said: Who will say to us that the willow branch by taking Perhaps it is by standing upright
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Rather, is it difficult? Rav Yosef said: Who will say to us that the evening is suitable for immersion? Perhaps it is due to the twilight!"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לוּלָב וַעֲרָבָה שִׁשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה. מַאי לָאו, כְּלוּלָב: מָה לוּלָב בִּנְטִילָה — אַף עֲרָבָה בִּנְטִילָה! מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? הָא כִּדְאִיתֵיהּ וְהָא כִּדְאִיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to lulav and the willow branch six or seven What, is it not like lulav just as lulav by taking so too, willow branch by taking Are the cases comparable? this as it is, and this as it is,
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: A lulav and willow, six and seven. What is the reason? Is it not because of the lulav: Just as the lulav requires handling — so too the willow requires handling! Is this a valid argument? This one is as it is, and this one is as it is.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בְּכׇל יוֹם מַקִּיפִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ פַּעַם אַחַת, וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים. מַאי לָאו, בַּעֲרָבָה? לָא, בְּלוּלָב. וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: בַּעֲרָבָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא אָמַר לָךְ בַּעֲרָבָה, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא בְּלוּלָב. אִתְּמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בְּלוּלָב. רַב שְׁמוּאֵל [בַּר נָתָן] אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בַּעֲרָבָה. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: בַּעֲרָבָה.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to On every day circle the altar one time, and that day, seven times. What, is not with the willow branch No, with a lulav . But didn’t Rav Naḥman say Rabba bar Avuh said: with the willow branch? said to him: He said to you with the willow branch; and I say with a lulav . It was stated Rabbi Elazar says: with a lulav . Rav Shmuel bar Natan said Rabbi Ḥanina said: with the willow branch. And likewise, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: with the willow branch.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye raised an objection: Every day they would encircle the altar once, and on that day seven times. What is the reason? Is it not because of the willow? No, it is because of the lulav. But didn't Rav Nachman say in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: Because of the willow! He said to him: He told you it is because of the willow, but I believe it is because of the lulav. Rabbi Elazar said: Because of the lulav. Rav Shmuel bar Natan said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: Because of the willow. And so said Rav Nachman in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: Because of the willow.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: בַּר אוּרְיָא, תָּא וְאֵימָא לָךְ מִלְּתָא מְעַלַּיְתָא דַּהֲוָה אָמַר אֲבוּךְ. הָא דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַיּוֹם מַקִּיפִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ פַּעַם אַחַת, וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם מַקִּיפִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים, הָכִי אֲמַר אֲבוּךְ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּלוּלָב.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rabba bar bar Ḥana: Son of Torah [ bar urya ], come and I will tell you an outstanding statement that your father would say. that which we learned every day circle the altar one time, and on that day, they circle the altar seven times; this your father said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: with a lulav .
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Yitzchak, son of Rabba bar bar Chana: "Bar Uriya, come and I will say to you a matter that was said by your father." As we learned: "All day they would circle the altar once, but on that day they would circle the altar seven times." So said your father in the name of Rabbi Elazar: "With a lulav."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לוּלָב דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת בִּתְחִלָּתוֹ, וַעֲרָבָה בְּסוֹפוֹ. פַּעַם אַחַת חָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל עֲרָבָה לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְהֵבִיאוּ מֻרְבִּיּוֹת שֶׁל עֲרָבָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְהִנִּיחוּם בָּעֲזָרָה. וְהִכִּירוּ בָּהֶן בַּיְיתּוֹסִין, וּנְטָלוּם וּכְבָשׁוּם תַּחַת אֲבָנִים.
human_translation: raised an objection to lulav overrides Shabbat at start and the willow branch at end One time, the seventh of willow branch occurred on Shabbat, and they brought branches of willow on Shabbat eve, and placed them in the courtyard Boethusians noticed them and took them and concealed them under stones.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: The lulav overrides the Sabbath at its beginning, and the willow at its end. Once the seventh day of the willow fell on the Sabbath, and they brought willow branches from the eve of the Sabbath and placed them in the Temple courtyard. They recognized them as withered, and they took them and trampled them under stones.

hebrew_text: לְמָחָר הִכִּירוּ בָּהֶן עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ, וּשְׁמָטוּם מִתַּחַת הָאֲבָנִים, וַהֲבִיאוּם הַכֹּהֲנִים וּזְקָפוּם בְּצִידֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בַּיְיתּוֹסִין מוֹדִים שֶׁחִיבּוּט עֲרָבָה דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The next day, the ignoramuses noticed And they extracted them from under the stones. And the priests brought them and stood them upright at the sides of the altar. because Boethusians do not concede that waving the willow branch overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: On the next day, the common people recognized them, and they removed them from beneath the stones, and the priests brought them and placed them on the sides of the altar. Because the Boethusians agree that the binding of the willow overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא בִּנְטִילָה הִיא! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Apparently, is by taking a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma b'netilah hi! Teyuvta."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא נִדְחוֹ! כֵּיוָן דַּאֲנַן לָא דָּחֵינַן, אִינְהוּ נָמֵי לָא דָּחוּ. וְהָא יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן, דִּלְדִידַן לָא דָּחֵי וּלְדִידַהוּ דָּחֵי!
human_translation: Rather, let them override Since we do not override they also do not override But doesn’t the first day of the Festival for us does not override and for them it overrides
llm_translation: But isn't he a Nidchoh! Since we do not reject, they also did not reject. And the first day of the festival, according to us it does not reject, and according to them it does reject!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לְדִידְהוּ נָמֵי לָא דָּחֵי. וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי; דְּתָנָא חֲדָא: כׇּל הָעָם מוֹלִיכִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן לְהַר הַבַּיִת, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וּמְתָרְצִינַן: כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: say: For them it also does not override But these two difficult, as it was taught in one All the people bring their lulavim to the Temple Mount and it was taught in another to the synagogue. And we resolved Here, when the Temple is standing, there, when the Temple is not standing.
llm_translation: They said: According to their opinion, it is also not rejected. But rather, there is a difficulty in these two teachings. For it was taught: One may bring their lulav to the Temple Mount, and it was taught elsewhere: to the synagogue. And we reconcile the two teachings as follows: here - when the Temple is standing, here - when the Temple is not standing.

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, כָּאן — בַּגְּבוּלִין.
human_translation: No, this and that when the Temple is in existence; and not difficult. Here, in the Temple. there, in the outlying areas
llm_translation: Not, both and both when the Temple stood, and not difficult: here — in the Temple, here — in the borders.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: מַאי שְׁנָא לוּלָב דְּעָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא עֲרָבָה דְּלָא עָבְדִינַן לַהּ שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בָּעֲרָבָה שֶׁבַּלּוּלָב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא מִשּׁוּם לוּלָב הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵיד לַיהּ. וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּקָא מַגְבַּהּ לַיהּ וַהֲדַר מַגְבַּהּ לַיהּ, וְהָא מַעֲשִׂים בְּכׇל יוֹם דְּלָא קָא עָבְדִינַן הָכִי!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: What is different lulav that we perform seven in commemoration of the Temple, and what is different willow branch that we do not perform seven in commemoration of the Temple? said to him: Since a person fulfills his obligation with the willow branch in the lulav , said to him: he is performing that due to the lulav And if you say that he lifts and then lifts it again aren’t actions daily that we do not do so,
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rava: What is the difference with the lulav that we make for it seven circuits around the sanctuary, and what is the difference with the willow that we do not make for it seven circuits around the sanctuary? He said to him: Since a person fulfills his obligation with the willow that is part of the lulav. He said to him: That is specifically because of the lulav that he is doing it. And if you will say that he is elevating it and then lowering it, we do such actions every day that we do not do so!
