hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לוּלָב דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — עָבְדִינַן שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, עֲרָבָה דְּרַבָּנַן — לָא עָבְדִינַן לַהּ שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: lulav by Torah we perform it seven in commemoration of the Temple willow branch by rabbinic we do not perform it seven in commemoration of the Temple.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: Regarding the biblical lulav - we fulfill seven days in the Temple, but regarding the rabbinic willow - we do not fulfill for it seven days in the Temple.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל, הָאָמַר ״עַרְבֵי נַחַל״ כְּתִיב — שְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת לַלּוּלָב וְאַחַת לַמִּקְדָּשׁ. אִי לְרַבָּנַן, הִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא אִישׁ בִּקְעַת בֵּית חוֹרְתָן: עֶשֶׂר נְטִיעוֹת, עֲרָבָה, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: with whose If we say Abba Shaul, didn’t he say that it is written: Willows of the river, two one for the lulav and one for the Temple? If with the Rabbis, they learned this a halakha as Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Neḥunya of the valley of Beit Ḥortan: ten saplings, willow branch and the water libation a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: To whom? If you say it is Abba Shaul, who said "willows of the brook" is written - two, one for the lulav and one for the Temple. If you say it is according to the Rabbis, the tradition is established for them, as Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Nechunia the son of the valley of Beit Chorot: Ten saplings, an aravah, and the water libation - it is a halacha from Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לוּלָב דְּאִית לֵיהּ עִיקָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, — בַּגְּבוּלִין עָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, עֲרָבָה דְּלֵית לַהּ עִיקָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה — בַּגְּבוּלִין לָא עָבְדִינַן שִׁבְעָה זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: lulav , which has basis in the Torah, in the outlying areas we perform it seven in commemoration of the Temple. willow branch, which does not have basis in the Torah, in the outlying areas we do not perform it seven in commemoration of the Temple.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: If the lulav has its main part from the Torah, — we bind to it seven branches of myrtle for the Temple; if the willow does not have its main part from the Torah — we do not bind to it seven branches for the Temple.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין נִכְנָסִין בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ, כְּדֵי לָצֵאת בַּעֲרָבָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי אֲמָרָהּ? מִי אֲמָרָהּ?! הָא אִיהוּ אֲמַר! דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא אִישׁ בִּקְעַת בֵּית חוֹרְתָן: עֶשֶׂר נְטִיעוֹת, עֲרָבָה, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Priests with defects enter between the Entrance Hall and the altar in order to fulfill the willow branch. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Who stated Who stated it? Didn’t himself state As Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Neḥunya of the valley of Beit Ḥortan: ten saplings, willow branch and the water libation a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Priests with blemishes enter between the hall and the altar, in order to exit through the Arubah. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: Who said it? Who said it?! He himself said it! For Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Nechunia the son of Beit Hakortan: Ten saplings, Arubah, and pouring of water - a halacha from Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִי אֲמָרָהּ בִּנְטִילָה, דִּלְמָא בִּזְקִיפָה! מִי אֲמָרָהּ בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין, דִּלְמָא בִּתְמִימִים!
human_translation: Rather, Who said by taking Perhaps by standing upright Who said by with defects? Perhaps by unblemished
llm_translation: Rather: Who said it regarding immersion, perhaps it is regarding sprinkling! Who said it regarding blemished animals, perhaps it is regarding unblemished ones!

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: עֲרָבָה יְסוֹד נְבִיאִים, וְחַד אָמַר: עֲרָבָה מִנְהַג נְבִיאִים. תִּסְתַּיַּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר יְסוֹד נְבִיאִים, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֲרָבָה יְסוֹד נְבִיאִים הוּא. תִּסְתַּיַּים.
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. One said willow branch an ordinance of prophets, And one said willow branch custom prophets Conclude that it was Rabbi Yoḥanan who said an ordinance of prophets, as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: willow branch is an ordinance of prophets. conclude
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said: "Arava is the foundation of prophets," and one said: "Arava is the custom of prophets." The matter was concluded according to Rabbi Yochanan who said, "Arava is the foundation of prophets," as Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Arava is the foundation of prophets." Concluded.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא אִישׁ בִּקְעַת בֵּית חוֹרְתָן: עֶשֶׂר נְטִיעוֹת, עֲרָבָה, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי? אֶשְׁתּוֹמַם כְּשָׁעָה חֲדָא וַאֲמַר, שְׁכֵחוּם וְחָזְרוּ וְיִסְּדוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abbahu: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Neḥunya of the valley of Beit Ḥortan: ten saplings, willow branch and the water libation a halakha to Moses from Sinai? “He was astonished for a while” and he said they forgot and then reinstituted them.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Avahu: Who said it thus, Rabbi Yochanan? And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Nechunia the son of Beqat of Beit Horotan: Ten saplings, willow, and pouring water - is this a halakha from Moses at Sinai? He was silent for a moment and said, "Forget them and return and establish them."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דִּלְכוֹן אֲמַרִי: דִּלְהוֹן הִיא! לָא קַשְׁיָא:
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say And didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Yours, say that is theirs, not difficult;
llm_translation: And who said so, Rabbi Yochanan thus? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: "For they are His"? It is not difficult.

hebrew_text: כָּאן בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — כָּאן בַּגְּבוּלִין.
human_translation: Here, in the Temple; there, in the outlying areas.
llm_translation: Here in the Temple - here in the borders.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: עֲרָבָה צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר, וְאֵינָהּ נִיטֶּלֶת אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וְאֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בָּעֲרָבָה שֶׁבַּלּוּלָב. כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר אֵינָהּ נִיטֶּלֶת אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּעֲרָבָה שֶׁבַּלּוּלָב!
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: willow branch requires a measure, and it is taken only in and of itself and a person does not fulfill his obligation with the willow branch that is with the lulav . Since the Master said: It is taken only in and of itself, obvious that a person does not fulfill with the willow branch that is with the lulav .
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: An Aravah requires a measure, and it is not removed except by itself, and a person does not fulfill his obligation with the Aravah that is in the Lulav. Since the Master said it is not removed except by itself, it is obvious that a person does not fulfill his obligation with the Aravah that is in the Lulav!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא אַגְבְּהַיהּ וַהֲדַר אַגְבְּהַיהּ, אֲבָל אַגְבְּהַיהּ וַהֲדַר אַגְבְּהַיהּ — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בָּעֲרָבָה שֶׁבַּלּוּלָב (בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג).
human_translation: lest you say that this applies where he did not lift and then lift it however, where he lifted and then lifted it say no, he teaches us And Rav Ḥisda Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A person fulfills his obligation with the willow branch that is with the lulav on the first day of the festival
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? These matters, where it was not raised and then it was raised, but if it was raised and then it was raised again - say no, it is implied to us. And Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rabbi Yitzḥak: A person fulfills his obligation with the willow branch (on the first day of the festival).

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרָהּ? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה בַּדֵּי עָלִין לַחִין. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ עָלֶה אֶחָד וּבַד אֶחָד. עָלֶה אֶחָד וּבַד אֶחָד סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ עָלֶה אֶחָד בְּבַד אֶחָד.
human_translation: And what is its measure? Rav Naḥman said: three branches of moist leaves. And Rav Sheshet said: even one leaf and one branch. Does it enter your mind a single leaf and a single branch Rather, say: even with one leaf on one branch.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And what is its measure? Rav Nachman said: three logs of oil for one hin. And Rav Sheshet said: even one log and one half. One log and one half, is it your intention?! Rather say: even one log by itself."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַיְיבוּ: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק וְאַיְיתִי הָהוּא גַּבְרָא עֲרָבָה קַמֵּיהּ. שָׁקֵיל, חַבֵּיט חַבֵּיט, וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ. קָסָבַר מִנְהַג נְבִיאִים הוּא. אַיְיבוּ וְחִזְקִיָּה בְּנֵי בְרַתֵּיה דְּרַב אַיְיתוֹ עֲרָבָה לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, חַבֵּיט חַבֵּיט, וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ. קָא סָבַר מִנְהַג נְבִיאִים הוּא.
human_translation: Aivu, said: I was standing before Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok, and a certain man brought a willow branch before him He took it waved he waved and did not recite a blessing. he holds is a custom of the prophets Aivu and Ḥizkiya, sons of the daughter of Rav, brought a willow branch before Rav He waved he waved and did not recite a blessing. he, holds it is a custom of the prophets.
llm_translation: He said: They raised an objection: We were standing before Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok, and they brought before him a certain man from the Aravah. He took, handful by handful, but did not bless. He thought it is the custom of the prophets. They raised an objection: and Hezekiah, the sons of his daughter, brought before Rav a certain Aravah. He took, handful by handful, but did not bless. He thought it is the custom of the prophets.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַיְיבוּ: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קִרְיָיתָא אִית לִי, כַּרְמַיָּא אִית לִי, זֵיתַיָּא אִית לִי, וְאָתוּ בְּנֵי קִרְיָיתָא וּמְקַשְׁקְשִׁין בְּכַרְמַיָּא וְאוֹכְלִין בְּזֵיתַיָּא — אֲרִיךְ אוֹ לָא אֲרִיךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא אֲרִיךְ. הֲוָה קָא שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ וְאָזֵיל. אֲמַר: כְּדוּ הֲוֵיתִי דָּיַיר בְּאַרְעָא הָדָא אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין, וְלָא חֲמֵיתִי בַּר אִינָשׁ מְהַלֵּךְ בְּאָרְחָן דְּתָקְנָן כְּדֵין. הָדַר וְאָתֵי וְאָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי מֶיעְבַּד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַפְקַר זֵיתַיָּא לְחָשׁוֹכַיָּא, וְתֵן פְּרִיטַיָּא לְקַשְׁקוֹשֵׁי כְּרָמִים.
human_translation: Aivu said: I was standing before Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok, a certain man came before him said to him: I have villages, I have groves, I have olives, and the villagers come and hoe the groves and eat from the olive appropriate or inappropriate He said to him: inappropriate. was leaving him and going said: I have already resided in this land for forty years and I have not seen a person walk in a path as straight as this came back and said to him: What should I do He said to him: Declare the olives ownerless for the poor, and give perutot to hoe the olive groves.
llm_translation: He said: They brought an objection: We were standing before Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok, that man came before him, he said to him: I have a city, I have a vineyard, I have olive trees, and the children of the city come and play in the vineyard and eat from the olive trees - should I uproot them or not? He said to him: Do not uproot them. He left him and went. He said: I lived in a certain city for forty years, and I did not see a man walking in the streets as they had arranged. He returned and came and said to him: What should I do? He said to him: Declare the olive trees ownerless for the passersby, and give the fruits to the vineyard workers.

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁקוֹשֵׁי מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: ״וְהַשְּׁבִיעִית תִּשְׁמְטֶנָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּהּ״. ״תִּשְׁמְטֶנָּה״ — מִלְּקַשְׁקֵשׁ, ״וּנְטַשְׁתָּהּ״ — מִלְּסַקֵּל! אָמַר רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: תְּרֵי קִשְׁקוּשֵׁי הָווּ. חַד — סַתּוֹמֵי פִּילֵי, וְחַד — אַבְרוֹיֵי אִילָנֵי. אַבְרוֹיֵי אִילָנֵי — אָסוּר, סַתּוֹמֵי פִּילֵי — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Is hoeing permitted But wasn’t taught “But the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow” you shall let it rest from hoeing, and lie fallow from clearing rocks? Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: There are two hoeing, one to seal cracks and one to enhance the trees’ health. Enhancing the trees’ health is prohibited; sealing cracks is permitted,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "And what is the meaning of 'kashkoshay mi shrei'? But it was taught: 'And the seventh year you shall release it, and abandon it.' 'You shall release it' - from being checked, 'and abandon it' - from being pruned! Rav Ukva bar Chama said: There were two types of checking. One - the buds of the shoots, and one - the branches of the trees. The branches of the trees - prohibited, the buds of the shoots - permitted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַיְיבוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: אַל יְהַלֵּךְ אָדָם בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת יוֹתֵר מִשָּׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, אֲבָל לְאוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ — אַמַּאי דְּנָקֵיט סְמִיךְ.
human_translation: Aivu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok: A person should not walk on Shabbat eves more than three parasangs [ parsaot ]. Rav Kahana said: We said only to his house. However, to an inn, he relies on that he took
llm_translation: He said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok: A person should not walk on Friday evenings more than three Parsaot. Rav Kahana said: We only said this regarding going to his house, but to his inn - why is it different? Because it is close by.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְבֵיתֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וַאֲפִילּוּ כָּסָא דְהַרְסָנָא לָא אַשְׁכַּחִי.
human_translation: Some say Rav Kahana said: was required even to his house, Rav Kahana said: There was an incident with me and I did not find even small fried fish [ deharsena ]
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Kahana said: It is not necessary except even for his house. Rav Kahana said: It was a personal matter for me, and even the chair of the blacksmith I did not forget.

hebrew_text: מִצְוַת לוּלָב כֵּיצַד? תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: סוּדָרִין עַל גַּג הָאִיצְטְבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: How the mitzva of lulav tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: arranges them on the roof the bench said to him:
llm_translation: The commandment of the lulav, how? It was taught, a Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: They are arranged on the roof of the istavah. He said to him:

hebrew_text: וְכִי לְיַיבְּשָׁן הוּא צָרִיךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עַל גַּב הָאִיצְטְבָא. אָמַר רַחֲבָא אָמַר (רַב) יְהוּדָה: הַר הַבַּיִת סְטָיו כָּפוּל הָיָה, סְטָיו לְפָנִים מִסְּטָיו.
human_translation: And does he need to dry them? Rather, say: On the bench Raḥava said Rav Yehuda said: The Temple Mount was a double colonnade [ setav ], a colonnade within a colonnade,
llm_translation: And when it is necessary to dry them? Rather say: on top of the roof. Rakhava said in the name of (Rav) Yehudah: The roof of the house was folded, its fold was in front of its fold.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוַת עֲרָבָה כֵּיצַד? מָקוֹם הָיָה לְמַטָּה מִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְנִקְרָא ״מוֹצָא״, יוֹרְדִין לְשָׁם וּמְלַקְּטִין מִשָּׁם מוּרְבִּיּוֹת שֶׁל עֲרָבָה, וּבָאִין וְזוֹקְפִין אוֹתָן בְּצִדֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְרָאשֵׁיהֶן כְּפוּפִין עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ. בְּכׇל יוֹם מַקִּיפִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ פַּעַם אַחַת וְאוֹמְרִים: ״אָנָּא ה׳ הוֹשִׁיעָה נָּא, אָנָּא ה׳ הַצְלִיחָה נָּא״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי וָהוּ הוֹשִׁיעָה נָא״. וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם מַקִּיפִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים. בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתָן מָה הֵן אוֹמְרִים: ״יוֹפִי לְךָ מִזְבֵּחַ, יוֹפִי לְךָ מִזְבֵּחַ!״ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: ״לְיָהּ וּלְךָ מִזְבֵּחַ, לְיָהּ וּלְךָ מִזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: How is the mitzva of willow branch There was a place below Jerusalem, and it was called Motza. They descend there and gather willow branches [ murbiyyot ] from there. And they come and stand them upright at the sides of the altar, and tops be inclined over the top of the altar. They sounded a tekia , sounded a terua , and sounded tekia . Each day they circle the altar one time and say: “Lord, please save us. Lord, please grant us success” Rabbi Yehuda says Ani vaho , please save us. And on that day, they circle the altar seven times. At the time of their departure what they say? beautiful for you, altar; beautiful for you, altar. Rabbi Elazar said To the Lord and to you, altar; to the Lord and to you, altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the mitzvah of the willow branch (Aravah)? If the place was below Jerusalem and called "Motsa," they would descend there and gather willow branches from there, and they would come and stand them on the sides of the altar, and their tops were bent over the top of the altar. They would sound the shofar, shout, and sound the shofar. Every day they would circle the altar once and say: "Please, Hashem, save now; Please, Hashem, bring success now." Rabbi Yehudah says: "Ani vahu, save now." And on that day, they would circle the altar seven times. At the time of their departure, what would they say? "How beautiful you are, altar, how beautiful you are, altar!" Rabbi Elazar says: "For you and for Him, altar, for you and for Him, altar."

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל כָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיוּ מְלַקְּטִין אוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב וּמַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן בְּגִיגִיּוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִכְמוֹשׁוּ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: חֲרִיּוֹת שֶׁל דֶּקֶל הָיוּ מְבִיאִין, וְחוֹבְטִין אוֹתָן בְּקַרְקַע בְּצִדֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם נִקְרָא חִבּוּט חֲרִיּוֹת. מִיַּד תִּינוֹקוֹת שׁוֹמְטִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן וְאוֹכְלִין אֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן.
human_translation: As its performance during the week, so is its performance on Shabbat; except that they would gather from eve and place them in basins of gold so that they would not dry. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: They would bring palm branches and place them on the ground at the sides of the altar, and that day was called: placing of palm branches. Immediately children remove their lulavim and eat their etrogim
llm_translation: As its manner on a weekday, so is its manner on Shabbat, except that they would gather them from the evening and place them in golden baskets, so that they would not spoil. Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka says: They would bring palm fronds, and beat them on the ground at the sides of the altar, and that day was called "the day of beating palm fronds." Immediately after, children would release their lulavs and eat their etrogs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מְקוֹם קָלָנְיָא הֲוָה. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן מַאי טַעְמָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״מוֹצָא״? אַיְּידֵי דְּמִיפָּק מִכְּרָגָא דְמַלְכָּא — קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״מוֹצָא״.
human_translation: It was taught: was military colony [ kelanya ]. And the tanna our what is the reason he called it Motza? since it is exempted from the king’s tax [ karga ], they call it Motza,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Tanah: mekom kalanya havah. Ve'tana didan mai ta'ama karei leih "motza"? Aydei d'mifak mikraga d'malka - karei leih "motza." English translation: Gemara: It was a place of Kalanya. And our Mishnah, what is the reason it calls it "motza"? Because it emerges from the king's palace - it is called "motza."

hebrew_text: וּבָאִין וְזוֹקְפִין אוֹתָן בְּצִדֵּי כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: רַבּוֹת, וַאֲרוּכוֹת, וּגְבוֹהוֹת אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ גּוֹחוֹת עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ אַמָּה.
human_translation: And they come and stand them upright at the sides It was taught: numerous and long, and eleven cubits high, so that they would lean over the altar cubit.
llm_translation: They come and stand them on the sides of the courtyard. It was taught: "Many, and long, and tall, each one eleven cubits, so that they will be projecting over the altar by a cubit."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָרִימָר מִשּׁוּם מָר זוּטְרָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עַל הַיְּסוֹד מַנַּח לְהוּ, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אַאַרְעָא מַנַּח לְהוּ, מִכְּדֵי: עָלָה אַמָּה וְכָנַס אַמָּה — זֶהוּ יְסוֹד. עָלָה חָמֵשׁ וְכָנַס אַמָּה — זֶהוּ סוֹבֵב. עָלָה שָׁלֹשׁ — זֶהוּ מְקוֹם הַקְּרָנוֹת. גּוֹחוֹת עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַיְּסוֹד מַנַּח לְהוּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Mareimar said in the name of Mar Zutra: Learn from it one places them on the base as, if it enters your mind that one places them on the ground, Now, since ascended cubit and indented cubit that is base, ascended five and indented cubit that is surrounding ledge, it ascended three that is the location of the horns where can you find lean over the altar Rather, is it not conclude from placed on the base, conclude from it
llm_translation: The Master said in the name of Master Zutra: Hear from it regarding the foundation, place it for them. For if your intention is to place it in the earth, from where: it rose a cubit and entered a cubit - this is the foundation. It rose five and entered a cubit - this is the surrounding. It rose three - this is the place of the horns. How do you find the hollows on the top of the altar? Rather, no, hear from it: place the foundation for them. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי קְרָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִסְרוּ חַג בַּעֲבוֹתִים עַד קַרְנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַנּוֹטֵל לוּלָב בְּאִגּוּדוֹ וַהֲדַס בַּעֲבוֹתוֹ, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה מִזְבֵּחַ וְהִקְרִיב עָלָיו קׇרְבָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: What is verse as it is stated: “Encircle [ isru ] with branches on the Festival until the horns of the altar” Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Elazar said: anyone who takes a lulav in its binding and a myrtle branch in its dense-leaved the verse ascribes him as though he built an altar and sacrificed an offering upon it, as it is stated:
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: What is the verse? As it is stated: "Bind the festival offering with cords to the horns of the altar." Rabbi Avahu said that Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who takes a palm branch in its binding and a myrtle branch in its leaves, the Scripture regards it as though he built an altar and offered a sacrifice upon it, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: ״אִסְרוּ חַג בַּעֲבוֹתִים עַד קַרְנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַמָּחוֹזִי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַמָּכוֹתִי: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה אִיסּוּר לֶחָג בַּאֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה מִזְבֵּחַ וְהִקְרִיב עָלָיו קׇרְבָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִסְרוּ חַג בַּעֲבוֹתִים עַד קַרְנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: “Bind [ isru ] with dense-leaved branches [ ba’avotim ] on the Festival until the horns of the altar” Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, and Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon HaMeḥozi, in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan HaMakkoti: anyone who establishes an addition [ issur ] to the Festival by eating and drinking, the verse ascribes him as though he built an altar and sacrificed an offering upon it, as it is stated: “Add [ isru ] to the Festival with fattened animals [ ba’avotim ] until the horns of the altar.”
llm_translation: "Prohibit the festival with ropes until the horns of the altar." Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, and Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon HaMachuzi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan HaMakotzi: Anyone who imposes a prohibition on the festival regarding eating and drinking, the Scripture accounts it to him as if he built an altar and offered a sacrifice upon it, as it is stated: "Prohibit the festival with ropes until the horns of the altar."

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת כּוּלָּן אֵין אָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ גְּדִילָתָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים עוֹמְדִים״.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya said Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: all each and every the mitzvot, a person fulfills his obligation only in the manner of their growth. as it is stated “Acacia wood, standing”
llm_translation: Hezekiah said, Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: All the commandments, all of them, a person does not fulfill them except in a grand manner, as it is stated: "Acacia trees standing."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים עוֹמְדִים״ — שֶׁעוֹמְדִים דֶּרֶךְ גְּדִילָתָן. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עוֹמְדִים״ — שֶׁמַּעֲמִידִין אֶת צִיפּוּיָן. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עוֹמְדִים״ — שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אָבַד סִיבְרָם וּבָטַל סִיכּוּיָין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים עוֹמְדִים״ — שֶׁעוֹמְדִים לְעוֹלָם וּלְעוֹלְמֵי עוֹלָמִים.
human_translation: That was also taught “Acacia wood, standing,” that they stand in the manner of their growth Alternatively, standing that support their plating Alternatively, standing Lest you say their hope is lost and their prospect is abolished, the verse states: “Acacia wood, standing,” that they stand forever and for all time
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "Acacia trees stand" - that they stand upright like their trunk. Another explanation: "stand" - that they support their branches. Another explanation: "stand" - lest you say their reason has ceased and their possibility has been nullified, the Torah teaches us: "Acacia trees stand" - that they stand forever and for all eternity.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: יָכוֹל אֲנִי לִפְטוֹר אֶת כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִן הַדִּין — מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרֵאתִי עַד עַתָּה, וְאִילְמָלֵי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנִי עִמִּי — מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם וְעַד עַכְשָׁיו, וְאִילְמָלֵי יוֹתָם בֶּן עוּזִּיָּהוּ עִמָּנוּ — מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם עַד סוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: And Ḥizkiya said Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: I am able to absolve the entire world from judgment from the day I was created until now. And were Eliezer, my son, with my from the day that the world was created until now. And were Jotham ben Uzziah, with our from the day that the world was created until its end.
llm_translation: And Chizkiyah said in the name of Rabbi Yirmiyah in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: I could exempt the entire world from judgment - from the day I was created until now, and if not for Eli'ezer my son with me - from the day the world was created until now, and if not for Yotam ben Uzziyahu with us - from the day the world was created until its end.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: רָאִיתִי בְּנֵי עֲלִיָּיה וְהֵן מוּעָטִין. אִם אֶלֶף הֵן — אֲנִי וּבְנִי מֵהֶן, אִם מֵאָה הֵם — אֲנִי וּבְנִי מֵהֶן, אִם שְׁנַיִם הֵן — אֲנִי וּבְנִי הֵן. וּמִי זוּטְרֵי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָא אָמַר רָבָא: תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי אַלְפֵי הָוֵה דָּרָא דְּקַמֵּיהּ קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סָבִיב שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר אָלֶף״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּמִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה, הָא דְּלָא מִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה.
human_translation: And Ḥizkiya said Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: I have seen members of prominent, and they are few. If they one thousand, I and my son are among them. If they one hundred, I and my son are among them; and if they two, I and my son are they. Are they so few? But didn’t Rava say: There are eighteen thousand in a row before the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Surrounding are eighteen thousand” not difficult. This who view through a bright, partition, that who do not view through a bright partition.
llm_translation: And Hezekiah said, Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: I have seen the children of the upper class, and they are few. If they are a thousand - I and my son are among them, if they are a hundred - I and my son are among them, if they are two - I and my son are among them. And who are the few of this? And Rava said: Eighteen thousand chariots of fire stand before the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is said: "A fiery stream issued and came forth from before Him; thousand thousands ministered unto Him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before Him." It is not difficult: this refers to those who gaze upon the shining mirror, and this refers to those who do not gaze upon the shining mirror.

hebrew_text: וּדְמִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה, מִי זוּטְרֵי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא פָּחֵית עָלְמָא מִתְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא צַדִּיקֵי דִּמְקַבְּלִי אַפֵּי שְׁכִינָה בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי כׇּל חוֹכֵי לוֹ״, ״לוֹ״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא הָווּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּעָיְילִי בְּבַר, הָא דְּעָיְילִי בְּלָא בַּר.
human_translation: And are who view a bright partition so few? But didn’t Abaye say: The world no fewer than thirty-six righteous who greet the Divine Presence every day, as it is stated: “Happy are all they that wait for Him [ lo ]” The numerological value of lo , is thirty-six, not difficult. This who enter by permission, that who enter without permission,
llm_translation: And it was visible in the aspaklarya that shines, who are the Zutrei Kullei Hai? And Abaye said: The world has not been empty of thirty and six righteous individuals who receive the presence of the Divine every day, as it is said: "Happy are all who wait for Him," "for Him" in gematria is thirty-six! It is not difficult: this one who goes with a son, this one who goes without a son.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתָן מָה הֵן אוֹמְרִים וְכוּ׳. וְהָא קָא מִשְׁתַּתַּף שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם וְדָבָר אַחֵר, וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל הַמְשַׁתֵּף שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם וְדָבָר אַחֵר נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּלְתִּי לַה׳ לְבַדּוֹ״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְיָהּ אֲנַחְנוּ מוֹדִים, וְלָךְ אָנוּ מְשַׁבְּחִין. לְיָהּ אֲנַחְנוּ מוֹדִים, וְלָךְ אָנוּ מְקַלְּסִין.
human_translation: At the time of their departure what they say? But aren’t they joining the name of Heaven and another entity, and it was taught Anyone who joins the name of Heaven and another entity is uprooted from the world, as it is stated: save unto the Lord only, this is what are saying To the Lord, we acknowledge and to you, we give praise; to the Lord, we acknowledge and to you, we give acclaim.
llm_translation: At the time of their departure, what do they say, etc. And this is the participation of the Name of Heaven and another matter, and it was taught: Anyone who participates the Name of Heaven and another matter is uprooted from the world, as it says: "Except to the Lord alone!" This is what it means: To Him we give thanks, and to you we offer praise. To Him we give thanks, and to you we offer scorn.

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּפּוֹת״, שְׁנַיִם: אַחַת לַלּוּלָב וְאַחַת לְמִזְבֵּחַ. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: ״כַּפַּת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: As its performance during the week, Rav Huna said: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka? as it is written: branches two one for the lulav and one for the altar. And the Rabbis say: is written kappot ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like his usual practice on weekdays. Rav Huna said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, as it is written: "palms," two: one for the lulav and one for the altar. And the Rabbis say: "palm" is written.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי לֵוִי אוֹמֵר, כְּתָמָר: מָה תָּמָר זֶה אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא לֵב אֶחָד, אַף יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין לָהֶם אֶלָּא לֵב אֶחָד לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi says: likening a date palm Just as the date palm has only one heart, so too, the Jewish people have only one heart toward their Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi says, like a date palm: Just as this date palm has only one heart, so too the Israelites have only one heart to their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לוּלָב שִׁבְעָה, וְסוּכָּה יוֹם אֶחָד. מַאי טַעְמָא? לוּלָב דְּמַפְסְקִי לֵילוֹת מִיָּמִים, כׇּל יוֹמָא מִצְוָה בְּאַפֵּיהּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ הוּא. סוּכָּה דְּלָא מַפְסְקִי לֵילוֹת מִיָּמִים, כּוּלְּהוּ שִׁבְעָה כְּחַד יוֹמָא אֲרִיכָא דָּמוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: lulav seven and sukka one day. What is the rationale lulav , where the nights are distinct from the days, each day is a mitzva in and of itself. sukka , where the nights are not distinct from the days, all seven is like one long day.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The lulav is for seven days, and the sukkah is for one day. What is the reason? The lulav, which separates nights from days, every day is a mitzvah in its own right. The sukkah, which does not separate nights from days, all seven days are considered as one long day.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סוּכָּה שִׁבְעָה, וְלוּלָב יוֹם אֶחָד. מַאי טַעְמָא? סוּכָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — שִׁבְעָה, לוּלָב דְּרַבָּנַן — סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּחַד יוֹמָא.
human_translation: But Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan said: sukka seven lulav one day. What is the rationale sukka by Torah seven lulav , by rabbinic it is enough one day,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A sukkah for seven days, and a lulav for one day. What is the reason? A sukkah, which is from the Torah – seven days, a lulav, which is from the Rabbis – it is sufficient for it to be used for one day.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה שִׁבְעָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: נְקוֹט דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה בִּידָךְ, דְּכוּלְּהוּ אָמוֹרָאֵי קָיְימִי כְּווֹתֵיהּ בְּסוּכָּה.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: both this, and that, seven Rav Yosef said: Take of Rabba bar bar Ḥana in your hand, as all the amora’im hold in accordance with his in sukka .
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One this and one this, seven. Rav Yosef said: Take Rabba bar bar Ḥana in your hand, for all the statements are fulfilled in his Sukkah.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי:
human_translation: raises an objection
llm_translation: Challenged (it) (the) questioner:

hebrew_text: הָעוֹשֶׂה לוּלָב לְעַצְמוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ וְהִגִּיעָנוּ לִזְמַן הַזֶּה״. נְטָלוֹ לָצֵאת בּוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל נְטִילַת לוּלָב״. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבֵּירַךְ עָלָיו יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, חוֹזֵר וּמְבָרֵךְ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּה לְעַצְמוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ וְקִיְּימָנוּ כּוּ׳״, נִכְנַס לֵישֵׁב בָּהּ, אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ לֵישֵׁב בַּסּוּכָּה״, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁבֵּירַךְ יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: One who prepares a lulav for himself, recites Blessed…Who has given us life, sustained us, and brought us to this time. When he takes it in order to fulfill his obligation, he says: Blessed…Who sanctified us with His mitzvot and commanded us concerning the taking of a lulav . And even though he recited the blessing over on the first day he repeats and recites the blessing all seven One who establishes a sukka for himself recites: Blessed…Who has given us life, sustained us, he enters to sit in he recites: Who has sanctified us with His mitzvot and commanded us to reside in the sukka . And once he recited the blessing on the first day, he no longer recites it
llm_translation: The one who makes a lulav for himself, says: "Blessed... Who has granted us life, sustained us, and enabled us to reach this time." When he takes it to fulfill his obligation with it, he says: "Blessed... Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the taking of the lulav." Even though he blessed over it on the first day, he goes back and blesses for all seven days. The one who makes a sukkah for himself, says: "Blessed... Who has granted us life, sustained us, etc.," when he enters to sit in it, he says: "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to sit in the sukkah." And once he has blessed on the first day, he does not repeat the blessing.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לוּלָב אַלּוּלָב, קַשְׁיָא סוּכָּה אַסּוּכָּה!
human_translation: lulav difficult; lulav sukka difficult, sukka
llm_translation: A bundle of palm branches is difficult for the lulav, a bundle of branches is difficult for the sukkah!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לוּלָב אַלּוּלָב לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. אֶלָּא סוּכָּה אַסּוּכָּה קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, lulav lulav not difficult. Here, to a time when the Temple is in existence, There, to a time when the Temple is not in existence. However, sukka sukka difficult,
llm_translation: In truth, regarding the lulav, it is not difficult. Here, when the Temple is standing, it is valid; here, when the Temple is not standing, it is valid. Rather, regarding the sukkah, that is where the difficulty lies!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: תְּפִילִּין, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמַּנִּיחָן — מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ אֶלָּא שַׁחֲרִית בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it was taught phylacteries, every time one dons them he recites the blessing over them; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: One recites the blessing only in the morning.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: Regarding Tefillin, as long as one wears them, he recites a blessing over them, according to the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: One only recites a blessing over them in the morning prayer alone.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי, וְרָבָא אָמַר: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּנַן. אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל: חֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא דְּלָא עָבֵיד כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, אֶלָּא מַקְדֵּים וְקָאֵי וְעָיֵיל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא, וְנָפֵיק וּמָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ וּמַנַּח תְּפִילִּין וּמְבָרֵךְ. וְכִי אִצְטְרִיךְ זִימְנָא אַחֲרִינָא, עָיֵיל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְנָפֵיק וּמָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ וּמַנַּח תְּפִילִּין וּמְבָרֵךְ, וַאֲנַן נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי עָבְדִינַן, וּמְבָרְכִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: it was stated Abaye said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi and Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the Rabbis. Rav Mari, son of the daughter of Shmuel, said: I observed Rava, who did not act in accordance with his halakha Rather, he rises early, and enters the bathroom, and exits, and washes his hands, and dons phylacteries, and recites the blessing. And when he needs another time, he enters the bathroom, and exits, and washes his hands, and dons phylacteries, and recites the blessing. And we too, act in accordance of Rabbi and recite the blessing all seven
llm_translation: It was stated: Abbaye said: the halakha is according to Rabbi, and Rava said: the halakha is according to the Rabbis. Rav Mari, son of the daughter of Shmuel, said: I saw Rava who did not act in accordance with his own teaching, but rather he would first enter and sit down in the bathroom, then he would come out, wash his hands, put on tefillin, and recite the blessing. And if another need arose, he would go back to the bathroom, then come out, wash his hands, put on tefillin, and recite the blessing, while we follow the opinion of Rabbi and recite the blessing only once.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: חֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לְרַב פַּפֵּי, דְּכׇל אֵימַת דְּמַנַּח תְּפִילִּין מְבָרֵךְ. רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי, כׇּל אֵימַת דִּמְ[מַ]שְׁמְשִׁי בְּהוּ מְבָרְכִי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: I observed Rav Pappi, who recited blessing whenever he donned phylacteries. The Sages of the school of Rav Ashi recited blessing whenever they touched
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: We have seen that Rav Pappi, whenever he removes his Tefillin, recites a blessing. The sages of the house of Rav Ashi said: Whenever one engages with them, recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִצְוַת לוּלָב כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן — מִצְוַת לוּלָב, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת זְקֵנִים. וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: כָּל יוֹמָא מִצְוַת זְקֵנִים. וַאֲפִילּוּ יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! אֵימָא: בַּר מִיּוֹם רִאשׁוֹן. אִי הָכִי — הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי! אֵימָא: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: the mitzva of lulav all seven And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: first day, the mitzva of lulav From that onward a mitzva of the Elders, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: each day a mitzva of the Elders. Even the first day? But don’t we maintain that the first day by Torah Say except for the first day. If so, that is of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi; say: And likewise, Rabbi Yitzḥak said,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The mitzvah of the lulav is all seven days. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: On the first day - the mitzvah of the lulav, from here on - the mitzvah of the elders. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Every day - the mitzvah of the elders. Even on the first day?! But we establish that the first day is biblical! Say: From the first day. If so - this is the same as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi! Say: And so said Rabbi Yitzchak.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב סָבַר: כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִצְוַת לוּלָב. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הַמַּדְלִיק נֵר שֶׁל חֲנוּכָּה — צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: הָרוֹאֶה נֵר שֶׁל חֲנוּכָּה — צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, הַמַּדְלִיק מְבָרֵךְ שָׁלֹשׁ, הָרוֹאֶה מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, מַדְלִיק מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם, וְרוֹאֶה מְבָרֵךְ אַחַת.
human_translation: And Rav also held the mitzva of lulav all seven as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: One who lights a Hanukkah light must recite a blessing. Rabbi Yirmeya said: One who sees Hanukkah light must recite a blessing. What blessings does one recite? Rav Yehuda said: first day the one who lights recites three The one who sees recites two From this onward, lights recites two and sees recites one
llm_translation: And even Rav holds: all seven mitzvot of the lulav. As Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: One who lights the Hanukkah candle - must recite a blessing. Rabbi Yirmeya said: One who sees the Hanukkah candle - must recite a blessing. What does one recite? Rav Yehuda said: On the first day, one who lights recites three blessings, one who sees recites two. From here on, one who lights recites two, and one who sees recites one.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מְבָרֵךְ: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ לְהַדְלִיק נֵר (שֶׁל) חֲנוּכָּה״. וְהֵיכָן צִוָּנוּ? מִ״לֹּא תָּסוּר״. וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: ״שְׁאַל אָבִיךָ וְיַגֵּדְךָ״.
human_translation: what blessing recites? Blessed…Who has made us holy through His mitzvot and has commanded us to light the Hanukkah light. And where did He command us? from “You shall not turn aside Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said “Ask your father, and he will declare unto you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what does one bless? "Blessed is He who sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to kindle the Hanukkah light." And where were we commanded? "You shall not turn away." And Rav Nahman son of Yitzhak said: "Ask your father and he will tell you."

hebrew_text: (מַאי מְמַעֵט? — זְמַן. אֵימָא מְמַעֵט נֵס? נֵס כֹּל יוֹמָא אִיתֵיהּ). רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי לַהּ בְּהֶדְיָא, אָמַר רַב: כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִצְוַת לוּלָב.
human_translation: What omit omits time: And say he omits miracle: miracle is all days, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak taught explicitly, Rav said: all seven the mitzva of lulav .
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "mema'et"? - Time. Shall we say "mema'et" is a miracle? A miracle is with it every day. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches it in the academy, Rav said: All seven mitzvot of the lulav.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָעוֹשֶׂה סוּכָּה לְעַצְמוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... שֶׁהֶחֱיָינוּ כּוּ׳״. נִכְנַס לֵישֵׁב בָּהּ, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ כּוּ׳״. הָיְתָה עֲשׂוּיָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת, אִם יָכוֹל לְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ דָּבָר — מְבָרֵךְ. אִם לָאו, לִכְשֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לֵישֵׁב בָּהּ — מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ אַכָּסָא דְקִדּוּשָׁא.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who establishes a sukka for himself recites: Blessed…Who has given us life, he enters to reside in he recites: Who has sanctified us was established and standing if he is able to introduce a novel element he recites the blessing: And if not, when he enters to reside in he recites two blessings: Rav Ashi said: I observed Rav Kahana, who recites all over the cup kiddush .
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who makes a sukkah for himself, he says: "Blessed is God... who has kept us alive." If he enters to sit in it, he says: "Blessed is God... who has sanctified us." If it was made and standing, if he can introduce something new into it, he recites a blessing. If not, when he enters to sit in it, he recites two blessings. Rav Ashe said: I saw Rav Kahana saying to all of them, "The cup of sanctification."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו מִצְוֹת הַרְבֵּה, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ ... אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל הַמִּצְוֹת״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְבָרֵךְ עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ יוֹם יוֹם״, וְכִי בַּיּוֹם מְבָרְכִין אוֹתוֹ, וּבַלַּיְלָה אֵין מְבָרְכִין אוֹתוֹ? אֶלָּא בָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: בְּכׇל יוֹם וְיוֹם תֵּן לוֹ מֵעֵין בִּרְכוֹתָיו, הָכָא נָמֵי — בְּכׇל דָּבָר וְדָבָר תֵּן לוֹ מֵעֵין בִּרְכוֹתָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one had several mitzvot before him he recites: Blessed…Who has sanctified us with His mitzvot, and commanded us concerning the mitzvot. Rabbi Yehuda says: He recites a blessing over each and every one in and of itself. Rabbi Zeira said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Zeira said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa What is the rationale for of Rabbi Yehuda? as it is written: “Blessed is the Lord, day by day” Is it so that one blesses Him by day and does not bless Him at night? Rather, to tell you: Each and every day, give the Lord blessings Here too, with regard to each and every matter, give Him blessings appropriate
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one had many mitzvot before him, he says: "Blessed is He who sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the commandments." Rabbi Yehuda says: One blesses for each one separately. Rabbi Zeira said, and some say it was Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Zeira said, and some say it was Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? Because it is written: "Blessed be the Lord day by day." And is it only during the day that one blesses Him, and not at night? Rather, he comes to tell you: Every day, give Him blessings akin to His blessings. Here too — for every matter, give Him blessings akin to His blessings.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם — כְּלִי רֵיקָן
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood is an empty vessel
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said, and some say it was Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood is like an empty vessel.

hebrew_text: מַחֲזִיק, מָלֵא — אֵינוֹ מַחֲזִיק. אֲבָל מִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָלֵא — מַחֲזִיק, רֵיקָן — אֵינוֹ מַחֲזִיק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע וְגוֹ׳״. ״אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ — ״תִּשְׁמַע״. וְאִם לָאו — לֹא תִּשְׁמַע. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ — בְּיָשָׁן, ״תִּשְׁמַע״ — בְּחָדָשׁ. ״וְאִם יִפְנֶה לְבָבְךָ״ — שׁוּב לֹא תִשְׁמָע.
human_translation: holds a full does not hold However, the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, a full vessel he holds an empty will not hold it is stated: “And it shall come to pass, if you will hearken diligently [ shamoa tishma ] unto If you hearken [ shamoa ] you will hearken [ tishma ] and if not, you will not hearken. Alternatively: If you hearkened to the old, you will hearken to the new “But if your heart turns away” ( you will no longer hearken.
llm_translation: One who holds, full — does not hold. But according to the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He: full — holds, empty — does not hold, as it is stated: "And it shall come to pass, if you shall hearken." "If you shall hearken" — "you shall hearken." And if not — you shall not hearken. Another interpretation: "If you shall hearken" — in the old, "you shall hearken" — in the new. "But if your heart turns away" — turn back, you shall not hearken.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד תִּינוֹקוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶתְרוֹג בַּשְּׁבִיעִי — אָסוּר, בַּשְּׁמִינִי — מוּתָּר. סוּכָּה — אֲפִילּוּ בַּשְּׁמִינִי, אֲסוּרָה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֶתְרוֹג — אֲפִילּוּ בַּשְּׁבִיעִי נָמֵי מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Immediately children Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is prohibited etrog on the seventh on the eighth it is permitted. It is prohibited sukka even on the eighth And Reish Lakish said: It is permitted etrog even on the seventh
llm_translation: Immediately children etc. Rabbi Yohanan said: An etrog on the seventh day — forbidden, on the eighth day — permitted. A sukkah — even on the eighth day, it is forbidden. And Reish Lakish said: An etrog — even on the seventh day itself is permitted.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: לְמִצְוָתַהּ אִתַּקְצַאי, וּמַר סָבַר: כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא אִתַּקְצַאי.
human_translation: what do they disagree? One Sage, holds was set aside for its mitzva; And one Sage, holds that was set aside for the entire day.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: for its mitzvah it is designated, and the other Master holds: it is designated for the entire day.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִיָּד תִּינוֹקוֹת שׁוֹמְטִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן וְאוֹכְלִין אֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן. מַאי לָאו, הוּא הַדִּין לִגְדוֹלִים! לָא, תִּינוֹקוֹת דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan Immediately children remove their lulavim and eat their etrogim . What, is it not the same is true for adults, No, children specifically,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "Immediately children release their belts and eat their etrogim." What is the reason? Is it not the same for adults! No, specifically children.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִיָּד הַתִּינוֹקוֹת שׁוֹמְטִין אֶת לוּלְבֵיהֶן וְאוֹכְלִין אֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן. תִּינוֹקוֹת — אִין, גְּדוֹלִים לָא! הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ גְּדוֹלִים, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי תִּינוֹקוֹת — אוֹרְחָא דְּמִלְּתָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish Immediately children remove their lulavim and eat their etrogim . children, yes, adults, no, The same is true for adults, and the reason that is teaching children it is teaching the manner matter
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "Immediately the children release their lulavs and eat their etrogs." Children - yes, adults - no! It is the same whether they are adults, and this that it teaches "children" - it is merely the common way of speaking.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי שְׁנָא סוּכָּה, מַאי שְׁנָא אֶתְרוֹג?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is different a sukka what is different an etrog ?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: To Rabbi Yochanan, what is the difference between a Sukkah, what is the difference between an Etrog?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סוּכָּה דְּחַזְיָא לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, דְּאִי אִיתְרְמִי לֵיהּ סְעוֹדְתָּא בָּעֵי מֵיתַב בְּגַוַּוהּ וּמֵיכַל (בַּהּ) בְּגַוַּוהּ, אִתַּקְצַאי לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, וּמִיגּוֹ דְּאִתַּקְצַאי לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת — אִתַּקְצַאי לְכוּלֵּי יוֹמָא דִּשְׁמִינִי. אֶתְרוֹג, דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת — לָא אִתַּקְצַאי לְבֵין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, וְלָא אִתַּקְצַאי לְכוּלֵּי יוֹמָא דִּשְׁמִינִי.
human_translation: said to him: a sukka , it is suitable even during twilight as, if a meal happens to him he is required to sit in and eat in is set aside for twilight and since it is set aside for twilight it is set aside for the entire eighth day. an etrog , which, is not suitable during twilight not set aside during twilight it is not set aside for the entire eighth day.
llm_translation: He said to him: A sukkah that is visible between the suns, for if they prepared for it a meal in the sun and ate in the sun, it is considered visible between the suns, and from the time it is considered visible between the suns, it is considered visible for the entire eighth day. An etrog, if it is not visible between the suns, it is not considered visible between the suns, and it is not considered visible for the entire eighth day.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי אָמַר: אֶתְרוֹג אֲפִילּוּ בַּשְּׁמִינִי אָסוּר, וַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֶתְרוֹג בַּשְּׁבִיעִי אָסוּר, בַּשְּׁמִינִי מוּתָּר. קָם אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּשִׁיטְתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי, קָם רַבִּי זֵירָא בְּשִׁיטְתֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֶתְרוֹג שֶׁנִּפְסְלָה — אָסוּר לְאוֹכְלָהּ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: And Levi said: It is prohibited the etrog even on the eighth The father of Shmuel said: It is prohibited the etrog on the seventh and it is permitted on the eighth the father of Shmuel assumed the opinion of Levi. Rabbi Zeira, assumed the opinion of the father of Shmuel, as Rabbi Zeira said: an etrog that was rendered unfit it is prohibited to eat it all seven days,
llm_translation: Levi said: An etrog, even on the eighth day, is forbidden. But the father of Shmuel said: An etrog on the seventh day is forbidden, but on the eighth day it is permitted. The father of Shmuel stood by the opinion of Levi, while Rabbi Zeira stood by the opinion of the father of Shmuel. For Rabbi Zeira said: An etrog that became disqualified - it is forbidden to eat it for seven days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לָא לִיקְנֵי אִינִישׁ הוֹשַׁעְנָא לְיָנוֹקָא בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא קַמָּא. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּיָנוֹקָא מִקְנֵא קָנֵי, אַקְנוֹיֵי לָא מַקְנֵי. וְאִשְׁתְּכַח דְּקָא נָפֵיק בְּלוּלָב שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: A person should not transfer ownership of the four species to a child on the first day of the Festival. What is the rationale acquisition, a child acquire however, transferring ownership, not to transfer ownership And will result fulfill with a lulav that is not his.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: A person should not engage in buying a lulav for a child on the first day of the festival. What is the reason? Because a child acquires (property) and does not acquire (property). And it was found that he took a lulav that is not his.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לָא לֵימָא אִינִישׁ לְיָנוֹקָא ״דְּיָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ מִידֵּי״ וְלָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי לְאַגְמוֹרֵיהּ שִׁיקְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִמְּדוּ לְשׁוֹנָם דַּבֶּר שֶׁקֶר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: A person should not say to a child: I will give you something, and not give to him, because he comes to teach him lying, as it is stated: “They have taught their tongues to speak lies”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: One should not say to a child, "I will give you this as a gift," and then not give it to him, because it leads to falsehood, as it is stated: "They have taught their tongue to speak lies."

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּאִיתְּמַר: הִפְרִישׁ שִׁבְעָה אֶתְרוֹגִין לְשִׁבְעָה יָמִים, אָמַר רַב: כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת יוֹצֵא בָּהּ וְאוֹכְלָהּ לְאַלְתַּר, וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת יוֹצֵא בָּהּ וְאוֹכְלָהּ לְמָחָר. בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: לְמִצְוָתַהּ אִתַּקְצַאי. וּמַר סָבַר: לְכוּלֵּי יוֹמָא אִתַּקְצַאי.
human_translation: And with regard to the dispute of Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, as it was stated: one designated seven etrogim for seven days Rav said: With each and every one, he fulfills his obligation with it and he eat it immediately. And Rav Asi said: With each and every one, he fulfills his obligation with it and he eat it the following day. With regard to what do they disagree? One Sage, holds: was set aside for the mitzva; Sage, holds: was set aside for the entire day.
llm_translation: In the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, it was stated: One should set aside seven etrogim for seven days. Rav said: Each and every one goes out with it and eats it immediately, and Rav Assi said: Each and every one goes out with it and eats it the next day. What are they disagreeing about? One Master holds: It should be set aside for its mitzvah, and the other Master holds: It should be set aside for all the days.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן דְּאִית לַן תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמִינִי סְפֵק שְׁבִיעִי — אָסוּר, תְּשִׁיעִי סְפֵק שְׁמִינִי — מוּתָּר. מָרִימָר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁמִינִי סְפֵק שְׁבִיעִי — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And we, who have two days how do we act Abaye said: eighth uncertainty seventh it is prohibited, ninth uncertainty eighth it is permitted. Mareimar said: Even eighth uncertainty seventh permitted.
llm_translation: We who have two days, how do we act? Abaye said: The eighth day of doubt regarding the seventh — forbidden, the ninth day of doubt regarding the eighth — permitted. Marimar said: Even the eighth day of doubt regarding the seventh — permitted.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא עָבְדִי כְּמָרִימָר, רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי עָבֵיד כְּאַבַּיֵּי. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּאַבַּיֵּי.
human_translation: In Sura they acted in accordance with Mareimar Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, acted in accordance with Abaye. The halakha is in accordance with Abaye.
llm_translation: In Sura, the servants of Marimar, Rav Shisha son of Rav Idi would act like Abbaye. And the halakha is like Abbaye.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: שְׁמִינִי סְפֵק שְׁבִיעִי, שְׁבִיעִי לְסוּכָּה וּשְׁמִינִי לִבְרָכָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שְׁמִינִי לָזֶה וְלָזֶה. מֵיתַב כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּיָתְבִינַן, כִּי פְּלִיגִי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: the eighth uncertainty seventh seventh to the sukka and eighth to the blessing, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: eighth to this, and to that, Everyone, agrees that we reside When they disagree is
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, said in the name of Rav: The eighth day is in doubt whether it is considered part of the seventh day of Sukkot, the seventh day for dwelling in the Sukkah, and the eighth day for blessings. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The eighth day for this one purpose and for that one purpose. The entire world agrees that when they sit in the Sukkah they do not disagree, but they do disagree.

hebrew_text: לְבָרוֹכֵי. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁבִיעִי לְסוּכָּה — בָּרוֹכֵי נָמֵי מְבָרְכִינַן, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁמִינִי לָזֶה וְלָזֶה — בָּרוֹכֵי לָא מְבָרְכִינַן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: נְקוֹט דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּיָדְךָ, דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא וְכׇל גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר אִיקְּלַעוּ בְּסוּכָּה בִּשְׁמִינִי סְפֵק שְׁבִיעִי. מֵיתַב הֲווֹ יָתְבִי, בָּרוֹכֵי לָא בָּרִיכוּ.
human_translation: to recite the blessing to the one who says seventh to the sukka , we also recite the blessing: to the one who says eighth to this and to that, we do not recite the blessing. Rav Yosef said: Take of Rabbi Yoḥanan in your hand, As Rav Huna bar Bizna and all the prominent of the generation happened sukka on the eighth uncertainty seventh they were sitting they did not recite the blessing.
llm_translation: The blessed ones. According to the one who says the seventh day is for the sukkah - the blessed ones, we bless. According to the one who says the eighth day for this one and for that one - the blessed ones, we do not bless. Rav Yosef said: Take hold of the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan, for Rav Huna son of Bizna and all the great ones of the generation would enter the sukkah on the eighth day of doubt of the seventh. They would sit, they would not bless.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁבֵּירַךְ יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שׁוּב אֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ? גְּמִירִי דְּמֵאֲפָר אֲתוֹ.
human_translation: And perhaps they hold in accordance with the one who said: Once he recited the blessing on first Festival he does not recite it again learned that were coming from the fields,
llm_translation: And perhaps he holds like the one who says: Since one already recited Kiddush on the first day of Yom Tov, he does not recite it again? We learn that he comes to nullify it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בָּרוֹכֵי — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מְבָרְכִינַן. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, לְמֵיתַב. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁבְעָה לְסוּכָּה — מֵיתַב יָתְבִינַן, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁמִינִי לָזֶה וְלָזֶה — מֵיתַב נָמֵי לָא יָתְבִינַן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: נְקוֹט דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּידָךְ, דְּמָרָא דִשְׁמַעְתָּא מַנִּי — רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת, וּבִשְׁמִינִי סְפֵק שְׁבִיעִי לְבַר מִסּוּכָּה יָתֵיב. וְהִלְכְתָא: מֵיתַב יָתְבִינַן, בָּרוֹכֵי לָא מְבָרְכִינַן.
human_translation: Some say Everyone agrees that we do not recite the blessing; when they disagree to reside to the one who says seventh to the sukka , we reside to the one who says eighth to this and to that, neither do we reside Rav Yosef said: Take of Rabbi Yoḥanan in your hand, as who is the Master of the halakha ? Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, and on the eighth uncertainty seventh resides outside of the sukka . And the halakha is that we reside we do not recite the blessing.
llm_translation: There are some who say: Baruchei - everyone in the world does not argue that we do not bless. When they do argue, it is to sit. According to the one who says seven for the sukkah - they sit and understand, and according to the one who says eight for this and for that - they also sit but do not understand. Rav Yosef said: Take the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan in your hand, for the master you heard from me is Rav Yehudah the son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat, and on the eighth day, the doubt of the seventh sits in the sukkah. And the halacha is: they sit and understand, but the Baruchei do not bless.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹמְרִים זְמַן בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג, וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים זְמַן בִּשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל פֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said one recites time, on the eighth of the Festival, and one does not recite time on the seventh of Passover
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They say the time on the eighth day of the festival, and they do not say the time on the seventh day of Passover.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חָמָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי חָלוּק בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: בְּסוּכָּה, וְלוּלָב, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם. וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: בַּלּוֹג הָיָה מְנַסֵּךְ כׇּל שְׁמוֹנָה, הֲרֵי חָלוּק בִּשְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama said, and some say Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina Know as it is distinct with regard to three matters: With regard to sukka , and lulav , and the water libation, And according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: With one log pours all eight is distinct with regard to two matters.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi son of Chama said, and some say it was Rabbi Chama son of Chanina: Know that they disagreed on three matters: regarding the Sukkah, the Lulav, and the pouring of water libation. And according to Rabbi Yehuda who said: With a log he would pour all eight, they disagreed on two matters.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל פֶּסַח נָמֵי: הֲרֵי חָלוּק בַּאֲכִילַת מַצָּה! דְּאָמַר מָר: לַיְלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — חוֹבָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ רְשׁוּת. הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם — מִלַּיְלָה חָלוּק, מִיּוֹם אֵינוֹ חָלוּק. הָכָא — אֲפִילּוּ מִיּוֹם נָמֵי חָלוּק.
human_translation: If so, seventh of Passover as well, as it is distinct eating matza , as the Master said: first night an obligation From that onward, it is optional; How can be compared? There, is distinct from the night; it is not distinct from the day, Here, is distinct even from the day.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, the seventh of Pesach is indeed: there is a division in the eating of matzah! As Mar said: the first night - obligatory, from here on - optional. Is it so now?! There - from night it is divided, from day it is not divided. Here - even from day it is divided.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: זֶה חָלוּק מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו, וְזֶה חָלוּק מִשֶּׁלִּפְנֵי פָנָיו.
human_translation: Ravina said This, is distinct from before it, that, is distinct from previous to the day before,
llm_translation: Ravinah said: This is a division from his face, and this is a division from before his face.

hebrew_text: (אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא): הָכָא כְּתִיב ״פַּר״, הָתָם כְּתִיב ״פָּרִים״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Here, it is written: bull” There, it is written: bulls”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here it is written "par," there it is written "parim."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר, הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם״, הָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּבַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Here, it is written: “On the day there, it is written: And on the day,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, here it is written: "in the day," there it is written: "and in the day."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״, הָתָם כְּתִיב: ״כְּמִשְׁפָּטָם״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Here, it is written: as per the regulation” there, it is written: as per their regulation”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, here it is written: "like the judgment," there it is written: "like their judgment."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַפָּרִים הָאֵילִים וְהַכְּבָשִׂים, מְעַכְּבִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: פָּרִים אֵין מְעַכְּבִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, שֶׁהֲרֵי מִתְמַעֲטִין וְהוֹלְכִין.
human_translation: Let us say supports the bulls, the rams, or the sheep prevents the other Rabbi Yehuda says: the bulls does not prevent other since they decrease progressively
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: the bulls, rams, and lambs, they impede one another. And Rabbi Yehuda says: Bulls do not impede one another, for they decrease and go.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא כּוּלָּן מִתְמַעֲטִין וְהוֹלְכִין בַּשְּׁמִינִי! אָמַר לָהֶן: שְׁמִינִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא. שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁשִּׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַחַג טְעוּנִין קׇרְבָּן וְשִׁיר וּבְרָכָה וְלִינָה, אַף שְׁמִינִי טָעוּן קׇרְבָּן וְשִׁיר וּבְרָכָה וְלִינָה.
human_translation: said to But don’t the numbers of all eventually decrease on the eighth said to them: Eighth is a Festival in and of itself. As just as the seven days of the festival require an offering, and a song and a blessing and staying overnight so too, eighth requires an offering, and a song and a blessing and staying overnight
llm_translation: They said to him: But don't they all decrease and go on the eighth day! He said to them: The eighth day is distinct by itself. Just as the seven days of the holiday require sacrifices, song, blessing, and dwelling, so too the eighth day requires sacrifices, song, blessing, and dwelling.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, זְמַן? לֹא, בִּרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן וּתְפִלָּה.
human_translation: What, is it not time, No, Grace after Meals and prayer,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not, the blessing of the food and prayer.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ זְמַן — זְמַן כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: דְּאִי לָא בָּרֵיךְ הָאִידָּנָא — מְבָרֵךְ לִמְחַר, אוֹ לְיוֹמָא אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as should it enter your mind time, is there all seven This not difficult, if one did not recite the blessing today, he recites the blessing on the next day or on another day
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: If one's mind is preoccupied, for if the time has passed, is there any time during the entire week? This is not difficult: for if one did not bless now, one may bless tomorrow or on another day.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם כּוֹס בָּעֵינַן! לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זְמַן אוֹמְרוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בַּשּׁוּק. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ בָּעֵינַן כּוֹס — כּוֹס כֹּל יוֹמָא מִי אִיכָּא? דִּלְמָא דְּאִיקְּלַע לֵיהּ כּוֹס.
human_translation: in any case we require a cup let us say supports Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said: One recites time even in the marketplace, as, if you say that we require a cup is there a cup of wine every day Perhaps a cup happened to him.
llm_translation: From every place, a cup we require! Let us say it supports for Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said: His time is even in the market. For if you say a cup we require - is there a cup every day? Perhaps a cup will come to him.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שְׁמִינִי טָעוּן לִינָה? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ טָעוּן לִינָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפָנִיתָ בַבֹּקֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ לְאֹהָלֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים תֹּאכַל מַצּוֹת״. אֶת שֶׁטָּעוּן שִׁשָּׁה — טָעוּן לִינָה, אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ טָעוּן שִׁשָּׁה — אֵינוֹ טָעוּן לִינָה. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי נָמֵי שְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג?
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold Eighth requires stay overnight But wasn’t taught Rabbi Yehuda says: From where that the second Pesaḥ , does not require staying overnight As it is stated “And you shall turn in the morning and go unto your tents” written: “Six days you shall eat matzot ” That which requires six requires staying overnight; that which does not require six does not require staying overnight. What to exclude? Is it not to exclude eighth day of the Festival,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yehuda the Eighth thought that the second Passover requires lodging? But isn't it taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: From where do we derive that the second Passover, which does not require lodging? As it is stated: "And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents," and it is written: "You shall eat unleavened bread for six days." That which requires six — requires lodging, that which does not require six — does not require lodging. What is the exclusion for? Is it not to exclude also the eighth day of the festival?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: הַבִּיכּוּרִים טְעוּנִין קׇרְבָּן וְשִׁיר וּתְנוּפָה וְלִינָה. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר תְּנוּפָה — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְקָאָמַר: טָעוּן לִינָה.
human_translation: No, to exclude the second Pesaḥ , which is similar to So too, it is reasonable as we learned The first fruits require offering a song waving, and staying overnight. Whom did you hear who said waving? Rabbi Yehuda, and is saying require staying overnight.
llm_translation: Not for, for the exclusion of the second Passover offering. So too it is logical, as we learned: The Bikurim require a sacrifice, a song, waving, and staying overnight. Who heard that waving is necessary? Rabbi Yehuda, and he says: Staying overnight is required.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִנַּחְתּוֹ״ — זוֹ תְּנוּפָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר זוֹ תְּנוּפָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא הַנָּחָה מַמָּשׁ. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהִנִּיחוֹ״, הֲרֵי הַנָּחָה אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְהִנַּחְתּוֹ״ — זוֹ תְּנוּפָה.
human_translation: as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says “And you shall set it down this is waving you say this is waving, or only to actually setting it down When says: and set it down setting it down is already stated. How, do I establish “And you shall set it down”? This is waving.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: "And you shall set it down" - this is waving. You say this is waving, or is it only actual setting down? When it says "And he shall place it," behold, actual placing is meant. How do I fulfill "And you shall set it down" - this is waving.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן הַטֶּנֶא מִיָּדֶךָ״ — לִימֵּד עַל הַבִּיכּוּרִים שֶׁטְּעוּנִין תְּנוּפָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: And perhaps it is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, As it was taught “And the priest shall take the basket from your hand” taught concerning first fruits that they require waving. statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And perhaps it is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as it was taught: "And the priest shall take the basket from your hand" — this teaches about the first fruits that require waving, the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב? אָתְיָא ״יָד״ ״יָד״ מִשְּׁלָמִים, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן הַטֶּנֶא מִיָּדֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יָדָיו תְּבִיאֶינָה אֵת אִשֵּׁי ה׳״.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? is derived “hand” “hand” a peace-offering. It is written here, “And the priest shall take the basket from your hand,” and it is written there, “His own hands shall bring the offerings of the Lord made by fire;
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov? It is derived "hand" "hand" from the payment, as it is written here: "And the priest shall take the basket from your hand," and it is written there: "His hands shall bring the offerings of the Lord."

hebrew_text: מָה כָּאן — כֹּהֵן, אַף לְהַלָּן — כֹּהֵן. וּמָה לְהַלָּן — בְּעָלִים, אַף כָּאן — בְּעָלִים. הָא כֵּיצַד? כֹּהֵן מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ תַּחַת יָד בְּעָלִים וּמֵנִיף.
human_translation: just as here, a priest so too, a priest And just as there, owner so too here, owner How so? priest places his hand under the hand of the owner and waves
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "What here — priest, also there — priest. And what there — owners, also here — owners. How so? Priest places his hand under the hand of owners and waves."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אוֹמְרִים זְמַן בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵין אוֹמְרִים זְמַן בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג. וְהִלְכְתָא: אוֹמְרִים זְמַן בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: What was reached concerning Rav Naḥman said: One recites time on the eighth of the festival And Rav Sheshet said: One does not recite time on the eighth of the Festival. And the halakha is one recites time on the eighth of the Festival.
llm_translation: What is the law regarding it? Rav Nachman said: They say the time on the eighth day of the festival, and Rav Sheshet said: They do not say the time on the eighth day of the festival. And the halakha is: They say the time on the eighth day of the festival.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: שְׁמִינִי
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with of Rav Naḥman: eighth
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Nachman: "Shemini"

hebrew_text: רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ לְעִנְיַן פָּזֵ״‎ר קֶשֶׁ״‎ב. פַּיִיס בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. זְמַן בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. קׇרְבָּן בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. שִׁירָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. בְּרָכָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: a Festival in and of itself to the matter Peh , zayin , reish ; kuf , shin , beit . A lottery [ payis ] in and of itself, time [ zeman ], in and of itself, a Festival [ regel ] in and of itself, an offering [ korban ] in and of itself, a song [ shira ] in and of itself, a blessing [ berakha ] in and of itself,
llm_translation: Foot by itself for the matter of Pasar Keshev. Payment by itself. Time by itself. Foot by itself. Offering by itself. Song by itself. Blessing by itself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַהַלֵּל וְהַשִּׂמְחָה — שְׁמוֹנָה. כֵּיצַד? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחַיָּיב אָדָם בְּהַלֵּל וּבְשִׂמְחָה וּבִכְבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג כִּשְׁאָר כׇּל יְמוֹת הַחַג.
human_translation: The hallel and the rejoicing are eight How so? teaches that a person is obligated in hallel , and in the rejoicing, and in reverence for the last day of the Festival like all the other days of the Festival.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Halal and Simchah - eight." How so? This teaches that a person is obligated in Halal, Simchah, and honoring the last day of the festival just like all the other days of the festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי — דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהָיִיתָ אַךְ שָׂמֵחַ״ — לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אַךְ״ — חִלֵּק.
human_translation: From where are these matters, as the Sages taught “And you shall be altogether joyful” to include the evenings of the last day of the Festival, Or it only the the first day of the Festival. When says: Altogether, it distinguished
llm_translation: Gemara: These words - as the Rabbis taught: "And you shall only be joyful" - to include the nights of the last day of the festival. Or is it specifically the first day of the festival? When it says "only" - it divides.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן וּלְהוֹצִיא לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן — שֶׁיֵּשׁ שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי לֵילֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן — שֶׁאֵין שִׂמְחָה לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: What did you see to include the evenings of the last day of the Festival and to exclude the evenings of the first day of the Festival? I include the evenings of the last day of the Festival, before which there is rejoicing, and I exclude the evenings of the first day of the Festival, before which there is not rejoicing,
llm_translation: And what did you see to include the nights of the last day of a festival and to exclude the nights of the first day of a festival? I include the nights of the last day of a festival - because there is joy before it, and I exclude the nights of the first day of a festival - because there is no joy before it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סוּכָּה — שִׁבְעָה. כֵּיצַד? גָּמַר מִלֶּאֱכוֹל — לֹא יַתִּיר אֶת סוּכָּתוֹ. אֲבָל מוֹרִיד אֶת הַכֵּלִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: sukka seven How one finished eating he not dismantle his sukka However, he takes the vessels down from minḥa and onward in deference to the last day of the Festival,
