llm_translation: Mishnah: A sukkah - seven. How so? If one finishes eating - he may not remove his sukkah. But he may remove the vessels from the meal-offering and upwards, due to the honor of the last day of the festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֵין לוֹ כֵּלִים לְהוֹרִיד, מַהוּ? אֵין לוֹ כֵּלִים?! אֶלָּא כִּי אִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּמַאי אִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ? אֶלָּא: אֵין לוֹ מָקוֹם לְהוֹרִיד כֵּלָיו, מַהוּ? רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר (רַב) אָמַר: פּוֹחֵת בָּהּ אַרְבָּעָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: מַדְלִיק בָּהּ אֶת הַנֵּר.
human_translation: one does not have vessels to take down what One does not have vessels? But when he utilized with what did he he utilized Rather, If he has no place he take down his vessels what Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav said: He reduces four And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: He lights a lamp inside
llm_translation: Gemara: If one does not have vessels to lower water, what is the law? He does not have vessels?! Rather, when he used vessels for one purpose, can he use them for another purpose? Rather: He does not have a place to lower his vessels, what is the law? Rabbi Chiya bar (Rav) said: He should decrease the water by four handbreadths. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: He should light a candle in it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא לַן וְהָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: And they do not disagree This is for us, and this is for them,
llm_translation: And he did not argue: this one for us and this one for them.

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח סוּכָּה קְטַנָּה, סוּכָּה גְּדוֹלָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דִּמְעַיֵּיל בַּהּ מָאנֵי מֵיכְלָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מָאנֵי מֵיכְלָא — בַּר מִמְּטַלַּלְתָּא. מָאנֵי מִשְׁתְּיָא — בִּמְטַלַּלְתָּא.
human_translation: This well a small sukka , a large sukka , what can be said? that he brings eating vessels, into as Rava said: Eating vessels out of the sukka ; drinking vessels in the sukka .
llm_translation: Here is a small sukkah, a large sukkah, what can be said? One can walk in it from one side to the other. For Rava said: "One can walk in it from one side to the other." If one can drink in it, it is a sukkah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם כֵּיצַד? צְלוֹחִית שֶׁל זָהָב מַחְזֶקֶת שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּים הָיָה מְמַלֵּא מִן הַשִּׁילוֹחַ. הִגִּיעוּ לְשַׁעַר הַמַּיִם, תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ. עָלָה בַּכֶּבֶשׁ וּפָנָה לִשְׂמֹאלוֹ, שְׁנֵי סְפָלִים שֶׁל כֶּסֶף הָיוּ שָׁם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל סִיד הָיוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיוּ מוּשְׁחָרִין פְּנֵיהֶם מִפְּנֵי הַיַּיִן. וּמְנוּקָּבִין
human_translation: water libation how One would fill a golden jug with a capacity of three log from the Siloam reached the Gate of the Water, they sounded a tekia , sounded a terua , and sounded tekia ascended the ramp and turned to his left. There were two silver basins there Rabbi Yehuda said: They were limestone but they would blacken due to the wine perforated
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How is the water libation performed? A golden flask holding three log was filled from the Shiloach. They arrived at the Water Gate, blew a blast, shouted, and blew a blast. He ascended the ramp and turned to his left; there were two silver basins there. Rabbi Yehuda says: They were made of plaster, but their faces were blackened due to the wine. And they had holes.

hebrew_text: כְּמִין שְׁנֵי חוֹטָמִין דַּקִּין, (וְאֶחָד) מְעוּבֶּה וְאֶחָד דַּק, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כָּלִין בְּבַת אַחַת. מַעֲרָבוֹ — שֶׁל מַיִם, מִזְרָחוֹ — שֶׁל יַיִן. עֵירָה שֶׁל מַיִם לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל יַיִן, וְשֶׁל יַיִן לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל מַיִם — יָצָא.
human_translation: two thin nose-like One broad, and one, thin, so that both conclude simultaneously. west of for water, east of for wine. one poured of water into of wine, or of wine into of water, he fulfilled
llm_translation: Like two thin threads, one thick and one thin, so that both of them should be woven together in one warp. Its west is water, its east is wine. If water is poured into wine, or wine into water, it is valid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּלּוֹג הָיָה מְנַסֵּךְ כׇּל שְׁמוֹנָה. וְלַמְנַסֵּךְ אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הַגְבַּהּ יָדֶךָ. שֶׁפַּעַם אֶחָד נִסֵּךְ אֶחָד עַל גַּבֵּי רַגְלָיו, וּרְגָמוּהוּ כׇּל הָעָם בְּאֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: one would pour with one log all eight And says to the one pouring Raise your hand, as one time poured on his feet, all the people pelted him with their etrogim .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In the Beis HaMikdash, he would pour the entire Shemonah. And to the one who poured, they would say to him: "Raise your hand." For once, one poured on his feet, and the entire nation stoned him with their esrogim.

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל כָּךְ מַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיָה מְמַלֵּא מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת חָבִית שֶׁל זָהָב שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת מִן הַשִּׁילוֹחַ וּמַנִּיחָהּ בַּלִּשְׁכָּה. נִשְׁפְּכָה, נִתְגַּלְּתָה, הָיָה מְמַלֵּא מִן הַכִּיּוֹר. שֶׁהַיַּיִן וְהַמַּיִם מְגוּלִּין — פְּסוּלִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: As its performance during the week, so is its performance on Shabbat, except on Shabbat eve, one would fill a golden barrel that was not consecrated from the Siloam and he place it in the chamber spilled, was exposed one would fill from the basin as exposed wine or water is unfit for the altar.
llm_translation: As his action on a weekday, so is his action on Shabbat, except that he was filling from Friday a barrel of gold that is not sanctified from the press, and he placed it in the chamber. If it spilled and was revealed, he was filling from the pitcher. Because wine and water that are poured out are disqualified for the altar.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב עֵינָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם מַיִם בְּשָׂשׂוֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Eina said as the verse states: “With joy [ sason ] you shall draw water
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rav Eina said, as the verse says: "And you shall draw water with joy..."

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי מִינֵי, חַד שְׁמֵיהּ שָׂשׂוֹן וְחַד שְׁמֵיהּ שִׂמְחָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שָׂשׂוֹן לְשִׂמְחָה: אֲנָא עֲדִיפְנָא מִינָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׂשׂוֹן וְשִׂמְחָה יַשִּׂיגוּ וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שִׂמְחָה לְשָׂשׂוֹן: אֲנָא עֲדִיפְנָא מִינָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׂמְחָה וְשָׂשׂוֹן לַיְּהוּדִים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שָׂשׂוֹן לְשִׂמְחָה: חַד יוֹמָא שָׁבְקוּךְ וְשַׁוְּיוּךְ פַּרְוַונְקָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי בְשִׂמְחָה תֵצֵאוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שִׂמְחָה לְשָׂשׂוֹן: חַד יוֹמָא שָׁבְקוּךְ וּמָלוּ בָּךְ מַיָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם מַיִם בְּשָׂשׂוֹן״.
human_translation: these two heretics, one named Sason and one named Simḥa. Sason said to Simḥa: I am superior to you, as it is written: “They shall obtain joy [ sason ] and happiness [ simḥa ], Simḥa said to Sason, I am superior to you, as it is written: “There was happiness [ simḥa ] and joy [ sason ] for the Jews” Sason said to Simḥa: One day they will dismiss you and render you a messenger [ parvanka ], as it is written: “For you shall go out with happiness [ simḥa ]” Simḥa said to Sason: One day they will dismiss you and draw water with you, as it is written: “With joy [ sason ] you shall draw water.”
llm_translation: Behold, there are two types: one is named Sasson and one is named Simchah. Sasson said to Simchah: I am preferable to you, as it is written: "Sasson and Simchah will reach." Simchah said to Sasson: I am preferable to you, as it is written: "Simchah and Sasson for the Jews." Sasson said to Simchah: One day they left you and adorned you with a crown, as it is written: "For with joy you shall go out." Simchah said to Sasson: One day they left you and filled you with water, as it is written: "And you shall draw water with joy."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא דִּשְׁמֵיהּ שָׂשׂוֹן לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עֲתִידִיתוּ דִּתְמַלּוֹ לִי מַיִם לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם מַיִם בְּשָׂשׂוֹן״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִיב ״לְשָׂשׂוֹן״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״בְּשָׂשׂוֹן״ — מַשְׁכֵּיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא מְשַׁוֵּינַן לֵיהּ גּוֹדָא וּמָלֵינַן בֵּיהּ מַיָּא.
human_translation: A certain heretic named Sason said to Rabbi Abbahu: You are destined to draw water for me in the World-to-Come, as it is written: “With sason you shall draw water.” said to him: If it had been written: For sason , as you say; now that it is written: With sason , the skin of that man, will be rendered a wineskin, and we will draw water with it.
llm_translation: He said to him, that heretic whose name was Sason said to Rabbi Avahu: "You will draw water for me in the world to come, as it is written: 'And you shall draw water with joy.'" He said to him: If it had been written 'for joy,' as you say, now that it is written 'with joy,' we draw a line and say the water is for him.

hebrew_text: עָלָה בַּכֶּבֶשׁ וּפָנָה לִשְׂמֹאלוֹ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הָעוֹלִים לְמִזְבֵּחַ — עוֹלִין דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין וּמַקִּיפִין וְיוֹרְדִין דֶּרֶךְ שְׂמֹאל. חוּץ מִן הָעוֹלֶה לִשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ, שֶׁעוֹלִין דֶּרֶךְ שְׂמֹאל וְחוֹזְרִין עַל הֶעָקֵב. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַיַּיִן, וְעוֹלַת הָעוֹף כְּשֶׁרָבְתָה בַּמִּזְרָח.
human_translation: ascended the ramp and turned to his left. The Sages taught: All who ascend the altar ascend via right, and circle and descend via left. except for one ascending these three tasks, as ascend via left, and turn on heel and return And are: The water libation, and the wine libation, and the bird a burnt-offering when there were many in the east
llm_translation: He went up on the ramp and turned to his left. The Rabbis taught: All those who ascend to the altar - they ascend to the right and circle around and descend to the left. Except for these three things, for they ascend to the left and return on the same path. And these are they: the water libation, the wine libation, and the burnt offering of the bird when it became mixed up in the east.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, שֶׁהָיוּ מַשְׁחִירִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּיַיִן מַשְׁחִיר, דְּמַיָּא אַמַּאי מַשְׁחִיר? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: עֵירָה שֶׁל מַיִם לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל יַיִן, וְשֶׁל יַיִן לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל מַיִם יָצָא — שֶׁל מַיִם אָתֵי לְאַשְׁחוֹרֵי.
human_translation: but they would blacken Granted, for wine blackened why did the for water blacken? Since the Master said one poured of water into of wine or of wine into of water, he fulfilled for water come to blacken
llm_translation: Rather, they were darkening. But with wine, it darkens. Why does water darken? Since the Master said: If a drop of water falls into wine, or a drop of wine falls into water, the water will darken.

hebrew_text: וּמְנוּקָּבִים כְּמִין שְׁנֵי חוֹטָמִין וְכוּ׳. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּלּוֹג הָיָה מְנַסֵּךְ כׇּל שְׁמוֹנָה. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, — כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: And perforated two thin, nose-like Let us say the mishna is Rabbi Yehuda and not the Rabbis, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: One would pour with one log all eight As, if the Rabbis, they are the same
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the hollows are like two reeds, etc. Let us say it is a Mishnah of Rabbi Yehuda and not of the Rabbis, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: In a log one would pour all eight. For if it were the Rabbis, — they are contradictory!"

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן: חַמְרָא סְמִיךְ, מַיָּא קְלִישׁ.
human_translation: Even you say the Rabbis, wine is thick water is thin,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis: wine is thick, water is thin.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — ״רָחָב״ וְ״קָצָר״ אִית לֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי קַשְׂווֹאוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, אֶחָד שֶׁל מַיִם וְאֶחָד שֶׁל יַיִן. שֶׁל יַיִן — פִּיהָ רָחָב, שֶׁל מַיִם — פִּיהָ קָצָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כָּלִין בְּבַת אַחַת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as, if Rabbi Yehuda, is of as wide and narrow, as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: There were two pipes there, one for water and one for wine. The mouth of for wine was wide and the mouth of for water was narrow, so that would conclude simultaneously. learn from it
llm_translation: So it was thought, for if Rabbi Yehuda — "wide" and "narrow" it has. As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: There were two pitchers there, one of water and one of wine. The one of wine — its mouth is wide, the one of water — its mouth is narrow, so that both of them can be filled at once, learn from this.

hebrew_text: מַעֲרָבוֹ שֶׁל מַיִם. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַדּוּקִי אֶחָד שֶׁנִּיסֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי רַגְלָיו, וּרְגָמוּהוּ כׇּל הָעָם בְּאֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן. וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם נִפְגְּמָה קֶרֶן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְהֵבִיאוּ בּוּל שֶׁל מֶלַח וּסְתָמוּהוּ. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּכְשַׁר לַעֲבוֹדָה, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֵרָאֶה מִזְבֵּחַ פָּגוּם.
human_translation: west of for water, The Sages taught: an incident involving one Sadducee who poured on his feet, all the people pelted him with their etrogim . And that day, the horn of the altar was damaged They brought a fistful of salt and sealed not because it rendered fit for the service, but so that the altar would not be seen damaged
llm_translation: Western side of water. The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with a certain Sadducee who poured water on his feet, and the entire people stoned him with their etrogs. And that day, the corner of the altar was damaged, and they brought a heap of salt and stopped it. Not because it was fit for service, but so that the blemished altar would not be seen.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכׇּל מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ לֹא כֶּבֶשׁ וְלֹא קֶרֶן וְלֹא יְסוֹד וְלֹא רִיבּוּעַ — פָּסוּל לַעֲבוֹדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַסּוֹבֵב.
human_translation: As any altar that lacks a ramp, or a horn, or a base, or a square, is disqualified for service. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Even the surrounding ledge
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "That any altar that does not have neither a lamb nor a horn nor a base nor a fourth — invalid for service. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Even the surrounding."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁיתִין, מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית נִבְרְאוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חַמּוּקֵי יְרֵכַיִךְ כְּמוֹ חֲלָאִים מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי אׇמָּן״. ״חֲמוּקֵי יְרֵכַיִךְ״ — אֵלּוּ הַשִּׁיתִין. ״כְּמוֹ חֲלָאִים״ — שֶׁמְּחוֹלְלִין וְיוֹרְדִין עַד הַתְּהוֹם. ״מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי אׇמָּן״ — זוֹ מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי אוּמָּנוּתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״, אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״, אֶלָּא ״בָּרָא שִׁית״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The drainpipes [ shittin ] were created from the six days of Creation, as it is stated: “The hidden of your thighs are like the links of a chain, the handiwork of a skilled workman” “The hidden of your thighs”; these are the drainpipes “are like the links of a chain [ ḥala’im ]”; they are hollow [ meḥolalin ] and descend to the depths; “the handiwork of a skilled workman”; this is the handiwork of the Holy One, Blessed be He. it was taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael “In the beginning [ bereshit ]” do not read Bereshit , but rather as: Bara shit ,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Six things were created on the first day of creation, as it is stated: "The curves of your thighs are like jewels, the handiwork of a skilled craftsman." "The curves of your thighs" - these are the heavens. "Like jewels" - that they are rolled and descend to the depths. "The handiwork of a skilled craftsman" - this is the handiwork of the Holy One, blessed be He. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "In the beginning," do not read it as "In the beginning," rather read it as "Bara Sheet

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שִׁיתִּין מְחוֹלָלִין וְיוֹרְדִין עַד תְּהוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָשִׁירָה נָּא לִידִידִי שִׁירַת דּוֹדִי לְכַרְמוֹ כֶּרֶם הָיָה לִידִידִי בְּקֶרֶן בֶּן שָׁמֶן. וַיְעַזְּקֵהוּ וַיְסַקְּלֵהוּ וַיִּטָּעֵהוּ שׂוֹרֵק וַיִּבֶן מִגְדָּל בְּתוֹכוֹ וְגַם יֶקֶב חָצֵב בּוֹ״. ״וַיִּטָּעֵהוּ שׂוֹרֵק״ — זֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, ״וַיִּבֶן מִגְדָּל בְּתוֹכוֹ״ — זֶה מִזְבֵּחַ, ״וְגַם יֶקֶב חָצֵב בּוֹ״ — אֵלּוּ הַשִּׁיתִין.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yosei says: drainpipes are hollow and descend to the depths, as it is stated: “Let me sing of my well beloved, a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My well beloved had a vineyard in a very fruitful hill, and he dug it, and cleared it of stones, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also hewed out a vat therein” “He planted it with the choicest vine”; this Temple; “he built a tower therein”; this altar; “and hewed out a vat therein”; this the drainpipes.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: "Sixty myriads of troops would descend to the depths, as it is stated: 'I will sing to my beloved a song of my beloved regarding his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard on a fertile hill. He dug it up and cleared it of stones and planted it with choice vines. He built a tower in its midst and even hewed out a winepress in it.' 'He built a tower in its midst' — this refers to the Temple. 'And even hewed out a winepress in it' — these are the Shitin."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: לוּל קָטָן הָיָה בֵּין כֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ, וְאַחַת לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה יוֹרְדִין לְשָׁם, וּמְלַקְּטִין מִשָּׁם יַיִן קָרוּשׁ שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְעִיגּוּלֵי דְבֵילָה, וּבָאִין וְשׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ שֵׁכָר לַה׳״ —
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: There was a small gap between the ramp and the altar west of the ramp, and once in seventy years young priests descend there and gather from there the congealed wine which resembled round cakes of figs. They would come and burn it in sanctity as it is stated: “In sanctity shall you pour a libation of strong drink unto the Lord”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: If a small ramp was between the sheep and the altar in the west of the sheep, and once in seventy years the priests' phylacteries blossomed, they would descend there, and collect from there aged wine resembling the cakes of figs of Dvaylah, and they would come and burn it in the Holy of Holies, as it is stated: "Pour out a drink offering of strong drink to the Lord in the sanctuary" —

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּיסּוּכוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, כָּךְ שְׂרֵיפָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רָבִינָא: אַתְיָא ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְשָׂרַפְתָּ אֶת הַנּוֹתָר בָּאֵשׁ לֹא יֵאָכֵל כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הוּא״.
human_translation: just as its pouring is in sanctity, so too must its burning be in sanctity. From where be inferred Ravina said: It is derived sanctity sanctity It is written here, “In sanctity shall you pour a libation” and it is written there, “You shall burn the leftovers in fire; they are not to be eaten, for they are sanctity”
llm_translation: As they poured it in the sanctuary, so shall its offering be in the sanctuary. What is the implication? Ravina said: It comes to teach "holy" "holy." It is written here: "In the sanctuary you shall pour out the drink offering," and it is written there: "And you shall burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא (דְּתַנְיָא): נְסָכִים, בַּתְּחִילָּה מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. יָרְדוּ לַשִּׁיתִין — אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. לֵימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק הִיא, דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, הָא נָחֲתוּ לְהוּ לִתְהוֹם!
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught libations, initially, one misuse consecrated property with them, they descended to the drainpipes, one does not misuse consecrated property with them, Let us say is Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok, As, if the Rabbis, Didn’t they descend to the depths
llm_translation: As to where it went (as it was taught): libations, initially they are effective. If they have descended to the depths — they are not effective. Let Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok say: if they are sages, they have reached the depths!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, בִּדְאִיקְּלַט.
human_translation: Even you say the Rabbis, to where was collected
llm_translation: Even if you say "Rabbanan," in the case of a "Diklata."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לֵימָא רַבָּנַן הִיא, וְלָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק? דְּאִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אַכַּתִּי בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ קָיְימִי! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה מִצְוָתוֹ וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בִּזְמַן שֶׁמְּנַסְּכִין יַיִן עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, פּוֹקְקִין אֶת הַשִּׁיתִין. לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ שֵׁכָר לַה׳״.
human_translation: And some say Let us say is the Rabbis and not Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok. As, if Rabbi Elazar, remains in its sanctity, Even you say Rabbi Elazar, there is no item whose mitzva has been performed with which one misuse of consecrated property. Reish Lakish said: When they pour wine onto the altar, they plug the drainpipes to fulfill that which is stated: “In sanctity shall you pour a libation of strong drink [ shekhar ] unto the Lord”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who say: Let it be the opinion of the sages, and not Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok? For if it were Rabbi Elazar, then they are standing in their holiness! Even if you were to say it is Rabbi Elazar, you have nothing that is done as a commandment and is invalidated. Reish Lakish said: When they pour wine on the altar, they would empty out the basins. To fulfill what is said: "Pour a drink offering of strong drink to the Lord in the holy place."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: ״שֵׁכָר״ — לְשׁוֹן שְׁתִיָּה, לְשׁוֹן שְׂבִיעָה, לְשׁוֹן שִׁכְרוּת. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּי שָׂבַע אִינִישׁ חַמְרָא — מִגְּרוֹנֵיהּ שָׂבַע. אָמַר רָבָא: צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּלָא נְפִישׁא לֵיהּ חַמְרָא, לִיגַמַּע גַּמּוֹעֵי. רָבָא אַכָּסָא דְבִרְכְּתָא אַגְמַע גַּמּוֹעֵי.
human_translation: From where be inferred Rav Pappa said: Shekhar an expression of drinking, of satiation, of intoxication. Rav Pappa said: Conclude from this that when a person is satiated from wine, from his throat satiated. Rava said: let a young scholar, who does not much wine, swallow in swigs, Rava a cup of blessing, would swallow swigs
llm_translation: What is implied? Rav Papa said: "Shikar" - language of drinking, language of satisfaction, language of drunkenness. Rav Papa said: Learn from it, when a person is satisfied with wine, his throat is satisfied. Rava said: The wine of a scholar, which does not satisfy him, will cause his throat to be cut. Rava cut the cup of blessing, causing his throat to be cut.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מַה יָּפוּ פְעָמַיִךְ בַּנְּעָלִים בַּת נָדִיב״ — מַה יָּפוּ פַּעֲמוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹלִין לָרֶגֶל. ״בַּת נָדִיב״ — בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ שֶׁנִּקְרָא נָדִיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נְדִיבֵי עַמִּים נֶאֱסָפוּ עַם אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״. ״אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״, וְלֹא אֱלֹהֵי יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב?! אֶלָּא: ״אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״, שֶׁהָיָה תְּחִילָּה לְגֵרִים.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “How beautiful are your steps in sandals, O prince’s daughter” How beautiful are the feet of the Jewish people at the time when they ascend for the Festival. “O prince’s daughter”; the daughter of Abraham our Patriarch, who was called prince, as it is stated: “The princes of the peoples are gathered, the people of the God of Abraham” the God of Abraham and not the God of Isaac and Jacob. Rather the God of Abraham, who was first of the converts,
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "How beautiful are your steps in sandals, O noble daughter"? — How beautiful are the steps of the Israelites when they ascend to the pilgrimage. "Noble daughter" — the daughter of our forefather Abraham, who was called noble, as it is stated: "The nobles of the peoples have gathered, the people of the God of Abraham." "The God of Abraham," and not the God of Isaac and Jacob?! Rather, "The God of Abraham," who was the first to accept converts.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַב עָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״חַמּוּקֵי יְרֵכַיִךְ״ — לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּיָרֵךְ? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה יָרֵךְ בַּסֵּתֶר, אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בַּסֵּתֶר.
human_translation: the school of Rav Anan taught: What is which is written: “The hidden of your thighs” Why are matters of Torah likened to a thigh? to tell you just as thigh is concealed, too, matters of Torah in private
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Rav Anan taught: What is the meaning of the verse, "The recesses of your thighs"? Why are the words of Torah compared to a thigh? To tell you: Just as the thigh is hidden, so too the words of Torah are hidden.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״הִגִּיד לְךָ אָדָם מַה טּוֹב וּמָה ה׳ דּוֹרֵשׁ מִמְּךָ כִּי אִם עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט וְאַהֲבַת חֶסֶד וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִם אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. ״עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט״ — זֶה הַדִּין, ״וְאַהֲבַת חֶסֶד״ — זוֹ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, ״וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִם אֱלֹהֶיךָ״ — זוֹ הוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת וְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה לַחוּפָּה. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לַעֲשׂוֹתָן בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״הַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת״, דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לַעֲשׂוֹתָן בְּצִנְעָא — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “It has been told you, O man, what is good, and what the Lord does require of you; only to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God” “To do justly”; this is justice. “To love mercy”; this is acts of kindness. “To walk humbly with your God”; this is taking the dead out and accompanying bride to wedding canopy, And are matters not a fortiori ? If, matters that tend to be conducted in public, the Torah says: Walk humbly, matters that tend to be conducted in private, all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "He has told you, O man, what is good, and what the Lord requires of you: only to do justice, to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God." "To do justice" - this is the law, "to love kindness" - this is acts of loving-kindness, "and to walk humbly with your God" - this is escorting the dead and bringing the bride to the wedding canopy. And are these not logical arguments: if for things that people usually do openly, the Torah said "walk humbly," for things that people usually do in secret - all the more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה צְדָקָה יוֹתֵר מִכׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֲשֹׂה צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט נִבְחָר לַה׳ מִזָּבַח״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: גְּדוֹלָה גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים יוֹתֵר מִן הַצְּדָקָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זִרְעוּ לָכֶם לִצְדָקָה וְקִצְרוּ לְפִי חֶסֶד״. אִם אָדָם זוֹרֵעַ — סָפֵק אוֹכֵל סָפֵק אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אָדָם קוֹצֵר — וַדַּאי אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who performs charity is greater than all offerings, as it is stated: “To perform charity and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than an offering” And Rabbi Elazar said: Acts of kindness, are greater than charity, as it is stated: “Sow to yourselves according to charity, and reap according to kindness” If a person sows, uncertain he eat or he not eat, a person reaps, he certainly eats.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Great is one who performs charity more than all the offerings, as it is stated: "To do charity and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice." And Rabbi Elazar said: Greater is the bestowal of acts of kindness than charity, as it is stated: "Sow for yourselves charity, reap according to kindness." If a person sows - perhaps he will eat, perhaps he will not eat; a person reaps - and certainly he will eat.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין צְדָקָה מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא לְפִי חֶסֶד שֶׁבָּהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זִרְעוּ לָכֶם לִצְדָקָה וְקִצְרוּ לְפִי חֶסֶד״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: charity is paid only in accordance with the kindness therein as it is stated: “Sow to yourselves according to charity, and reap according to kindness.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Charity only thrives according to the kindness within it, as it is said: "Sow for yourselves charity, reap according to kindness."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים גְּדוֹלָה גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים יוֹתֵר מִן הַצְּדָקָה. צְדָקָה — בְּמָמוֹנוֹ; גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — בֵּין בְּגוּפוֹ, בֵּין בְּמָמוֹנוֹ. צְדָקָה — לָעֲנִיִּים; גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — בֵּין לָעֲנִיִּים בֵּין לָעֲשִׁירִים. צְדָקָה — לַחַיִּים; גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — בֵּין לַחַיִּים בֵּין לַמֵּתִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught acts of kindness are superior to charity in three respects: Charity with one’s money, acts of kindness both with his person and with his money. Charity to the poor, acts of kindness both for the poor and for the rich. Charity living, acts of kindness both for the living and for the dead.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: In three things, acts of loving-kindness are greater than charity. Charity — with one's money; acts of loving-kindness — whether with one's body or with one's money. Charity — for the poor; acts of loving-kindness — whether for the poor or for the rich. Charity — for the living; acts of loving-kindness — whether for the living or for the dead.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט, כְּאִילּוּ מִילֵּא כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ חֶסֶד. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹהֵב צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט חֶסֶד ה׳ מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ״. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר כׇּל הַבָּא לִקְפּוֹץ קוֹפֵץ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַה יָּקָר חַסְדְּךָ אֱלֹהִים (חֶסֶד ה׳ מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ) וְגוֹ׳״. יָכוֹל אַף יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם כֵּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְחֶסֶד ה׳ מֵעוֹלָם וְעַד עוֹלָם עַל יְרֵאָיו״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who performs charity and justice is as though he filled the whole world in its entirety with kindness, as it is stated: “He loves charity and justice; the earth is full of the kindness of the Lord” Lest you say that anyone who comes to leap leap the verse states: “How precious is your kindness, O God” might even a God-fearing the verse states: “But the kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who does charity and justice, it is as if he filled the entire world with kindness. As it is stated: "He loves charity and justice; the earth is full of the kindness of the Lord." Lest you say that anyone who comes to jump, jumps, the Scripture teaches: "How precious is Your kindness, O God! (The kindness of the Lord fills the earth)" and so forth. You might think the same applies to those who fear heaven - the Scripture teaches: "But the kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon those who fear Him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר פָּפָּא: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו חֵן, בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֶסֶד ה׳ מֵעוֹלָם וְעַד עוֹלָם עַל יְרֵאָיו״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״פִּיהָ פָּתְחָה בְחָכְמָה וְתוֹרַת חֶסֶד עַל לְשׁוֹנָהּ״, וְכִי יֵשׁ תּוֹרָה שֶׁל חֶסֶד וְיֵשׁ תּוֹרָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל חֶסֶד? אֶלָּא: תּוֹרָה לִשְׁמָהּ — זוֹ הִיא תּוֹרָה שֶׁל חֶסֶד, שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ — זוֹ הִיא תּוֹרָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל חֶסֶד. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: תּוֹרָה לְלַמְּדָהּ — זוֹ הִיא תּוֹרָה שֶׁל חֶסֶד, שֶׁלֹּא לְלַמְּדָהּ — זוֹ הִיא תּוֹרָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל חֶסֶד.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Pappa said: any person who has grace about him, it is certain that he is God-fearing, as it is stated: “But the kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him.” And Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “She opens her mouth with wisdom, and a Torah of kindness is on her tongue” Is there, then, a Torah of kindness and a Torah that is not of kindness? Rather, Torah for its own sake that is a Torah of kindness, not for its own sake that is a Torah that is not of kindness. Some say Torah to teach it that is a Torah of kindness; with not teaching it that is a Torah that is not of kindness.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Papa: Any person upon whom there is grace, it is known that he fears Heaven, as it is stated: "The kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon those who fear Him." And Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "She opens her mouth with wisdom, and the Torah of kindness is on her tongue"? Is there a Torah of kindness and a Torah that is not of kindness? Rather, Torah for its own sake—this is the Torah of kindness; Torah not for its own sake—this is the Torah that is not of kindness. Some say: Torah to teach it—this is the Torah of kindness; Torah not to teach it—this is the Torah that is not of kindness.

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ בַּחוֹל כּוּ׳. וְאַמַּאי? נַיְיתֵי בִּמְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! אֲמַר זְעֵירִי: קָסָבַר אֵין שִׁיעוּר לַמַּיִם, וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת מְקַדְּשִׁין שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת.
human_translation: As its performance during the week, And why Let bring in a consecrated Ze’iri said: holds that there is no measure for the water and Temple vessels consecrate without intent
llm_translation: As his deed on a weekday, so too. And why? It was done in the Temple! Zeiri said: He holds that there is no prescribed measure for water, and Temple vessels sanctify even unintentionally.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מַיְיתֵי בִּמְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, אִיפְּסִילוּ לְהוּ בְּלִינָה. חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת, וּגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ לְדַעַת נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ.
human_translation: And if he brings in a consecrated will become disqualified by remaining overnight, Ḥizkiya said: Temple vessels consecrate only with intent. And a decree lest say, was intentionally consecrated.
llm_translation: If one brings vessels into the Temple courtyard, they become sanctified only during the day. Hezekiah said: Vessels of service are not sanctified except with intent, due to the decree lest people say they were sanctified unintentionally.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא יֵשׁ שִׁיעוּר לַמַּיִם, וּכְלֵי שָׁרֵת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת, וּגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ לְקִידּוּשׁ יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם מִלְּאָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said Rabbi Zeira said: Even you say that there is a measure for the water and Temple vessels consecrate only with intent, decree lest they say was filled for sanctifying the hands and the feet
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Zeira: Even if you say there is a measure for water, and vessels of service only sanctify with intent, and a decree lest they say the washing of hands and feet is from there.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁפְּכָה אוֹ נִתְגַּלְּתָה כּוּ׳. וְאַמַּאי? לִיעַבַּיר בִּמְסַנֶּנֶת. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, דְּתַנְיָא: מְסַנֶּנֶת יֵשׁ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם גִּילּוּי. אָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה מְגוּלָּה, אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה מְכוּסָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהָעֶלְיוֹנָה מְגוּלָּה — אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם גִּילּוּי. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֶרֶס נָחָשׁ דּוֹמֶה לִסְפוֹג צָף וְעוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: If spilled or was exposed Why Let him pass it through a strainer, Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya, as it was taught with a strainer is subject to exposure Rabbi Neḥemya said: When when the lower vessel, is exposed. However, if the lower vessel is covered, even if the upper vessel is exposed, is not subject to exposure, because the poison of a snake is like a sponge it floats and stays in place.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Spilled or uncovered, etc." And why? To clarify in a sieve. Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Nechemiah, as it was taught: A sieve has the status of revealing. Rabbi Nechemiah said: When is this? - When the lower part is revealed, but when the lower part is covered, even though the upper part is revealed - it does not have the status of revealing. Because a woven network is like a floating sponge that floats and remains in its place.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה לְהֶדְיוֹט, אֲבָל לְגָבוֹהַּ מִי אָמַר? וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: ״הַקְרִיבֵהוּ נָא לְפֶחָתֶךָ הֲיִרְצְךָ אוֹ הֲיִשָּׂא פָנֶיךָ אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת״?!
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Neḥemya, say that Rabbi Neḥemya said for a common However, did he say to God? Isn’t Rabbi Neḥemya of Present it now unto your governor; will he be pleased with you or will he accept your person, says the Lord of hosts”
llm_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Nechemiah, say that Rabbi Nechemiah said to a layman, but to a scholar, who did he say it to? Rabbi Nechemiah does not have it: "Present it now to your governor; will he be pleased with you or show you favor?" says the Lord of hosts!

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ לוּלָב וַעֲרָבָה
llm_translation: We will return to you with the lulav and willow branch.

hebrew_text: הֶחָלִיל — חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁשָּׁה. זֶהוּ הֶחָלִיל שֶׁל בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה, שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: The flute five six This is the flute of the Place of the Drawing whose overrides neither Shabbat nor Festival.
llm_translation: The flute - five and six. This is the flute of the Beit Hashoevah, which does not override neither the Sabbath nor the festival day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב עֵינָא, חַד תָּנֵי: שׁוֹאֵבָה, וְחַד תָּנֵי: חֲשׁוּבָה. אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאן דְּתָנֵי שׁוֹאֵבָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי חֲשׁוּבָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ. מַאן דְּתָנֵי שׁוֹאֵבָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם מַיִם בְּשָׂשׂוֹן״. וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי חֲשׁוּבָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מִצְוָה חֲשׁוּבָה הִיא, וּבָאָה מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Yehuda and Rav Eina One teaches Drawing [ sho’eva ] and one teaches significant [ ḥashuva ] Mar Zutra said: The one who taught sho’eva is not mistaken, and the one who taught ḥashuva is not mistaken. The one who taught sho’eva is not mistaken, as it is written: “And you shall draw [ ushavtem ] water with joy And the one who taught ḥashuva is not mistaken, as Rav Naḥman said: It is a significant mitzva and from the six days of Creation.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Rav Yehudah and Rav Eina, one taught: Shovevah, and one taught: Hashuvah. Mar Zutra said: One who teaches Shovevah does not become confused, and one who teaches Hashuvah does not become confused. One who teaches Shovevah does not become confused, as it is written: "And you shall draw water with joy." And one who teaches Hashuvah does not become confused, as Rav Nachman said: It is a significant commandment, and it comes from the six days of Creation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֶחָלִיל דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף יוֹם טוֹב אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל קׇרְבָּן, דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי, וַעֲבוֹדָה הִיא, וְדוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה, וְלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אֲבָל שִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שִׂמְחָה הִיא, וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The flute overrides Shabbat; statement of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: It does not override even a Festival. Rav Yosef said: The dispute is with regard to the song that the offering. As Rabbi Yosei holds primary song by instruments, are service and override Shabbat. The Rabbis hold primary song with the mouth, and are not service; and do not override Shabbat. However, the song of Drawing everyone agrees it is rejoicing and it does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The flute overrides the Sabbath, the words of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And the Sages say: Even a festival day does not override. Rav Yosef said: The dispute is regarding the song of the offering, for Rabbi Yosei holds: The essence of the song is in the vessel, and it is a form of service, thus it overrides the Sabbath. And the Rabbis hold: The essence of the song is in the voice, and it is not a form of service, thus it does not override the Sabbath. But the song of a wine-drawing woman, everyone agrees it is a joyous occasion, and it does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא דִּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן שֶׁל עֵץ, רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מַאן דְּמַכְשַׁיר סָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי, וְיָלְפִינַן מֵאַבּוּבָא דְמֹשֶׁה. וּמַאן דְּפָסֵיל סָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה, וְלָא יָלְפִינַן מֵאַבּוּבָא דְמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say that they disagree about this as it is taught service vessels that one crafted of wood, Rabbi deems unfit and Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda deems fit. What, is it not that they disagree with regard to this The one who deems fit holds primary song is by instruments, and we derive from the flute of Moses, And the one who deems unfit holds primary song with the mouth, and we do not derive from the flute of Moses,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this that they argue about this matter, as it is taught: vessels of service made of wood, Rabbi Posa'el and Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda deem them unfit. What is the reason they do not argue about this? The one who deems them fit holds: the essence of the service is in the vessel, and we learn from the wording of Moses' father-in-law. And the one who deems them unfit holds: the essence of the service is in the mouth, and we do not learn from the wording of Moses' father-in-law.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי, וְהָכָא בְּדָנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מַאן דְּמַכְשַׁיר סָבַר: דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר, וּמַאן דְּפָסֵיל סָבַר: לָא דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: No, that everyone agrees: primary song by instruments. And here, with regard to one derives possible from impossible they disagree. The one who deems fit holds that one derives possible, from impossible, And the one who deems unfit holds that one does not derive the possible from the impossible.
llm_translation: Not, that, all, of, the, world, essence, song, in, vessel, and, here, in, judge, possible, from, that, possible, argue. Who, that, permits, thinks: judge, possible, from, that, possible, and, who, that, invalidates, thinks: not, judge, possible, from, that, possible.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דְּעִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה, וְאֵין דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר, וְהָכָא בְּמֵילַף מְנוֹרָה בִּכְלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי אוֹ בְּרִבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees that primary song with the mouth, and one does not derive the possible from the impossible. And here, with regard to deriving candelabrum by means of generalizations and details or by means of amplifications and restrictions that they disagree. Rabbi interprets generalizations and details, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda interprets amplifications and restrictions.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, the essence of song is in the mouth, and we do not judge what is impossible as if it were possible. And here in the matter of the Menorah, whether in general and specific terms, or in inclusiveness and exclusiveness, they disagree. Rabbi interprets in general and specific terms, while Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda interprets in inclusiveness and exclusiveness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ מְנוֹרַת״ — כָּלַל, ״זָהָב טָהוֹר״ — פָּרַט, ״מִקְשָׁה תֵּעָשֶׂה הַמְּנוֹרָה״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת, אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi interprets generalizations and details. “And you shall make a candelabrum of,” a generalization, “pure gold,” a detail, “of beaten work shall the candelabrum be made,” then generalized a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only that are similar to the detail; just as the detail is explicit from a metal, so too all of metal.
llm_translation: Rabbi Darish expounded generalizations and specifics: "And you shall make a menorah" - generalization, "pure gold" - specification, "the menorah shall be made of hammered work" - he repeated and generalized. Generalization, specification, and generalization, you only judge in accordance with the nature of the specification. Just as the specification is explicit regarding metal, so too, everything is of metal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה, דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ מְנוֹרַת״ — רִיבָּה, ״זָהָב טָהוֹר״ — מִיעֵט, ״מִקְשָׁה תֵּעָשֶׂה הַמְנוֹרָה״ — חָזַר וְרִיבָּה, רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה — רִיבָּה הַכֹּל. מַאי רַבִּי — רַבִּי כֹּל מִילֵּי, מַאי מַיעֵט — מַיעֵט שֶׁל חֶרֶס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, interprets amplifications and restrictions. “And you shall make a candelabrum of,” amplification, “pure gold,” restriction, “of beaten work shall the candelabrum be made,” repeated and amplified. amplification and restriction and amplification, to amplify all What did amplify? It amplified all materials, what did exclude It excluded of earthenware.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda expounded: "And you shall make a menorah" - it increased, "of pure gold" - it decreased, "shall the menorah be made of beaten work" - it repeated and increased, it increased and decreased and repeated - it increased everything. What is "Rabbi"? - Rabbi is everything, what is "decreased"? - decreased of earthenware.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי, (דְּתַנְיָא): עַבְדֵי כֹהֲנִים הָיוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית הַפְּגָרִים וּמִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית צִיפְּרַיָּא, וּמֵאֱמָאוּם הָיוּ, שֶׁהָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: parallel tanna’im , as it is taught were slaves of priests; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: the family of the House of Happegarim and the family of the House of Tzipperaya. And they were from Emma’um, that they would marry to the priesthood.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ketanaei (d'tanya): avdei kohanim hayu, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei omer: mishpachat beit hapgarim u'mishpachat beit tsipperyaya, u'me'amaum hayu, shehayu masi'in lakehunah." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita: They were servants of the priests, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: They were from the family of the House of P'garim and the family of the House of Tsipperyaya, and they were of blemished lineage, yet they would appoint to the priesthood."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: לְוִיִּם הָיוּ. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲבָדִים הָיוּ, קָסָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְוִיִּם הָיוּ, קָסָבַר: עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: They were Levites. What, is it not that they disagree with regard to this; that the one who said were slaves holds primary song with the mouth. And the one who said that were Levites holds primary song by instruments.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: "They were Levites." What is the reason that he does not agree with this? Because whoever says they were slaves, he holds: the main aspect of singing is with the mouth. And whoever says they were Levites, he holds: the main aspect of singing is with an instrument.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה — אֲפִילּוּ עֲבָדִים נָמֵי, אִי קָסָבַר עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי — לְוִיִּם אִין, יִשְׂרְאֵלִים לָא!
human_translation: And you understand what does Rabbi Yosei hold? If he holds primary song with the mouth, even slaves also If he holds primary song by instruments, Levites, yes, Israelites, no,
llm_translation: "And was it created?! Rabbi Yosei, what does he hold? If he holds that the essence of singing is with the mouth - even if it is done by slaves, if he holds that the essence of singing is with an instrument - Levites are not needed, Israelites are sufficient!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה. וּבְהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וּמָר סָבַר: הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rather, that everyone agrees primary song with the mouth And with regard to this that they disagree: that Sage holds event this and Sage holds event this
llm_translation: Rather: the entirety of the world, the essence of song is in the mouth. And in this case they dispute, for one Master holds: thus was the deed, and the other Master holds: thus was the deed.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמַעֲלִין מִדּוּכָן לְיוּחֲסִין וּלְמַעֲשֵׂר קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: What difference is there to one elevates from the platform to lineage and to tithes that they disagree.
llm_translation: For what does it come out? For elevating from a lower status to a higher status, and regarding tithing, he disputes.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר עֲבָדִים הָיוּ, קָסָבַר: אֵין מַעֲלִין מִדּוּכָן לְיוּחֲסִין, וְלֹא לְמַעֲשֵׂר. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר יִשְׂרָאֵל הָיוּ, קָסָבַר: מַעֲלִין מִדּוּכָן יוּחֲסִין, אֲבָל לֹא לְמַעֲשֵׂר. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְוִיִּם הָיוּ, קָסָבַר: מַעֲלִין מִדּוּכָן, בֵּין לְיוּחֲסִין בֵּין לְמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: The one who said that were slaves holds one does not elevate from the platform to lineage and to tithes. And the one who said that were Israelites holds one elevates from the platform lineage but not to tithes. And the one who said that were Levites holds one elevates from the platform to lineage to tithes.
llm_translation: The one who says they were slaves, holds: they do not ascend from their status to lineage, nor to tithes. And the one who says they were Israelites, holds: they ascend from their status to lineage, but not to tithes. And the one who says they were Levites, holds: they ascend from their status, whether to lineage or to tithes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה, דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה סָבַר: שִׂמְחָה יְתֵירָה נָמֵי דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: שִׂמְחָה יְתֵירָה אֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. אֲבָל בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל קׇרְבָּן, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, וְדוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: The dispute is with regard to the song of Drawing Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda holds extra rejoicing also overrides Shabbat, and the Rabbis hold extra rejoicing does not override Shabbat. However, with regard to song that an offering, everyone agrees service, and overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: A dispute regarding the song of the Levites, for Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda holds: Excessive joy overrides the Sabbath, while the Rabbis hold: Excessive joy does not override the Sabbath. However, concerning the song of the offering, all agree that it is a form of service and overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף יוֹם טוֹב אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection The song of Drawing overrides Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: It does not override even the Festival. a conclusive refutation of Rav Yosef. a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: The song of a mourner overrides the Sabbath, the words of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And the sages say: Even a festival day does not override. The rebuttal of Rav Yosef! The rebuttal.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי, אֲבָל בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל קׇרְבָּן דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּתַרְתֵּי!
human_translation: Let us say, it is with regard to the song of Drawing that they disagree; however, with regard to the song that the offering, everyone says it overrides Shabbat. let us say this will be a conclusive refutation of of Rav Yosef on two
llm_translation: Let us say, in the case of a song of a woman in labor, there is a dispute, but in the case of a song of a sacrifice, everyone agrees that it overrides the Sabbath. Let us say it is a support for Rav Yosef in both cases!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב יוֹסֵף: פְּלִיגִי בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְקׇרְבָּן. וְהַאי דְּקָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּשִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ דְּשׁוֹאֵבָה נָמֵי דָּחֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: They disagree with regard to the song of Drawing and the same is true for an offering. And that they disagree with regard to the song of Drawing is to convey to you the far-reaching of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, that even the of Drawing also overrides
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: Dispute in the song of the well, and it is the same regarding a sacrifice. And this one who disputes in the song of the well — to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, for even the well itself rejects.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: זֶהוּ חָלִיל שֶׁל בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת יוֹם טוֹב: זֶהוּ דְּאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה, אֲבָל דְּקָרְבָּן דּוֹחֶה מַנִּי? אִי נֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר שִׁיר שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵבָה נָמֵי דּוֹחֶה! אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבָּנַן — וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּתַרְתֵּי! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught This is flute of the Place of the Drawing which overrides neither Shabbat nor Festival. this is that does not override however, the offering overrides Who is If we say Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, didn’t he say that the song of Drawing also overrides Rather, is it not the Rabbis, and a conclusive refutation Rav Yosef on two a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And it was taught: This is a flute of the Beit HaShoeva that does not override neither the Sabbath nor the festival. This is what it means that it does not override, but the offering does override, who is the Tanna? If we say it is Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, who said that the song of the shoeva overrides! Rather, it is not so, it is the Rabbis - and the conclusion is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Yosef in both cases! The conclusion.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בִּכְלִי? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת הָעוֹלָה לְהַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּבְעֵת הֵחֵל הָעוֹלָה הֵחֵל שִׁיר ה׳ וְהַחֲצוֹצְרוֹת וְעַל יְדֵי כְּלֵי דָּוִיד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the one who said: primary song by instruments? as it is written: “And Hezekiah commanded to sacrifice the burnt-offering upon the altar. And when the burnt-offering began, the song of the Lord began also, and the trumpets, together with the instruments of David, king of Israel”
llm_translation: What is the reason for one who says that the essence of singing is with an instrument? For it is written: "And Hezekiah said to offer the burnt offering on the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song of the Lord began, and the trumpets, accompanied by the instruments of David king of Israel."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עִיקַּר שִׁירָה בַּפֶּה? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כְאֶחָד לַמְחַצְּצרִים וְלַמְשׁוֹרְרִים לְהַשְׁמִיעַ קוֹל אֶחָד״.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the one who said: primary song with the mouth? as it is written: “And it came to pass, when the trumpeters and the singers were as one to make one sound”
llm_translation: What is the reason for one who says that the essence of singing is in the mouth? For it is written: "And it came to pass, as the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound heard."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״הֵחֵל שִׁיר ה׳״ — בַּפֶּה, ״עַל יְדֵי כְּלֵי דָּוִיד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְבַסּוֹמֵי קָלָא.
human_translation: And the other too, isn’t it written: “And Hezekiah commanded This is what is saying: “The song of the Lord began,” with the mouth; “with the instruments of David, King of Israel,” to sweeten the sound,
llm_translation: And the other one says, is it not written: "And Hezekiah said"! This is what he is saying: "He began the song of the Lord" — with the mouth, "by the hands of the Levites who were skilled" — to the accompaniment of musical instruments.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כְּאֶחָד לַמְחַצְּצרִים וְלַמְשׁוֹרְרִים״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מְשׁוֹרְרִים דֻּומְיָא דִּמְחַצְּצרִים, מָה מְחַצְּצרִים — בִּכְלִי, אַף מְשׁוֹרְרִים — בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: And the other too, isn’t it written: “And it came to pass, when the trumpeters and the singers were as one,” This is what is saying: singers similar to the trumpeters; just as trumpeters with an instrument, so too singers with an instrument.
llm_translation: The other one says, is it not written: "And it came to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one"! This is what he means to say: Singers are similar to trumpeters, just as trumpeters — with instruments, so too singers — with instruments.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה שִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה, לֹא רָאָה שִׂמְחָה מִיָּמָיו. בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג יָרְדוּ לְעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, וּמְתַקְּנִין שָׁם תִּיקּוּן גָּדוֹל. מְנוֹרוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב הָיוּ שָׁם, וְאַרְבָּעָה סְפָלִים שֶׁל זָהָב בְּרָאשֵׁיהֶם, וְאַרְבָּעָה סוּלָּמוֹת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְאַרְבָּעָה יְלָדִים מִפִּירְחֵי כְהוּנָּה וּבִידֵיהֶם כַּדִּים שֶׁל מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים לוֹג שֶׁהֵן מְטִילִין לְכׇל סֵפֶל וָסֵפֶל. מִבְּלָאֵי מִכְנְסֵי כֹהֲנִים וּמֵהֶמְיָינֵיהֶן, מֵהֶן הָיוּ מַפְקִיעִין, וּבָהֶן הָיוּ מַדְלִיקִין. וְלֹא הָיָה חָצֵר בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְאִירָה מְאוֹר בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה.
human_translation: One who did not see the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing never saw celebration in his days. At the conclusion of the first Festival descended to the Women’s Courtyard, where they would introduce a significant repair, There were golden candelabra there And four basins of gold at the top And four ladders for each and every and four children from the priesthood trainees, and in their hands pitchers of 120 log that they would pour into each and every basin. From the worn trousers of the priests and their belts they would loosen and with them they would light And there was not a courtyard in Jerusalem that was not illuminated from the light of the Place of the Drawing
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has not seen the joy of the Water Drawing Celebration has never seen joy in his life. On the eve of the first day of the festival, they would descend to the Women's Courtyard and make a great preparation there. There were golden candelabras there, with four golden bowls atop them, and four ladders to each one, and four young priests from priestly families holding jars of one hundred and twenty logs, which they would pour into each bowl. From worn-out priestly garments and belts, they would make wicks, and with them they would light the candelabras. There was no courtyard in Jerusalem that was not illuminated by the light of the Water Drawing Celebration.

hebrew_text: חֲסִידִים וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה הָיוּ מְרַקְּדִין בִּפְנֵיהֶם
human_translation: pious and men of action would dance before
llm_translation: The pious and men of deeds were dancing before them.

hebrew_text: בַּאֲבוּקוֹת שֶׁל אוֹר שֶׁבִּידֵיהֶן, וְאוֹמְרִים לִפְנֵיהֶם דִּבְרֵי שִׁירוֹת וְתוּשְׁבָּחוֹת. וְהַלְוִיִּם בְּכִנּוֹרוֹת וּבִנְבָלִים וּבִמְצִלְתַּיִם וּבַחֲצוֹצְרוֹת וּבִכְלֵי שִׁיר בְּלֹא מִסְפָּר, עַל חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת הַיּוֹרְדוֹת מֵעֶזְרַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, כְּנֶגֶד חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה (מַעֲלוֹת) שֶׁבַּתְּהִלִּים, שֶׁעֲלֵיהֶן לְוִיִּם עוֹמְדִין בִּכְלֵי שִׁיר וְאוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה.
human_translation: with flaming torches in their hands, and they would say before them passages of song and praise And the Levites on lyres, harps, cymbals, and trumpets, and countless musical instruments. on the fifteen stairs that descend from the Israelites’ courtyard to the Women’s Courtyard, corresponding to the fifteen Ascents in Psalms, upon which Levites stand with musical instruments and recite song.
llm_translation: In the chambers of light that were in their hands, and they would say before them words of songs and praises. And the Levites with harps, lyres, cymbals, and trumpets, and with musical instruments without number, upon the fifteen steps descending from the Ezrat Yisrael to the Ezrat Nashim, corresponding to the fifteen (steps) of the Songs, upon which the Levites would stand with musical instruments and sing praises.

hebrew_text: וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי כֹהֲנִים בְּשַׁעַר הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁיּוֹרֵד מֵעֶזְרַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, וּשְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת בִּידֵיהֶן, קָרָא הַגֶּבֶר — תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ. הִגִּיעוּ לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית — תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ. הִגִּיעוּ לָעֲזָרָה — תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ.
human_translation: And Two priests stood at the Upper Gate that descends from the Israelites’ courtyard to the Women’s Courtyard, with two trumpets in their hands. the rooster crowed they sounded a tekia , and sounded a terua , and sounded a tekia . they reached the tenth stair sounded a tekia , and sounded a terua , and sounded a tekia , they reached the Courtyard sounded a tekia , and sounded a terua , and sounded a tekia .
llm_translation: And stood two Kohanim at the Upper Gate, from the Azarah of Yisrael to the Azarah of the women, and two trumpets in their hands, the man called out - blow, sound the alarm, and blow. They reached the tenth step - blow, sound the alarm, and blow. They reached the Azarah - blow, sound the alarm, and blow.

hebrew_text: (הִגִּיעוּ לַקַּרְקַע — תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ.) הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין וְהוֹלְכִין עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעִין לְשַׁעַר הַיּוֹצֵא מִמִּזְרָח. הִגִּיעוּ לְשַׁעַר הַיּוֹצֵא מִמִּזְרָח — הָפְכוּ פְּנֵיהֶן מִמִּזְרָח לְמַעֲרָב וְאָמְרוּ: אֲבוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁהָיוּ בַּמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה — ״אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הַהֵיכָל וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים קֵדְמָה לַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״, וְאָנוּ לְיָהּ עֵינֵינוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, הָיוּ שׁוֹנִין וְאוֹמְרִין: אָנוּ לְיָהּ, וּלְיָהּ עֵינֵינוּ.
human_translation: they reached the ground sounded a tekia , and sounded a terua , and sounded a tekia . They continued sounding until they reached the gate which exits to the east, they reached the gate which exits to the east, they turned from east to west, and said: Our ancestors who were in this place “with their backs toward the Sanctuary of the Lord, and their faces toward the east; and they worshipped the sun toward the east” and we, our eyes are to God. Rabbi Yehuda says they would repeat and say: We are to God, and our eyes are to God.
llm_translation: (They reached the ground - they knocked and shouted and knocked.) They would knock and walk until they reached the gate that faces east. When they reached the gate that faces east - they turned their faces from east to west and said: Our ancestors who were in this place - "their backs to the sanctuary and their faces eastward, bowing to the sun," but we to the Lord our God. Rabbi Yehuda says, they would repeat and say: "We to the Lord, and to the Lord our eyes."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה שִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה — לֹא רָאָה שִׂמְחָה מִיָּמָיו. מִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בְּתִפְאַרְתָּהּ — לֹא רָאָה כְּרַךְ נֶחְמָד מֵעוֹלָם. מִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּבִנְיָנוֹ — לֹא רָאָה בִּנְיָן מְפוֹאָר מֵעוֹלָם. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב חִסְדָּא: זֶה בִּנְיַן הוֹרְדוֹס.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who did not see the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing never saw celebration in his life. One who did not see Jerusalem in its glory, never saw a beautiful city. One who did not see the Temple in its constructed never saw a magnificent structure. What is Abaye said, and some say Rav Ḥisda This building of Herod,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who has not seen the joy of the Water Drawing Celebration has never seen true joy in his life. One who has not seen Jerusalem in its glory has never seen a desirable city in his life. One who has not seen the Temple in its construction has never seen a magnificent building in his life. What is it? Abaye said, and some say it was Rav Ḥisda: This is the building of Herod.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי בַּנְיֵהּ? אָמַר (רָבָא): בְּאַבְנֵי שֵׁישָׁא וּמַרְמְרָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּאַבְנֵי שֵׁישָׁא כּוּחְלָא וּמַרְמְרָא. אַפֵּיק שָׂפָה וְעַיֵּיל שָׂפָה, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּלְקַבֵּל סִידָא. סְבַר לְמִשְׁעֲיֵיהּ בְּדַהֲבָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁבְקֵיהּ, דְּהָכִי שַׁפִּיר טְפֵי, דְּמִיתְחֲזֵי כְּאִדְוָתָא דְיַמָּא.
human_translation: With what did he construct it? Rava said: with stones of marble and white marble [ marmara ]. Some say: with stones of blue marble and white marble. one row protruded and one row indented, so that the plaster would take He thought to plate with gold, the Sages said to him: Leave it as it is better this way, as it has the appearance of waves of the sea.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what did they build it? Rava said: With marble stones and white stones. Some say: With marble stones like glass and white stones. They would remove a layer and add a layer, in order to receive lime. He thought to cover it with gold, the Rabbis said to him: Leave it, for it is better as it is, for it appears like the waves of the sea.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה דְּיוֹפְּלוּסְטוֹן שֶׁל אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם, לֹא רָאָה בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמְרוּ: כְּמִין בָּסִילְקֵי גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה, סְטָיו לְפָנִים מִסְּטָיו. פְּעָמִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהּ (שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא עַל שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא), כִּפְלַיִם כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם. וְהָיוּ בָּהּ שִׁבְעִים וְאַחַת קָתֶדְרָאוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב, כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעִים וְאַחַת שֶׁל סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה, כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת אֵינָהּ פְּחוּתָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד רִבּוֹא כִּכְּרֵי זָהָב. וּבִימָה שֶׁל עֵץ בְּאֶמְצָעִיתָהּ, וְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת עוֹמֵד עָלֶיהָ וְהַסּוּדָרִין בְּיָדוֹ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לַעֲנוֹת אָמֵן, הַלָּה מֵנִיף בַּסּוּדָר וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹנִין אָמֵן.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: One who did not see the great synagogue [ deyofloston ] of Alexandria of Egypt never saw the glory of Israel. They said was like a large basilica [ basileki ], a colonnade within a colonnade. At times there were six hundred thousand and six hundred thousand in it, twice the number of those who left Egypt. In it there were seventy-one golden chairs [ katedraot ], corresponding to the seventy-one of the Great Sanhedrin, each of which no less than twenty-one thousand talents of gold. And a wooden platform at the center. The sexton of the synagogue stand on it, with the scarves in his hand. And when reached to answer amen, waved the scarf and all the people answer amen.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One who has not seen the marble of Alexandria in Egypt has not seen the glory of Israel." They said: It was like the great basilica, its pillars were in front of its pillars. There were times when there were in it (sixty myriads upon sixty myriads), twice as many as those who left Egypt. And there were in it seventy-one golden thrones, corresponding to the seventy-one members of the Great Sanhedrin, and each one was not less than twenty-one myriads of gold talents. And there was a wooden platform in its midst, and the chazzan of the synagogue stood upon it with the officers in his hand. And when he reached the response of 'Amen,' he waved the scarf, and all the people responded 'Amen.'

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִין מְעוֹרָבִין, אֶלָּא זֶהָבִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן וְכַסָּפִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן וְנַפָּחִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן וְטַרְסִיִּים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן וְגַרְדִיִּים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן. וּכְשֶׁעָנִי נִכְנָס שָׁם, הָיָה מַכִּיר בַּעֲלֵי אוּמָּנֻתוֹ וְנִפְנֶה שָׁם. וּמִשָּׁם פַּרְנָסָתוֹ וּפַרְנָסַת אַנְשֵׁי בֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: And would not sit mingled. Rather, the goldsmiths among themselves, and the silversmiths among themselves, and the blacksmiths among themselves, and the coppersmiths among themselves, and the weavers among themselves. And when a poor entered there, he would recognize people his craft, and he would turn to there. And from there his livelihood the livelihood members of his household,
llm_translation: They did not sit mixed together, but gold by themselves and silver by themselves and copper by themselves and iron by themselves and tin by themselves. And when a poor person entered there, he would recognize the members of his trade and find sustenance there. And from there his livelihood and the livelihood of the members of his household would be sustained.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְכוּלְּהוּ קַטְלִינְהוּ אָלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדֹּן. מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנוּשׁ? מִשּׁוּם דְּעָבְרִי אַהַאי קְרָא: ״לָא תוֹסִיפוּן לָשׁוּב בַּדֶּרֶךְ הַזֶּה עוֹד״, וְאִינְהוּ הֲדוּר אֲתוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: All of were killed by Alexander of Macedonia. What is the reason they were punished due to that they violated this verse: “You shall henceforth return no more that way” and they returned.
llm_translation: Abaye said: And they all killed him, Alkisandros Mokedon. What is the reason for the punishment? Because of this verse: "You shall not return on this way again," and they returned on it.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא, אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ בְּסִיפְרָא: ״יִשָּׂא ה׳ עָלֶיךָ גּוֹי מֵרָחוֹק״, אֲמַר: מִכְּדֵי הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בָּעֵי לְמֵיתֵי סְפִינְתָּא בְּעַשְׂרָה יוֹמֵי, דַּלְיַהּ זִיקָא וְאָתֵי סְפִינְתָּא בְּחַמְשָׁא יוֹמֵי — נְפַל עֲלַיְיהוּ וְקַטְלִינְהוּ.
human_translation: When arrived, he found them, that they were reading in the scroll: “The Lord will bring a nation against you from far, He said, Now, since that man sought to come by ship in ten days, a wind carried it and the ship arrived in five days, he set upon them and slaughtered them.
llm_translation: When he came, he found that they were reading in a book: "The Lord will bring upon you a nation from afar." He said: Since that man wants to sink a ship in ten days, let the worm come and the ship arrive in five days - it will fall upon them and kill them.

hebrew_text: בְּמוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב כּוּ׳. מַאי תִּיקּוּן גָּדוֹל? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: חֲלָקָה הָיְתָה בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה. וְהִקִּיפוּהָ גְּזוּזְטְרָא, וְהִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ נָשִׁים יוֹשְׁבוֹת מִלְמַעְלָה וַאֲנָשִׁים מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: At the conclusion of Festival What significant repair? Rabbi Elazar said it is like that which we learned: were smooth, initially. surrounded with a balcony [ gezuztra ]. And they instituted that women should sit above and men below.
llm_translation: On the eve of a festival, it is said: "What is the great improvement?" Rabbi Elazar said: "As we learned: Initially, there was a partition. They surrounded it with a balcony, and they arranged that women would sit above and men below."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ נָשִׁים מִבִּפְנִים וַאֲנָשִׁים מִבַּחוּץ, וְהָיוּ בָּאִים לִידֵי קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ נָשִׁים יוֹשְׁבוֹת מִבַּחוּץ וַאֲנָשִׁים מִבִּפְנִים, וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ בָּאִין לִידֵי קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ נָשִׁים יוֹשְׁבוֹת מִלְּמַעְלָה וַאֲנָשִׁים מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Initially, women would on the inside and the men on the outside And they would come to levity instituted that the women should sit on the outside and the men on the inside, and still they would come to levity. they instituted that the women would sit above and the men below.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, women would be inside and men outside, and they would come to frivolity. They instituted that women should sit outside and men inside, yet they would still come to frivolity. They then instituted that women should sit above and men below.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עֲבִיד הָכִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״הַכֹּל בִּכְתָב מִיַּד ה׳ עָלַי הִשְׂכִּיל״.
human_translation: How could one do so, But isn’t it written “All this in writing, the Lord has made me wise by His hand upon me,
llm_translation: "How does one do this? And it is written: 'All in writing from the hand of Hashem upon me understanding.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: קְרָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ וּדְרוּשׁ —
human_translation: Rav said: They found a verse, and interpreted it homiletically
llm_translation: Rav said: "A verse is found and expound—"

hebrew_text: ״וְסָפְדָה הָאָרֶץ מִשְׁפָּחוֹת מִשְׁפָּחוֹת לְבָד מִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית דָּוִד לְבָד וּנְשֵׁיהֶם לְבָד״. אָמְרוּ: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וְאֵין יֵצֶר הָרָע שׁוֹלֵט בָּהֶם — אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה אֲנָשִׁים לְבַד וְנָשִׁים לְבַד. עַכְשָׁיו, שֶׁעֲסוּקִין בְּשִׂמְחָה וְיֵצֶר הָרָע שׁוֹלֵט בָּהֶם — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: “The land will eulogize, each family separately; the family of the house of David separately, and their women separately, They said: And are matters not a fortiori ? If in the future, when are involved in eulogy and the evil inclination does not dominate them, the Torah says: Men separately and women separately; now that they are involved in Celebration and the evil inclination dominates them, all the more so
llm_translation: "The land shall mourn, each family by itself: the family of the house of David by itself and their wives by themselves." They said: Isn't this a logical inference: If in the future, when they are engaged in mourning and the evil inclination does not rule over them, the Torah said, 'Men by themselves and women by themselves,' now, when they are engaged in rejoicing and the evil inclination rules over them, how much more so!"

hebrew_text: הָא הֶסְפֵּידָא מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי דּוֹסָא וְרַבָּנַן. חַד אָמַר: עַל מָשִׁיחַ בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג, וְחַד אָמַר: עַל יֵצֶר הָרַע שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג.
human_translation: what is the nature of this eulogy? Rabbi Dosa and the Rabbis disagree concerning this One said for Messiah ben Yosef who was killed And one said for the evil inclination that was killed.
llm_translation: The Gemara: What is the mourning for? Rabbi Dosa and the Rabbis disagree about it. One says: For the Messiah son of Joseph who was killed, and one says: For the evil inclination that was killed.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל מָשִׁיחַ בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִבִּיטוּ אֵלַי אֵת אֲשֶׁר דָּקָרוּ וְסָפְדוּ עָלָיו כְּמִסְפֵּד עַל הַיָּחִיד״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל יֵצֶר הָרַע שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג — הַאי הֶסְפֵּידָא בָּעֵי לְמֶעְבַּד? שִׂמְחָה בָּעֵי לְמֶעְבַּד! אַמַּאי בָּכוּ?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said Messiah ben Yosef who was killed, this which is written “And they shall look unto Me because they have thrust him through; and they shall mourn for him, as one mourns for his only son” However, according to the one who said for the evil inclination that was killed, need to conduct a eulogy this? one should conduct a celebration. Why, did they cry?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says it refers to the Messiah, son of Joseph, who was slain, that is why it is written: "And they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, and they shall mourn for him as one mourns for an only child." But according to the one who says it refers to the evil inclination that was slain - does mourning need to be done? Joy needs to be done! Why then do they weep? English translation:

hebrew_text: כִּדְדָרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, מְבִיאוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיֵצֶר הָרָע, וְשׁוֹחֲטוֹ בִּפְנֵי הַצַּדִּיקִים וּבִפְנֵי הָרְשָׁעִים. צַדִּיקִים נִדְמֶה לָהֶם כְּהַר גָּבוֹהַּ, וּרְשָׁעִים נִדְמֶה לָהֶם כְּחוּט הַשַּׂעֲרָה. הַלָּלוּ בּוֹכִין וְהַלָּלוּ בּוֹכִין. צַדִּיקִים בּוֹכִין וְאוֹמְרִים: הֵיאַךְ יָכוֹלְנוּ לִכְבּוֹשׁ הַר גָּבוֹהַּ כָּזֶה! וּרְשָׁעִים בּוֹכִין וְאוֹמְרִים: הֵיאַךְ לֹא יָכוֹלְנוּ לִכְבּוֹשׁ אֶת חוּט הַשַּׂעֲרָה הַזֶּה! וְאַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא תָּמֵהַּ עִמָּהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת כִּי יִפָּלֵא בְּעֵינֵי שְׁאֵרִית הָעָם הַזֶּה בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם גַּם בְּעֵינַי יִפָּלֵא״.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yehuda taught: In the future, God will bring the evil inclination and slaughter it in the presence of the righteous and in the presence of the wicked. the righteous appears to them as a high mountain, and the wicked appears them as strand of hair. These weep and those weep. The righteous weep and say: How were we able to overcome so high a mountain? And the wicked weep and say: How were we unable to overcome this strand of hair? And even the Holy One, Blessed be He, will wonder with them, as it is stated “So says the Lord of hosts: If it be wondrous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in those days, it should also be wondrous in My eyes”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehuda expounded: In the future, the Holy One, blessed be He, will bring the Evil Inclination and slaughter it in the presence of the righteous and the wicked. The righteous will appear like a high mountain, and the wicked will appear like a hair's breadth. The righteous will cry and say: How could we overcome such a high mountain! And the wicked will cry and say: How could we not overcome this hair's breadth! And even the Holy One, blessed be He, will marvel with them, as it is said: "Thus says the Lord of hosts: If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in those days, it will also be marvelous in My eyes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: יֵצֶר הָרָע בַּתְּחִילָּה דּוֹמֶה לְחוּט שֶׁל בּוּכְיָא, וּלְבַסּוֹף דּוֹמֶה כַּעֲבוֹתוֹת הָעֲגָלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹי מוֹשְׁכֵי הֶעָוֹן בְּחַבְלֵי הַשָּׁוְא וְכַעֲבוֹת הָעֲגָלָה חַטָּאָה״.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: Initially, the evil inclination is like a strand of a spider’s web [ bukhya ]; and ultimately it is like ropes of a wagon, as it is stated: “Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as if it were with a wagon rope”
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: The evil inclination at first resembles a thread of a spider, and in the end it resembles the ropes of a wagon, as it is stated: "Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood and sin as with cart ropes."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָשִׁיחַ בֶּן דָּוִד שֶׁעָתִיד לְהִגָּלוֹת בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ, אוֹמֵר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: שְׁאַל מִמֶּנִּי דָּבָר וְאֶתֵּן לָךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲסַפְּרָה אֶל חוֹק וְגוֹ׳ אֲנִי הַיּוֹם יְלִדְתִּיךָ. שְׁאַל מִמֶּנִּי וְאֶתְּנָה גוֹיִם נַחֲלָתֶךָ״. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁרָאָה מָשִׁיחַ בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג, אוֹמֵר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! אֵינִי מְבַקֵּשׁ מִמְּךָ אֶלָּא חַיִּים. אוֹמֵר לוֹ: חַיִּים, עַד שֶׁלֹּא אָמַרְתָּ כְּבָר הִתְנַבֵּא עָלֶיךָ דָּוִד אָבִיךָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חַיִּים שָׁאַל מִמְּךָ נָתַתָּה לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
