human_translation: The Sages taught: To Messiah ben David, who is destined to be revealed swiftly in our time, the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: Ask of Me anything and I will give you as it is stated: “I will tell of the decree; this day have I begotten you, ask of Me, and I will give the nations for your inheritance, Once saw Messiah ben Yosef, who was killed, he says Master of the Universe, I ask of you only life; says to him: Life? before you stated your father, David, already prophesied about you as it is stated: “He asked life of You, You gave it to him;
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The Messiah, son of David, who is destined to be revealed quickly in our days, the Holy One, blessed be He, will say to him: Ask of Me anything, and I will give it to you, as it is stated: "I will tell of the decree, etc., I have begotten you this day. Ask of Me, and I will give nations as your inheritance." And once the Messiah, son of Joseph, saw that he was slain, he will say before Him: Master of the World! I ask of You only for life. He will say to him: Life, as you have not yet said, "You have already prophesied concerning him, your father David, as it is stated: 'Life he asked of You, You gave it to him, etc.'"

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי עַוִּירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: שִׁבְעָה שֵׁמוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ לְיֵצֶר הָרָע. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא קְרָאוֹ ״רַע״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יֵצֶר לֵב הָאָדָם רַע מִנְּעוּרָיו״. מֹשֶׁה קְרָאוֹ ״עָרֵל״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמַלְתֶּם אֵת עׇרְלַת לְבַבְכֶם״. דָּוִד קְרָאוֹ ״טָמֵא״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵב טָהוֹר בְּרָא לִי אֱלֹהִים״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא טָמֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Avira, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, taught: The evil inclination has seven names. The Holy One, Blessed be He, called it evil, as it is stated: “For the inclination of a man’s heart is evil from his youth” Moses called it uncircumcised, as it is stated: “And circumcise the foreskin of your hearts” David called it impure, as it is stated: “Create for me a pure heart, O God” by inference, there is an impure
llm_translation: Rabbi Avira expounded and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The evil inclination has seven names. The Holy One, blessed be He, calls it "evil," as it is stated: "For the inclination of man's heart is evil from his youth." Moses calls it "uncircumcised," as it is stated: "And you shall circumcise the foreskin of your heart." David calls it "impure," as it is stated: "Create for me a pure heart, O God," from which it can be inferred that it is impure.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹמֹה קְרָאוֹ ״שׂוֹנֵא״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם רָעֵב שֹׂנַאֲךָ הַאֲכִילֵהוּ לָחֶם וְאִם צָמֵא הַשְׁקֵהוּ מָיִם כִּי גֶחָלִים אַתָּה חוֹתֶה עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וַה׳ יְשַׁלֶּם לָךְ״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״יְשַׁלֶּם לָךְ״, אֶלָּא ״יַשְׁלִימֶנּוּ לָךְ״.
human_translation: Solomon called it enemy, as it is stated: “If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat, and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink; for you will heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord will reward you” Do not read And the Lord will reward you [ yeshalem lakh ]; rather will reconcile it to you [ yashlimenu lakh ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Solomon called him "hater," as it is stated: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him bread, and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink, for you will heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord will reward you." Do not read it as "will reward you," rather as "will repay him to you." English translation: Solomon called him "hater," as it is stated: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him bread, and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink, for you will heap coals of fire upon his head, and the Lord will reward you." Do not read it as "will reward you," rather as "will repay him to you."

hebrew_text: יְשַׁעְיָה קְרָאוֹ ״מִכְשׁוֹל״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סוֹלּוּ סוֹלּוּ פַּנּוּ דָרֶךְ הָרִימוּ מִכְשׁוֹל מִדֶּרֶךְ עַמִּי״. יְחֶזְקֵאל קְרָאוֹ ״אֶבֶן״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲסִרֹתִי אֶת לֵב הָאֶבֶן מִבְּשַׂרְכֶם וְנָתַתִּי לָכֶם לֵב בָּשָׂר״. יוֹאֵל קְרָאוֹ ״צְפוֹנִי״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֶת הַצְּפוֹנִי אַרְחִיק מֵעֲלֵיכֶם״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְאֶת הַצְּפוֹנִי אַרְחִיק מֵעֲלֵיכֶם״ — זֶה יֵצֶר הָרָע, שֶׁצָּפוּן וְעוֹמֵד בְּלִבּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם.
human_translation: Isaiah called it a stumbling block, as it is stated: “And He will say: Cast you up, cast you up, clear the way, take up the stumbling block out of the way of My people” Ezekiel called it stone, as it is stated: “And I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh” Joel called it hidden one, as it says: “But I will remove the northern one [ hatzefoni ] far off from you” The Sages taught “But I will remove the northern one [ hatzefoni ] far off from you,” this is the evil inclination. that it is always hidden [ tzafun ] in the heart of man.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Yeshayahu called it "mikshol," as it is stated: "Clear the way, clear the way, remove the stumbling block from the way of My people." Yehezkel called it "even," as it is stated: "And I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh." Yoel called it "tzefoni," as it is stated: "And I will remove the northerner far from you." The Rabbis taught: "And I will remove the northerner far from you" — this is the evil inclination, which is hidden and stands in the heart of man.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִדַּחְתִּיו אֶל אֶרֶץ צִיָּה וּשְׁמָמָה״ — לִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין בְּנֵי אָדָם מְצוּיִין לְהִתְגָּרוֹת בָּהֶן. ״אֶת פָּנָיו אֶל הַיָּם הַקַּדְמוֹנִי״ — שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן וְהֶחְרִיבוֹ, וְהָרַג תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבּוֹ. ״וְסוֹפוֹ אֶל הַיָּם הָאַחֲרוֹן״ — שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי וְהֶחְרִיבוֹ, וְהָרַג תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבּוֹ. ״וְעָלָה בׇאְשׁוֹ וְתַעַל צַחֲנָתוֹ״ — שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, וּמִתְגָּרֶה בְּשׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. ״כִּי הִגְדִּיל לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּבְתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים יוֹתֵר מִכּוּלָּם.
human_translation: “And will drive it to a land barren and desolate” where there are no people for to incite. “With its face toward the eastern [ hakadmoni ] sea” as it set its eyes on the First mukdam Temple and destroyed it, and killed the Torah scholars that in it; “and its end toward the western [ ha’aḥaron ] sea” as it set its eyes on the Second aḥaron Temple and destroyed it, and killed the Torah scholars that in it; “its foulness may come up, and its ill odor may come up” as it forsakes the nations of the world and incites the enemies of Jewish people: “Because it has done greatly” Abaye said: And Torah scholars more than everyone
llm_translation: "And I will push him to a desolate land and desolation" — to a place where there are no people present to contend with them. "His face towards the eastern sea" — that he placed his eyes on the first Temple and destroyed it, and killed the scholars within it. "And his end towards the western sea" — that he placed his eyes on the second Temple and destroyed it, and killed the scholars within it. "And his end with burning coals and kindling of fire" — that he leaves the nations of the world, and contends with the enemies of Israel. "For he has magnified to do" — Abaye said: And with scholars of the wise more than all of them.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאַבָּיֵי שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָאָמַר לְהַהִיא אִתְּתָא: נַקְדֵּים וְנֵיזִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא. אֲמַר: אֵיזִיל אַפְרְשִׁינְהוּ מֵאִיסּוּרָא. אֲזַל בָּתְרַיְיהוּ תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי בְּאַגְמָא. כִּי הֲווֹ פָּרְשִׁי מֵהֲדָדֵי, שַׁמְעִינְהוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי: אוֹרְחִין רַחִיקָא, וְצַוְותִּין בְּסִימָא.
human_translation: like this as Abaye once heard a certain man say to a certain woman: Let us rise early and go on the road. said I will go prevent them from the prohibition He went after them three parasangs in a marsh When they were taking leave of each other, he heard that they were saying: a long distance and the company was pleasant company.
llm_translation: The matter of Abbaye heard from that man who said to that woman: "We will go and walk on the road." He said: "I will separate them from the prohibition." He went after them, three parasangs in a marsh. When they separated from each other, they heard him saying: "The roads are distant, and the signs are clear."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי מַאן דְּסָנֵי לִי הֲוָה, לָא הֲוָה מָצֵי לְאוֹקוֹמֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲזַל תְּלָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּעִיבּוּרָא דְּדָשָׁא וּמִצְטַעֵר. אֲתָא הָהוּא סָבָא, תְּנָא לֵיהּ: כׇּל הַגָּדוֹל מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — יִצְרוֹ גָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: if it had been one whom I hate, he would not have been able to restrain himself he went and leaned against the doorpost, and feeling regret. A certain Elder came taught him: Anyone who is greater than another, his inclination is greater than his.
llm_translation: Abaye said: If one who hates me existed, he would not be able to stand before me. He would go hang himself on a thornbush and suffer. An elder came and taught him: Anyone who is greater than his fellow, his inclination is greater than him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יִצְרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַק
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A person’s inclination overcomes him each day, as it is stated: “Only
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: The inclination of a person overpowers him every day, as it is stated: "Only."

hebrew_text: רַע כׇּל הַיּוֹם״. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: יִצְרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו בְּכׇל יוֹם וּמְבַקֵּשׁ לַהֲמִיתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צוֹפֶה רָשָׁע לַצַּדִּיק וּמְבַקֵּשׁ לַהֲמִיתוֹ״, וְאִלְמָלֵא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁעוֹזֵר לוֹ — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ לֹא יַעַזְבֶנּוּ בְיָדוֹ וְלֹא יַרְשִׁיעֶנּוּ בְּהִשָּׁפְטוֹ״.
human_translation: evil all day” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A person’s inclination overcomes him each day and seeks to kill him, as it stated: “The wicked watches the righteous and seeks to kill him” And if not for the Holy One, Blessed be He, Who assists he would not overcome it, as it is stated: “The Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor suffer him to be condemned when he is judged”
llm_translation: Evil all the day." Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The inclination of a person grows stronger against him every day and seeks to kill him, as it is stated: "The wicked watches for the righteous and seeks to kill him." And if not for the Holy One, blessed be He, who helps him, he would not be able to withstand, as it is stated: "The Lord will not abandon him into his hand, nor let him be condemned when he is judged."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אִם פָּגַע בְּךָ מְנֻוּוֹל זֶה — מׇשְׁכֵהוּ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. אִם אֶבֶן הוּא — נִימּוֹחַ, אִם בַּרְזֶל הוּא מִתְפּוֹצֵץ. אִם אֶבֶן הוּא נִימּוֹחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״, וּכְתִיב: ״אֲבָנִים שָׁחֲקוּ מַיִם״. אִם בַּרְזֶל הוּא מִתְפּוֹצֵץ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֲלׂא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳ וּכְפַטִּישׁ יְפוֹצֵץ סָלַע״.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: If this scoundrel, accosted you, drag it to the study hall If it is a stone, it will be dissolved If it is iron, it will be shattered. If it is stone, it will be dissolved, as it is written: “Ho, everyone who is thirsty, come you for the water” and it is written: “Stones were worn by water” If it is iron, it will be shattered, as it is written: “Is not My word like fire, says the Lord; and like a hammer that shatters rock”
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: If a nutcracker encounters you, pull him to the study hall. If it is a stone, it will dissolve; if it is iron, it will shatter. If it is a stone that will dissolve, as it is written: "Ho, everyone who thirsts, come to the water," and it is written: "The rocks poured out water." If it is iron that will shatter, as it is written: "Is not My word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that shatters rock."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: יֵצֶר הָרָע מְסִיתוֹ לָאָדָם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וּמֵעִיד עָלָיו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְפַנֵּק מִנּוֹעַר עַבְדּוֹ וְאַחֲרִיתוֹ יִהְיֶה מָנוֹן״ — שֶׁכֵּן בְּאַטְבַּ״‎ח שֶׁל רַבִּי חִיָּיא, קוֹרִין לְסָהֲדָה מָנוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The evil inclination incites a person in this world, and testifies against him in the next world, as it is stated: “He that delicately brings up his servant from a child shall have him become a master [ manon ] at the last” as in Rabbi Ḥiyya’s alef tet beit ḥet , Witness sahada is called manon .
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: The evil inclination entices a person in this world, and testifies against him in the world to come, as it is stated: "He pampered him from his youth, and afterward he will be his delight" (Deuteronomy 32:15) — so in the academy of Rabbi Chiya they read the verse as "his delight."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא רָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״כִּי רוּחַ זְנוּנִים הִתְעָה״. וּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִרְבָּם״! בַּתְּחִלָּה הִתְעָם, וּלְבַסּוֹף בְּקִרְבָּם.
human_translation: Rav Huna raised a contradiction It is written: “For the spirit of harlotry caused to err” And it is written: is within them” Initially, it causes them to err and ultimately, within them.
llm_translation: Rav Huna raises a contradiction: It is written, "For the spirit of harlotry has led them astray." And it is written, "In their midst!" Initially, they were led astray, but ultimately, it is within them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בַּתְּחִלָּה קְרָאוֹ ״הֵלֶךְ״, וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ ״אוֹרֵחַ״, וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ ״אִישׁ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּבֹא הֵלֶךְ לְאִישׁ הֶעָשִׁיר וַיַּחְמוֹל לָקַחַת מִצֹּאנוֹ וּמִבְּקָרוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת לָאוֹרֵחַ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח אֶת כִּבְשַׂת הָאִישׁ הָרָשׁ וַיַּעֲשֶׂהָ לָאִישׁ הַבָּא אֵלָיו״.
human_translation: Rava said: Initially, called a traveler Subsequently, calls it a guest, Ultimately, calls it man, As it is stated “And there came a traveler to the rich man, and he was reluctant to take of his own flock and of his own herd, to prepare for the guest” And it is written “And he took the poor man’s lamb, and prepared it for the man that was come to him.”
llm_translation: Rava said: At the beginning it is called "helek," and in the end it is called "oreach," and in the end it is called "ish," as it is stated: "And he went helek to the ish the wealthy, and he had compassion to take from his flock and from his herd to make for the oreach," and it is written: "And he took the sheep of the ish the poor and made it for the ish who came to him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵבֶר קָטָן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָדָם, מַרְעִיבוֹ — שָׂבֵעַ, מַשְׂבִּיעוֹ — רָעֵב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּמַרְעִיתָם וַיִּשְׂבָּעוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A man has a small organ If he starves is satiated; if he satiates is starving, as it is stated: “When they were fed, they became full,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A small limb has a person, hungry him — satisfied, satisfied him — hungry, as it is stated: "As they were satisfied, they became haughty" (Hosea 13:6).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר אַחָא, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: אַרְבָּעָה מִתְחָרֵט עֲלֵיהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁבְּרָאָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: גָּלוּת, כַּשְׂדִּים, וְיִשְׁמְעֵאלִים, וְיֵצֶר הָרָע. גָּלוּת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעַתָּה מַה לִּי פֹה נְאֻם ה׳ כִּי לֻקַּח עַמִּי חִנָּם וְגוֹ׳״. כַּשְׂדִּים, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֵן אֶרֶץ כַּשְׂדִּים זֶה הָעָם לֹא הָיָה״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Aḥa said in the school of Rav say: four the Holy One, Blessed be He, regrets that He created them, And these are they: Exile, Chaldeans, and Ishmaelites, and the evil inclination. Exile, as it is written: “Now therefore, for what am I here, says the Lord, seeing that My people is taken away for naught” Chaldeans, as it is written: “Behold the land of the Chaldeans, this is the people that was not”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanah bar Aḥa said, the students of Rav said: Four things the Holy One, blessed be He, regrets that He created, and they are: the exile, the Chaldeans, the Ishmaelites, and the evil inclination. The exile, as it is written: "And now what do I have here," says the Lord, "for my people has been taken away for nothing." The Chaldeans, as it is written: "Behold, the land of the Chaldeans—this people was not."

hebrew_text: יִשְׁמְעֵאלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״יִשְׁלָיוּ אֹהָלִים לְשׁוֹדְדִים וּבַטּוּחוֹת לְמַרְגִּיזֵי אֵל לַאֲשֶׁר הֵבִיא אֱלוֹהַּ בְּיָדוֹ״. יֵצֶר הָרָע, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר הֲרֵעֹתִי״.
human_translation: Ishmaelites, as it is written: “The tents of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure, in whatsoever God brings with His hand” The evil inclination, as it is written: and her that I corrupted”
llm_translation: The Ishmaelites, as it is written: "They set up tents for marauders, and enclosures for shepherds of flocks." The evil inclination, as it is written: "And that which I have done evil."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִלְמָלֵא שָׁלֹשׁ מִקְרָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ, נִתְמוֹטְטוּ רַגְלֵיהֶם שֶׁל שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. חַד, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲשֶׁר הֲרֵעֹתִי״. וְחַד, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה כַחוֹמֶר בְּיַד הַיּוֹצֵר כֵּן אַתֶּם וְגוֹ׳״. וְאִידַּךְ: ״וַהֲסִרֹתִי אֶת לֵב הָאֶבֶן מִבְּשַׂרְכֶם וְנָתַתִּי לָכֶם לֵב בָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Were it not for these three verses the legs of the enemies of Jewish people, would have collapsed, One, as it is written: “And her that I corrupted,” And one, as it is written: “Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are you And the other “And I will take away the heart of stone out of your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Were it not for these three verses, the enemies of the Israelites would have stumbled. One, as it is written: "And that I have done evil." And one, as it is written: "Behold, as the clay in the potter's hand, so are you." And the other: "And I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר, אַף מֵהַאי נָמֵי: ״וְאֶת רוּחִי אֶתֵּן בְּקִרְבְּכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: from this as well: “And I will put My spirit within you,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, also from this verse: "And I will put My spirit within you..."

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּרְאֵנִי ה׳ אַרְבָּעָה חָרָשִׁים״, מַאן נִינְהוּ אַרְבָּעָה חָרָשִׁים? אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: מָשִׁיחַ בֶּן דָּוִד, וּמָשִׁיחַ בֶּן יוֹסֵף, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ, וְכֹהֵן צֶדֶק. מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי אֵלֶּה הַקְּרָנוֹת אֲשֶׁר זֵרוּ אֶת יְהוּדָה״, הָנֵי לְשׁוּבָה אָתוּ!
human_translation: “The Lord then showed me four craftsmen” Who are these four craftsmen? Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said: Messiah ben David, Messiah ben Yosef, Elijah, and the righteous Priest, Rav Sheshet raised an objection: If so, that which is written “And he said to me: These are the horns that scattered Judea” these are coming for their enemies,
llm_translation: "And Hashem showed me four craftsmen," who are these four craftsmen? Rav Chana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: Messiah ben David, and Messiah ben Yosef, and Elijah, and the Righteous Priest. Rav Sheshet objected: If so, is this not what is written: "And he said to me, 'These are the horns that scattered Judah,'" they have come for destruction!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, שְׁפֵיל לְסֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא: ״וְיָבוֹאוּ אֵלֶּה לְהַחֲרִיד אוֹתָם לְיַדּוֹת אֶת קַרְנוֹת הַגּוֹיִם הַנּוֹשְׂאִים קֶרֶן אֶל אֶרֶץ יְהוּדָה לְזָרוֹתָהּ וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּהֲדֵי חָנָא בְּאַגָּדְתָּא לְמָה לִי.
human_translation: said to Go to the end of the verse: “These then are come to frighten them, to cast down the horns of the nations, which lifted up horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.” said to him: Why I with Ḥana in aggada ,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Interpret the end of the verse: 'And these shall come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations who raise a horn against the land of Judah to scatter it, etc.'" He said to him, "By the life of Hanina, in the Aggadah, what do I need it for."

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיָה זֶה שָׁלוֹם אַשּׁוּר כִּי יָבֹא בְאַרְצֵנוּ וְכִי יִדְרוֹךְ בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֵינוּ וַהֲקֵמֹנוּ עָלָיו שִׁבְעָה רוֹעִים וּשְׁמֹנָה נְסִיכֵי אָדָם״. מַאן נִינְהוּ ״שִׁבְעָה רוֹעִים״? דָּוִד בָּאֶמְצַע, אָדָם שֵׁת וּמְתוּשֶׁלַח מִימִינוֹ, אַבְרָהָם יַעֲקֹב וּמֹשֶׁה בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ. וּמַאן נִינְהוּ ״שְׁמֹנָה נְסִיכֵי אָדָם״? יִשַׁי, וְשָׁאוּל, וּשְׁמוּאֵל, עָמוֹס, וּצְפַנְיָה, צִדְקִיָּה, וּמָשִׁיחַ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: “And this shall be peace: When the Assyrian shall come into our land, and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise against him seven shepherds, and eight princes among men” Who are these seven shepherds? David in the middle; Adam, Seth, and Methuselah are to his right; Abraham, Jacob, and Moses are to his left. And who are the eight princes among men? Yishai, Saul, Samuel, Amos, Zephania, Zedekiah, Messiah, and Elijah.
llm_translation: "And this shall be the peace: when the Assyrian shall come into our land, and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise against him seven shepherds, and eight princes of men." Who are the "seven shepherds"? David in the middle, Adam, Seth, and Methuselah on his right, Abraham, Jacob, and Moses on his left. And who are the "eight princes of men"? Jesse, Saul, Samuel, Amos, Zephaniah, Zedekiah, Messiah, and Elijah.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה סוּלָּמוֹת כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: גּוֹבְהָהּ שֶׁל מְנוֹרָה חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, וְאַרְבָּעָה יְלָדִים שֶׁל פִּרְחֵי כְּהוּנָּה, וּבִידֵיהֶם כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים לוֹג. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים לוֹג כּוּלְּהוּ, אוֹ דִּלְמָא לְכׇל חַד וְחַד? תָּא שְׁמַע: וּבִידֵיהֶם כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל שְׁלֹשִׁים שְׁלֹשִׁים לוֹג, שֶׁהֵם כּוּלָּם מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים לוֹג.
human_translation: And there were four ladders taught: The height of the candelabrum is fifty cubits. And four children from the priesthood trainees and in their hands jugs of oil of 120 log A dilemma was raised: 120 log altogether, or perhaps each and every Come hear And in their hands jugs of oil, each of thirty log , that were all 120 log .
llm_translation: Four ladders, like so. It was taught: The height of the menorah is fifty cubits, and four children of the flower buds of the priesthood, and in their hands the amount of oil of one hundred and twenty logs. They raised a dilemma: Is it one hundred and twenty logs altogether, or perhaps for each one individually? Come and hear: And in their hands the amount of oil of thirty logs each, which are all one hundred and twenty logs.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וְהֵן מְשׁוּבָּחִין הָיוּ יוֹתֵר מִבְּנָהּ שֶׁל מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְיתּוֹס. אָמְרוּ עַל בְּנָהּ שֶׁל מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְיתּוֹס שֶׁהָיָה נוֹטֵל שְׁתֵּי יְרֵיכוֹת שֶׁל שׁוֹר הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁלָּקוּחַ בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, וּמְהַלֵּךְ עָקֵב בְּצַד גּוּדָל. וְלֹא הֱנִיחוּהוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, מִשּׁוּם: ״בְּרׇב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״.
human_translation: taught: And these were superior to the son of Marta, daughter of Baitos, They said about the son of Marta, daughter of Baitos, that he would take two thighs of a large bull that purchased for one thousand zuz , and walk heel to toe, his brethren the priests would not allow him do so, due to “In the multitude of people is the King’s glory”
llm_translation: Mishnah: And they were more praiseworthy than the son of Marta, the daughter of Bayitos. They said about the son of Marta, the daughter of Bayitos, that he would take the two hind legs of a large ox, purchased for a thousand zuz, and walk behind it. But his priestly brothers did not allow him to do so, because of: "In the multitude of people is the king's glory."

hebrew_text: מַאי מְשׁוּבָּחִים? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם יוּקְרָא — הָנֵי יַקִּירִי טְפֵי! אֶלָּא: הָתָם כֶּבֶשׁ, וּמְרוּבָּע, וְלָא זְקִיף. הָכָא סוּלָּמוֹת, וּזְקִיף טוּבָא.
human_translation: what superior? If we say it is due to the weight these thighs are heavier Rather, there, ramp and four and not steep; here ladders, and very steep.
llm_translation: What are the praiseworthy things? If you say it is because of honor - those are precious trifles! Rather, there it is a lamb, and it is square, and not round. Here it is ladders, and round is good.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיָה חָצֵר בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. תָּנָא:
human_translation: And there was not a courtyard in Jerusalem taught:
llm_translation: And there was no courtyard in Jerusalem. It was taught:

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה הָיְתָה בּוֹרֶרֶת חִטִּים לָאוֹר שֶׁל בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה.
human_translation: a woman would sort wheat by the light of the Place of the Drawing
llm_translation: A woman was sifting wheat by the light of the well of the Shova.

hebrew_text: חֲסִידִים וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, יֵשׁ מֵהֶן אוֹמְרִים: אַשְׁרֵי יַלְדוּתֵנוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּיְּישָׁה אֶת זִקְנוּתֵנוּ — אֵלּוּ חֲסִידִים וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן אוֹמְרִים: אַשְׁרֵי זִקְנוּתֵנוּ שֶׁכִּפְּרָה אֶת יַלְדוּתֵנוּ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה. אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אוֹמְרִים: אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָטָא, וּמִי שֶׁחָטָא — יָשׁוּב וְיִמְחוֹל לוֹ.
human_translation: The pious and the men of action The Sages taught some of them would say Happy is our youth, that did not embarrass our old age. These are the pious and the men of action, And some would say: Happy is our old age, that atoned for our youth These are the penitents. these and those say: Happy is he who did not sin; and he who sinned should repent and will absolve him.
llm_translation: The pious and the men of action. The Rabbis taught: Some of them say, "Fortunate is our youth that did not disgrace our old age" - these are the pious and the men of action. And some of them say, "Fortunate is our old age that atoned for our youth" - these are the penitents. Both of these and those say, "Fortunate is one who did not sin, and if one sinned, let him repent and seek forgiveness."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן, כְּשֶׁהָיָה שָׂמֵחַ בְּשִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה, אָמַר כֵּן: אִם אֲנִי כָּאן — הַכֹּל כָּאן, וְאִם אֵינִי כָּאן — מִי כָּאן. הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר כֵּן: מָקוֹם שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹהֵב — שָׁם רַגְלַי מוֹלִיכוֹת אוֹתִי. אִם תָּבֹא אֶל בֵּיתִי — אֲנִי אָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ, אִם אַתָּה לֹא תָּבֹא אֶל בֵּיתִי — אֲנִי לֹא אָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּכׇל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר אַזְכִּיר אֶת שְׁמִי אָבֹא אֵלֶיךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּיךָ״.
human_translation: It is taught They said about Hillel the Elder that when he was rejoicing at the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing he said this: If I am here, everyone is here; and if I am not here, who is here? He would say this: To the place that I love, there my feet take me, If you come to My house, I will come to your house; if you do not come to My house, I will not come to your house, as it is stated: “In every place that I cause My name to be mentioned, I will come to you and bless you”
llm_translation: It was taught: They said of Hillel the Elder, when he rejoiced at the celebration of the water-drawing festival, he would say thus: If I am here — everyone is here, but if I am not here — who is here. He used to say thus: The place that I love — there my feet lead me. If you come to my house — I will come to your house, but if you do not come to my house — I will not come to your house, as it is said: "In every place where I cause My name to be mentioned, I will come to you and bless you."

hebrew_text: אַף הוּא רָאָה גֻּלְגּוֹלֶת אַחַת שֶׁצָּפָה עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, אֲמַר לַהּ: עַל דְּאַטֵּפְתְּ אַטְפוּךְ וּמְטִיפַיִךְ יְטוּפוּן. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַגְלוֹהִי דְּבַר אִינִישׁ אִינּוּן עָרְבִין בֵּיהּ, לַאֲתַר דְּמִיתְבְּעֵי — תַּמָּן מוֹבִילִין יָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Additionally, he saw one skull that was floating on the water he said to it: Because you drowned they drowned you, and those that drowned you will be drowned. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The feet of a person are responsible for him; to the place where he is in demand, there they lead him.
llm_translation: He also saw a skull floating on the surface of the water, he said to it: "Because you drowned others, they will drown you, and those who drowned you will be drowned." Rabbi Yochanan said: When a person's feet are in a place where snakes are common, they should not wear sandals, as it is likely that they will be bitten there - in a place where it is common, they should not bring their vessel.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תַּרְתֵּי כּוּשָׁאֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָיְימִי קַמֵּי שְׁלֹמֹה, אֱלִיחֹרֶף וַאֲחִיָּה בְּנֵי שִׁישָׁא, סוֹפְרִים דִּשְׁלֹמֹה הֲווֹ. יוֹמָא חַד חַזְיֵיהּ מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת דַּהֲוָה קָא עֲצִיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיבַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּקָא בָעוּ מִינַּאי הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי כּוּשָׁאֵי דְּיָתְבִי הָכָא. מַסְרִינְהוּ לִשְׂעִירִים, שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ לְמָחוֹזָא דְלוּז. כִּי מְטוֹ לְמָחוֹזָא דְלוּז — שְׁכִיבוּ.
human_translation: these two Cushites who would stand before Solomon: “Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha” they were scribes of Solomon. One day saw that the Angel of Death was sad. He said to him: Why are you sad? He said to him: They are asking me these two Cushites who are sitting here. handed them to the demons and sent them to the district of Luz, When they arrived at the district of Luz, they died.
llm_translation: Behold, those two Kushites who stood before Solomon, Elihoref and Ahiyah sons of Shisha, were scribes of Solomon. One day they saw the Angel of Death who was sad, and they said to him: "Why are you sad?" He said to them: "Because I have been sent for those two Kushites who are sitting here." They handed them over to demons, who took them to the district of Luz. When they arrived in the district of Luz, they died.

hebrew_text: לִמְחַר, חַזְיֵהּ מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת דַּהֲוָה קָבָדַח! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי בְּדִיחַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּאֲתַר דִּבְעוֹ מִינַּאי, תַּמָּן שַׁדַּרְתִּינְהוּ. מִיָּד פָּתַח שְׁלֹמֹה וְאָמַר: רַגְלוֹהִי דְּבַר אִינִישׁ אִינּוּן עָרְבִין בֵּיהּ, לַאֲתַר דְּמִיתְבְּעֵי — תַּמָּן מוֹבִילִין יָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: The following day, saw that the Angel of Death was happy. He said to him: Why are you happy? He replied: In the place that they asked me there you sent them. Immediately, Solomon began and said: The feet of a person are responsible for him; to the place where he is in demand, there they lead him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "The next day, behold, the angel of death appeared! He said to him: Why are you laughing? He said to him: In a place where they are accustomed to me, there I send them. Immediately Solomon opened and said: The feet of a person are responsible for him, if they lead him to a place where he should not go - there they will bring him."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, כְּשֶׁהָיָה שָׂמֵחַ שִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה, הָיָה נוֹטֵל שְׁמֹנֶה אֲבוּקוֹת שֶׁל אוֹר, וְזוֹרֵק אַחַת וְנוֹטֵל אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹגְעוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, נוֹעֵץ שְׁנֵי גּוּדָלָיו בָּאָרֶץ וְשׁוֹחֶה וְנוֹשֵׁק אֶת הָרִצְפָּה וְזוֹקֵף, וְאֵין כׇּל בְּרִיָּה יְכוֹלָה לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, וְזוֹ הִיא קִידָּה.
human_translation: It is taught They said about Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel that when he would rejoice at the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing he would take eight flaming torches and toss one and catch another, and, they would not touch each other. And when he would prostrate himself, he would insert his two thumbs into the ground, and bow, and kiss the floor and straighten, and not any creature could do that And this was the kidda
llm_translation: It was taught: They said about Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, when he was rejoicing at the Simchat Beit HaShoeva, he would take eight torches of light, and throw one and catch one, and they would not touch one another. And when he would prostrate himself, he would plant his two thumbs in the ground and bow and kiss the floor and stand up, and no creature could do so, and this is arrogance.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אַחְוִי קִידָּה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי וְאִיטְּלַע. וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם אַל יָטִיחַ אָדָם דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם גָּדוֹל הֵטִיחַ דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה וְאִיטְּלַע, וּמַנּוּ — לֵוִי. הָא וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Levi demonstrated a kidda before Rabbi and came up lame. And is that what caused him But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: One should never speak impertinently toward above; as a great person spoke impertinently toward above, and came up lame. And who Levi. this and that caused him
llm_translation: Levi the brother of Kidah stood before Rabbi and argued. And what caused him to do so? Didn't Rabbi Elazar say: A person should never utter words of Torah in the presence of the Divine, for a great man once uttered words of Torah in the presence of the Divine and was burned, and Levi argued. This and that caused him to do so.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי הֲוָה מְטַיֵּיל קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי בְּתַמְנֵי סַכִּינֵי. שְׁמוּאֵל קַמֵּיהּ שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא בִּתְמָנְיָא מְזָגֵי חַמְרָא. אַבָּיֵי קַמֵּיהּ (דְּרָבָא) בִּתְמָנְיָא בֵּיעֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה בֵּיעֵי.
human_translation: Levi would walk before Rabbi with eight knives. Shmuel before King Shapur with eight glasses of wine Abaye before Rabba with eight eggs. Some say with four eggs.
llm_translation: Levi was walking in front of Rabbi with eight knives. Samuel was walking in front of King Shapur with eight cups of wine. Abaye was walking in front of (Rava) with eight cups, and they said to him with four cups.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: כְּשֶׁהָיִינוּ שְׂמֵחִים שִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה, לֹא רָאִינוּ שֵׁינָה בְּעֵינֵינוּ. כֵּיצַד? שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, מִשָּׁם לִתְפִלָּה, מִשָּׁם לְקׇרְבַּן מוּסַף, מִשָּׁם לִתְפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין, מִשָּׁם לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, מִשָּׁם לַאֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה, מִשָּׁם לִתְפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה, מִשָּׁם לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לְשִׂמְחַת בֵּית הַשּׁוֹאֵבָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya said: When we would rejoice the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing we did not see sleep in our eyes How so? first hour the daily morning offering From there to prayer from there, to the additional offerings; from there, to the additional prayer. From there to the study hall from there to the eating and drinking from there to the afternoon prayer. From there to the daily afternoon offering From this forward, to the Celebration of the Place of the Drawing
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah said: When we were rejoicing with the joy of the Water Drawing, we did not see sleep in our eyes. How so? The first hour of the morning, always, from there to prayer, from there to the additional offering, from there to the prayer of the additional offerings, from there to the study hall, from there to eating and drinking, from there to the afternoon prayer, from there to the afternoon continual offering, from there and onwards to the joy of the Water Drawing.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אִישַׁן שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים״ — מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ וְיָשֵׁן לְאַלְתַּר! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא טָעַמְנוּ טַעַם שֵׁינָה, דַּהֲווֹ מְנַמְנְמִי אַכַּתְפָּא דַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: an oath that I will not sleep three days, one flogs him and he sleep immediately Rather, this is what is saying: We did not experience the sense of sleep, because they would doze on each other’s shoulders.
llm_translation: I? And did not Rabbi Yochanan say: "A vow not to sleep for three days" — he is lashed and made to sleep immediately! Rather, this is what he meant: We did not taste the taste of sleep, for we were dozing off one to the other.

hebrew_text: חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְהָהוּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן דַּהֲוָה קָמְסַדַּר אַגָּדָתָא קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמִיעַ לְךָ, הָנֵי חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת, כְּנֶגֶד מִי אֲמָרָם דָּוִד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁכָּרָה דָּוִד שִׁיתִין, קְפָא תְּהוֹמָא וּבָעֵי לְמִשְׁטְפֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא. אָמַר דָּוִד חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת וְהוֹרִידָן. אִי הָכִי, חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה ״מַעֲלוֹת״ — ״יוֹרְדוֹת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: fifteen stairs Rav Ḥisda said to one of the Sages who was organizing aggada before him: Did you hear these fifteen Ascents corresponding to what did David say them? He said to him this Rabbi Yoḥanan said: At the time that David dug the drainpipes the depths rose and sought to inundate the world. David recited the fifteen Ascents and caused them to subside. If so, fifteen Ascents? They should have been Descents.
llm_translation: Fifteen steps. Rav Ḥisdah said to that Sage who was arranging the Aggadah before him: Listen, these fifteen steps, against whom did David say them? He said to him: Thus said Rabbi Yoḥanan: At the moment when David reached the sixty steps, the abyss contracted, and he needed to wash for the world. David said, "Fifteen steps and descending." If so, fifteen "steps" — they should be "descending"!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וְאַדְכַּרְתַּן (מִלְּתָא), הָכִי אִתְּמַר: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁכָּרָה דָּוִד שִׁיתִין, קְפָא תְּהוֹמָא וּבְעָא לְמִשְׁטְפֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא. אָמַר דָּוִד: מִי אִיכָּא דְּיָדַע אִי שְׁרֵי לְמִכְתַּב שֵׁם
human_translation: said to him: Since you reminded me matter, this is was stated: At the time that David dug the drainpipes, the depths rose and sought to inundate the world. David said: Is there anyone who knows whether it is permitted to write the name
llm_translation: He said to him: Since you have mentioned the matter, thus it was stated: At the time when David became intoxicated with wine, he dug a pit and sought to immerse the world in it. David said: Is there anyone who knows if it is permitted to erase the Name in writing?

hebrew_text: אַחַסְפָּא, וְנִשְׁדְּיֵהּ בִּתְהוֹמָא וּמַנַּח! לֵיכָּא דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ מִידֵּי. אֲמַר דָּוִד: כׇּל דְּיָדַע לְמֵימַר וְאֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר, יֵחָנֵק בִּגְרוֹנוֹ. נָשָׂא אֲחִיתוֹפֶל קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמוֹ: וּמָה לַעֲשׂוֹת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אִישׁ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: שְׁמִי שֶׁנִּכְתַּב בִּקְדוּשָּׁה יִמָּחֶה עַל הַמַּיִם, לַעֲשׂוֹת שָׁלוֹם לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: on an earthenware shard? we will throw it into the depths, and will subside. There was no one who said anything to him. David said: Anyone who knows to say and does not say may he be strangled in his throat. Ahithophel raised an a fortiori argument on his own And just as to make peace between a man and his wife the Torah said: My Name that was written in sanctity will be erased on the water to establish peace for the whole world in its entirety, all the more so He said to It is permitted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Achaspa, v'nishdeyeh b'tehoma u'manach! Leika d'ka'amar lei miday. Amar David: Kol deyada l'meimar v'eino omer, yechaneik b'grovno. Nasa Achitofel kal vachomer b'atzmo: U'mah la'asot shalom bein ish l'ishto, amra Torah: Shmi shenichtav b'kidusha yimacheh al hamayim, la'asot shalom l'chol haolam kulo - al achas kamah v'kamah. Amar lei: Shrei.

hebrew_text: כָּתֵב שֵׁם אַחַסְפָּא וְשָׁדֵי לִתְהוֹמָא, וּנְחֵית תְּהוֹמָא שִׁיתְּסַר אַלְפֵי גַּרְמִידֵי. כִּי חָזֵי דְּנָחֵית טוּבָא, אֲמַר: כַּמָּה דְּמִידְּלֵי — טְפֵי מִירְטַב עָלְמָא. אֲמַר חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת, וְאַסְּקֵיהּ חֲמֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּרְמִידֵי, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּאַלְפָּא גַּרְמִידֵי. אָמַר עוּלָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סוּמְכָא דְאַרְעָא אַלְפָּא גַּרְמִידֵי. וְהָא חָזֵינַן דְּכָרֵינַן פּוּרְתָּא וְנָפְקִי מַיָּא! אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הָהוּא מִסּוּלָּמָא דִפְרָת.
human_translation: He wrote the name on an earthenware shard and cast it into the depths, and the the depths subsided sixteen thousand cubits. When he saw that they subsided excessively, he said: The higher the moister the world. He recited the fifteen Ascents and elevated them fifteen thousand cubits, and established them at one thousand cubits. Ulla said: Learn from here that the thickness of the earth is one thousand cubits. But don’t we see that we dig a little, water emerges? Rav Mesharshiyya said: That is from the ascent of the Euphrates
llm_translation: He wrote the name of Achaspa and threw it into the depths, and the depths descended twelve thousand cubits. When he saw that the good descended, he said: Just as they ascend, they descend into the depths. He said fifteen steps, and he ascended thirteen thousand cubits, and he established it in a thousand cubits. Ulla said: Learn from this that the support of the land is a thousand cubits. And we see that we mention a pit and water comes out! Rav Mesharshaya said: That is from the tradition of the Euphrates.

hebrew_text: וְעָמְדוּ כֹּהֲנִים בְּשַׁעַר הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁיּוֹרֵד כּוּ׳. בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית — דְּנָחֵית חַמְשָׁה וְקָאֵי אַעַשְׂרָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא דְּנָחֵית עַשְׂרָה וְקָאֵי אַחַמְשָׁה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And two priests stood at the Upper Gate that descends Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma: tenth stair that he would descend five and stand on the tenth Or perhaps that he would descend ten and stand on the fifth shall stand
llm_translation: The priests shall stand at the upper gate that faces east. Rabbi Yirmeya asked: If one ascends a tenth and descends five, and stands at eleven, or perhaps if one ascends ten and stands at five? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁ״אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳״?
human_translation: The Sages taught: By inference, from that it is stated: “And their faces toward the east,” don’t I know that “their backs toward the Sanctuary of the Lord”?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From the implication of what is stated: "and their faces were eastward," I do not know that "their backs were towards the sanctuary of the Lord"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ פּוֹרְעִין עַצְמָן, וּמַתְרִיזִין כְּלַפֵּי מַטָּה.
human_translation: Rather, what does the verse state: “Their backs toward the Sanctuary of the Lord”? It teaches that they would expose themselves and defecate downward,
llm_translation: Rather, what is the Talmud to say: "Behind them, to the Temple of the Lord" — teaches that they were separating themselves, and hurling towards the staff.

hebrew_text: אָנוּ לְיָהּ וּלְיָהּ עֵינֵינוּ כּוּ׳. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״שְׁמַע״ ״שְׁמַע״, כְּאִילּוּ אָמַר ״מוֹדִים״ ״מוֹדִים״! אֶלָּא הָכִי אָמְרִי: הֵמָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים קֵדְמָה, וְאָנוּ לְיָהּ (אֲנַחְנוּ מוֹדִים), וְעֵינֵינוּ לְיָהּ מְיַחֲלוֹת.
human_translation: We are to God, and to God are our eyes. Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Zeira say: One who says: Listen, listen, is who says: We give thanks, we give thanks, Rather, this is what they said: They bow toward the east, we give thanks to God, and our eyes turn in hope to God,
llm_translation: We are to God, and to God our eyes. Is it not so?! And Rabbi Zeira said: Anyone who says "Shema, Shema," it is as though he said "Modim, Modim"! Rather, this is what they say: They bow forward, and we to God (we acknowledge), and our eyes await God.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַחַת תְּקִיעוֹת בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ שָׁם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַחַת תְּקִיעוֹת בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ: שָׁלֹשׁ לִפְתִיחַת שְׁעָרִים, וְתֵשַׁע לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, וְתֵשַׁע לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם. וּבַמּוּסָפִין הָיוּ מוֹסִיפִין עוֹד תֵּשַׁע.
human_translation: One no fewer than twenty-one blasts in the Temple, and one no more than forty-eight. Each day there were twenty-one blasts in the Temple: Three for the opening of the gates nine for the daily morning offering, and nine for the daily afternoon offering, And with the additional offerings they would add nine additional blasts.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There are not less than twenty-one blasts in the Temple, and not more than forty-eight. Every day there were twenty-one blasts in the Temple: three for the opening of the gates, nine for the morning continual offering, and nine for the afternoon continual offering. And on festivals, they would add another nine.

hebrew_text: וּבְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הָיוּ מוֹסִיפִין שֵׁשׁ: שָׁלֹשׁ לְהַבְטִיל אֶת הָעָם מִמְּלָאכָה, וְשָׁלֹשׁ לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין קֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל.
human_translation: And on Shabbat eve they would add six Three to stop the people from labor, and three to demarcate between sacred and profane.
llm_translation: And on Friday evening, they would add six: three to nullify the people from work, and three to distinguish between holy and mundane.

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה: שָׁלֹשׁ לִפְתִיחַת שְׁעָרִים, שָׁלֹשׁ לְשַׁעַר הָעֶלְיוֹן, וְשָׁלֹשׁ לְשַׁעַר הַתַּחְתּוֹן, וְשָׁלֹשׁ לְמִילּוּי הַמַּיִם, וְשָׁלֹשׁ עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, תֵּשַׁע לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, וְתֵשַׁע לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְתֵשַׁע לְמוּסָפִין, שָׁלֹשׁ לְהַבְטִיל אֶת הָעָם מִן הַמְּלָאכָה, וְשָׁלֹשׁ לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לְחוֹל.
human_translation: Shabbat eve during the festival there were forty-eight Three for the opening of the gates; three for the upper gate; and three for the lower gate; and three for the filling of the water, and three upon the altar; nine for the daily morning offering; and nine for the daily afternoon offering; and nine for the additional offerings; three to stop the people from work; and three to demarcate between sacred and profane,
llm_translation: On the eve of Shabbat, during the festival, there were forty-eight Levites there: three for opening the gates, three for the upper gate, three for the lower gate, three for drawing water, three on the platform of the altar, nine for the daily morning offering, nine for the daily afternoon offering, and nine for the additional offerings. Three to dismiss the people from work, and three to distinguish between the sacred and the mundane.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַפּוֹחֵת לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשֶּׁבַע, וְהַמּוֹסִיף לֹא יוֹסִיף עַל שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: תְּקִיעָה תְּרוּעָה תְּקִיעָה — אַחַת הִיא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: תְּקִיעָה לְחוּד וּתְרוּעָה לְחוּד.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The one who minimize shall not minimize fewer than seven And one who add shall not add sixteen. what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds: tekia , terua , tekia is one blast. And the Rabbis hold: A tekia separately and a terua separately.
llm_translation: Gemara: Mishnaic teaching that is not like Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "The one who subtracts shall not subtract from seven, and the one who adds shall not add to sixteen." What are they arguing about? Rabbi Yehuda holds: Tekiah Teruah Tekiah - it is one, and the Rabbis hold: Tekiah separately and Teruah separately.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם תְּרוּעָה״ (וּכְתִיב: ״תְּרוּעָה יִתְקְעוּ״, הָא כֵּיצַד? תְּקִיעָה וּתְרוּעָה — אַחַת הִיא). וְרַבָּנַן: הַהוּא לִפְשׁוּטָה לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ הוּא דַּאֲתָא (וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ מְנָלֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״שֵּׁנִית״).
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yehuda? the verse states: “And you shall sound [ utkatem ] a terua ” and it is written: “A terua they will sound [ yitke’u ]” How is it a tekia and a terua one And the Rabbis This comes a plain preceding it and following it. And from where does Rabbi Yehuda derive preceding it and following it? He derives it from a second time”
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? The verse says: "And you shall sound the trumpet" (Numbers 10:10). But it is written: "A blast they shall make sound" (Leviticus 25:9), how so? The blast and the trumpet sound - they are one. And the Rabbis say: That verse is for its simple meaning, and it is he who came before and after it. (And Rabbi Yehuda, from where does he derive the requirement for both before and after? He derives it from the "second" mention of the word "trumpet").

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְהַקְהִיל אֶת הַקָּהָל תִּתְקְעוּ וְלֹא תָרִיעוּ״, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ: תְּקִיעָה תְּרוּעָה — אַחַת הִיא, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא פַּלְגָא דְּמִצְוָה עֲבֵיד וּפַלְגָא לָא עֲבֵיד?! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָהוּא לְסִימָנָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And what is the rationale the Rabbis? as it is written: “And when congregating the people you shall sound a tekia and shall not sound a terua ” And if it enters your mind tekia terua are one would the Merciful One say to perform half a mitzva and not to perform half And Rabbi Yehuda That came merely as a signal
llm_translation: The sages, what is their reasoning? As it is written: "And when you gather the assembly, you shall blow, but you shall not sound a blast." And if you were to suggest: blowing and sounding a blast are one and the same, did the Merciful One command to fulfill half of the commandment and not the other half?! And Rabbi Yehuda said: That is merely a mnemonic in the world that it came.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: סִימָנָא הוּא, וְרַחֲמָנָא שַׁוְּיֵהּ מִצְוָה. כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אֵין בֵּין תְּקִיעָה לִתְרוּעָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. (אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה) פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: And the Rabbis it is a signal the Merciful One rendered it a mitzva. In accordance with whose is this statement of Rav Kahana: There is no between a tekia and a terua at all In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. If Rabbi Yehuda; obvious.
llm_translation: The Sages: It is a mnemonic, and the Merciful One has made it a commandment. According to whom does this go? Like the one that Rav Kahana said: There is no difference between Tekiah and Teruah, and not as nothing, according to whom? Like Rabbi Yehuda. (If Rabbi Yehuda) it is obvious!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ כְּרַבָּנַן, וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: שָׁמַע תֵּשַׁע תְּקִיעוֹת בְּתֵשַׁע שָׁעוֹת בַּיּוֹם — יָצָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say even in accordance with the Rabbis, to exclude of Rabbi Yoḥanan who said: one heard nine blasts in nine hours on the day he fulfilled his obligation. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Even according to the Rabbis, and to exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan who said: "Hear, nine blasts in nine hours during the day - one fulfills the obligation," it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אִם כֵּן, מַאי ״וְלֹא כְּלוּם״?
human_translation: And say it is indeed so If so, what is At all,
llm_translation: And why not say thus! If so, what is "and not nothing"?

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג כּוּ׳. וְאִילּוּ לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית לָא קָתָנֵי. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שָׁלֹשׁ לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Shabbat eve during the festival However, is not teaching the tenth stair. whose mishna? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught Three at the tenth stair. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Three upon the altar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On Erev Shabbat during the middle of the festival, and if it is a tenth above, it is not taught. Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah? Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. As it was taught: Three tenths above, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Three on the altar. English translation:

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית — אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְהָאוֹמֵר עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ — אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית.
human_translation: The one who says at the tenth stair does not say upon the altar; and the one who says upon the altar does not say at the tenth stair.
llm_translation: One who says "above a tenth" - does not say it on the altar, and one who says it on the altar - does not say "above a tenth."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב? כֵּיוָן דְּתָקַע לִפְתִיחַת שְׁעָרִים, לְמַעֲלָה עֲשִׂירִית לְמָה לִי דְּתָקַע? הַאי לָאו שַׁעַר הוּא! הִלְכָּךְ, עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ עֲדִיף. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּתָקַע לְמִילּוּי הַמַּיִם, עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ לְמָה לִי? הִלְכָּךְ, לְמַעֲלָה הָעֲשִׂירִית עֲדִיף.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? Since he sounded for the opening of the gates, for what do I to sound at the tenth stair? That is not a gate. Therefore, preferable upon the altar. And the Rabbis hold that since he sounded for the filling the water, why do I upon the altar? Therefore, it is preferable at the tenth stair.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov's opinion? Since he blows for the opening of the gates, why do I need to blow upwards a tenth? This is not a gate! Therefore, on top of the altar is preferable. And the Rabbis hold: Since he blows for the filling of the water, why do I need on top of the altar? Therefore, upwards a tenth is preferable.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא מִדָּרוֹמָא, אַיְיתִי מַתְנִיתָא בִּידֵיהּ: ״וּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֲנִים יִתְקְעוּ בַּחֲצוֹצְרוֹת״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִתְקְעוּ״, שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם בַּחֲצוֹצְרוֹת עַל עוֹלוֹתֵיכֶם וְעַל זִבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵיכֶם״. וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִתְקְעוּ״ — הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמּוּסָפִין תּוֹקְעִין. הוּא תָּנֵי לַהּ, וְהוּא אָמַר לַהּ: לוֹמַר שֶׁתּוֹקְעִין עַל כׇּל מוּסָף וּמוּסָף.
human_translation: When Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina came from the south he brought a baraita with him “And the children of Aaron, the priests, will sound the trumpets” no the verse to state: “Shall sound,” as it is already stated: “And you shall sound the trumpets for your burnt-offerings and your peace-offerings” And what the verse states: “Shall sound”? all according to the additional offerings one sounds teaches and he said its to say that one sounds for each and every additional offering
llm_translation: When Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina came from the South, he brought a teaching in his hand: "And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow with the trumpets," as it does not say "shall blow," for it is already stated, "And you shall blow with the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings." And what does it mean to say "shall blow"? — All according to the additional offerings blow. He taught her, and he said to her: to say that they blow on every additional offering.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה. וְאִם אִיתָא, לִיתְנֵי: שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ חַמְשִׁין וְחַד! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תּוֹקְעִין לִפְתִיחַת שְׁעָרִים בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: We learned Shabbat eve during the festival there were forty-eight And if it is so, Let teach Shabbat during the Festival, you find fifty-one Rabbi Zeira said: because one does not sound for the opening of the gates on Shabbat;
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: On Erev Shabbat that falls during the festival, there were forty-eight candles there. And if you wish, it can be taught: On Shabbat that falls during the festival, you forget to light fifty-one! Rabbi Zeira said: Because we do not knock on doors on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן הַאי דְּלָא חָשׁ לְקִימְחֵיהּ! חֲדָא: דִּ״בְכׇל יוֹם״ תְּנַן, וְעוֹד: אִי נָמֵי כַּהֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, לִיתְנֵי שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה, דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, וְשָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Who is this who is not concerned about the flour First, we learned each day, And furthermore, even if they are equal to each other, let teach: Shabbat during the Festival there are forty-eight You would learn two from You would learn from it that of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov And you would learn from it of Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina,
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is this one who does not pay attention to his flour! One: For "every day" we learned, and furthermore: If they were also like Hadadei, they should have observed Shabbat within the festival, there were forty-eight there, you heard two from it: You heard from it of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and you heard from it of Rabbi Ahah bar Chanina.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תּוֹקְעִין לְמִילּוּי מַיִם בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּבָצְרִי טוּבָא. וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּהָא אִיכָּא תְּלָתָא מוּסָפִין: מוּסָף דְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, מוּסָף דְּרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, מוּסַף דְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: because one does not sound for filling water on Shabbat, were considerably fewer And let also teach Rosh HaShana that occurs on Shabbat, as there are three additional offerings: additional offering of Rosh HaShana, additional offering of the New Moon, additional offering of Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rava said: Because we do not blow for the filling of the water on Shabbat, it is a good decree. And let him also teach about Rosh Hashanah that falls on Shabbat, for there are three additional offerings: the additional offering of Rosh Hashanah, the additional offering of Rosh Chodesh, the additional offering of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, לְאַשְׁמֹעִינַן כִּדְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. אַטּוּ מִי קָאָמַר — לִיתְנֵי הָא וְלָא לִיתְנֵי הָא? לִיתְנֵי הָא וְלִיתְנֵי הָא! תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. מַאי שַׁיֵּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר?
human_translation: Shabbat eve during the Festival is necessary to teach in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov Is anyone saying: Let teach this and let him not teach that Let him teach this and let him teach that he taught and omitted What did he omit, that he omitted
llm_translation: On Erev Shabbat that falls within the festival, it is necessary for him, to hear as Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. Now, who is saying - to teach this and not to teach that? Teach this and teach that! A Tanna and he remains. What does he remain with this remain?

hebrew_text: שַׁיַּיר עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: He omitted Passover eve.
llm_translation: Remnant of the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח — לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא, דְּהָא מַנִּי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִימֵיהֶם שֶׁל כַּת שְׁלִישִׁית לֹא הִגִּיעָה לוֹמַר ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳״, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיוּ עַמָּהּ מוּעָטִין.
human_translation: If due to Passover eve, that is not an omission, who this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: never in the all the days of the third shift did it reach to recite: “I love that the Lord hears because people were few.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If because of the eve of Passover — it is not a remnant, for Rabbi Yehuda counted it, for he said: From the days of the third generation of the Cat, it did not reach to say, "I have loved because the Lord will hear," because they were few with her.

hebrew_text: (הָא אוֹקֵימְנָא) דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! וְדִלְמָא הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: But didn’t we establish not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? And perhaps this tanna holds in accordance with in one and disagrees with him in one
llm_translation: (Here we establish) that it is not like Rabbi Yehuda! And perhaps this Tanna holds according to his own opinion in one matter, and disagrees with him in another matter.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, אַפֵּיק שֵׁית וְעַיֵּיל שֵׁית.
human_translation: But What did he omit, that he omitted this He omitted Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat eve, you eliminate six and incorporate six
llm_translation: Rather: What is the leftover of this leftover? The leftover of Erev Pesach that happens to fall on Erev Shabbat, take out six and bring in six.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה. וְלָא? וְהָא אִיכָּא עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּאִי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — חַמְשִׁין וַחֲדָא, אִי לְרַבָּנַן — חַמְשִׁין וּשְׁבַע!
human_translation: And one no more than forty-eight And no But isn’t there Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat, where if to Rabbi Yehuda, fifty-one if to the Rabbis, fifty-seven blasts?
llm_translation: And one does not add on forty-eight. And no? But there is the eve of Passover that falls on Shabbat, for if according to Rabbi Yehuda - fifty-one, if according to the Rabbis - fifty-seven!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָתָנֵי, מִידֵּי דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּכׇל שָׁנָה. עֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה, לָא קָתָנֵי. אַטּוּ עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג מִי אִיתֵיהּ בְּכׇל שָׁנָה? זִימְנִין דְּלָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָל יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: When teaches matters that every year; Passover eve that occurs on Shabbat, that does not each and every year, he does not teach. Is that to say Shabbat eve during the Festival occurs every year? There are times when you do not find And what are the circumstances? where the first Festival occurs on Shabbat eve,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ki katanai, midei deiteih bechol shanah. Erev haPesach shechal lihyot beshabbat, deleiteih bechol shanah veshanah, lo katanai. Attu erev Shabbat shebetoch hachag mi deiteih bechol shanah? Zimnin delei mashkachatei leih. Vehaychi damei, kegon shechal yom tov rishon be'erev Shabbat." English translation: "For it is taught, from the fact that it occurs every year. If the eve of Passover falls on a Shabbat, since it does not occur every year, it is not taught. But if the eve of Shabbat falls during the festival, does it occur every year? Sometimes it does not occur to him. And how is it similar? For example, when the first day of a festival falls on the eve of Shabbat."

hebrew_text: כִּי מִקְּלַע יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מִדְחֵי דָּחֵינַן לֵיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיקְּלַע יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֵימַת הָוֵי — בְּחַד בְּשַׁבָּת, הִלְכָּךְ דָּחֵינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: when the first Festival of happen to occur on Shabbat eve, we postpone it What is the reason Since if the first Festival occurs on Shabbat eve, when is Yom Kippur on Sunday. Therefore, we postpone
llm_translation: When the first day of a festival falls on Erev Shabbat, we push it off. What is the reason? Since when the first day of the festival falls on Erev Shabbat, when will Yom Kippur be? It will fall on Shabbat. Therefore, we push it off.

hebrew_text: וּמִי דָּחֵינַן לֵיהּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: חֶלְבֵי שַׁבָּת קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים,
human_translation: And do we postpone it But didn’t we learn The fats of Shabbat may be sacrificed on Yom Kippur
llm_translation: And who pushed him away? But didn't we learn: The fats of Shabbat are offered on Yom Kippur,

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב בְּבָבֶל, הֲוָה אָמְרִי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לֹא הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין, וּבְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת לֹא הָיוּ מַבְדִּילִין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הִיא. כִּי סְלֵיקִית לְהָתָם, אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא!
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: When we were in the school of Rav in Babylonia, they said that which was taught Yom Kippur that occurs on Shabbat eve they did not sound and at the conclusion of Shabbat they would not recite havdala everyone agrees when I ascended to there, I found Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, who was sitting and saying is Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: When we were in the study hall of Rav in Babylonia, they used to say the following that was taught: On Yom Kippur that falls on Erev Shabbat, they would not blow the shofar, and on Motzaei Shabbat they would not recite the Havdalah blessing - this is the opinion of all. When I went there, I found it with Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, who was sitting and saying: It is Rabbi Akiva!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבָּנַן, הָא אֲחֵרִים הִיא.
human_translation: not difficult. This, the Rabbis, this is Aḥerim ,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this is Rabbanan, this is others.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין בֵּין עֲצֶרֶת לַעֲצֶרֶת וְאֵין בֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים בִּלְבַד, וְאִם הָיְתָה שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: As it is taught Aḥerim say: Between Shavuot Shavuot and between Rosh HaShana Rosh HaShana there is only four days And if it was a leap year five
llm_translation: It was taught: Others say, there is no difference between one Festival and another Festival, and there is no difference between one New Year and another New Year, except for four days alone, and if the year was a leap year - five.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — שִׁיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ דּוֹחֶה שִׁיר שֶׁל שַׁבָּת. וְאִי אִיתָא, לֵימָא דְּשַׁבָּת וְלֵימָא דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ!
human_translation: raises an objection: the New Moon that occurs on Shabbat, the song of the New Moon supersedes the song of Shabbat. And if it is so, let us recite the song of Shabbat and let us recite the song of the New Moon.
llm_translation: Challenger: If Rosh Chodesh falls on Shabbat - the song of Rosh Chodesh overrides the song of Shabbat. And if you will say, let it be for Shabbat and let it be for Rosh Chodesh!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: מַאי דּוֹחֶה — דּוֹחֶה לִקָּדֵם. וְאַמַּאי? תָּדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר — תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם!
human_translation: Rav Safra said: What supersedes? Supersedes to precede, And why frequent and an infrequent frequent takes precedence
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: What is more frequent - it takes precedence. And why? If it is frequent and if it is not frequent - the frequent takes precedence!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֵידַע שֶׁהוּקְבַּע רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בִּזְמַנּוֹ. וְהַאי הֶיכֵּירָא עָבְדִינַן? הָא הֶיכֵּירָא אַחֲרִינָא עָבְדִינַן! (דְּתַנְיָא) חֶלְבֵי תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר נִיתָּנִין מֵחֲצִי כֶּבֶשׁ וּלְמַטָּה בַּמִּזְרָח, וְשֶׁל מוּסָפִין נִיתָּנִין מֵחֲצִי כֶּבֶשׁ וּלְמַטָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב, וְשֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ נִיתָּנִין תַּחַת כַּרְכּוֹב הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּלְמַטָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said, to inform that the New Moon was established at its time And is that the indicator that we implement Don’t we implement a different indicator, as it is taught the fats of the daily morning offering were placed from the midpoint of the ramp and below on the east side and those of the additional offerings were placed from the midpoint of the ramp and below on the west side And the New Moon were placed under the surrounding ledge of the altar and beneath
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: To know that the establishment of the new month is in its proper time. And this recognition, did we do? This recognition we did afterwards! (As it was taught) The fats of the daily offering of the morning are placed from the half of the sheep and below in the east, and the fats of the additional offerings are placed from the half of the sheep and below in the west, and the fats of the new moon offering are placed beneath the ramp of the altar and below.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֵידַע שֶׁהוּקְבַּע רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ בִּזְמַנּוֹ. תְּרֵי הֶיכֵּירָא עָבְדִינַן. דְּחָזֵי הַאי — חָזֵי, וְחָזֵי בְּהַאי — חָזֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to know that the New Moon was established at its time, they implemented two indicators: who saw this saw and saw that saw
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: To know that the establishment of the new month is in its proper time. We have done two recognitions. If he sees this one - he sees, and if he sees this one - he sees.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, דְּתָנֵי רָבָא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁתּוֹקְעִין עַל שַׁבָּת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעַל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, כָּךְ יִהְיוּ תּוֹקְעִין עַל כׇּל מוּסָף וּמוּסָף — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם״, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אַחָא! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises objection as Rava bar Shmuel taught might that just as they sound for Shabbat in and of itself, and for the New Moon in and of itself, so too would they sound for each and every additional offering the verse states: and on your New Moons, a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Aḥa. a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi, detanei Rava bar Shmuel: Yakhol keshem she'tok'in al Shabbat bifnei atzmo ve'al rosh chodesh bifnei atzmo, kakh yihiyu tok'in al kol musaf u'musaf - Talmud lomar: "Uv'rashei chodshei'chem," teyuveta de'Rabbi Acha! Teyuveta. English translation: A contradiction was raised: for Rava bar Shmuel taught: One might have thought that just as the shofar is blown on Shabbat by itself and on Rosh Chodesh by itself, so too it should be blown for every additional offering - the Torah teaches: "At the beginnings of your months," an additional point of Rabbi Acha! An additional point.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם״ — הוּקְּשׁוּ כׇּל חֳדָשִׁים כּוּלָּם זֶה לָזֶה. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּתִיב ״חׇדְשְׁכֶם״, וּכְתִיב ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי״ — וְאֵיזֶה חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי רָאשִׁים, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״חׇדְשְׁכֶם״, חַד הִיא.
human_translation: What is the derivation Abaye said: The verse states: “And on your New Moons,” all the months are equated to each other, Rav Ashi said it is written: Your moon [ ḥodshekhem ], and it is written: “And on new [ uverashei ],” And which month that has two new You must say it is Rosh HaShana, And the Merciful One says: Your moon, it is one
llm_translation: What is the Talmud? Abaye said, Scripture says: "At the beginnings of your months" - all the new moons are juxtaposed to one another. Rav Ashi said: It is written "your month" and it is written "at the beginnings" - which month has two beginnings? You must say: this is the New Year, and the Merciful One said "your month," it is one.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, בָּרִאשׁוֹן מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״הָבוּ לַה׳ בְּנֵי אֵלִים״. בַּשֵּׁנִי מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״וְלָרָשָׁע אָמַר אֱלֹהִים״. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״מִי יָקוּם לִי עִם מְרֵעִים״.
human_translation: And furthermore, it was taught On the intermediate days of the Festival, on the first what would they say “Ascribe [ havu ] unto the Lord, O you sons of might” On the second what would they say? “But unto the wicked [ velarasha ] God says: On the third what would they say? “Who [ mi ] will rise up for me against the evildoers?”
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught: On a weekday of the festival, on the first day, what would they say? "Give to the Lord, O sons of mighty ones." On the second day, what would they say? "And to the wicked, God has said." On the third day, what would they say? "Who will rise up for me against evildoers."

hebrew_text: בָּרְבִיעִי מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״בִּינוּ בּוֹעֲרִים בָּעָם״. בַּחֲמִישִׁי מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״הֲסִירוֹתִי מִסֵּבֶל שִׁכְמוֹ״. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי מֶה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״יִמּוֹטוּ כׇּל מוֹסְדֵי אָרֶץ״. וְאִם חָל שַׁבָּת בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶם, ״יִמּוֹטוּ״ יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: On the fourth what would they say? “Consider [ binu ], you brutish among the people” On the fifth what would they say? “I removed [ hasiroti ] his shoulder from the burden” On the sixth what would they say? “All the foundations of the earth are moved [ yimotu ]” And if Shabbat occurred on any are moved,” is superseded,
llm_translation: On the fourth day of the week, what would they say: "Understand, you who carry the fire among the people." On the fifth day of the week, what would they say: "I have removed the burden from his shoulder." On the sixth day of the week, what would they say: "Let all the foundations of the earth shake." And if Shabbat coincides with any of them, "Let them be shaken" is postponed.

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא מַנַּח בְּהוּ סִימָנָא: ״הוּמְבָּהֵ״‎י״. רַב פָּפָּא מַנַּח בְּהוּ סִימָנָא: ״הוּמְהָבֵּ״‎י״. וְסִימָנָךְ, ״אַמְבּוּהָא דְסָפְרֵי״.
human_translation: Rav Safra established a mnemonic for Heh , vav , mem , beit , heh , yod , Rav Pappa established a mnemonic for Heh , vav , mem , heh , beit , yod , A mnemonic Convoy [ ambuha ] of scribes [ desafrei ],
llm_translation: Rav Safra placed it with the mnemonic: "Hum-ba-hei-yud." Rav Papa placed it with the mnemonic: "Hum-ha-bei-yud." And your mnemonic is, "Ambuha d'safrei."

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא! תְּיוּבְתָּא. וְהָא רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא קְרָא וּמַתְנִיתָא קָאָמַר?
human_translation: a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina, But didn’t Rabbi Aḥa say a verse and a baraita
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina! The question. But Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina cited a verse and a teaching?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁמַּאֲרִיכִין בִּתְקִיעוֹת. רַבָּנַן דְּקֵיסָרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחָא אָמְרִי: לוֹמַר שֶׁמַּרְבֶּה בְּתוֹקְעִין.
human_translation: Ravina said: to say that one extends of the blasts The Sages of Caesarea, in the name of Rabbi Aḥa, said: to say that one increases trumpeters
llm_translation: Ravina said: to say that they lengthen in the blasts. The sages of the Caesareans in the name of Rabbi Akha said: to say that one increases in the blowing.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן, דְּאִית לַן תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: שֵׁנִי יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: And we, who have two days how do we conduct Abaye said: the second will be superseded.
llm_translation: And we, who have two days, what should we do? Abbaye said: postpone the second day.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: שְׁבִיעִי יִדָּחֶה. תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אִם חָל שַׁבָּת לִהְיוֹת בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, ״יִמּוֹטוּ״ יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: Rava said: seventh will be superseded. was taught in accordance with Rava: And if Shabbat occurs on any are moved,” is superseded.
llm_translation: Rava said: The seventh day is postponed. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rava: If Shabbat coincides with one of them, "they shall be postponed" Deuteronomy 16:8 is postponed.

hebrew_text: אַתְקִין אַמֵּימָר בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, דִּמְדַלְּגִי דַּלּוֹגֵי.
human_translation: Ameimar instituted in Neharde’a that one repeats
llm_translation: Amemar established in Nehardea, that they may leap over the logs.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג הָיוּ שָׁם שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר פָּרִים, אֵילִים שְׁנַיִם וְשָׂעִיר אֶחָד. נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ שָׁם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר כְּבָשִׂים לִשְׁמוֹנֶה מִשְׁמָרוֹת. בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, שִׁשָּׁה מַקְרִיבִין שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד.
human_translation: the first Festival of Sukkot there were thirteen bulls, two rams, and one goat there. Fourteen sheep remained to eight watches. On the first day six sacrifice two each and the remaining one each.
llm_translation: It was taught: On the first day of the festival, there were thirteen bulls, two rams, and one goat. Fourteen lambs remained there for eight watches. On the first day, six would offer two each. And the rest, one by one.

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי, חֲמִשָּׁה מַקְרִיבִין שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי, אַרְבָּעָה מַקְרִיבִין שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד.
human_translation: On the second five sacrifice two each, and the remaining one each. On the third four sacrifice two each, and the remaining one each.
llm_translation: In the second group, five people bring offerings two by two. And the rest, one by one. In the third group, four people bring offerings two by two. And the rest, one by one.

hebrew_text: בָּרְבִיעִי, שְׁלֹשָׁה מַקְרִיבִין שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד. בַּחֲמִישִׁי, שְׁנַיִם מַקְרִיבִין שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי, אֶחָד מַקְרִיב שְׁנַיִם. וְהַשְּׁאָר, אֶחָד אֶחָד.
human_translation: On the fourth three sacrifice two each, and the remaining one each. On the fifth two sacrifice two each, and the remaining one each. On the sixth one sacrifices two and the remaining one each.
llm_translation: On the fourth day, three people bring offerings, two each. And the rest bring one each. On the fifth day, two people bring offerings, two each. And the rest bring one each. On the sixth day, one person brings offerings, two each. And the rest bring one each.

hebrew_text: בַּשְּׁבִיעִי, כּוּלָּן שָׁוִין. בַּשְּׁמִינִי, חָזְרוּ לַפַּיִיס כְּבָרְגָלִים. אָמְרוּ: מִי שֶׁהִקְרִיב פָּרִים הַיּוֹם — לֹא יַקְרִיב לְמָחָר, אֶלָּא חוֹזְרִין חֲלִילָה.
human_translation: On the seventh they are all equal On the eighth they returned to the lottery as on the other pilgrimage Festivals, They said One who sacrificed bulls today will not sacrifice tomorrow; rather, They rotate,
llm_translation: On the seventh day, all of them are equal. On the eighth day, they returned to the mouth of the pit like clogs. They said: "One who offered oxen today should not offer them tomorrow, rather, it is absolutely forbidden."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן? דְּתַנְיָא: פַּר הַבָּא בַּשְּׁמִינִי — בַּתְּחִילָּה מְפַיְּסִין עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי מִשְׁמָרוֹת דְּלֹא שִׁלְּשׁוּ בְּפָרִים, עוֹשָׂה אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say the mishna is Rabbi and not the Rabbis. As it is taught the bull that comes on the Eighth they draw lots over it from the beginning; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: One of the two watches that did not sacrifice three bulls sacrifices it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it Rabbi Neima's teaching and not the Rabbis'? As it was taught: "A bull that comes on the eighth day - initially they appease him," the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: "From one of the two shifts that did not participate in the offering of the bulls, he shall make it."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, אַטּוּ שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁמָרוֹת לָא אַפּוֹסֵי בָּעֵי?
human_translation: Even you say the Rabbis, is that to say that the two priestly watches are not required to draw lots
llm_translation: Even if you say it is according to the Rabbis, do they not still require two shifts?

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל הַמִּשְׁמָרוֹת שׁוֹנוֹת וּמְשַׁלְּשׁוֹת, חוּץ מִשְּׁנֵי מִשְׁמָרוֹת שֶׁשּׁוֹנוֹת וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּשׁוֹת? נֵימָא רַבִּי וְלָא רַבָּנַן! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן: מַאי לֹא שִׁלְּשׁוּ — בְּפָרֵי הַחַג.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught All of the priestly watches twice and three except for two watches that twice and do not three Let us say Rabbi and not the Rabbis, Even you say the Rabbis; what is They did not three with regard to the bulls of the festival
llm_translation: As to where did he go, this is what was taught: All the watches change and rotate, except for two watches that change but do not rotate? Say it is Rabbi and not the Rabbis! Even if you say it is the Rabbis: What is the reason they did not rotate? In the produce of the festival.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מִי שֶׁהִקְרִיב פָּרִים הַיּוֹם — לֹא יַקְרִיב לְמָחָר, אֶלָּא חוֹזְרִין חֲלִילָה.
human_translation: what does teach us? This teach us: One who sacrificed bulls today will not sacrifice tomorrow; rather, they rotate.
llm_translation: And what is it teaching us? It is teaching us: One who brought bulls today - should not bring tomorrow, rather, God forbid, they return.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (אֶלְעָזָר): הָנֵי שִׁבְעִים פָּרִים כְּנֶגֶד מִי — כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעִים אוּמּוֹת. פַּר יְחִידִי לָמָּה — כְּנֶגֶד אוּמָּה יְחִידָה.
